quests.title: &6&lApotheosis Adventure
desc:
If you want good gear you're gonna need &6&lApotheosis Gear&r, and that all starts with a &aGem&r! 

&aGems&r are rare Drops from any Mob, they are also confirmed Drops from &4Invaders&r. 

You'll learn more about those later, for now Farm those Mobs!

quests.title: &9Gem Dust
desc:
To get &9Gem Dust&r you need an &6&lApotheosis&r &aGem&r and an &7&lAnvil&r. 

Any &6&lApotheosis&r &aGem&r (Recommended only &8Common &fand &aUncommon&r)! 

Once you get your &aGems&r, smash them with a falling &7&lAnvil&r! 

Then, you can use your &9Gem Dust&r to Craft a &c&lSalvaging Table&r.

quests.title: &mVials and&r &8Sigils
quests.subtitle: Just Sigils now!
desc:
&8Sigils&r are items used to change your &6&lApotheosis&r &eAffixed Items&r; whether it be clearing &9Sockets&r, adding more &9Sockets&r, or removing the Name! 

All are used with your Item in a &8&lSmithing Table&r, &9&lReforging Table&r, or &6&lAugementing Table&r.

quests.title: &c&lSalvaging Table
desc:
The &c&lSalvaging Table&r can finally get you Materials and &9Gem Dust&r without using &7Anvils&r. 

You can recycle &eTools &fand &eArmor &fwith &eAffixes&r to get their Materials. 

The Materials you get are based on the Rarity of Item, &8Common&r Items will give &8Common&r Materials. 

And break down Horse/Dog Armor for some reason.

quests.title: &8Mysterious Scrap Metals
quests.subtitle: &8Common
desc:
&8Common&r is the most basic Rarity. This makes it most common to find early game, but also the weakest. 

&8Common&r shows up most at the &lWorld Tier: &9Haven&r, and will stop appearing after &lWorld Tier: &6Summit&r. 

&8Mysterious Scrap Metals&r are made from using &8Common&r &eItems&r in a &c&lSalvaging Table&r.

quests.title: &aTimeworn Fabric
quests.subtitle: &aUncommon
desc:
&aUncommon&r is the second Rarity. 

It starts appearing in &lWorld Tier: &9Haven&r, most abundant in &lWorld Tier: &2Frontier&r, and stops in &lWorld Tier: &4Pinnacle&r. 

&aTimeworn Fabric&r is made from using &aUncommon&r &eItems&r in a &c&lSalvaging Table&r.

quests.title: &9Luminous Crystal Shard
quests.subtitle: &9Rare
desc:
&9Rare&r is the middle ground of Rarities. 

It appears in all &lWorld Tiers&r but most common in &lWorld Tier: &eAscent&r. 

&9Luminous Crystal Shards&r are made from using &9Rare&r &eItems&r in a &c&lSalvaging Table&r.

quests.title: &6Godforged Pearl
quests.subtitle: &6Mythic
desc:
&6Mythic&r are some of the greatest we can get! 

&6Mythics&r are found only in &lWorld Tier: &6Summit&r and in &lWorld Tier: &4Pinnacle&r, where they are most common. 

&6Godforged Pearls&r are made from using &6Mythic&r &eItems&r in a &c&lSalvaging Table&r.

quests.title: &5Arcane Sands
quests.subtitle: &5Epic
desc:
&5Epic&r is finally climbing more to the overpowered side. 

&5Epic&r appears after &lWorld Tier: &2Frontier&r and is most common in &lWorld Tier: &4Pinnacle&r. 

&5Arcane Sands&r are made from using &5Epic&r &eItems&r in a &c&lSalvaging Table&r.

quests.title: &9Sigil of Socketing
desc:
To those new to &6&lApotheosis&r, &9Sockets&r can be confusing and irritating. 

In short, your Weapons and Armor need &9Sockets&r to use &aGems&r with it. 

But what if it doesn't have a &9Socket&r? 

Then you'll need a &9Sigil of Socketing&r! 

Combine your item and &9Sigil&r in a &8&lSmithing Table&r and boom you can get up to 2 &9Sockets&r.

quests.title: &7Sigil of Unnaming
desc:
&7Sigil of Unnaming&r does as the name suggests, when you have an &eAffixed Item&r with an awkwardly long name, you can combine it with the &7Sigil&r in a &8&lSmithing Table&r to get rid of most of the name. 

(Only the Material and Item Type as with the Rarity color will stay).

quests.title: &aSigil of Withdrawal
desc:
Thankfully &6&lApotheosis&r has made taking &9Sockets&r out of &eTools&r much easier! 

Now instead of having to choose whether to save the &eTool&r or &aGem&r you can now keep both. 

Use the &aSigil of Withdrawal&r with an &eAffixed Tool&r in a &8&lSmithing Table&r and you'll separate the &aGem&r from it.

quests.title: &6Sigil of Enhancement
desc:
The &6&lAugmenting Table&r needs different Fuel to work, and that Fuel is &6Sigils of Enhancement&r. 

Each Reroll will cost 1 &6Sigil of Enhancement&r while each Upgrade will cost 2! 

You'll need a &6Godforged Pearl&r for 4 of them.

quests.title: &dSigil of Rebirth
desc:
The &dSigil of Rebirth&r is Fuel for all the &l&9Reforging Tables&r. 

They still need the other Material, and obviously the Item it'll change to work though... 

Atleast they're relatively easier to Craft!

quests.title: &9&lSimple Reforging Table
desc:
The &9&lSimple Reforging Table&r is used like an &5&lEnchantment Table&r but with &eAffixes&r! 

To add an &eAffix&r to any &eItem&r, place the &eItem&r in the center Slot. Then, add your Rarity Material to the left Slot. 

The Rarity Material will determine what Rarity &eAffix&r you get on your &eItem&r. This can be used to upgrade some Items, like from &8Common&r to &aUncommon&r. 

You will get 3 choices of &eAffixes&r you can pick, also similar to an &5&lEnchantment Table&r the second and third get more expensive. 

With the &9&lSimple Reforging Table&r we can only get up to &9Rare&r &eAffixes&r.

quests.title: (Better) &5&lReforging Table&r
desc:
The &5&lReforging Table&r does everything the &9&lSimple&r one will do, but better! 

It can give us &5Epic&r and &6Mythic &eAffixes&r along with our previous ones!

quests.title: &6&lAugmenting Table
desc:
This is what you really need for perfect &eAffixes&r. 

First you need the &6&lTable&r, a Tool, and &6Sigils of Enhancement&r. 

Once you have all those, the world is all yours! You can reroll &eAffixes&r, choose a specific &eAffix&r, or upgrade set &eAffixes&r!

quests.title: Applying &aGems&r (and others)
desc:
You got &eTools&r and you got &aGems&r... so how do we combine them? 

First, make sure your &eTool&r has an open &9Socket&r. (For more on &9Sockets&r check the Sigils section). 

If one is open, you can combine your &eTool&r and &aGem&r in a &8&lSmithing Table&r. 

If you aren't happy with your current &aGems&r then you might need a different Table!

quests.title: Getting better &aGems
desc:
Don't like your &aGems&r? Then, change them! 

To change the Rarity of your &aGem&r you'll need to use this &a&lTable&r. 

By using 2 of the same &aGem&r and Rarity Materials, you can increase your &aGems&r Rarity and that increases its power.

quests.title: &lWorld Tier: &9Haven
desc:
The 1st &lWorld Tier&r is &l&9Haven&r! It being the first makes it the easiest to explore with and easiest to obtain. 

To get it you just need to hold an &eAffixed Item&r in your Hand! It will automatically be set when unlocked. 

The &lWorld Tier: &9Haven&r has highest chances for &8Common&r &aGear&r &fand &aGems&r. It can also have &aUncommon&r and very rarely, &9Rare&r.
This is also the only &lWorld Tier&r where &4Invaders&r cannot spawn naturally.

quests.title: &4Invaders/Bosses&r and &lWorld Tiers
desc:
&4Invaders&r are what we know as &6&lApotheosis&r &4Bosses&r. 

These are Mobs that can spawn in any Dimension and they will always be buffed and have &eAffixed Items&r equipped. 

Most will have more Hearts, Damage, and Effects than normal Mobs! When Killed they'll drop &eAffixed Items&f and &aGems&r. 

They have their own Rarities align with &6&lApotheosis&r Rarities. Their Rarities determine what they spawn with and their stats. 

Their Rarities are determined by the &lWorld Tier&r! &lWorld Tiers&r are new additions to &6&lApotheosis&r, they will change the Rarity of Loot and &4Bosses&r you can find. 

To access the &lWorld Tier&r Menu, Hold CTRL and press T.

quests.title: &lWorld Tier: &2Frontier
desc:
To get the &lWorld Tier: &2Frontier&r, you'll obviously need &9&lHaven&r done, but also need a few &eAffixed Items&r! 

How many? You need a full set of &eAffixed Armor&r plus an &eAffixed Tool &for &eWeapon&r. 

Now &aUncommon&r &4Invaders &fand &aGems&r are most abundant, with the rest following in order: &8Common&r, &9Rare&r, and also &5Epic&r. 

The Player with &lWorld Tier: &2Frontier&r will get a 35% Experience Boost plus 20% Luck! 

Hey, not everything will be easy though, now &4Monsters&r will gain 4 Armor Points extra.

quests.title: &lWorld Tier: &eAscent
desc:
For &l&2Frontier&r the Rarity of &eAffixes&r didn't matter, but now for &l&eAscent&r you'll need everything being &aUncommon&r or better. 

You'll also need to kill an &4Invader&r aka an &6&lApothic&r Boss, to upgrade your &lWorld Tier&r. The Rarity of &4Boss&r doesn't matter! 

&eAffixes&r will only stay up to &5Epic&r but now &9Rare&r is more common than the rest. We can also get &6Mythic&r &aGems&r... just only with Lady Luck's Favor! 

Speaking of Luck, our Luck will increase to 30% and Experience will jump to 55%. 

&4Monsters&r in return will now have 8 Armor Points and 5 Armor Pierce.

quests.title: &lWorld Tier: &6Summit
desc:
&lWorld Tier: &6Summit&r will need you to upgrade your &eArmor&r and &eTool/Weapon&r from &aUncommon&r to &9Rare&r (or better)! You'll also need to kill &0&lThe Wither&r. 

&0&lThe Wither&r doesn't need to be an &4Invader&r and honestly, it'll be easier if he isn't. 

In &6&lSummit&r &5Epic&r &eItems &fand &2Gems&r will be the most common, and for &eItems&r you can now get &6Mythic&r and with &aGems&r you can find &zPerfect&r. Again, both being extremely rare! 

Now we'll get 75% Experience Gained and 50% Luck. 

&4Monsters&r will also be buffed to get 12 Armor Points, 10 Armor Toughness, 15 Armor Pierce, and 10 Protection Pierce. 

Is it just me or are their upgrades better than ours?

quests.title: &lWorld Tier: &4Pinnacle
desc:
The last &lWorld Tier&r, &lWorld Tier: &4Pinnacle&r. To get it, you'll need to Kill the &d&lEnder Dragon&r atleast once, and equip all &5Epic&r or &6Mythic&r &eArmor &fand &eTool/Weapon&r. 

Now &5Epic&r and &6Mythic&r are most common for &aGems &fand &eTools&r, plus we are more likely to get &zPerfect&r gems! This comes at the loss of &8Common&r and &aUncommon&r but hey, who'll miss them! 

On the same pattern of upgrades we'll get 125% Experience Gained and 100% Luck increase. 

&4Monsters&r will receive their final upgrade, getting: 16 Armor Points, 20 Armor Toughness, 25 Armor Pierce, and 20 Protection Pierce.

quests.title: Sigil Of Malice
desc:
The &cSigil of Malice&r is a mysterious sigil. No one knows how to craft it. Rumors circulate about it being dropped by &4Invaders&r.

What it does is another mystery, though some players found that they lost an affix from gear they used it on, making a different affix stronger. The affixes chosen for this are, much like the sigil itself, yet another mystery.

quests.title: Smart Filter
desc:
&6&lApotheosis&r is now integrated with &aGateways&r.

There are &aGateways&r based on each &lWorld Tier&r (except &l&9Haven&r), providing waves of monsters and &4Invaders&r. These &aGateways&r may only be used within their respective &lWorld Tier&r. Once you beat the final wave, you get a variety of rewards, useful for finishing their respective &lWorld Tier&r.

Unlike other &aGateways&r, you have a total of 3 lives to work with.

quests.title: Gate Pearl
desc:
Unlike other Gate Pearls, this one is obtained by clearing the &4&lPinnacle&r Gateway.

It will come with the sacrifice of Craig the Eternal, a creature with a LOT of health, though.

This gateway will summon an endless stream of increasingly scaling waves, with less and less time between each one. It can spawn &4Invaders&r from ANY dimension, not just the dimension you used it in. This also means you can get gems normally exclusive to other dimensions, such as Endersurge Gems outside of The End.

If you can beat 100 waves, you can get...

quests.title: Sigil Of Supremacy
desc:
The &6Sigil of Supremacy&r!

Another sigil that cannot be crafted, similarly to &cMalice&r. Like &cMalice&r, it can make affixes stronger. Unlike &cMalice&r, it does this to EVERY affix on the gear, and will not sacrifice any in the process.

You can obtain this by beating 100 waves of the Endless Gateway of Apothic Invaders.

quests.title: Quest 7080F026
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks. 

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission. 

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &5&lApothic Enchanting
desc:
&5Enchanting&r gets a few changes with &5&lApotheosis&r. 

To summarize it, 15 &7Bookshelves&r won't be enough now. 

There's new Bookshelves and actions you can do with &5Enchantment Tables&r now and hopefully these quests will help you understand.

quests.title: &2&lVanilla&r Max is just the start
quests.title_plain: Vanilla Max is just the start
desc:
&7Bookshelves&r are your starting point, but definitely not your end point. Atleast not normal &7Bookshelves&r. 

With only normal &7Bookshelves&r you can only get &aEterna&r up and to a max of 30. 
(I will explain the &5Enchantment Levels&r soon but just know you need them up)

quests.title: &l&dInfusing
desc:
&d&lInfusion&r is a special version of &5Enchanting&r which ironically is used for better &5Enchantments&r. 

When the right amount of &aEterna&r, &cQuanta&r, and &5Arcana&r is reached the &5Enchantments&r will offer &d&lInfusion&r. 

(To know the Levels needed you can check EMI or follow these Quests)

quests.title: Other &d&lInfusion&r Items
desc: It's not just &7Bookshelves&r that can be &d&lInfused!&r

quests.title: Making a real &3Trident
desc:
&5&lApotheosis&r knows how annoying &3Tridents&r can be to get so they made it easier... well kinda easier! 

You can now make an &3Inert Trident&r and &d&lInfuse&r it to get a normal &3Trident&r. 

The &3Trident&r requires between &a40 Eterna&r, &c20%-50% Quanta&r, and atleast &535% Arcana&r. 

You can get this with 1 &7Bookshelf&r, 4 &9Echoing Sculkshelf&r, and 1 &2Melonshelf&r.

quests.title: &5Enchantment Library
desc:
The &5Enchantment Library&r is the single greatest &5Enchanted Book&r storage, ever! 

To Craft it you'll need 4 &3Ender Chests&r, 1 &5Enchanting Table&r, and 4 of any of the &d&lInfused&r &7Bookshelves&r: &4Infused Hellshelf&r, &bInfused Seashelves&r, and &9Deepshelves&r. 

To use it, you can either Shift Left Click &5Enchanted Books&r or bring them into the &9Blue Slot&r. This will add the &5Books&r to the &5Library&r. 

The &5Books&r are sorted by name and are held in Points. Each Level of &5Enchanted Book&r determines the Level, and it is reflected on how many &5Books&r would be needed to get that Level. Level 1, is 1 Point. Level 2 is 2 Points. Level 3 is 4 Points. Level 4 is 8 Points. 

Each &5Book&r is stored to a max of 32768 Points, and they can be extracted by Left Clicking the stored &5Book&r. Each Click will add another Level to the &5Book&r in the &6Orange Slot&r. 

You can Click different &5Books&r to add to the &5Book&r in the &6Orange Slot&r, similar to combining &5Books&r in an Anvil. 

The max Level of &5Enchanted Book&r is determined by the highest Level of &5Book&r you've put in. It doesn't matter if you have 32000 Points, if you only put in &5Sharpness III&r, you can only take out &5Sharpness III&r.

quests.title: &6&oLibrary of Alexandria
quests.subtitle: Just imagine if Rome never burned...
desc:
The &6&oLibrary of Alexandria&r is a better &5Enchantment Library&r. 

It can hold higher Levels of &5Enchanted Books&r, but it will still need the Level of &5Book&r to get taken out at that Level. 

It will also hold more Points. The &5Enchantment Library&r can hold 32768, while the &6&oLibrary of Alexandria&r can hold 1.1 Billion Points of each &5Book&r! 

To obtain it, we'll need to &d&lInfuse&r the &5Enchantment Library&r. 

Use 4 &9Soul-Touched Sculkshelves&f, 4 &9Echoing Sculkshelves&f, 1 &dDraconic Endshelf&f, 5 &6Geode-Encased Bookshelves of Stability&r, and a Skeleton Skull.

quests.title: &4Negative&r amounts
desc:
Some &d&lInfusions&r need very, very exact amounts of &aEterna&r, &cQuanta&r, or &5Arcana&r. 

To get these you might need one of these &7Shelves&r. 

Each lowers the amount of its respective quantities.

quests.title: &4Hellshelves
desc:
&4Hellshelves&r are your introduction to &cQuanta&r, they give &c3% Quanta&r and &a3 Eterna&r. 

Better than normal Shelves right? 

You're going to want 16 of them for the next step, 15 &4Hellshelves&r around the &5Enchantment Table&r, with 1 in your Inventory. 

Make the first 11 and I'll give you the last 5 &4Hellshelves&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/apothic/enchant_hellshelf.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &4Infused Hellshelves
desc:
Once we get those 15 &4Hellshelves&r around our &5Enchantment Table&r, we'll have &a45 Eterna&r and &c30% Quanta&r in our &5Table&r. 

This is the perfect amount to &d&lInfuse&r our &4Hellshelves&r! 

&4Infused Hellshelves&r give &a5 Eterna&r with a max of &a60 Eterna&r, along with &c5% Quanta&r. 

These can be Crafted with other Items to make different &7Bookshelves&r, for the ones we want we'll need 12 &4Infused Hellshelves&r! 

Of course, with me being soooo generous, you'll only need to collect 8!

quests.title: &3Enchanting Clues
desc:
You ever spend 3 months studying &oGalatic Code&r to finally understand &5Enchantment Table&r language just for it to be gibberish? 

No? 

Me either, but &9Enchanting Clues&r are your actual translator for it! 

Each &9Enchanting Clue&r will tell you 1 &5Enchantment&r before you actually use it.

quests.title: &4Blazing Hellshelf
desc: &4Blazing Hellshelves&r give a bit of &cQuanta&r and &aEterna&r but they aren't the cheap option we are looking for, for our &d&lInfusions&r!

quests.title: &4Glowing Hellshelf
desc:
By combining an &4Infused Hellshelf&r with some &eGlowstone&r we can make &4Glowing Hellshelves&r! 

These have the same &aEterna&r and &cQuanta&r, but give &53% Arcana&r. 

This will be helpful in later &d&lInfusions&r, like if we wish to use 12 of them to &d&lInfuse&r a &9Dormant Deepshelf&f into a &9Deepshelf&r!

quests.title: &9Deepshelf
desc:
This is where the seperation of &4Hellshelves&r and &bSeashelves&r end! 

First, we'll need to Craft a &9Dormant Deepshelf&r. These are just 6 &8Cracked Deepslate Tiles&r and 3 &7Books&r. 

Then, we'll need &a60 Eterna&r, &c40% Quanta&r, and &540% Arcana&r. We can get that with 12 &bCrystalline Seashelves&r or 12 &4Glowing Hellshelves&r! 

Finally, we can &d&lInfuse&r our &9Dormant Deepshelves&r into regular &9Deepshelves&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/apothic/enchant_deepshelf.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &9Soul-Touched Deepshelf
desc:
&9Soul-Touched Deepshelves&r are an upgrade to &9Deepshelves&r. 

They are Crafted with a &bSoul Lantern&r and 3 &3Sculk Blocks&r. You'll need &5Silk Touch&r to pick up &3Sculk Blocks&r. 

Then, we can Craft our &9Soul-Touched&r version. These will give a ton more &cQuanta&r at &c15%&r! 

It also increases max &aEterna&r to &a75&r.

quests.title: &9Soul-Touched Sculkshelf
desc:
To upgrade &9Deepshelves&r even farther, surprisingly we don't need &d&lInfusion&r! Instead we need more Crafting! 

First, is 5 &3Sculk Blocks&r and a &3Sculk Catalyst&r. Both can be found within the &9Deep Dark&r and will need &5Silk Touch&r to collect. 

Last is the &9Warden Tendril&r... this is a Drop from the &9&lWarden&r... Yes, you'll need to kill the &9&lWarden&r. 

Once you have all that you can Craft one of the best &7Bookshelves&r! One that gives &a10 Eterna&r, &c15% Quanta&r, and &510% Arcana&r. 

And most importantly, gives us a max &aEterna&r of &a80&r! Almost to 100!

quests.title: &9Echoing Deepshelf
desc:
For the &9Echoing&r upgrade we'll need a few different Items. 

Candles which are relatively easy to get! And &9Echo Shards&r... which definitely aren't... 

The best chance at getting them is by Looting an &6Ancient City&r, but you can Craft them with a few different Rituals. 

(Or even later on with &5Enchanting&r!) 

The &9Echoing Deepshelves&r will give a whole lot more &5Arcana&r at &515%&r! Along with raising the max &aEterna&r to &a75&r.

quests.title: &9Echoing Sculkshelf
desc:
To upgrade &9Deepshelves&r even farther, surprisingly we don't need &d&lInfusion&r! Instead we need more Crafting! 

First, is 5 &3Sculk Blocks&r and a &3Sculk Catalyst&r. Both can be found within the &9Deep Dark&r and will need &5Silk Touch&r to collect. 

Last is the &9Warden Tendril&r... this is a Drop from the &9&lWarden&r... Yes, you'll need to kill the &9&lWarden&r. 

Once you have all that you can Craft one of the best &7Bookshelves&r! One that gives &a10 Eterna&r, &c10% Quanta&r, and &515% Arcana&r. 

And most importantly, gives us a max &aEterna&r of &a80&r! Almost to 100!

quests.title: &dEndshelves
desc:
The last and greatest of the &7Bookshelves&r, the &dEndshelves&r! 

These are created with 6 &eEndstone Bricks&r, 1 &3Ender Pearl&r, 1 &7Bookshelf&r, and of course the &dInfused Dragon's Breath&r. 

Their stats aren't currently the best, only giving 5 for each. But their max &aEterna&r of &a90&r is incredible! 

Oh yeah plus they can be Crafted with other Items to upgrade them!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/apothic/enchant_endshelf.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &6Negative Enchantments Removal
desc:
All &5Enchantments&r from the &5Enchantment Table&r is determined by the Levels of &aEterna&r, &cQuanta&r, and &5Arcana&r. 

We can see the Pool of &5Enchantments&r available by clicking the ? in the Top Right of the &5Enchantment Table's&r GUI when an Item is being &5Enchanted&r. 

The higher the &cQuanta&r is, the better the chance we get a weaker &5Enchantment&r gets. 

With the &6Geode-Encased Bookshelf of Stability&r it will get rid of the increased chances of worse &5Enchantments&r.
{@pagebreak}

To Craft it we'll need a &7Bookshelf&r, 7 Calcite, and 1 &5Budding Amethyst&r. 

&5Budding Amethyst&r can not be collected from Mining, even with &5Silk Touch&r. You'll need either a Ritual or Infusion to get one then!

quests.title: &dPearlescent Endshelf
desc:
The &dPearlescent Endshelf&r is an alright &7Shelf&r especially for the price. 

It is created by combining an &dEndshelf&r with 4 &7End Rods&r and 2 &3Ender Pearls&r. 

It will give us max &aEterna 90&r, but this isn't what we want for max &5Enchanting&r.

quests.title: &dDraconic Endshelf
desc:
The &dDraconic Shelf&r is the last Shelf we'll need for perfect set up. 

It might only give &aEterna&r but it has the max &aEterna&r of &a100&r. 

To Craft it we'll need 5 &3Ender Pearls&r and a &dDragon Head&r. That is what makes it &dDraconic&r! 

To get them you can either use &a&lMA&r or find them on &dEnd Ships&r. &dEnd Ships&r are Structures in &d&lThe End&r, on the bow (front) is the &dDragon Head&r.

quests.title: &6&lBest Enchanting set-up
desc:
Ever want the most perfect &5Enchantments&r? Like, every stat maxed out, every good &5Enchantment&r available? Then, you'll need these! 

First, is the 5 &9Soul-Touched Sculkshelves&r and 5 &9Echoing Sculkshelves&r. These will give us all the &cQuanta&r and &5Arcana&r we need! 

Next, is the &dDraconic Endshelf&r which will give us &a100 Eterna&r, as in amount of &aEterna&r and the max level. 

Third, is the &6Geode-Encased Bookshelf of Stability&r, this will make it so the &cQuanta&r doesn't backstab us with awful &5Enchantments&r! 

Last is optional but you should add it, the &6Deepshelf of Arcane Treasures&r. That &7Bookshelf&r will allow us to get &5Enchantments&r we normally wouldn't, like &5Mending&r!

quests.title: &bSeashelves
desc:
&4&lThe Nether&r can be pretty scary, if you'd rather voyage the &bSea&r, use &bSeashelves&r! 

&bSeashelves&r are your introduction to &5Arcana&r, they give &53% Arcana&r and &a3 Eterna&r. 

Better than normal &7Shelves&r right? 

You're going to need 16 for &d&lInfusing&r... well 15 for &d&lInfusing&r, 1 to be &d&lInfused&r! 

Like the &4Hellshelves&r, I'll give you extra, just collect 11 now!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/apothic/enchant_seashelf.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &bInfused Seashelf
desc:
With the 15 &bSeashelves&r around the &5Enchanting Table&r, we can &d&lInfuse&r our last &bSeashelf&r! 

&bInfused Seashelves&r give more &aEterna&r at 5 with a max of &a60&r. Also more &5Arcana&r at &55%&r. 

These can be Crafted into different &7Bookshelves&r, the ones we're looking for, for &6Max Enchanting&r is the &bCrystalline Seashelf&r. 

We'll need 12 of those, so we'll need 12 &bInfused Seashelves&r. Craft 8 and I'll reward you the rest!

quests.title: Remove &5Enchantments&r from Pool
desc:
If you want to remove a specific &5Enchant&r from &5Enchantment Pool&r, you can use this &bBookshelf&r in your &5Enchanting&r set up! 

Place an &5Enchantment Book&r, you want to Blacklist, in an empty spot in this &bSeashelf&r. 

Then, when you &5Enchant&r, this &5Enchantment&r won't show up on Items or Books.

quests.title: &bHeart-Forged Seashelf
desc:
The &bHeart-Forged Seashelf&r is another upgrade to the &bInfused Seashelf&r. 

It's a little expensive but gives lots of &5Arcana&r! 

This will be very helpful for later &d&lInfusions&r needing lots of &5Arcana&r.

quests.title: &bCrystalline Seashelf
desc:
We can Craft &bInfused Seashelves&r with &bPrismarine Crystals&r to get &bCrystalline Seashelves&r. 

The &bCrystalline Seashelves&r will keep the same &a5 Eterna&r, &55% Arcana&r, and now have &c3% Quanta&r. 

With 12 of them, we can get enough Levels to &d&lInfuse&r &9Dormant Deepshelves&r into normal &9Deepshelves&r!

quests.title: &5Arcana
desc:
&5Arcana&r is very important quantity, it increases the amount of &5Enchantments&r you get; and makes rare &5Enchantments&r more common. 

An example with Swords would be like, &5Smite&r is a very common &5Enchantment&r but &5Looting&r is much more rare. 

&5Arcanas&r default is &50%&r and max is &5100%&r.

quests.title: &aEterna
desc:
&aEterna&r sets the &5Enchantment Level&r which determines what &5Enchantments&r you can or will get! 

It's default is &a0&r and max is &a50&r. 

Almost all &7Bookshelves&r will give &aEterna&r but each has max they can set it to.

quests.title: &cQuanta
desc:
&cQuanta&r helps to mix up the &5Enchantment&r Pool, making it easier to get a whole bunch of different &5Enchantments&r. 

&cQuanta&r can work against you though, the more you have it, the more common Bad &5Enchantments&r will get. Bad &5Enchantments&r like &5Curse of Binding&r! 

Before we used &eRectification&r, instead we now use &6Geode-Encased Bookshelves of Stability&r! 

Default &cQuanta&r is &c15%&r and its max is &c100%&r.

quests.title: &dInfused Dragon's Breath
desc:
Now that we have our max &aEterna&r of &a80&r, we can start &d&lInfusing&r &dDragon's Breath&r! 

&dDragon's Breath&r can be obtained when fighting the &d&lEnder Dragon&r. When she is perched above her nest she might shoot a &dPink&r mist at you. When in it, you can Right Click with an Empty Bottle, to obtain &dDragon's Breath&r! 

The best way to get our Levels is with 4 &9Echoing Sculkshelves&r, 4 &9Soul-Touched Sculkshelves&r, and 6 &6Geode-Encased Bookshelves of Stability&r. 

These will give us &a80 Eterna&r, &c25% Quanta&r and &5100% Arcana&r. Perfect for &d&lInfusion&r!

quests.title: Making &5Budding Amethyst
desc:
&5Budding Amethyst&r can be useful for Crafting Recipes and even just Growing &5Amethyst&r! 

With a &5Amethyst Block&r, &a60 Eterna&r, between &c30% &fand &c50% Quanta&r, and &550% Arcana&r we can &d&lInfuse&r one. 

To get all those stats we can use 15 &4Glowing Hellshelves&r and 4 &2Melonshelves&r.

quests.title: Infinite &9Echo Shards&r?
desc:
&9Echo Shards&r can be pretty annoying to farm, plus we'll need a lot of them! So why not have an easier way of Farming them. 

With &d&lInfusion&r we can make 1 &9Echo Shard&r into 4! 

We'll need &a70 Eterna&r, &c50% Quanta&r, and &550% Arcana&r. 

To get that, we can use 12 &4Glowing Hellshelves&r and 2 &9Deepshelves&r, that aren't &9Dormant&r!

quests.title: Unbreakable &eCharms
desc:
The worst part about &eCharms&r is that they break! Why would these OP Potion Effects have to have Durability! 

Well don't you worry, &5&lApotheosis&r has a cure for that... with &d&lInfusions&r! 

You'll need &a100 Eterna&r, between &c8.5% &fand &c13.5% Quanta&r, and between &532.5% &fand &537.5% Arcana&r. 

You can use 10 &4Glowing Hellshelves&r, 4 &6Geode-Encased Bookshelves of Stability&r, 2 &dDraconic Endshelves&r, and a Skeleton Skull! 

Yes, some Skulls and other Items besides &7Bookshelves&r give stats!

quests.title: &8Tome of Scrapping
quests.subtitle: Half Enchantments, breaks Items
desc:
With 8 &7Books&r and an Anvil we can make the &8Tome of Scrapping&r. Well actually 8 of them, but you get the picture! 

By combining an Item with the &8Tome&r in an Anvil, we can take half the &5Enchantments&r off the Item. 

This will end up breaking and voiding the Item after it is done. I don't recommend using it, rather you should upgrade it!

quests.title: &8&lTomes
desc:
&8Tomes&r are &7Books&r... just more useful &7Books&r! 

Each &8Tome&r is Crafted with &7Books&r, Sticks, &cBlaze Rods &fand &cPowder&r. 

&8Tomes&r can be &5Enchanted&r, like Items, to get certain &5Enchantments&r. 

There is also the &8Tomes of Scrapping&r which can be used in Anvils to take &5Enchantments&r off Items.

quests.title: &8Tome of Superior Scrapping
quests.subtitle: All Enchantments, breaks Item
desc:
The &8Tome of Scrapping&r will only take off half the &5Enchantments&r, while the &8Tome of Superior Scrapping&r will take every &5Enchantment&r off the Item! 

Both of these &8Tomes&r will break the Item in use though. 

To &d&lInfuse&r our &8Tome of Scrapping&r into a &8Tome of Superior Scrapping&r we can use 3 &9Echoing Sculkshelves&r and 15 Bookshelves, or 4 Draconium Blocks.

quests.title: Extraction Tome
quests.subtitle: All Enchantments, doesn't break
desc:
The &8Tome of Extraction&r is the &8Tome&r we are looking for! It will take off all &5Enchantments&r and leave the Item alone! 

To make it we'll need to &d&lInfuse&r our &8Tome of Superior Scrapping&r. 

We can just use our previous setup for this.

quests.title: &8Armor Tomes
desc:
&8Armor Tomes&r are used to get &5Enchantments&r which are only used on Armor. All of the &8Tomes&r can get &5Protection&f, &5Blast Protection&f, and &5Fire Protection&r. 

Each also gives ones reserved for a certain part of the Armor. Boots will give &5Depth Strider&r and Helmets will give &5Aqua Affinity&r. 

If you want the best chance for just &5Protection&r try the &8Chestplate Tome&r!

quests.title: &8Weapon Tomes
desc:
&8Tomes of Weaponry&r will give &5Enchantments&r for Swords and Axes. 

Mostly the ones that help with Killing things! Like &5Sharpness &fand &5Fire Aspect&r. 
&8Tomes of Archery&r will give &5Enchantments&r for ranged Weapons, the Bow and Crossbow. 

&5Piercing&f, &5Power&f, and &5Knockback&r!

quests.title: &8Tool Tomes
desc:
The &8Tome of Miners&r will help you with all your Mining. It will give &5Efficiency&f, &5Fortune&f, and &5Silk Touch&r. 

These work for Pickaxes, Axes, Shovels, and even Hoes! 

&8Tome of the Fishers&r will only give Fishing Rod &5Enchantments&r, and yeah there is a lot.

quests.title: &8ETC. Tomes
desc:
The rest of the &5Enchantments&r come from this &8Tome&r. 

&5Unbreaking&r... I don't really know what else...

quests.title: Crafting &aEXP&r?
desc:
&aEXP&r is very important for &5&lApotheosis Enchanting&r! Every &5Enchant&r requires it! (Why do you think I give it in every Reward?) 

With &d&lInfusion&r we can transform &6Honey Bottles&r into &aBottles O' Enchanting&r. Actually we get 3 different &d&lInfusions&r for it! It goes from 1 &aBottle O' Enchanting&r, to 8, to 32! 

First, is for 1 &aBottle&r and needs only 2 &9Echoing Sculkshelves&r. 

Second, is for 8 &aBottles&r and needs 5 &9Echoing Sculkshelves&r and 1 &9Soul-Touched Sculkshelf&r. 

Last, is for 32 &aBottles O' Enchanting&r and will need 5 &9Echoing Sculkshelves&f, 3 &9Soul-Touched&f, and 1 &dDraconic Endshelf&r!

quests.title: &5Flimsy Ender Lead
desc:
Ever wanted to pick up mobs? We...have Soul Gems, Mob Imprisonment Tools, and Creature Catchers for that.

Let's just ignore those for now and focus on the option &5&lApotheosis&r offers. The &5Flimsy Ender Lead&r is the cheapest variant of &5Ender Lead&r, but also the weakest, and most fragile. It can only hold animals, and breaks after 8 uses.

quests.title: &5Ender Lead
desc:
A considerable step up from the &5Flimsy Ender Lead&r. Now, it can hold hostile mobs as well, and will break after 64 uses. To get this, we will need at least &a45 Eterna&r, &c25% Quanta&r, and &540% Arcana&r.

This can be achieved with 9 &bCrystalline Seashelves&r, or, if you prefer &4Hellshelves&r, 9 &4Glowing Hellshelves&r and 8 Candles (Tip: You can fit up to 4 candles into one block)

quests.title: &5Occult Ender Lead
quests.subtitle: Nothing to do with Occultism I swear
desc:
The third and final tier of &5Ender Lead&r is here! This one is unbreakable and can even bind mobs to Spawners. It will require a considerably more tricky &d&lInfusion&r setup. We'll need at least &a75 Eterna&r, &c85% Quanta&r, and between &560-85% Arcana&r.

You can get this with 4 &9Soul-Touched Sculkshelves&r, 4 &9Echoing Sculkshelves&r, 2 &7Stoneshelves&r, and a vanilla Bookshelf. Oh, and you also need a Witch in the Ender Lead used for this &d&lInfusion&r.

quests.title: Apothic Spawners
desc: Another game change Apotheosis brings is to Spawners. Remember being able to mine Spawners with Silk Touch? Well it's back thanks to Apotheosis! There's also many new Modifications you can add to Spawners by right clicking any of these items.

quests.title: Ignore Light
desc: Some mobs (mostly monsters) need certain Light Levels to spawn. Hostile ones needing lower levels and passive needing higher ones. Using a Soul Lantern makes it so you never have to worry about Light Levels as it ignores them! This does not ignore other requirements for spawning like livestock animals needing Grass.

quests.title: Spawn Count
desc: A Fermented Spider's Eye can be used to increase the amount of mobs that CAN spawn from a spawner. The Mobs spawned is random with a Maximum amount determined by the number. It goes up or down by 1 for each eye to a maximum of 16.

quests.title: Max Entities
desc: Max entities is the amount of mobs that can be spawned by a spawner and kept. If it's only 6 max entities when 6 mobs are already spawned no more will spawned until they're dead or moved. Each Ghast Tear brings it up or down 2 Entities. Max of 16 Entities and Minimum of 1.

quests.title: No AI
desc: By using a Chorus Fruit on a Spawner you suck the souls out the mobs that will be spawned, only leaving a hollow husk of what they used to be. The mobs will lose all AI so they will do basically what an armor stand does. They can't hit you, can't teleport, can't move on their own. They sit there ready to be killed, how exciting!

quests.title: Youthful
desc: This one might be new to ones returning from earlier versions. By using a turtle egg on a spawner, it will only spawn in baby versions of the mobs in it. This only works with Vanilla baby versions of mobs, not modded.

quests.title: Spawn Range
desc: The Spawn Range is the area of where mobs can spawn. The bigger the area, the more room for them to spawn in. The smaller the area the cheaper the factory.

quests.title: Redstone Active
desc: Redstone Activation gives your spawner an on/off switch. Without Redstone Power it will not spawn.

quests.title: Activation Range
desc: Activation Range is how close the Player (You) must be to the Spawner for it to work. The lowest it can be is 1 block away and the highest is a 48 block radius.

quests.title: Minimum Spawn Delay
desc: To determine when the Spawner will spawn it picks a random number between maximum and minimum spawn delay. The Minimum can be as low as 20 to as high as 32,767. Each piece of sugar modifies the min delay up or down by 10.

quests.title: Maximum Spawn Delay
desc: The Maximum Spawn Delay is how long it could take to spawn mobs. Just like the Minimum it can be as low as 20 to as high as 32,767. Each Clock modifies the speed of the spawner by 10. The speed is expressed in ticks where 20 ticks equals 1 second. So quickest spawn delay would be 1 second between each.

quests.title: Ignore Players
desc: A Nether Star will do what the Prismarine Shards do but much better. Players no longer need to be near the spawner. As long as its chunk-loaded it will spawn.

quests.title: Ignore All Conditions
desc: The must-need for all Spawners. When it says ignores all conditions, it means most. Ignores light levels, blocks needing for spawning, and biomes. Space conditions are still needed though, like slimes needing 3x3 area to spawn, and same goes with players needing to be nearby.

quests.title: Opposite Day
desc: The Quartz makes whatever the other item does, it does the opposite for the Spawner. With Quartz in your offhand and the other Spawner Modification item in your main it will do the opposite of its role. With Quartz and Blaze Rods instead of increasing Spawn Range it will decrease it. With Quartz and Ghast Tears it'll decrease Max Entities.

quests.title: Quiet down you'll wake up the mobs!
quests.title_plain: Quiet down you'll wake up the mobs!
desc: Wool only does one thing to the spawner and that's to shut it up. Don't like hearing the stupid Spawner noises? Then use Wool! Any color, thread count, or design!

quests.title: Echoing
desc: Echo shards give a special effect to the spawner. Any mobs spawned will have the loot that they drop multiplied.

quests.title: Health
desc: Dripstone used on the spawner will reduce the max health of the mob spawned. This can decrease their health to as low as 20%

quests.title: Burning
desc: A Campfire used on the spawner will have the mobs spawn on fire. Perfect for a nice Steak.

quests.title: Quest 2FE4B7B7
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &4Strider Shoes&r
quests.subtitle: Feet
desc:
The Strider's secret to walking on &cLava&r is within their Legs. So we took their Legs off of them and have you use them instead! 

When Sneaking you can walk safely ontop of &cLava&r! When you stop Sneaking you will fall into the &cLava&r though. These also allow you to safely walk over Magma blocks and other hot blocks!

quests.title: &aRooted Boots
quests.subtitle: Feet
desc:
Like get in touch with Mother Nature man. 

With &aRooted Boots&r nature is your Bestfriend! When standing on Grass you will Regenerate Hearts. Also when you Eat Food when standing on Grass it will act as if you Bonemealed it.

quests.title: &9Flippers&r
quests.subtitle: Feet
desc:
I don't have Hands, I have &9Flippers&r. 

&9Flippers&r will act like a much better Depth Strider. You can Swim and Walk through &9Water&r much faster!

quests.title: &7Steadfast Boots&r
quests.subtitle: Feet
desc:
Spikes, Cleats, Crampons whatever they are! 

&7Steadfast Boots&r keep you steady on your Feet. You won't be knocked back from attacks and you won't slip on Ice anymore.

quests.title: Snowshoes
quests.subtitle: Feet
desc:
If you're like me, or any sane person you despise Powdered Snow. Thankfully &l&3Artifacts&r gives us a tool for dealing with it! Snowshoes! 

Snowshoes will allow you to safely walk over Powdered Snow just like how Leather Boots do. You will also get a Speed boost when walking on any Snow!

quests.title: &cRunning Shoes&r
quests.subtitle: Feet
desc:
I don't believe I have permission to use a specific brand name of &cRunning Shoes&r so use your imagination on which these are. 

&cRunning Shoes&r will give you a Speed Boost when Sprinting so you will be even faster when Running! Also gives you auto-jump when Sprinting...

quests.title: &7Kitty Slippers&r
quests.subtitle: Feet
desc:
For some reason Creepers are scared of Cats. Creepers are also extremely dumb and believe the Cats that your &7Slippers&r look like are real. 

All Creepers will run away from you and won't be hostile when these &7Slippers&r are worn. 

Also makes Kitty noises when you take damage! (Can't assure you that you will always land on your Feet though).

quests.title: &dBunny Hoppers&r
quests.subtitle: Feet
desc:
Bunny, hop. Bunny, hop. Bunny, hop.

With &dBunny Hoppers&r on you can jump twice as high and take half the fall damage as usual! Doesn't make you invincible to Fall Damage, you can still die it's just harder.

quests.title: &bAqua-Dashers&r
quests.subtitle: Feet
desc:
While wearing &bthese&r on your Feet you can preform a miracle! Walking on &9Water&r! 

Well actually running on &9Water&r, you have to be Sprinting to be able to run over &9Water&r. Once you stop Sprinting you will start Sinking.

quests.title: &5Withered Bracelet&r
quests.subtitle: Wrists (Hands)
desc:
While wearing the &5Withered Bracelet&r Melee Attacks have a chance to give the Wither Effect.

Sorry Bow users!

quests.title: &7Pickaxe Heater&r
quests.subtitle: Hands
desc:
Don't you hate having to Mine then Smelt your Ores with two different Items? Well now you can be lazier than ever with the &7Pickaxe Heater&r!

While wearing the &7Pickaxe Heater&r, Ores that you Mined will automatically be Smelted!

Might want to be careful with it if you want Ore Processing.

quests.title: &6Onion Ring&r
quests.subtitle: Hands
desc:
Food by itself can get pretty boring, but it gets much better when you have a side with your dish! More specifically some (a) &6Onion Ring&r!

When wearing the &6Onion Ring&r, everything you eat will give you slight Haste.

quests.title: &eGolden Hook&r
quests.subtitle: Hands
desc: Wearin' dis &eGolden Hook&r will increase yar yield of experience from keel-hauled enemies!

quests.title: &7Vampiric Glove&r
quests.subtitle: Hands
desc:
With this &7Glove&r you will steal the life from any enemies you hit!

Oh yeah sorry I forgot... bleh bleh blehhh!

quests.title: &6Pocket Piston&r
quests.subtitle: Hands
desc:
With the &6Pocket Piston&r your Attacks will hit your Enemies much farther! 

I wonder which wins, &6Pocket Piston&r or &7Steadfast Boots&r?

quests.title: &cFire Gauntlet&r
quests.subtitle: Hands
desc: Everything I hit, bursts into Flames!!!!!

quests.title: &ePower Glove&r
quests.subtitle: Hands
desc: The other side of the &aFeral Claws&r, these increase the Damage you deal while wearing them.

quests.title: &aFeral Claws&r
quests.subtitle: Hands
desc:
Wearing these &aClaws&r just makes you feel a certain way. Adrenaline pumping, thoughts ceasing, strength rising like no other! 

With &aFeral Claws&r you will Attack much faster with your Weapons or Fists.

quests.title: &9Digging Claws&r
quests.subtitle: Hands
desc:
Now these are one of my favorites! 

&9Digging Claws&r will 1. Increase your Mining Speed, so basically a level of Efficiency on all Pickaxes, and 2. Makes your Fists act as a Stone Pickaxe! 

Super helpful for building and just playing in general!

quests.title: &9Warp Drive&r
quests.subtitle: Belt
desc:
Enderpearls are a fun way of travel! (Helpful for the Bumblezone, I wonder if we'll get a Quest chapter for that Mod!) But don't you hate that the Enderpearl gets consumed on use and takes 2 Hearts of damage with each use? 

With &9Warp Drive&r that all goes away, clearly making Enderpearls the greatest transportation! Hunger gets consumed instead of the Enderpearl and no longer take damage from using an Enderpearl. When all Hunger Bars are depleted it will go back to consuming Enderpearls.

quests.title: &5Chorus Belt&r
quests.subtitle: Belt
desc:
Don't you hate when you're just about to kill an Endermen and it teleports away? Well you don't hate you, you love it! You're just angry because you're envious! You want it! 

And with the &5Chorus Belt&r you can get it! You will teleport from a hit that would kill you.

quests.title: &dHelium Flamingo&r
quests.subtitle: Belt
desc:
Perfect for Pool Parties! 

Besides looking cute and funny the &dHelium Flamingo&r allows you to swim in Air. Yes you heard me! Swim... in... Air... 

When in the Air, like jumping, you can press CTRL to start Swimming in Air. You can move around just like in the Water: Swim up, Swim down, Swim all around!

quests.title: &4Crystal Heart&r
quests.subtitle: Belt
desc:
'Also try Terraria!'

When equipped you will gain 5 extra Hearts! Or 10 whole points of Health! Adding up to on default 30 Health.

quests.title: &6Antidote Vessel&r
quests.subtitle: Belt
desc:
Do you have to drink it? Idk it kinda just stays there and works... 

With the &6Antidote Vessel&r, negative Effects (like Wither or Poison) will have their durations cut short! Very helpful when facing Witches or Wither Skeletons.

quests.title: &cUniversal Attractor&r
quests.subtitle: Belt
desc: It's a &cMagnet&r.

quests.title: &5Obsidian Skull&r
quests.subtitle: Belt
desc: After you take a hit from Fire Damage, the &5Obsidian Skull&r will activate giving you a period of Fire Resistance. Hopefully long enough to escape the flames!

quests.title: &bCloud in a Bottle&r
quests.subtitle: Belt
desc:
With the &bCloud in a Bottle&r equipped you can hit Space Bar twice to double jump! Very helpful for parkour! 

Also increases the height you can fall from, like &dBunny Hoppers&r!

quests.title: &5Charm of Shrinking&r
quests.subtitle: Necklace
desc:
Where'd you go?

Oh you're just half your previous size. Small enough to fit beneath a 1 Block gap.

quests.title: &3Charm of Sinking&r
quests.subtitle: Necklace
desc:
What &9Water&r? 

With the &3Charm of Sinking&r you move through the &9Water&r as if it were Air! Still can't breath underwater though...

quests.title: &aThorn Pendant&r
quests.subtitle: Necklace
desc: Gives you Thorns. Not your Armor, you! Like a Pufferfish!

quests.title: &cFlame Pendant&r
quests.subtitle: Necklace
desc:
Similar to &aThorn Pendant&r, just a little hotter. No wait way hotter! 

The &cFlame Pendant&r has a chance to light your attackers on Fire! When they are lit on fire the &cPendant&r will also give you Fire Resistance.

quests.title: &bShock Pendant&r
quests.subtitle: Necklace
desc:
Like the other Pendants this has a chance to hurt your attacker, just with Lightning! 

Also makes it so if you're (un)lucky enough to be hit by Lightning, it won't hurt you.

quests.title: &4Panic Necklace&r
quests.subtitle: Necklace
desc:
Some times the best way to fight, is not to fight.. it's to run away! 

With the &4Panic Necklace&r, when hit you will get Speed Effect for a small time. Just enough time to get away!

quests.title: &eCross Necklace&r
quests.subtitle: Necklace
desc:
Most games that have a Health and Damage system, have Invincibility Frames. After you take Damage you will have a few Invincibility Frames so 1. You don't die in an instant by a simple attack and 2. Gives you time to fight back. 

With &eCross Necklace&r you get a few more Invincibility Frames. Which means a few more times to fight back!

quests.title: &2Lucky Scarf&r
quests.subtitle: Scarf (Necklace)
desc:
This and the &aSuperstitious Hat&r gives you all the lucky charms you can need!
The &2Lucky Scarf&r gives you an extra level of Fortune to your Pickaxes.

quests.title: &9Scarf of Invisibility&r
quests.subtitle: Scarf (Necklace)
desc: Where'd you go?

quests.title: &cAngler's Hat
quests.subtitle: Head
desc:
By tonight he'll be sleeping with the Fishes. 

The &cAngler Hat&r helps you Lure Fish in and makes your chances at getting a Rare Drop higher!

quests.title: &7Cowboy Hat
quests.subtitle: Head
desc:
Wearin' this here &7Hat&r makes yer critters run like the wind! 

It's right purty too.

quests.title: &aSuperstitious Hat
quests.subtitle: Head
desc:
'They're magically delicious!' 

The &aSuperstitious Hat&r grants you an extra level of Looting to Mobs you kill! 

It does stack with Enchants!

quests.title: &eVillager Hat
quests.subtitle: Head
desc:
One of us! One of us! 

The &eVillager Hat&r makes the Villagers believe you're from the same Town so they get rid of the Out-of-Towners Tax. Villager Trades are cheaper.

quests.title: &2Night Vision Goggles
quests.subtitle: Head
desc:
I see you! 

When wearing &2Night Vision Goggles&r you get the ability to see in the dark! Not much else to them...

quests.title: &3Snorkel
quests.subtitle: Head
desc: The &3Snorkel&r gives you a small amount of Water Breathing when you enter &9Water&r. Similar to a Turtle Helmet! Careful though it runs out.

quests.title: &9Novelty Drinking Hat
quests.subtitle: Head
desc:
'It was his Hat Mr Krabs! He was Number 1!' 

Does the same exact thing as the normal &6Drinking Hat&r, just looks much cooler!

quests.title: &6Plastic Drinking Hat
quests.subtitle: Head
desc:
Why spend time sitting down and eating a nice Home-Cooked meal when you can just Eat and Drink quickly! 

With this very stylish &6Hat&r, Eating and Drinking is much faster.

quests.title: &dWhoopie Cushion&r
quests.subtitle: Unique
desc: The single most important! Most powerful! Most dangerous &l&3Artifact&r of them all!
{@pagebreak}
I'm not even sure if I should explain what it does, it's too dangerous!
{@pagebreak}
If you're so sure you can handle its power, then maybe keep reading...
{@pagebreak}
Not too late to turn back!
{@pagebreak}
Okay I warned you...
{@pagebreak}
Press Shift for a chance to Fart when &dWhoopie Cushion&r is equipped.

quests.title: &4Everlasting Steak
quests.subtitle: Unique
desc:
Like regular Raw Beef, you can cook the &cEverlasting Beef&r to get &4Eternal Steak&r!

Works just like &cEverlasting Beef&r but more Food Points and Saturation.

quests.title: &cEverlasting Beef&r
quests.subtitle: Unique
desc:
When slaughtering hundreds of Cows you might come across a Rare Beef. Not one with Mad Cow Disease, I mean the &cEverlasting Beef&r!

&cEverlasting Beef&r can be eaten like a normal Raw Beef, but it won't be deleted when consumed! Instead it will have a cooldown before you can eat it again.

(Also works with autofeeding backpacks!)

quests.title: &4Umbrella&r
quests.subtitle: Unique
desc:
'I'm Marry Poppins ya'll!' 

&4The Umbrella&r is a very useful tool added by &l&3Artifacts&r! It can be held infront of you to work as a Shield, by holding Right Click. Or it can be used to slow your fall by just holding it!

quests.title: &l&3Artifacts
desc:
&l&3Artifacts&r is a wonderful Mod that adds &l&3Artifacts&r that will make your Minecraft expereince much easier and much more fun!

All &l&3Artifacts&r can either be found from exploring, archeology, or killing Mimics!

Mimics are found in Campsites underground, looking like normal Chests! But once you get too close they'll attack!

quests.title: Quest 5FD6A738
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks. 

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission. 

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &l&ePipez
desc: &e&lPipez&r is the simplest &f&lLogistics&r Mod. It's so simple that the entire mod is fit in this Quest Page while having room for more Mods!
Attach the specific Pipe to where you want to move items and use the Pipe Wrench to configure what side Pulls, Pushes, or doesn't connect.
Other Wrenches do work with &e&lPipez&r as well!
(Can be laggy when used in mass, still not as laggy as &5&lMekanism&r pipes though).

quests.title: &eItem Pipez
desc:
The simplest of the simplest of &e&lPipes&r, the &eItem Pipe&r. 

It will move Items from one Inventory to another. Could be from one Chest to another, could be a Farm to a System, or even a Quarry to a Smelter. 

Very simple just connect the &ePipes&r to what you want moved, and use your Wrench to configure which side it Pulls from.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/logistics/pipez_item.png width:200 height:50 align:center}

quests.title: &bFluid Pipez
desc:
&bWater&r=&bBlue&r &bWater&r=&bFluid&r therefore &bBlue&r=&bFluid&r

Lots of Mods have their own &bFluids&r, with even Minecraft having their own, with &bWater&r and &cLava&r. You'll most likely need to move those &bFluids&r and a good way of doing so is with &bFluid Pipes&r. 

This can be connected to Sinks to move Infinite &bWater&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/logistics/pipez_fluid.png width:200 height:50 align:center}

quests.title: &cEnergy Pipez
desc:
Every Tech Mod needs &cEnergy&r, whether it's FE, RF or something else! &cEnergy Pipez&r don't discriminate, it just moves! 

Some Machines have strict IO ports for &cEnergy&r so make sure to check for those!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/logistics/pipez_energy.png width:200 height:50 align:center}

quests.title: &5Universal Pipez
desc: Why worry about what's being moved when you can just move everything! &5Universal Pipez&r are even less discriminatory than &cEnergy Pipez&r. They can move &eItems&r, &bFluids&r, or &cEnergy&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/logistics/pipez_universal.png width:200 height:50 align:center}

quests.title: &aGas Pipez&r
desc:
These &e&lPipez&r are mostly due to &5&lMekanism&r. &5&lMekanism&r adds the last state of matter in the form of &aGas&r. &aGas&r can't be moved with any of the other &e&lPipez&r so if you need to move Hydrogen or Lithium you'll need &aGas Pipez&r. 

(I've always had problems telling whether the &5&lMekanism&r item is &aGas&r, &bFluid&r, or even Infuse Type. When it's in a Machine it might tell &aGas&r or &bFluid&r, which can help teach you. If it doesn't you can check JEI for other recipes that might involve it!)
{image:atm:textures/questpics/logistics/pipez_gas.png width:200 height:50 align:center}

quests.title: Filter Destination Tool
desc:
&e&lPipez&r do have their own way of Filtering Items, you need atleast an Advanced Upgrade to get it though. When an Advanced Upgrade is in you can click the Add button to add Filters. 
Then you can add: Item, Tag, or NBT in the Filter. 

There you can also add the set Destination Filter. To set it, Shift Right Click an Inventory with it. 

You'll also have to set it to either Whitelist the Filter or Blacklist, so only the Filter or everything but the Filter.

quests.title: Smart Filter
desc:
&e&lPipez&r move more! 

All Upgrades increase the amount the &e&lPipez&r move but each grant more options to use with the &e&lPipe&r. 

Basic Upgrade allows Redstone Activation with &e&lPipez&r.

Improved Upgrade allows you to change distribution either:Closest First, Farthest First, Round-Robin, or Random.

Advanced Upgrade gives you option to add Filters.

Ultimate doesn't grant anything new it just moves a lot!

quests.title: &5&lMekanism
desc: &5&lMekanism&r is a huge and popular Tech Mod, so of course it has &lLogistics&r with it.
The different Machines are picky with Configurations and will need to be changed in their GUI to properly move items. Then you can use the &5&lMeka Pipes&r to move whatever you need to move!
But wait it's not just &5&lMekanism&r these work for! They work for plenty of other machines as well! Just need to be Configured with a Wrench to Push and Pull.
(These can cause a bit of lag when used in mass so be careful with them).

quests.title: &3&lIntegrated Dynamics
desc: &3&lIntegrated Dynamics&r is all about &f&lLogistics&r! It's practically the definition of &lLogistic&r.
It's all about moving, managing, and storing items. Heck you might not even need the Wrench for it, it's so well designed! Get one just incase though.
(Least laggy pipe solution, these are recommended).

quests.title: Smart Filter
quests.subtitle: Fluids
desc:
Mechanical Pipes are how &5&lMeka&r lets the Fluids flow.

Some Machines in &5&lMeka&r will need Fluids like Electrolytic Separator needing Water or Evaporation Plants to make Lithium.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/logistics/meka_pipe.png width:200 height:50 align:center}

quests.title: Smart Filter
quests.subtitle: Energy
desc: &5&lMekanism&r is Tech Mod... why are you surprised it needs Energy for its Machines?
{image:atm:textures/questpics/logistics/meka_cable.png width:200 height:50 align:center}

quests.title: Smart Filter
quests.subtitle: Blocks+Items
desc:
Logical Transporters are what &5&lMeka&r uses to move Items and Blocks across distance. 

They will need to be Configured to Pull or Push to Inventories like Chests or Drawers.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/logistics/meka_transporter.png width:200 height:50 align:center}

quests.title: Smart Filter
quests.subtitle: Heat
desc: Heat is another factor in &5&lMekanism&r and it Fuels a lot of Machines and Multiblocks. Thermal Evaporation Plants and Fusion Reactors both use Heat to work. And Conductors is how you will be moving Heat!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/logistics/meka_conductor.png width:200 height:50 align:center}

quests.title: Smart Filter
quests.subtitle: Gas+More
desc:
Because the normal &2&lMinecraft&r Items, Blocks, and Fluids wasn't enough. And the added Heat and Energy wasn't either. 

The rest of &5&lMekanism&r is moved with Pressurized Tubes. Gases are the main ones as if you're using &5&lMekanism&r you will be using Gases like Hydrogen and Oxygen. 
Infuse Types are similar like Coal Infuse and Redstone Infuse. Slurries are used with Ore Processing. 
And Dye Pigments are the essence of Color, any item that is Dyed can be changed with that part of &5&lMekanism&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/logistics/meka_tube.png width:200 height:50 align:center}

quests.title: Cable
desc:
Logic Cables are different from other &e&lPipez&r or &5&lMeka pipes&r. The other Pipes act as hoppers, the items move from 1 Inventory, into the Pipe, then into the 2nd Inventory. Logic Cables just skip the middle man which also skips a lotta lag. 

They are just for connecting Importers and Interfaces.

quests.title: &lLogistics
desc:
&n&f&lLogistics&r: 
A system of moving, managing, and storing items or resources. 

In Modded Minecraft it's quite the same, moving items! With Modded you will need items and by the thousands, heck if you want the &6&lStar&r it gets in the millions! So you'll need to move items from factories, machines, farms, and especially chests. That's what &l&fLogistics&r is for.

quests.title: Variable
desc:
Variable Cards are necessary for starting Interactions like Importing Items. You will put them in one of the slots of the Importer to add them. 

From there you can edit everything via the + Button. You can change how much is Importer, which Item Slot, which Channel, practically everything with just that Card. 

If you're like me just wanting to move items, nothing too fancy just put it in and maybe change the Limit for how much is moved.

quests.title: &fItem Importing
desc:
To get this working put the Item Importer onto the Inventory you want Items pulled from. Next, put the Interface on the second Inventory and connect them with Logic Cables. Then, put in the Variable Card into the Importer and change it as you please. 

It can be changed to Import Items at the Integer Limit (Over 2 Billion).
{image:atm:textures/questpics/logistics/id_item.png width:200 height:50 align:center}

quests.title: &eFluid Importing
desc:
Works just like the Item Importer, put the &eFluid Importer&r onto a Tank with Liquid. Then the &eFluid Interface&r on where you want it to go and connect with Logic Cables. Finally Variable Card just like before! 

Also can pull Liquids at the Integer Limit. 

Does not place or take Fluid Sources from in the world, it only moves Fluids from one Tank to another.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/logistics/id_fluid.png width:200 height:50 align:center}

quests.title: &3Energy Importing
desc:
Just smack an &3Energy Importer&r onto a Power Source and connect it to an &3Energy Interface&r with Logic Cables! Put and edit the Variable Cards and you'll be moving Power like a pro! 

I do have to say I found it having problems with Importing or Exporting to Flux Plugs and Points so be mindful of that.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/logistics/id_energy.png width:200 height:50 align:center}

quests.title: &c&lLaser IO
desc: &c&lLaserIO&r is DireWolf's continuation of &a&lEnderIO&r's &lLogistics&r.
It's all about moving items via &cLasers&r! Who doesn't love &cLasers&r?!
And it all starts with the Logic Chip.

quests.title: Laser Wrench
desc:
These are just used to Connect &cLaser Nodes&r to each other and to Connectors. Not too important I just wanted to keep with the theme of Wrenches. 

It does work as a Wrench for other Configs!

quests.title: Laser Node
desc:
Now this is the true Heart of &c&lLaserIO&r! The &cLaser Nodes&r are where the actual Cards will go into in order to work. 

They will move Items from any adjacent Inventory in the 4 Cardinal Directions and Up and Down. In order to move to Farther Inventories you'll need a second &cNode&r and Connect them with the Wrench by Shift Right Clicking 1 and Right Clicking the 2nd. 

You'll put the Cards into the Slots of the correct Direction and you can put Node Overclockers there as well to make it work faster.

quests.title: Filter Basic
desc:
The Basic Filter is pretty... easy to use! Simply put Items into it and they are now filtered. 

You can change it so it either Whitelists/allows only those Items or that is Blacklists/denies only those Items. 

You can also have it so it either matches NBT data or not. Matching NBT Data would mean having same Enchantments, Durabilitiy, or even Mobs inside of whatever Item. If selected to not match it will do any of that Item regardless of NBT.

quests.title: &2Item Card
desc:
In order to move &2Items&r with &c&lLaserIO&r you'll need some &2Item Cards&r. 

Set one to Extract and put it on the side of the &cLaser Node&r you want to Import from. Then set the other to Insert and put it to the side you want the Items to Export to. 

There are mutliple settings you can change with the Extract in order of where you want the Items to go if there's multiple places to Extract from. Round Robin will make it Extract items in an order instead of closest Inventory first.

quests.title: &9Fluid Card
desc: Works exactly like the &2Item Cards&r, you need Extract and Insert Cards. Just this time you take from Tanks holding &9Fluids&r to another Tank. No, it doesn't move Sources of &9Fluid&r in or out of the World.

quests.title: &eEnergy Card
desc: &eEnergy&r has to get around somehow, preferably where we want it to go. Move it around just the same as with &2Items&r, &9Fluids&r, and &5Chemicals&r!

quests.title: &4Redstone Card
desc: Don't you just hate &4Redstone&r having to be wired to everywhere? If we can have Wireless FE why not Wireless &4Redstone&r? Finally we can thanks to &c&lLaserIO&r. You can Input a &4Redstone Signal&r with the &4Card&r then use an &4Output Card&r to Output the &4Signal&r somewhere else!

quests.title: &5Chemical Card
desc: DireWolf was asked to make an addition of his Cards to work with &5&lMekanism&r and its... other states of matter. Everything Pressurized Tubes can move, these cards can. Gas, Infuse Types, and Pigments.

quests.title: Card Holder
desc:
When using &c&lLaserIO&r for &lLogistics&r you might end up with MANY Cards. With each taking a slot in your Inventory it can get pretty crampt. I wish they had a storage for Cards... oh wait they do, it's the Card Holder! 

You can store multiple Cards in it and when you open a Laser Node the Card Holder will open up as well like a second Inventory. Very helpful!

quests.title: Card Cloner
desc:
With each Card holding their own data it can be pretty annoying constantly changing each Cards settings. So lets just clone them instead! 

Left Click a Card with the Cloner to copy its Data, then Right Click a Card to give it that Data!

quests.title: Laser Connector
desc: If you need to string your &cLaser Nodes&r a far distance try using Connectors! Just use the Wrench like normal.

quests.title: Filter Count
desc:
1... 2... there's a 4 somewhere as well. 

To set a Number put the Item in then you can Left or Right Click to change the amount. Shift and do the same to go by 10s. Once you have a set Number through it into a Card! 

It will then wait until that set Number of Items is there to start taking Items. It will also leave that amount in the first Inventory.

quests.title: Filter Tag
desc:
Tags are very important part of grouping Items in Minecraft. So of course we can take advantage of that for Filters! 

You can put an Item in and select a Tag or if you know it, type it in yourself. 

Really helpful for ones like taking Gear out of a system by using Tag for Tools. 

(You can also find Tags by doing /kubejs hand to find what's the Tags of the Item in your hand.)

quests.title: Filter Mod
desc:
Mod Filter is another pretty basic Filter. This one you put Items in and it will do the same with either Whitelisting or Blacklisting. But instead of only being that Item it will be any Item from that Mod. 

Apotheosis Gem will only allow Apotheosis Items. Mekanism Alloy will only allow Mekanism Items. And so on.

quests.title: Overclocker Card
quests.subtitle: Max: 4
desc:
Cards have their limits. Item Extration can only extract 8 items per Operation. Fluid Extract at only 5 Buckets. God knows with Chemical and Energy. 

This is Modded &2&lMinecraft&r these limits won't suffice we need to Overclock them. 

Throw some Overclockers in the top right of the Card and it'll upgrade the cap they can transfer!

quests.title: Overclocker Node
quests.subtitle: Max: 8
desc:
Cards aren't the only ones with limits, so they also aren't the only ones with Overclockers! 

These go into the &cNode&r itself on bottom right and boost how fast it does Operations.

quests.title: Quest 230582AA
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &3&lTransfer Labels
quests.subtitle: When you gotta fit a pipe between your blocks
desc:
Ever wanted to fit a pipe between blocks? Allow me to introduce you to &3Transfer Labels&r. &3Transfer Labels&r can be used for items and fluids.

&lHow to use&r

You can place &3Labels&r on blocks by sneak right clicking onto blocks.
You can interact with the &3Label&r by holding another &3Label&r or a &#FFAC3BLabel Accessor&r and right clicking the placed &3Label&r.
You can remove the placed &3Label&r by left clicking the &3Label&r while holding another &3Label&r or a &#FFAC3BLabel Accessor&r.
You can access &3Labels&r through blocks using the &#FFAC3BLabel Accessor&r.
\
&lAcceleration&r

You can accelerate the &3Labels&r by adding the same type of &3Label&r in the amount or speed slots.

quests.title: &cBasic Power
quests.subtitle: All The Power!
desc:
This chapter is dedicated to all things power related!

Here you'll find the basic ways to generate, store, and transfer power.

quests.title: &9Extreme Reactors: &aReactors
quests.subtitle: Customizable Reactors!
desc:
&aExtreme Reactors&r offers multi-block Reactors that are completely customizable in size, efficiency, and more.

To learn more about getting started with Extreme Reactors, check out the quest chapter for the mod!

quests.title: &9Mekanism: &aRenewable Energy
quests.subtitle: The Power of the Sun...
desc:
Mekanism provides several ways to make power using renewable resources.

The &9Solar Generators&r harness the power of the Sun to provide basic power needs. It does not work during the night, and must have access to the sky. Glass is okay.

The &9Wind Generator&r provides power via the wind. Unless you've figured out a way for your character to manually spin this, the speed it spins is based off of the Y lvl it is placed at. It also needs direct access to the sky without any blocks above it.

quests.title: &cHeat Generator
desc:
Mekanism's &cHeat Generator&r is a different take on basic power production. It has two modes of creating power:

&9Passive:&r Surrounding the generator with Lava source or flowing blocks creates passive power over time through heat. Place one Lava source block on top and let it flow over the sides. Make sure to have Pipes connected for energy first!

&9Active:&r Placing combustible materials such as Coal or Wood into the generator will burn the fuel to create power. This is not very efficient.

quests.title: &8Coal Generators
quests.subtitle: Fossil Fuels
desc:
These &8Coal Generators&r are some of the easiest generators to make.

They are very simple to use and create a decent amount of power based on the combustible material you put in. They also automatically distributes power to adjacent blocks.

quests.title: &8&lEarly Game Power Options
quests.subtitle: Starter Power
desc:
Looking for early game power options? These are good ways to get you started with generating power.

These don't produce a ton of power, but they are typically easy or cheap to get in the early game!

quests.title: &9Pipez: &aEnergy Pipes
desc:
These are simple pipes that can be upgraded with Pipe Upgrades.

To 'extract' power from a block, place the pipe down next to the block, and on the side that is connected, shift+right-click with the pipe wrench to set the pipe to extract.

The &e&lPipez&r mod also offers ways to transport items, gases, and liquids as well! Or you can make an All-In-One Pipe called the &aUniversal Pipe&r.

Other Wrenches work with &e&lPipez&r as well!

quests.title: &9Mekanism: &aUniversal Cables
quests.subtitle: Mekanism's Energy Transfer Pipe
desc:
Mekanism offers a nice looking Cable to transfer your power.

If the machine you are connecting to already pulls or pushes power, you will not need to configure the Cable. Otherwise, you'll need a &9Configurator&r to configure the Cable. Shift right-clicking will change the Cable to pull or push mode.

quests.title: &f&lTransferring Power
desc:
If you're looking for different ways to get power out of your machines, this is where you can find it!

There are several options, both &awired&r and &9wireless&r, for transferring power.

quests.title: &9Mekanism: &6Quantum Entangloporter
quests.subtitle: Doesn't just work for Power
desc:
With a little work into Mekanism, this machine allows you to transfer anything wirelessly.

You can set specific channels to transfer individual items, energy, or even gases from Mekanism. It's pretty cool.

quests.title: &f&lStoring Power
desc: This section shows you different ways to store your power!

quests.title: &9Mekanism: &aEnergy Cubes
desc:
Mekanism is one of the best mods for energy storage, especially in the early game.

The Basic Energy Cube is easy to configure, easy to craft, and stores a lot of power. It can also be upgraded, and can charge items inside of the interface!

To learn more about upgrading the Energy Cube as well as the mod, head over to the &aMekanism&r quest chapter!

quests.title: &9RFTools Power: &cPowercells
desc:
RFTools Power has &9Powercells&r to store power, which are multi-block storage units that can be customized and upgraded to store power.

You will need a Wrench to determine inputs and outputs for power.

quests.title: &9Integrated Dynamics: &bEnergy Battery
quests.subtitle: Batteries Included
desc: &9Integrated Dynamics&r provides a simple power storage system. The Batteries can be combined in a crafting grid to increase the overall storage!

quests.title: &b&lMid Game Power Options
desc:
You can't power your base off of Coal forever! If you've got a decent amount of resources available, it's time to upgrade your power setup!

These options usually require a little setting up, but produce enough power to carry you far into your playthrough.

quests.title: &9Mekanism: &dGas-Burning Generator
quests.subtitle: MELON POWER!
desc:
If you've ever heard of someone talking about "Melon Power", this is it. Mekanism's &dGas-Burning Generator&r can produce a good amount of power by pumping in &9Ethylene&r made from Melon Slices.

To produce &dEthylene&r, start by crushing organic materials in a &eCrusher&r to create &6Bio Fuel&r. Melon Slices are typically used for this! This is then pumped into a &dPressurized Reaction Chamber&r (PRC for short).

The PRC needs Water, Bio Fuel, and some Hydrogen to create Ethylene. You can get the Hydrogen from separating water in an &9Electrolytic Separator&r.

Once you've started producing the Ethylene, pump it into the Gas-Burning Generator to start generating power!

quests.title: More &aPowah&r!
desc:
Believe it or not, the &aPowah&r mod has some great options for getting... powwe.

Make sure to check out the &cPowah&r qyest chapter to learn more!

quests.title: End Game Power Options
quests.subtitle: More Power Than You'll Need
desc:
If you're looking to generate a ton of power, you can start by scaling up some of the options from the &9Mid Game Power&r section. Make your &aReactors&r bigger. Upgrade your &9Thermo Generators&r to Nitro. Go wild.

However, you may need even more power.

quests.title: &9Pipez: &aUpgrades
desc:
All Upgrades increase the amount the &e&lPipez&r move but each grant more options to use with the &e&lPipe&r. 

Basic Upgrade allows Redstone Activation with &e&lPipez&r.

Improved Upgrade allows you to change distribution either:Closest First, Farthest First, Round-Robin, or Random.

Advanced Upgrade gives you option to add Filters.

Ultimate doesn't grant anything new it just moves a lot!

quests.title: More Power Storage
desc:
&9Mekanism's&r &aInduction Matrix&r is one of the best ways to store your power.

If you're looking for the best power storage Mekanism has to offer, check out the &aMekanism:&r &dReactors&r quest chapter.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_induction_matrix_small.png width:125 height:150 align:center fit:true}

quests.title: &8Flux Networks
quests.subtitle: The Ultimate Wireless Power Solution
desc:
&9Flux Networks&r is a mod that aims to be the solution to all of your wireless power needs.

The mod itself does not have a way to generate power, but it can store and wirelessly transmit power, even across dimensions. It can even charge your items in your inventory.

You can even charge your Jetpacks while you are flying with this mod.

To get started with the mod, you'll need some Flux Dust. Head to Bedrock, then throw some Redstone on top of some Bedrock. Place some Obsidian right above the floating Redstone, then left click the Obsidian.

quests.title: The "Core" Crafting Materials
quests.subtitle: Of Cores you need these
desc: In this mod, you'll need &aFlux Cores&r and &aFlux Blocks&r to craft the core parts of your network. Make a few of each!

quests.title: Starting Your Network
quests.subtitle: Just plug it in!
desc:
The first item you'll need to start your Flux Network is a &9Flux Plug&r.

The Plug is used to "draw" power from the block it is attached to. Aside from a small buffer, the Plug does not store any power itself, so don't worry about it zapping up all of your power.

It is suggested to place the Plug on a power storage block like an Energy Cube. It can connect to Cables, Pipes, or the output of any power producing machine.

To learn how to set up your first network, check the next quest!

quests.title: Quest 36DEA17C
quests.subtitle: Becoming a Network Admin!
desc:
If you right-click on the Plug, you'll see the Flux Network UI. On the far top-right corner, click on the + button to create your first network. You'll need to set a password to create the network, but you can also set a color!

From here, you can go to the Network Selection tab to activate your network on the Plug. If the Plug is attached to a power source, you can now harness that power anywhere in your system using a Flux Point!

Pro Tip: You can create multiple networks if you want to have different power sources powering different parts of your systems!

quests.title: Accessing Network Power
desc:
With our Plug set up, we can now tap into the power from our network. The &9Flux Point&r does exactly that. It points the power from your network to whatever block it is attached to, including Pipes or Cables, or just directly on machines!

Once you've placed your Point on the machine or block you want to power, right-click on it and select your network in the "Network Selection" tab. Just like the Plug, you can adjust how much power the Point pulls, priority level, etc.

quests.title: Flux Storage
quests.subtitle: Storing Power
desc:
Flux Networks does provide a way to store the power you generate for your network!

These hold massive amounts of power overall, and can be upgraded to store even more!

quests.title: Quest 2EB7784D
desc:
Right clicking a functional Flux Network block will give you this UI.

Each Plug or Point can be named, have a custom priority level, and have a custom power transfer limit. This allows complete control over all parts of your system.

&aBypass Limit&r ignores the limit set.

There are several other tabs to check out, mostly for statistics on your network!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/basic_power/flux_ui.png width:125 height:150 align:center}

quests.title: Wireless Charging
desc:
Flux Networks also provides a way to charge your items wirelessly, even across dimensions!

Once you have a Plug attached to your power system, you'll want to make the &9Flux Controller&r and place it down.

Right-click on it to bring up the interface, and go to the "Wireless Charging" tab. From there, you can select each section of your inventory you'd like to keep charged. To activate, make sure to hit the toggle button at the bottom to enable Wireless Charging, then click apply!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/basic_power/wireless_ui.png width:125 height:150 align:center}

quests.title: Automated Flux Dust
desc:
Flux Dust can be automated using &6Productive Bees&r!

Redstone Bee Spawn Eggs can be converted to Flux Dust Bee Spawn Eggs using an Obsidian Bee.

quests.title: &9Industrial Foregoing: &bMycelial Reactor
quests.subtitle: It's not Yourcelial Reactor
desc:
The &bMycelial Reactor&r consists of all the Mycelial Generators working at the same time, near the reactor block, and it produces a total of &a25MFE/t&r.

All sounds good, but you need to automate some stuff to get it working, see what each Mycelial Generator consumes to work, and automate it, most things are simple, but others, not that much... &olooking at Disenchanting Mycelial Generator&r.

But after you get it all automated, you don't need to stop at one, you can make more reactors.

quests.title: &9Mekanism: &dFusion Reactor
quests.subtitle: Fusion Activate!
desc: &9Mekanism&r has an end game power option that is tough to beat. The &dFusion Reactor&r can produce up to 80MRF/t, and if you want to learn how to build it, make sure to check out the &aMekanism: &dReactors&r quest chapter!

quests.title: &eDyson Cube
quests.subtitle: The power of the Sun, in the palm of your hand
desc: The &eDyson Cube&r is the ultimate power source, producing an insane &l&a1GFE/t&r&r!

Set up an &eEM Rail Ejector Controller&r to launch &bSolar Sails&r and &bBeams&r into orbit around the Sun.
