You can input items &bautomatically&r through the center of the bottom face (youll definitely need automation to reach maximum power output). Unfortunately, it &ocannot fire&r at midday, at night, or during rain.
To collect that glorious energy, build a &bRay Receiver Controller&r. It outputs power from the center of its bottom face but &ocannot receive power&r during &enight&r or &erain&r.
You can &epackage&r beams and sails into bundles for faster launches, which is much easier than sending them one by one.
For maximum output, youll need to send &c8,333,333&r beams and &c49,999,998&r sails into orbit, which is quite a lot.
Before you start scaling up to that level, make sure youve got some &arobust resource generation&r in place.

quests.title: &9Draconic Evolution: &dEnergy Core
quests.subtitle: Basically Infinite Storage
desc: &bDraconic Evolution&r adds a multiblock called the &dEnergy Core&r.
While it may seem confusing, the final tier can hold &m9,223,372,036,854,775,808 FE&r basically infinite power.
For more information check out the Draconic Evolution Chapter
{image:atm:textures/questpics/draconic/draconic_core_8on.png width:100 height:100 align:1}

quests.title: Automated Flux Dust
desc:
Flux Dust can also be automated using &6XyCraft&r!

Place a charged redstone crystal block on bedrock, surround the crystal block with 4 obsidian on all sides and place the extractor on top.
Then just place a storage on top of the extractor and you're done!

quests.title: &dNetherite Chest
quests.subtitle: So much room for activities!
desc: The biggest of the chests from Sophisticated Storage

quests.title: Sophisticated Storage
quests.subtitle: "Vanilla Chest"
desc:
Sophisticated Storage allows you to upgrade your Chests and Barrels with metals to increase their storage! You can also add upgrades to increase their functionality.

These chests are just like a vanilla Chest or Barrel, but they have a slot for a Storage Upgrade!

quests.title: Smart Filter
quests.subtitle: Stacks on Stacks
desc: Drawers can be 1x1, 2x1 or 2x2. Drawers can hold a ton of stacks of 1/2/4 items depending on the type of Drawer.

quests.title: Compacting Drawer
quests.subtitle: Auto Compacts/Decompacts
desc:
The Compacting Drawer can convert items placed inside to their nugget or block forms.

For example: An Iron Ingot placed in this will allow you to pull out 9 nuggets, or if more Iron is placed in, will covert it to Iron Blocks.

quests.title: Storage Controller
quests.subtitle: The Brain of the Drawers
desc:
When placed and connected with the &aLinking Tool&r to other Drawers, the Controller acts as a "Hub".

If you double right-click this, all the items in your inventory that have a slot in the Drawer network will be pulled.

By sneak right-Clicking the controller with an empty hand, you can open the upgrades tab, add normal storage upgrades to those slots to increase the Controller's range. Max range is 40 blocks for all sides, or a cube of 80x80x80.

quests.title: Basic Storage
desc:
Welcome to the Basic Storage Chapter!

You'll find all of the basic ways to store items without needing power, as well as useful items for your storage needs!

quests.title: Trash Cans
quests.subtitle: Getting Rid of The Excess
desc: Trash Cans act as a way to destroy unwanted items, liquid, and power.

quests.title: Ender Drawer
quests.subtitle: Dimensional Drawer...
desc:
Using a &aLinking Tool&r, you can link 2 Ender Drawers to sync up their contents.

This works just like an Ender Chest, but as a Drawer.

To link, left-click the first Ender Drawer with the &aLinking Tool&r (on the outside, not item face), then crouch/shift + right-click the second Ender Drawer.

quests.title: Functional Storage
quests.subtitle: Storage Drawers Distant Relative
desc:
Functional Storage is a storage mod that adds varuious useful items to help with storage and ways of storing stacks of the same items.

This can be useful for items like Cobblestone, Dirt and more.

quests.title: Sophisticated Backpacks
quests.subtitle: Inventories are too Small
desc:
Sophisticated Backpacks offers upgradable Backpacks that can use filters to add nifty features!

Backpacks can be put in your Curios Back slot and they can be dyed.

quests.title: Upgrade Base
quests.subtitle: The Base for Upgrades
desc: You will need these to make Backpack Upgrades.

quests.title: Pickup Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Allows the backpack to pick up items.
desc: Allows the Backpack to pick up items.

quests.title: Filter Upgrade
desc: Adds a filter for items being pumped in or out of the Backpack.

quests.title: Magnet Upgrade
desc: Magnets items into the Backpack.

quests.title: Feeding Upgrade
desc: Auto-feeds you with food in the Backpack.

quests.title: Compacting Upgrade
desc: Compacts items in the Backpack to their 2x2 recipe.

quests.title: &eAdvanced Compacting Upgrade
quests.subtitle: More Filtering Options
desc: Compacts items in the backpack to their 3x3 recipe.

quests.title: Void Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Adds a filter for items you want to auto-delete in the backpack.
desc: Adds a filter for items you want to auto-delete in the Backpack.

quests.title: Restock Upgrade
quests.subtitle: All Stocked up
desc: Adds a filter that allows you to tell the Backpack which items it should keep stocked. Shift right-clicking an inventory will refill it.

quests.title: Deposit Upgrade
desc: Shift-Right Click an inventory to empty.

quests.title: Refill Upgrade
desc: Keeps the player's inventory stacked up from items inside the Backpack.

quests.title: Inception Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Backpacks in your Backpacks?
desc: This is a Backpack upgrade so you can put your Backpack in your Backpack.
So you can have your Backpack in your Backpack for when you need your Backpack in your Backpack.

quests.title: Everlasting Upgrade
desc: This upgrade makes it so the Backpack can't die.

quests.title: Smelting Upgrade
desc: Adds a Furnace GUI to the Backpack.

quests.title: &eAuto-Smelting Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Automatic
desc: Auto-smelt items in the Backpack.

quests.title: Smoking Upgrade
desc: Adds a Smoker GUI to the Backpack.

quests.title: &eAuto-Smoking Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Automatic
desc: Auto-smelt items in the Backpack.

quests.title: Blasting Upgrade
desc: Adds a Blast Furnace GUI to the Backpack.

quests.title: &eAuto-Blasting Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Automatic
desc: Auto-smelt items in the Backpack.

quests.title: Crafting Upgrade
desc: Adds a Crafting Table GUI to the Backpack.

quests.title: Stonecutter Upgrade
desc: Adds a Stonecutter GUI to the Backpack.

quests.title: &fStack Upgrade Tier 1
desc: Increases stack size in the Backpack by 2.

quests.title: &eStack Upgrade Tier 2
desc: Increases stack size in the Backpack by 4.

quests.title: &bStack Upgrade Tier 3
desc: Increases stack size in the Backpack by 8.

quests.title: &dStack Upgrade Tier 4
desc: Increases stack size in the Backpack by 16.

quests.title: Jukebox Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Now we're jammin
desc: Adds a Jukebox GUI to the Backpack.

quests.title: Tool Swapper Upgrade
desc: Auto-swaps to the tool that is most effective for the block you are looking at.

quests.title: Tank Upgrade
desc: Adds a tank to the Backpack.

quests.title: Battery Upgrade
desc: Adds a battery to the Backpack.

quests.title: Pump Upgrade
desc: Adds the ability to pump liquids from the Tank Upgrade.

quests.title: &aExperience Pump Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Storing XP
desc: Allows you to pump experience between you and the Backpack.

quests.title: Linking Tool
desc:
Used to link Drawers to a Controller and to link up Ender Drawers.

To link Drawers to the Controller, right click the Controller block to start configuration. Right clicking Drawers will add them to the network.

Holding the tool will show you what Drawers are connected to the Controller.

quests.title: Upgrade Base
quests.subtitle: The Base for Upgrades
desc:
To save you from having this &oentire quest section&r covered with upgrades, take a look at the Sophisticated Backpack upgrades

You'll need to make the Sophisticated Storage equivalent, but they function about the same.

quests.title: Configuration Tool
desc:
The Configuration Tool is used to lock Drawers for them to remember the item it has inside.

This can be useful whenever you set up a system to push and pull from Drawers. The locked Drawer will not replace the item that was locked on it!

quests.title: Quest 7EF57BBE
desc:
Looking to create virtual storage using a mod like &9Applied Energistics 2&r?

These are great ways to upgrade your storage, but it is important to talk about &eNBT Items&r and the best way to store them.

NBT items are items with extra tags attached to them. Enchanted items, items with durability and more. These are items with NBT tags attached to them. Because of this, they don't usually stack.

When you store a lot of these into a storage system like AE2, you run the chance of creating issues for your save or server.

Because of this, it is best to store them in Chests or Bags!

quests.title: Controller Extension
desc: The Storage Access Point acts as a Storage Controller when linked to it, being able to be pushed into or pulled from. Basically a entry point for the Drawers.

quests.title: Simple Compacting Drawer
quests.subtitle: Auto Compacts/Decompacts
desc: This Drawer will auto convert the item placed inside it into it's compacted form.

quests.title: Iron Downgrade
desc: The Iron Downgrade will downgrade the Drawer's max space to a stack. This can be usefull for keeping items on stock, but not too many.

quests.title: Collector Upgrade
desc: The Collector Upgrade will make the Drawer vacuum items in from one of the sides.

quests.title: Puller Upgrade
desc: The Puller Upgrade allows Drawers to pull in items from any side.

quests.title: Pusher Upgrade
desc: The Pusher Upgrade allows Drawers to push out items into any side.

quests.title: Void Upgrade
desc:
This upgrade will void extra items that come when Drawers are full.

This can be usefull to prevent overflow or to prevent a setup from backing up due to the storage being full.

quests.title: Redstone Upgrade
desc:
This upgrade will make Drawers output a Redstone signal on all sides, signal strength saying how full/empty it is.

For multi-slot Drawers, the upgrade can be configured to which slot to monitor.

0 - means empty.
15 - means full.

quests.title: Controller
desc:
The Storage Controller allows you to work with multiple storages as if they were one big storage multiblock.

This allows for a very large storage network, which can be combined with mods like Applied Energistics or Integrated Dynamics, as the Storage Controller acts as an in/out point for all storages attached to it.

Connecting either can be done by simply putting storages next to Storage Controller or next to others that are already connected to Storage Controller (this works up to 14 blocks away from controller in all directions).

quests.title: Storage Link
desc:
The Storage Link allows you to connect multiple storages that are not attached to a Storage Controller or any blocks that are connected to it.

So its a way to wirelessly connect a "multiblock" of storages without needing to right-click each one of them.

14 blocks of range still applies.

quests.title: Storage Tool
desc:
The Storage Controller is also able to connect to other storages wirelessly, this is possible using the Storage Tool, just right click the Storage Controller to bind it and right click the storages to link them.

The range for wireless linking is the same as regular, 14 blocks of space.

quests.title: Smart Filter
desc:
Want to have custom Drawers? Look no further, these can mimic a block's texture on the outside, and a different one in the front.

Follow the tooltip on how to do it.

quests.title: Smart Filter
desc:
If you thought this mod was only for storing items, you would be wrong, there are also Fluid Drawers!

They work the same way as regular Drawers, but store fluids instead.

quests.title: Vanilla Storage
quests.subtitle: The Chest
desc: Chests have 27 slots and can be made into a double chest to store twice that amount.

quests.title: Trapped Chest
quests.subtitle: "I wonder what's in here?"
desc: Trapped Chests are the same as regular Chests only the emit a Redstone signal when opened and they can't be combined together into 1.

quests.title: Barrel
desc: Barrels work the same as Chests only they can't be combined together into 1. They look cool though.

quests.title: Ender Chest
desc: Ender Chests all share the same inventory and that inventory is different for every player. They can't be combined together into 1.

quests.title: Chest Minecart
desc: Minecarts with Chests are Minecarts with Chests in them. You can't ride in these but they can be useful for transporting items across Rail systems.

quests.title: Smart Filter
desc: Boats with Chests are Boats with Chests on them. You can open the chest while you're in the Boat or you can right-click on it. Only one person can ride in the Boat at a time.

quests.title: &6Copper Chest
desc: The Copper Chest can be made but is not needed to make an Iron Chest, it can be used if you want to save some Iron though.

quests.title: Smart Filter
desc: Adds crafting GUIs for Chipped Workbenches to your Backpack.

quests.title: Quest 209DC1E9
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &eWelcome to Getting Started&r!
desc:
ATM10 is a &aKitchensink&r pack, meaning you are free to explore and play the modpack any way that you want!

However, there is an endgame goal: Making the &6ATM Star&r!

This questline serves as a guide for all players, whether you are brand new to Minecraft or you've played through previous ATM packs.

Just like almost every modpack, gather some wood to get started!

quests.title: Putting the Craft in Minecraft
desc:
I'm going to assume you've been crafting, right? It is MineCRAFT after all.

Sure, you could craft in your inventory using the 2x2 crafting grid, but that won't get you far. We need to upgrade by making a Crafting Table!

quests.title: Our First Pick
desc:
Whether you are an experienced modded player, or a complete noob to MC, everyone has to make a &2Wooden Pickaxe&r.

Pickaxes allow you to break most stone and metal blocks. This wooden one won't last long, so make sure to gather some &3Cobblestone&r with it!

quests.title: Crafting, but on a Stick
desc:
Personally, I hate having to run to a block just to craft. That's where the &2Crafting Table on a Stick&r comes in!

This item works as a &aPortable Crafting Table&r!

Tip: You can also put this in your &aCurios&r slot and set a &bKeybind&r to open it!

quests.title: Stone Age
desc:
With our Wooden Pickaxe, stone shouldn't be a problem to break!

&3Cobblestone&r unlocks the next part of progression by allowing you to craft a Furnace to smelt our ores.

You'll also want to upgrade your pickaxe to stone to mine better ores like &bIron&r!

quests.title: &aFurnace Upgrades&r!
desc:
With our new metals, we can upgrade our Furnace using the mod &aIron Furnaces&r!

Iron Furnaces (Furnaces from the mod itself, not just the Iron version) allow you to add &aAugments&r to upgrade a Furnace's speed, change its function, and much more!

These Furnaces make automation easier by allowing you to auto-pull or push from the sides using the config on the left of the interface.

quests.title: The &9Metal&r Age
desc:
I'm going to assume you've been out mining, right? It is MINEcraft after all.

You'll find a ton of new ores that might confuse you, but you can stick to the vanilla materials to get you started!

Copper is abundant and has plenty of uses for things like &aOre Hammers&r or &eDrawer Upgrades&r, so make sure to grab plenty of it!

Iron is probably one of the most important ores you'll want to get every time you run into it. The world of modded MC pretty much runs on Iron.

quests.title: An &aIron&r Pick
desc:
The next step of progression is to make an Iron Pickaxe.

This pickaxe can mine some of the rarer ores in the game, including Diamond!

quests.title: &cRedstone&r
desc: Once you have an Iron or better tier Pickaxe, you'll be able to mine &cRedstone&r.
Redstone starts your journey into many technical mods, like creating power or making fancy gadgets.
This is a resource you will want a lot of!

quests.title: We've Struck &bDiamonds&r!
desc: Diamonds are one of the best materials to use for tool crafting, but they also allow you to visit new dimensions like the Twilight Forest!

quests.title: &cTo The Nether&r!
desc:
With a Diamond tier pickaxe, you'll be able to mine &dObsidian&r. Obsidian can be used to create a portal to the &cNether&r.

The portal frame can be many different sizes, but most go with the basic 'Door' shape. This is a hollow 4x5 shape using a minimum of 10 Obsidian. You don't have to use Obsidian for the corners, just the portal frame itself!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/gettingstarted/example_netherportal.png width:175 height:201 align:1}

quests.title: &eBasic Ore Doubling
desc:
Smelting down raw ores in the beginning is necessary, but you are missing out on extra resources!

There are several ways to double your output per raw ore, but one of the easiest ways is by creating and using an &eOre Hammer&r.

These will break down 1 raw ore into 2 ore dust, which can be smelted into ingots, effectively doubling your ingot output!

Want more per raw ore? Check out the mod &5Occultism&r!

quests.title: Smart Filter
desc: There are many ways to store power!
&9Powah&r offers great storage using &aEnergy Cells&r that can be upgraded, or you can always go with the multiblock style of &aRFTools&r using &aPowercells&r! The choice is yours.
Note: You only have to make one of the items to complete the quest.

quests.title: Smart Filter
desc: Transferring power out of your generators is probably a good idea, but how can you do it?
To start, you can use &cEnergy Pipes&r from the &aPipez&r mod, or you can use the &9Powah&r &cEnergy Cables&r if you have already started using that mod.
Or if you want a throwback, this pack has &6EnderIO&r and you can use the &6Energy Conduits&r from it.

quests.title: &aFinding &dThe End
desc:
Once you've gathered enough Ender Pearls and Blaze Powder, you can make your way to the End Portal in the Overworld.

To do this, craft some &dEyes of Ender&r and right click to throw them in the sky. These will point in the direction of the closest End Portal.

Make your way to the Stronghold, find the End Portal, and complete the frame using the Eyes of Ender to create the portal to &dThe End&r.

quests.title: &5The End
desc:
In &dThe End&r, you'll find the final boss of Vanilla Minecraft: The &5Ender Dragon&r.

At the top of each pillar of Obsidian, you'll find an End Crystal that heals the Dragon. Make sure to take those out first! They also deal a lot of damage when they explode, so make sure to create some distance!

Once defeated, a &dDragon Egg&r spawns at the top of the Exit Portal. This cannot be mined like normal blocks, but is affected by gravity.

quests.title: &9Gearing Up
desc:
This quest only requires you to make one Diamond tool or armor piece, but it's probably good to get a full set!

Diamond tools boast high durability, and the armor offers great protection overall.

To make the better tools and armor in the game, you'll need Diamond stuff as a base!

quests.title: &6Netherite Template&r
desc:
To create Netherite tools and armor you'll need to find the &6Netherite Smithing Template&r in chests found inside of Bastions.

These can be combined with a &cNetherite&r ingot and a Diamond tool or armor piece in a &aSmithing Table&r to upgrade it to &cNetherite&r.

Tip: Don't use all of your templates in one go! You can create duplicates by using the recipe to create another.

quests.title: &dNetherite Tier
desc:
&dNetherite&r items are even better overall, and won't burn in lava! You still will though, even wearing the armor. Don't try it out.

These items can be used to make some of the best tools and armor in the game.

quests.title: &2Archaeology&r!
desc:
&2Achaeology&r allows players to find items inside of &aSuspicious&r blocks like Sand and Gravel.

These blocks can be found in various structures like Warm Ocean Ruins, Desert Pyramids, Desert Wells, and &eTrail Ruins&r.

To uncover an item from a Suspicious block, you need to create a &aBrush&r to brush away the block to unveil an item.

quests.title: &dAncient Metals
desc: In the &cNether&r, you'll run into &6Ancient Debris&r. This can be smelted down into Scraps that can be combined with Gold to create &6Netherite Ingots&r, which is an endgame metal used to craft some of the strongest tools and armor in the game.

quests.title: &6Visit The &dDeep Dark&r!
desc:
This biome was introduced in the Wild Update!

Be careful! You might accidentally summon a new friend.

P.S. - He's not friendly.

quests.title: &dArmor Trims
desc:
&aArmor Trims&r are items used to add trims to your armor! This can be done in Smithing Tables.

While they do have a recipe, most of the trims are rare finds in from loot chests or archaeology digs. Once you find one, you can dupe the Template by using the recipe to create more!

quests.title: &aThe &5Sniffer
quests.subtitle: Scruff McGruff's Distant Cousin
desc:
To find this egg, you'll need to brush away &aSuspicious Sand&r in Warm Ocean Ruins.

You can place the Egg into the world and it will slowly hatch into a &dSnifflet&r. This takes around 20 minutes to hatch normally, but can be placed on a Moss block to double the hatch speed, taking only 10 minutes to hatch.

The Snifflet will eventually grow into an adult &dSniffer&r that can sniff up items like &2Torchflower Seeds&r or &2Pitcher Pods&r when they wander over blocks they can dig in.

You can breed 2 adult Sniffers by using Torchflowers.

quests.title: &5Kill The Warden
desc:
The &dWarden&r can be summoned by setting off a &5Sculk Sensor&r that is near a &3Sculk Shrieker&r at least 3 times.

Fun Fact: The Warden is blind! It can only find you if it hears you, so either fly around or sneak!

Tip: It doesn't matter if you use Ranged or Melee attacks, because it will find you. And it will hit you. If you go too far, it'll burrow into the ground and come up next to you! Good luck :D

quests.title: &6Kill The &5Wither
desc:
The &5Wither&r is one of the hardest bosses to kill in Minecraft. Mainly because it flies. And explodes. And is fast. You get the picture.

To summon it, place down the 4 Soul Sand in the shape of a T. Place the 3 Wither Skeleton Skulls on the top of the 'T' and the &5Wither&r will spawn.

Tip: It explodes. A lot. Don't do this near your base.

quests.title: Furnace &aAugments
desc:
&aAugments&r are Furnace upgrades that can either change or upgrade the function of a Furnace.

 - Blasting: Converts the Furnace to only allow for Blasting recipes.

 - Smoking: Converts the Furnace to only allow for Smoking recipes.

 - Factory: Converts the Furnace to use power instead of fuel, and upgrades it to a factory, allowing it to smelt multiple items at once. This increases depending on the tier of Furnace.

 - Speed: Doubles the speed of the furnace at the cost of double the fuel.

 - Fuel Efficiency: Doubles the amount of items smelted per fuel, but reduces the speed by 25%

quests.title: &6Summoning The &5Wither
desc: To summon the boss of the Nether, we need to gather a few items first.
We'll need to get at least 3 &5Wither Skeleton Skulls&r. These are rare drops from killing &7Wither Skeletons&r, or can be crafted with the more common drop, the &3Wither Skull Fragments&r.
You'll also need at least 4 pieces of Soul Sand, and probably some pretty good armor.

quests.title: Wind Power
desc: If you are like most this is the power you are after. All you do is place it as high as you can and get free power.

quests.title: Solar Power
desc: Just like wind generation this will give you lots of power without giving it any resources. The only downside here is it has to be daytime.

quests.title: Lava Power
desc: Now that you have all this lava what will you do with it? More early game power!

quests.title: Smart Filter
quests.subtitle: Smelt your logs
desc: Coal is your first real source of power. If you are running low and can't find any Coal, an alternative would be to use Charcoal.

quests.title: Lava Bucket
desc: Buckets and Tanks are a great early way to move around lava.

quests.title: Copper Generator
desc: We also have the mod called &aGenerators Galore&r! This mod adds unique generators that use coal or other items.

quests.title: Generators Galore
desc: As was mentioned before, this mod adds a ton of fun ways to generate power that require specific builds.

quests.title: Quest 110BF3A2
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &6&lCreate&r
desc:
Most Players will already know of &6&lCreate&r especially its billions of Addons! Not that many Mods have whole Modpacks based around them! 

If you aren't used to &6&lCreate&r, these Quests should help you to learn the Mod. And with many &eItems &fand &6Machines&r there is a Ponder Option! Hold W while viewing the &eItem&r to watch a schematic that will teach you to understand the &eItem &for &6Machine&r. 

And trust me, you'll want to learn &6&lCreate&r, it is super useful! 

To start you'll need &8Andesite&r and lots of it.

quests.title: &8Andesite Alloys
desc:
What will we need all that &8Andesite&r for? We'll need &8Andesite Alloys&r! 

&8Andesite Alloys&r are made by combining 2 &8Andesite&r with either 2 &7Iron Nuggets&r or 2 &7Zinc Nuggets&r. 

&8Andesite Alloys&r don't do much on their own, rather they are the Crafting Ingrediant for almost all Machines and Items. So yeah, we'll need a few.

quests.title: &d&lRotational Power
desc:
&dRotational Power&r is the most important and confusing part of &6&lCreate&r. 

All Machines will need some sort of &dRotational Power&r to work, but what is it and how do we use it? 

&dRotational Power&r is simply our Machines moving. Blocks like Shafts and Cogs will move that &dRotational Power&r to our Machines. 

Talking about Shafts, that is our start to &dRotational Power&r. They can be placed in a straight line, next to each other. 

When one &8Shaft&r is moved, all &8Shafts&r connected to it (on the same axis) will move with it. 

Craft 2 &8Andesite Alloys&r to create 8 &8Shafts&r.

quests.title: &6Encased Fan
quests.subtitle: This blows!
desc:
The &6Encased Fan&r is one of the most underrated Machines in &6&lCreate&r. 

You can place it down and it'll face you, or Shift Right Click to place it facing away from you. 

When given &dRotational Power&r &e&oClockwise&r, it will blow air away from it. When given &dRotational Power&r &9&oCounter-Clockwise&r it will suck air toward it. 

These sucks and blows will also effect &eItems&r and Entities near them, and yes the faster it spins the more it sucks and blows! 

We also get extra Recipes we can make by putting a Block in front of the &6Fan&r. This will then effect the &eItems&r being blown on by the &6Fan&r. 

We can use &cLava&r to &6Blast&e Items&r like a Furnace. Getting Ingots from Ores, Stone from Cobble, and Nuggets from Tools. 

If we put Fire in front of the Fan we can Smoke Items. Like Cooking them! 

Instead of Lava we can also place Water in front of it. This will wash whatever is in front of it like Concrete Powder into Concrete. 

And last, instead of Fire we can use Soul Fire to haunt Items! This will change Items either into Nether variants or entirely different Items.

quests.title: &dGearbox
desc:
The &dGearbox&r is helpful for sending &dRotational Power&r in a whole bunch of different directions! 

The normal &dGearbox&r will have 4 internal &8Shafts&r, on each of the Cardinal Directions: North, East, South, and West. 

The other &8Shafts&r will match the Speed and Stress Units but they will also spin in different directions from the original &8Shaft&r.

quests.title: &dClutch
desc:
The &dClutch&r can be connected to our Kinetic Systems where it will act like a Fence Gate. 

By giving it a &4Redstone Signal&r it will stop the flow of &dRotational Power&r through it. 

So all &dRotating&r will stop at the &dClutch&r if it is powered with &4Redstone&r. The ones &dRotating&r into it will continue &dRotating&r as normal though!

quests.title: &dGearshift
desc:
&dGearshifts&r work similar to a &dClutch&r by connecting to our Systems and being powered by &4Redstone&r. 

Instead of stopping &dRotational Power&r though, the &dGearshift&r will change its Direction! 

If it is going &e&oClockwise&r into the powered &dGearshift&r, it will come out &9&oCounter-Clockwise&r, and vice versa.

quests.title: &dEncased Chain Drives
desc:
&dEncased Chain Drives&r will act similar to &eBelts&r, by connecting &8Shafts&r to each other in a row. 

There is quite a few differences though, like that &dEncased Chain Drives&r can be used with a &6Wrench&r to rotate. They also need to be placed directly next to other &dChain Drives&r to keep &dRotating&r. 

Like &eBelts&r though, they keep the same Speed and Stress Units as the original &8Shaft&r. Plus they keep the same direction!

quests.title: &dAdjustable Chain Drive
desc:
&dAdjustable Chain Drives&r work like &dEncased Chain Drives&r, just with more configs. 

If we send a &4Redstone Signal&r to the &dAdjustable Chain Drive&r that the original &8Shaft&r is connected to, the other &dChain Drive &8Shafts&r will double in Speed! 

If we send one to a different &dChain Drive&r though, the Speed of that &dChain Drive&r will be cut in half!

quests.title: &6Mechanical Press
desc:
The &6Mechanical Press&r is very helpful for making even more &6Machines&r! 

When powered with &dRotational Power&r (and a lot of Stress Units) it will send the &6Metal Press&r down to Blocks below it. Like a Hydraulic Press! 

Any Items below it: either on a &eBelt&r, &eDepot&r, or even just dropped, will be &6Pressed&r. 

This is mainly for turning &7Ingots &finto &7Plates&r with no charge. You can also use it to get Paper from Sugarcane and Paths from Dirt! 

If you place a &8Basin&r beneath it you can then use the &6Press&r to combine &bLiquids&r, &eItems&r, and Blocks to create new &eItems&r. 

Another option with the &8Basin&r below our Press is Compacting Crafting. This is automated Crafting for Recipes that contain only one type of &eItem&r, like 9 &7Iron Ingots&f into an &7Iron Block&r.

quests.title: &6Mechanical Mixer
desc:
The &6Mixer&r can do quite a few different Recipes but all will need a &8Basin&r below it! 

We can &6Mix&r, this combines &bLiquids&f and &eItems&f into new &eItems&r. Like Baking! 

&6Brewing&r can combine the right &bLiquids &fand &eItems&r to make Liquid Potions. These can then be scooped out into Empty Bottles to get Potions. You'll need Heat from a &cBlaze Burner&r to &6Brew&r though. 

Last is &6Automated Shapeless Crafting&r. To the normal Player this might be a confusing statement but trust me it ain't that bad. &6Shapeless Crafting&r is a Recipe that can be made with the ingrediants in any pattern. 

Like Dying Wool, the Dye and Wool can be anywhere in the Crafting Table. Or even Silent Gear parts and patterns!

quests.title: &8Basin
desc:
The &8Basin&r is similar to the &eDepot&r, but can hold &eItems&r and &bFluids&r. 

This will be helpful for using the &6Mechanical Mixer&r to Mix and Brew. 

And with the &6Mechanical Press&r to Autocraft!

quests.title: &cBlaze Burner
desc:
&cBlaze Burners&r are pretty easy to Craft, you'll just need some &7Iron Plates&r with a singular Block of &4Netherrack&r. 

Then you'll need to use a &oMysterious Conversion&r to make it less Empty! That is just Right Clicking a &cBlaze&r with your &cEmpty Blaze Burner&r. 

When we place him though, he seems a little small and... lukewarm... 

We'll need to feed him! No, not Steak, &cBlazes&r don't like Steaks. He'll need either Furnace Fuels like Wood or Coal, or his favorite: the &cBlaze Cakes&r! 

The Furnace Fuel will get them only a bit Heated, but the &cBlaze Cakes&r will make them &bSuper-Heated&r! Yes, &bSuper-Heated&r is hotter than &6Orange&r Hot. 

Some Recipes and &6Machines&r will need to be Heated, like &6Automated Brewing&r, &6Mixing&r, and the Steam Boiler will!

quests.title: &aMechanical Pistons
desc:
&aMechanical Pistons&r act like normal Pistons with Moving Blocks, but after that the similarities end! 

They don't work off &4Redstone&r, instead they use &dRotational Power&r. The &dRotational Power&r will determine how fast and the direction the Piston moves. 

They also can have &aSlime Balls&r added to &aStick&r to Blocks. And those Blocks can be &aGlued&r to have everything moving with the Piston. 

Best part is that we can add &aPiston Extension Poles&r to the back of the &aPiston&r to change how far the &aPiston&r can move! 

Each new &aPole&r adds a new Block of distance. I'm not sure of the max you can add, maybe that is something you can find out yourself!

quests.title: Speed
desc:
Speed is distance over time, AKA how long it takes to get from point A to point B... well... we are working with &dRevolutions&r, it is more how long it takes to get from point A to point A in this big of a Circle. 

Anyways it is how quick our &6Machines&r move, including &dCogs&r and &8Shafts&r! 

This is important because Speed will effect how other &6Machines&r work. Some will need a certain Speed and others will work more efficiently at higher Speeds. 

We can place a Speedometer (yes, like in a car) into our Kinetic System to see how fast everything is moving.

quests.title: Stress
desc:
Stress, like &dRotational Power&r, is important and confusing. 

Stress Units (Su) are power loads for our &6Machines&r. Some &6Machines&r will have a minimum Stress, that means you'll need that much Stress in your System to work the &6Machine&r. 

&6Deployers&f, &6Mechanical Saws&f, and &6Encased Fans&r are examples of those! 

Some &6Machines&r also have a maximum Stress Units. That means if it goes over the amount, it will most likely stop working. Or blow up, either or! 

Stress Units are developed from &dCogs&r and from our &6Machines&r that make &dRotational Power&r. &9Water Wheels&r give little Stress while &dSteam Engines&r can give a ton!

quests.title: &aCart Assembler
desc: The &aCart Assembler&r can be placed on tracks. Anything you build on top of it will be picked up by a &7Minecart&r if the &aAssembler&r has a &4Redstone signal&r.
The Blocks must be &aGlued&r together and any Blocks requiring &dRotational Power&r will automatically be working.
To "unmount" the Blocks from the &7Minecart&r, simply turn off the &4Redstone signal&r and let the &7Minecart&r ride through.

quests.title: &aLinear Chasis
desc:
Linear Chasis work like Puddy in real life, only connecting to each other. 

Linear Chasis, which are facing the same way, will automatically connect as if they were Glued. Other Linear Chasis or ones facing different ways, will not stick together. 

You can then use Glue on the Top and Bottom of the Linear Chasis to connect a line of Blocks from it. So all Blocks on top of those will be Glued to the Linear Chasis. Very helpful for saving Glue! 

With the Wrench you can set how many Blocks get Glued on the Top or Bottom of the Linear Chasis.

quests.title: &aRadial Chasis
desc:
&aRadial Chasis&r work similar to &aLinear Chasis&r in connecting to other &aRadial Chasis&r but everything else changes. 

You can connect other &aRadial Chasis&r on the top or bottom of other ones and they will automatically connect. 

Then, &aGlue&r the sides of the &aRadial Chasis&r to &aGlue&r every Block within a set Radius of the &aChasis&r. BTW Radius means circle! 

You can change how far the circle goes with a &6Wrench&r to the &aRadial Chasis&r.

quests.title: &dWindmills
desc:
&dWindmills&r are a little more complicated than &9Water Wheels&r, but they also come with more customization and of course Speed and Stress Units! 

First, you'll need the heart of the &dWindmill&r, the &dWindmill Bearing&r. This Block will send the &dRotational Power&r out of it. It is also what we'll use to turn on the &dWindmill&r! 

Then, you'll need the Blocks to make the actual &dWindmill&r part. Blocks will automatically stick to the &dBearing&r, but to the rest of the &dWindmill&r you'll need &aGlue&r. Besides &dWindmill Sails&r, those attach automatically! 

We'll also need atleast 8 &dWindmill Sail&r like Blocks, those being the &dWindmill Sails&r or Wool. The more we have, the faster the &dWindmill&r spins! 

Once it is all set, just Right Click the &dBearing&r with an Empty Hand to start it up.

quests.title: &6Mechanical Drill
desc:
The &6Mechanical Drill&r can be used within a &aContraption&r or without. The without will need &dRotational Power&r but still does the same task. 

The &6Mechanical Drill&r will Mine any Block in front of it (that it can). 

It will Mine as fast as the &dRotational Power&r will give. And if there is an Inventory connected to the &aContraption&r, the Mined Block will be put into it, instead of on the floor. 

Yes, the &6Drill&r has a limit, it only has Diamond Tier for Mining. So, no Mining &6AllTheModium&r!

quests.title: &6Mechanical Saw
desc:
To see &6Mechanical Saws&r on their own, check out the second Page! This one talks about them in &aContraptions&r. 

When moved in a &aContraption&r, the &6Mechanical Saw&r will break any Tree that it comes in contact with! It will need to hit the bottom of the Tree and break all of the Logs on the lowest part of the Tree. 

Once it breaks those Logs, the entire Tree will be cut down into Item form. 

If the &aContraption&r has an Inventory, the Tree parts will be collected into it. If not, the Tree will remain in nature... on the ground.
{@pagebreak}

The &6Mechanical Saw&r can also do other tasks when not used in a &aContraption&r. Instead they can be placed down and used with &dRotational Power&r. 

The &6Saw&r can also cut down Trees that are near them. Yes, they'll still need to cut down the lowest Logs. 

But it can be used as a &7Stonecutter&r/Woodcutter as well! To use it like that it'll need to be placed faced up, like normal. 

Then, we can either feed it Blocks from our Hands (with the correct protection on) or through &eBelts&r. Logs will be Stripped and Stone Blocks will be Cut. 

If the Block has multiple Recipes through the Cutter, you can Filter which one you want by placing that Block in the &6Mechanical Saw's&r Filter.

quests.title: &6Deployer
quests.subtitle: Poke
desc:
&6Deployer&r is a very fun &6Machine&r for poking! 

By poking, I mostly mean &eItem Interactions&r that we can preform. Place an &eItem&r into the &6Deployer Hand&r, and then give it &dRotational Power&r. It will then place the &eItem&r into the Block on a &eDepot&f or &eBelt&r below. 

This will mimick many actions that we can do, like adding &6Wax&r to &cCopper&r. 

You'll most likely use it for &8Andesite&r/&cCopper&r/&eBrass&r Casings and &4Polished Rose Quartz&r.

quests.title: &6Mechanical Harvester
desc:
The &6Mechanical Harvester&r will automatically Farm Mature Crops, and Replant them. 

Obviously it has to be moved by a &aContraption&r to work. 

It will also automatically place the collected Crops into Inventories connected to the &aContraption&r. If not, it will drop the Crops on the ground.

quests.title: &6Mechanical Plough
desc:
The &6Mechanical Plough&r will plough through anything in its way! Well, that it can move atleast. 

Blocks with weak connections will immediately break when the &6Plough&r hits them. Blocks like Torches, Buttons, and Vines. 

When used above Dirt or Grass, it will make Farmland! Perfect for Mega-Farms! 

You can also use the &6Plough&r to move Mobs without killing them. Well the &6Plough&r won't kill them, whatever they hit might.

quests.title: &cCopper Casings
desc:
&cCopper Casings&r will be needed for most Machines involved in &bFluid Logistics&r. 

You wanna place &9Water&r? You'll need &cCopper Casings&r. You wanna pick up &9Water&r? You'll need &cCopper Casings&r. 

They are made just like &8Andesite Casings&r, apply a &cCopper Ingot&r to a Stripped Log.

quests.title: &6Mechanical Arm
quests.subtitle: Why do it yourself when Robot can do it better?
desc:
&6Mechanical Arms&r must be configured before Placing them, like the &eWeighted Ejector&r. 

It has a 4 Block Range and can pick up from &eBelts &fand &eDepots&r. It can also deposit into &eBelts&f, &eDepots&f, and &eFunnels&r. 
While Holding the &6Mechanical Arm&r, Right Click Blocks to set as Input, then Click again to change it to Output. You can Left Click to deselect the Blocks. You can select as many are in range! 

Once it has &dRotational Power&r, an &eItem&r in any Input Block, and space in any Output Block, it will start moving &eItems&r. It will go faster the more Speed is given to it. 

Like the &eBrass Tunnel&r, the &6Mechanical Arm&r has Distribution Modes. Thankfully a lot less! Round Robin: will go in order for Inputs and Outputs. Forced Round Robin: will wait until every Output has space or every Input has &eItems&r available. Prefer First Target: will go for the closest Block to it.

quests.title: &eAndesite Funnel
desc:
&eFunnels&r are like if a Hopper and Dispenser had a baby. 

When placed onto a Block with an Inventory, like Chests, it will automatically take &eItems&r out 1 at a time. 
If you Shift Right Click it will automatically take &eItems&r into the Inventory. 

Both can be turned off with a &4Redstone Signal&r!

quests.title: &eBrass Funnel
desc:
The &eBrass Funnel&r is placed and used similar to the &eAndesite Tunnel&r. 

But each side comes with new configs! 

The Input Side will now come with a Filter option. Just place the &eItem&r in, and it will only take in that &eItem&r. 

The Output Side will now come with a limit. You can Scroll to set a number from 1 to 64. You can also choose whether it will Output exactly that amount, or up to that amount. 

If it is exactly that amout, it will wait until that amount is within the Inventory to Output it. If it is up to, it will keep Outputting &eItems&r until that number is reached.

quests.title: &eAndesite Tunnel
desc:
&eTunnels&r at the most basic level, will cover your &eBelts&r. This will make it so the &eItems&r can't be picked up, and hopefully the Mobs won't leave. 

If you place another &eBelt&r moving perpendicular to the &eBelt&r the &eTunnel&r is on, the &eTunnel&r will filter 1 &eItem&r from the Stack of &eItems&r to the perpendicular &eBelt&r, while leaving the rest of the &eItems&r on the first &eBelt&r. 

If there is just 1 &eItem&r, it will move through the &eTunnel&r like normal.

quests.title: &eBrass Tunnel
desc:
&eBrass Tunnels&r work like &eAndesite Tunnels&r just with so many more configurations! 

First, we now get Filters! These are per side: if you Filter the Input side, only that Filter &eItem&r will be allowed to move throught the &eTunnel&r. If you Filter the Output sides, then only those &eItems&r will come out of its side. 

Now we can also line &eBrass Tunnels&r together. This will allow them to take all the same Inputs but Filter them out to certain &eBelts&r! 

At the top of the &eTunnel&r we'll find the option to change its Distribution Modes. I won't explain them in too much detail, our Quests have limited space, instead I'll summarize! 

Split: will split the &eItem&r stacks evenly per how many &eBelts&r it will go to. Forced Split: will make sure every &eBelt&r will get an even amount, while normal Split might skip some. Round Robin: will alternate individually between each &eBelt&r. Forced Round Robin: won't skip some &eItems&r and instead will wait, everyone gets a turn! Prefer Nearest: will send the &eItems&r to the closest Output. Randomize: it sends the &eItems&r randomly to different Outputs. Synchronize Inputs: will only Output when every &eBrass Tunnel&r has an &eItem&r waiting to Input.

quests.title: &eChute
desc:
These are literally just fancy Hoppers. 

They connect two Inventories, bringing &eItems&r from the Top one to the Bottom one. 

&eChutes&r can connect to each other, even diagonally. 

You can also use them with &6Fans&r to shoot &eItems&r up the &eChutes&r!

quests.title: &cBlaze Cakes
desc:
&cBlaze Cakes&r can be used to &bSuper-Heat&r &cBlaze Burners&r! A Heat that has never been seen before! 

But how do we Bake them? 

First, we'll need to make the &4Blaze Cake Base&r. To get it, process an Egg, Sugar, and &4Cinder Flour&r in a Mechanical Press and Basin. 

&4Cinder Flour&r is created by Crushing &4Netherrack&r through two Crushing Wheels. 

Then, once we have our &4Blaze Cake Base&r, we can fill it with &cLava&r from a &bSpout&r to make our &cBlaze Cake&r!

quests.title: &6Mechanical Crafter
desc:
&6Mechanical Crafters&r can be used for &6Auto-Crafting&r and Recipes that are bigger than 3x3 Crafting Grid like the &6Crushing Wheel&r. 

Place the &6Mechanical Crafters&r in the order that is needed, then you'll need to set which direction the &eItems&r in the recipe go. 

The direction is known by the arrows on the edge of the &6Crafters&r. These can be changed by Right Clicking them with a &6Wrench&r! 

Then, just place &eItems&r into the &6Mechanical Crafters&r either with your Hands or automated with &eFunnels&r. 

After that, you can supply &dRotational Power&r to any of the &6Mechanical Crafters&r (they share &dCogs&r) to start up the Recipes. 

If it isn't working, check to make sure every &eItem&r is in, every arrow is facing the right way, and it has enough &dRotational Power&r.

quests.title: &aGantry Carriage
quests.subtitle: Barbershop Poles
desc:
Do you like your &aContraptions&r going only on a straight line? Then, the &aGantry Carriage&r is perfect for you! 

Place down the &aGantry Shafts&r down in the line you wish your &aContraption&r to go and give it &dRotational Power&r. 

Then, place down your &aGantry Carriage&r on top of the &aGantry &fand&a Shaft&r and it will move along with it. 

You can &aGlue&r Blocks and &6Machines&r on top of the &aGantry Carriage&r to also move with it! 

The &aGantry Shafts&r can be stopped by giving it a &4Redstone Signal&r. Do you also notice how they look like those poles Barbershops have?

quests.title: &eSmart Chute
desc: The &eSmart Chute&r is a &eChute&r with the options to Filter.

quests.title: Schematic Table
desc: The Schematic Table will read and write structures to/from your schematics.
You can use it to copy buildings or to share them with others!

quests.title: Schematicannon
desc: The Cannon will build the structures from Schematics, taking materials from nearby chests and using gunpowder as fuel.

quests.title: &aRope Pulley
desc:
&aRope Pulley&r will move any Blocks that are attached to its &aRope&r at the bottom of it. This will also move any Blocks &aGlued&r to that Block! 

When moved &e&oClockwise&r by &dRotational Power&r, it will lower the &aRope&r until it hits another Block, or to where it is set. 

When given &9&oCounter-Clockwise&r &dRotational Power&r it will move the &aRope&r toward the &aPulley&r until it hits the &aPulley&r or it goes where it is set to go. 

Why do I keep saying "set to go"? Because there is destination settings with Movement Mode! 

These will decide where the Blocks end up stopping!

quests.title: &bSpout
desc:
&bSpouts&r are used with systems to fill &eItems&r with &bFluid&r. 

First, you'll need to fill the &bSpout&r by &bPiping Fluid&r into it! 

Then, if there is a &bFluid&r Holding &eItem&r: Bucket or Bottle, then it will be filled with the &bFluid&r in the Spout. 

It will automatically fill it, it doesn't need Rotational Power it uses Gravity!

quests.title: &bHose Pulley
desc:
The &bHose Pulley&r is used to take and place full Source Blocks of &bFluids&r, yes not just &9Water&r. 

First, set how far the &bHose&r actually goes down or up with the &8Shaft&r at one side. Either with a &6Cog&f, &8Shaft&r, or &dHand Crank&r which is easiest. 

Then, on the other side of the &bHose Pulley&r we can put some &bFluid Pipes&r. With &bMechanical Pumps&r we can choose whether the &bHose Pulley&r picks up &bFluid&r Sources or place them down. 

The &bHose Pulley&r only has an Inventory of 1.5 Buckets or 1500mB, but the &bFluids&r can be &bPiped&r into other Inventories or &bTanks&r! 

If the &9Water&r Source is infinite, the &bHose Pulley&r won't take out Source Blocks, but will keep taking &bFluid&r out. 

This will also work with &cLava&r Source Blocks, but those aren't infinite. So you might want to check out &c&lThe Nether&r for that as it is pretty much infinite there!

quests.title: &aPiston Extension
quests.subtitle: Why only move so far?
desc:
&aPiston Extension Poles&r are how we can make and expand &aMechanical Pistons&r. 

Not normal Pistons, sorry!

quests.title: &bPortable Fluid Interfaces
desc:
&bPortable Fluid Interfaces&r are used with &aContraptions&r that are using &bFluid Tanks&r. 

In order to access the &bFluid Tanks&r you'll need two &bPortable Fluid Interfaces&r, one connected to the &aContraption&r and one connected to &bFluid Pipes&r. 

The &bPortable Fluid Interfaces&r will need a 1 or 2 Block gap between a meeting point in order for them to work. 

If we have all that, the &bPortable Fluid Interface&r connected to the &aContraption&r will stop the &aContraption&r to either take &bFluids&r in or out from the second &bPortable Fluid Interface&r to add it to the &bFluid Tanks&r within the &aContraption&r.

quests.title: &e&lItem Logistics
desc:
&eItem Logistics&r is important to &6&lCreate&r. &6Millstones&r need &eItems&f, &6Deployers &fneed &eItems&f, &6Mechanical Mixers&f need &eItems&r, and so on. 

Now how does &6&lCreate&r want us to move &eItems&r? With &eBelts&r! 

&eBelts&r can be attached to two &8Shafts&r to connect and move with them. If the first &8Shaft&r is moving &e&oClockwise&r, the second will move same Speed and Direction. 

Same with the &eBelts&r that are placed on those &8Shafts&r, they will move same Speed and Direction as the &8Shafts&r they are placed between. 

With placing &8Belts&r they can be placed perfectly Horizontal, Vertical, or diagonal at 45% angles. 

Once placed and move, any &eItems&r or Entities will be moved with the &eBelt&r. Entities can walk off the &eBelts&r though so careful with that. Thankfully &eItems&r can't walk off or even despawn when on it! 

The &eItems&r will then be taken to wherever the &eBelt&r goes. If it abruptly ends, the &eItems&r will just be Dropped. If it goes to a &eDepot&r, the &eItem&r will be placed in a &eDepot&r. If it goes below a &6Machine&r, the&6 Machine&r will use it. 

If you want to take &eItems &foff the &eBelt&r you can just Right Click it!

quests.title: &dCogwheels&r!
quests.subtitle: I just call them Cogs
desc:
&dCogwheels&r (&dCogs&r) are the next Block needed to use &dRotational Power&r! They can connect to &8Shafts&r or other &dCogs&r to move the &dRotational Power&r. 

There is two versions of &dCogs&r: regular &dCogs &fand &dLarge Cogs&r. They will both act the same in the sense of &dRotational Power&r but there is also a few changes! 
Regular &dCogs&r can connect to other &dCogs&r adjacent to them. This will move the &dRotational Power&r into a whole different direction. When this happens the direction of the second &dCog&r will be reversed. If the first &dCog&r is rotating &e&oClockwise&r, the second one will rotate &9&oCounter-Clockwise&r. 

&dLarge Cogs&r are a little more difficult to use than &dCogs&r. They can't connect to other &dLarge Cogs&r adjacent, rather they can only connect to &dCogs&r that are diagonal to them! 

Most &6Machines&r will need &dRotational Power&r from connecting &dCogs&r. You'll recognize if the &6Machine&r has an internal &dCog&r, that is what must be moved in order to use the &6Machine&r.

quests.title: &dCog&r Teamwork!
desc:
&dCogs &fand &dLarge Cogs&r can interact with each other to change Speed and Stress! 

If you connect a &dCog&r, diagonally from a &dLarge Cog&r, the &dCog&r will double in Speed! This is because the &dLarge Cog&r has more Teeth than the &dCog&r, it takes longer to take a full &dRotation&r. 

This also works in the reverse, if you put a &dLarge Cog&r diagonal to a &dCog&r, the &dLarge Cog&r will spin at half Speed. 

These will also change the Stress Units from the &dCogs&r. More Speed, more Stress. Less Speed, less Stress.

quests.title: &6&lMachines
desc:
With our &8Andesite Alloys&r we can now make &8Andesite Casing&r. 

Get some Wood, Strip it with an Axe, and then Right Click the Stripped Wood with the &8Andesite Alloy&r. 

That will give us our &8Andesite Casing&r! 

&8Andesite Casing&r will be needed for many, many, many &6Machines&r! And looks good for decoration.

quests.title: &9Water Wheels
desc:
&9Water Wheels&r are simple automatic &dRotational Power&r generators. 

Simply place them down, and have &9Water&r run over them in a certain direction. If it flows over both sides, it won't move, and the direction the &9Water&r flows determines where the &9Water Wheel&r &dRotates&r to. 

The normal &9Water Wheel&r is just 1 Block big and provides a bit of Speed but with minimal Stress Units. 

The &9Large Water Wheel&r takes up 3x3 area and grants more Stress Units, just at a lower Speed. 

You can use both together to get the same Stress Units and Speed!

quests.title: &bSteam Engine
desc:
This one's a doozy! So listen carefully! 
1st is constructing the actual &bSteam Engine&r. The &bFluid Tanks&r will judge how much &9Water&r can be held within it and decide the Level the &bSteam Engine&r will be at. 

Then, simply attach the &bSteam Engine&r to the side of the &bFluid Tanks&r and it'll become a &bSteam Boiler&r. After, place a &8Shaft&r on the &bSteam Engine&r to get our Mechanical Arm that will give us &dRotational Power&r from it. 

2nd is a &cHeat Source&r. We'll need a &cHeat Source&r beneath the &bFluid Tanks&r to heat up the &9Water&r. There's quite a few &cHeat Sources&r: Fire, Campfire, Lava, Magma Blocks but &cBlaze Burners&r are the best! 

The better the &cHeat Source&r, the more Stress Units! So feed those &cBlaze Burners&r some &cBlaze Cakes&r and you'll be rocking! 

3rd is &9Water&r. This is the fuel of our &bSteam Engine&r, there wouldn't be Steam without &9Water&r. 

However you &bPipe&r in &9Water&r is your choice, but for &6&lATM10&r I recommend a Sink and &9&lID&r!

quests.title: &dHand Crank
quests.subtitle: Manual Power!
desc:
The &dHand Crank&r is the simplest and worst form of &dRotational Power&r generation. 

When you hold Right Click it'll move &e&oClockwise&r and if you hold Shift Right Click it will move &9&oCounter-Clockwise&r. 

It only gives a tiny bit of Stress Units and will stop after you quit holding it.

quests.title: &eDepot
desc:
&eDepots&r will hold &eItems&r. They can hold them to process the &eItems&r, or deposit to a &eChute&r, or even just for decoration! 

You can place a &eChute&r near the end of a &eBelt&r to bring &eItems&f from the &eBelt &fonto the &eDepot&r. 

The &eDepot&r can also be placed beneath a &6Machine&r to process &eItems&r within it.

quests.title: &eWeighted Ejector
desc:
Okay this ones fun! You like throwing &eItems&r? Like, I mean to really throw them! 

Then, the &eWeighted Ejector&r is for you! 

First, you need to Shift Right Click a Block with the &eWeighted Ejector&r to set it as the target. The target has to be in line with where the &eEjector&r is aimed in order to hit it. 

Once it has a target and is placed down, it can be fed &dRotational Power&r to charge it! Then, when an &eItem&r is placed on the &eWeighted Ejector&r, it will throw it! 
You can hold on some of the Sides to change the Stack Size needed to throw &eItems&r.

quests.title: &bFluid Pipe
desc:
&bFluid Pipes&r are what we'll use to actually move &bFluids&r automatically from one Inventory to another! 

You can place them down and they will automatically connect to Inventories and other &bPipes&r. 

With a Wrench you can add Windows to a &bPipe&r. These won't connect to parallel &bPipes&r without Windows. 

The &bPipes&r themselves won't move &bFluids&r though, we'll need a &bMechanical Pump&r for that! 

When we do get &bPipes&r to start flowing though, we can use them to take &bFluids&r out from a Source Block or the opposite with placing down Source Blocks. 

The &bPipe&r will need to have an Open End to do so though, so there can't be Blocks in the way.

quests.title: &b&lFluid Logistics
desc:
&bFluids &fand &bLiquids&r aren't the most important in every aspect of &6&lCreate&r, but luck is, you'll most likely run into them anyways! 

You'll need to learn the difficult path of &bFluid Logistics&r in order to use and move them. 

And to start, you'll need &cCopper&r!

quests.title: &6Crushing Wheels
desc:
You'll need &6Mechanical Crafters&r to make the &6Crushing Wheels&r, they are too big for a 3x3 Crafting Table. You'll also need a ton of &8Andesite Alloys&r. 

BTW, you'll need 2 to actually use them. 
Once you have 2, place them next to each other. Then, feed them both &dRotational Power&r and a lot of Stress Units. 

Make sure that the &6Crushing Wheels&r are spinning in opposite directions or else it won't &6Crush&r! The left one must be spinning &e&oClockwise&r, and the right one must spin &9&oCounter-Clockwise&r. 

Once they are spinning (fast and in the right directions) you can have &eItems&r Dropped in between them and they will be &6Crushed&r. 

What &eItems&r? &6Crushed&r Ores from Ores, &eItems&r from Stones and Netherrack, Sand and Flint from Gravel, and even Netherwart from Netherwart Blocks!

quests.title: &6Millstone
desc:
Before we get into the many &eItems&r we can get from the &6Millstone&r, let's talk about how to use it! 

First, it will need some &dRotational Power&r, don't worry it only needs a little. 

Then, you'll need to Drop the &eItem&r you want &6Milled&r, into the top of the &6Millstone&r. After it gets &6Milled&r, just Right Click the &6Millstone&r to take out your &eItems&r. 

Now, what &eItems&r can we get from the &6Millstone&r? We can get Dyes from pretty much every Flower, we can crush &7Stone&r into Gravel or other &7Stone&r like Blocks into similar Gravel Items. You can even get Wheat Flour from Wheat!

quests.title: &bMechanical Pump
desc:
&bMechanical Pumps&r will use Rotational Power to move &bFluids&r through &bPipes&r. 

First, replace a &bPipe&r with the &bMechanical Pump&r. Then, make sure it is facing the right way you want &bFluids&r to be moved. The Arrows next to the internal &6Cog&r will tell which direction it will move, you can change that with a Wrench. 

Then, feed it &dRotational Power&r with a &6Cog&r near it. The direction does not change anything, but the Speed will effect how quickly &bFluids&r are moved. 

&bMechanical Pumps&r will also be needed for other Machines like the &bHose Pulley&r!

quests.title: &6Wrench
desc:
Trust me when I say, you'll need a &6Wrench&r! 

The &6Wrench&r is the perfect Swiss Army Knife like Tool for &6&lCreate&r. You can rotate Blocks, break them, set their configs, what can't you do with it! 

To break Blocks just Shift Right Click any &6&lCreate&r Block and it'll break them. 

To Rotate a Block just normal Right Click them with the &6Wrench&r. Unfortunately this doesn't give us free &dRotational Power&r, but it is still useful for slip ups! 

It will also be useful for setting up &aContraptions&r, but that is for later.

quests.title: &aSuper-Glue
desc:
&aSuper Glue&r is used to attach Blocks together! In order to move them with &aContraptions&r. 

To &aGlue&r Blocks together, Right Click two different Blocks and all between them will be &aGlued&r. If you want to &aUnglue&r them, just Left Click them with the &aSuper-Glue&r. 

There is some requirements though, each Block must be connected to the other ones and not diagonally. 

You can also combine other &aGlued&r Blocks to different &aGlued&r Blocks. Everyone gets &aGlue&r! 

Plus this will effect other Blocks near the originally &aGlued&r one. Blocks adjacent to &aGlued&r Blocks will be moved with them. Same with Blocks that are attached to &aGlued&r Blocks, like Torches or Signs.

quests.title: &6Engineer's Goggles
desc:
&6Engineer's Goggles are perfect for you little know-it-alls. 

When worn it will tell just about everything the Block or &6Machine&r has to tell! 

Stressometers will tell how much Stress is given and how much it can take. Speedometers will tell how much Speed is within your system. 

&dSteam Boilers&r will tell how big, how much &9Water&r, and how much Heat they have. 

Other &6Machines&r, like &6Deployers&r or &6Mechanical Presses&r, will show how much Stress Units is being used up.

quests.title: &a&lContraptions
desc:
&aContraptions&r are very difficult to understand but pretty much it is the art of combining different Blocks and &6Machines&r into one moving systems. 

You'll need &6Machines&r to actually move the &aContraption&r like &aLinear Chasis&r, you'll need the &6Machines&r you want to work like &6Drills&r, and you'll need &aGlue&r to hold it all together! 

Once it is all &aGlued&r it should move when &dRotational Power&r is given to the moving &6Machine&r of the &aContraption&r.

quests.title: &bSmart Fluid Pipe
desc:
&bSmart Fluid Pipes&r will give us Filtering for &bFluid Pipes&r. 

When put on the Machine that the &bPipes&r are extracting from, it can be set to only take out the one &bFluid&r. This is set by adding a Bucket full of that &bLiquid&r in the Filter Slot. 

You can place the &bSmart Fluid Pipe&r later in the &bPipe system&r to only send that certain &bFluid&r through the &bPipes&r after it. 

This is helpful for mass sorting a bunch of &bFluid Tanks&r!

quests.title: &bFluid Valve
desc:
&bFluid Valves&r can be used to stop &bPipes&r from moving &bFluid&r. 

Give them a Rotation, most likely from a &cValve Handle&r, to stop moving &bFluids&r. 

Just Rotate it again to get the &bFluids&r back!

quests.title: &eBrass Casing
desc:
&eBrass Casings&r are made the same way as &8Andesite&r and &cCopper Casings&r. Just apply the &eItem&r to Stripped Wood. 

But with &eBrass Casings&r giving us some of the most powerful &6Machines&r, it won't be as easy to get as &8Andesite&r or &cCopper&r. 

Thankfully this is &6&lATM10&r so you can make &eBrass&r in many different ways! 

But the &6&lCreate&r way would be to throw a &cCopper Ingot&r and &7Zinc Ingot&r into a &8Basin&r below a &6Mechanical Mixer&r, while the &8Basin&r is heated.

quests.title: &ePrecision Mechanism
desc:
To make the &ePrecision Mechanism&r we'll need 3 &6Deployers&r, 3 &eDepots&f/&eBelts&r, 1 &eGold Plate&r, 5 Cogs, 5 Large Cogwheels, and 5 &7Iron Nuggets&r, as well as luck! 

Take your &eGold Plate&r (which can be made from Pressing a Gold Ingot) and place it beneath each of the Deployers in order. 

The first will need a Cog, the second will need a Large Cog, and the third will need an Iron Nugget. 

Then, once it has been processed through all 3 of them, repeat it! And do it 5 times in a row. 

At the end, there is only an 80% chance it will actually make it. The other 20% will see all your work going POOF!

quests.title: &eSequenced Gearshift
desc:
Because the &eSequenced Gearshift&r uses much fancier &eItems&r it is clearly a much fancier &6Machine&r! 

Judging by how confusing its GUI is, I'd say so... Hopefully I can help make it less confusing! No promises though. 

Like the normal &dGearshift&r it will need a &4Redstone Signal&r to do whatever is designed. We'll need to configure its GUI to make a "script". 

First, is the Instructions, these are the actual tasks it will preform. Here it can turn its &8Shaft&r, effect a Pulley, wait, or just stop. It will need to stop at the end, it is inevitable. 

Next, is the Angle. The Angle that either the &8Shaft&r or Pulley will turn. From 360 to 1 degree! 

Last is the Speed and Direction. It changes how quickly the Shaft or Pulley move and either &e&oClockwise&r or &9&oCounter-Clockwise&r.

quests.title: &5&lTrains
desc:
&6&lCreate&r 1.21 also now comes with Trains included with the base Mod. 

First, you'll need &5Sturdy Metal&r! 

Crush &5Obsidian&r to get &5Obsidian Dust&r. Then, use a &bSpout&r to place &cLava&r into the &5Crushed Obsidian&r. 

After that, Press it twice with &6Mechanical Presses&r and you'll get &5Sturdy Metal&r. 

&5Sturdy Metal&r can then be applied to a &eBrass Casing&r to make &5Train Casings&r.

quests.title: &dVertical Gearbox
desc:
The &dVertical Gearbox&r is just like the normal &dGearbox&r if someone rotated it. 

It has 4 internal &8Shafts&r just this time instead of the Cardinal Directions, they are (from where you place it) Front, Back, Up, and Down. 

Also like the normal &dGearbox&r, it will keep the Speed and Stress Units from the original &8Shaft&r!

quests.title: &bFluid Tanks
desc:
&bFluid Tanks&r can hold &bFluids&r. Like Chests, but for &9Water&r and such! 

You can only Input &bFluids&r with Buckets but with &bPipes&r you can Input and Output &bFluids&r from them. 

Each &bFluid Tank&r can hold 8 Buckets or 8000mB of &bFluid&r. But that number will rise when we combine them! 

Yes, you heard me right! We can place multiple &bFluid Tanks&r next to each other to connect their Inventories. They will stack when placed on top of each other up to 32, or by 2x2 or 3x3.

quests.title: &bItem Drain
desc:
&bItem Drains&r are what we can use to mass extract &bFluid&r from &eItems&r! 

If a Bottle or Bucket is thrown on top of the &bDrain&r: either by Belts, Chutes, or Hands, the &bFluid&r will be emptied into the &bDrain&r. 

The now empty &eItem&r will then be pushed off the &bDrain&r in the opposite direction, and the &bFluid&r will be sitting in the &bDrain&r waiting to be &bPiped&r out.

quests.title: &aMechanical Bearing
desc:
&aMechanical Bearings&r are the most simple forms of &aContraption&r movement. 

When given &dRotational Power&r from their bottom, they will rotate any Blocks above at the same Speed and Direction. 
Blocks will automatically be &aGlued&r to the &aMechanical Bearing&r, but any other Blocks will need to be &aGlued&r to that Block to move as well! 

If you use a &aMechanical Bearing&r within a &aContraption&r itself, it will try and keep the Block attached still instead of Rotating.

quests.title: &aClockwork Bearing
desc:
&aClockwork Bearings&r will move based on the Time of Day when given &dRotational Power&r. 

The Block in front of the &aClockwork Bearing&r will automatically &aGlue&r to it, but other Blocks can be &aGlued&r to that Block to join it! 

If you want more Hands to your &aClock&r, add more Blocks in front of the first Block, but make sure these aren't &aGlued&r together. 

You can change which Hands are which by Holding on the &aBearing&r to change whether the first Hand (closest Block) is the Hour or Minute Hand.

quests.title: &7Train Tracks
desc:
&7Train Tracks&r are... well what you'll use to move &5Trains&r! 

You'll need to &6Deploy&r 2 &7Iron Nuggets&r onto a &8Stone Slab&r, then &6Press&r it with a &6Metal Press&r to get 1. 

These will be the first Block you place in order to get &5Trains&r as it will be needed to place &5Train Stations&r. 

They have some limitations though, they can't go at steep angles to turn, or elevate. You'll need 4 Blocks of space to get up a Block with &7Train Tracks&r. To turn it is even worse! Let's just say, if you want a perfect circle with &7Train Tracks&r, it'll need a diameter of 18 Blocks.

quests.title: &5Train Stations
desc:
&5Train Stations&r are the most important Blocks for &5Trains&r! We need them for making &5Trains&f, breaking down &5Trains&r, and Scheduling them! 

To use them, you'll need to select a &7Train Track&r with them. Hold the &5Train Station&r in your Hand and Right Click a &7Train Track&r. 

I don't know the max distance a &5Train Station&r can be placed, it is atleast 10 Blocks! (I don't have that much room to test). 

Once placed you can Rename it with the Text Bar at the top. 

You can also Click "Create New Train", to start making your first &5Train&r. After you Clicked it, one of the &7Tracks&r will appear &9Blue&r, this is the &7Track&r you can place &5Boogeys&r on. 

Right Click that &7Track&r with a &5Train Casing&r to make a &5Boogey&r, AKA &5Train Wheels&r. Right Click the actual Wheels to change its design. Then you can...

quests.title: Constructing &5Trains
desc:
Finally make a &5Train&r! 

We should have our &5Boogeys&r from the &5Train Station&r Quest, no the design of &5Boogey&r doesn't matter. 

Then, we can place Blocks onto the &5Boogey&r with &aSuper-Glue&r. It doesn't matter what Blocks, pretty much any Block that can be moved can be &aGlued&r! 

This is when you try and make it look pretty! Check out Artwork-Builds Showoff in Discord to see a few of them. 

The most important Block for our &5Train&r is the &5Train Controls&r. You'll need one in order to actually move the &5Train&r. 

You can also add a &5Seat&r for &5Conductors&r (more on that later) or even yourself! 

Once it is all ready, just hit "Assemble Train" and either your &5Train&r will be made, or it will tell you what you did wrong!

quests.title: &5Train Signals
desc:
&5Train Signals&r are used with &5Conductors&r who aren't Players. 

They place just like &5Train Stations&f and &5Observers&r, but the way they are placed determines the Arrow placement. 

The Arrows will restrict where &5Conductors&r can pass their &5Trains&r, if the Arrow is facing the opposite way, the &5Train&r won't pass. 

You can add two Signals facing opposite directions to let &5Conductors&r pass wherever you want. 

With a bunch of &5Signals&r we can make Stop Lights for &7Track&r intersections. Place the &5Signals&r to where there are Arrows on both sides of the intersection. 

This will make it so &5Trains&r will stop if another &5Train&r is in the intersection. That prevents collisions which Derail &5Trains&r. Derailed &5Trains&r will need a Wrench to put them back on &7Track&r!

quests.title: &5Train Observer
desc:
&5Train Observers&r work like a fancy Detection Rail. 

When a &5Train&r rolls over it the &7Track&r it is set to (which is chosen like the &5Train Station&r) it will give a &4Redstone Signal&r. 

You can also place Filters into the &5Observer&r to only get &4Redstone Signals&r when the &5Train&r has that &eItem &for &bFluid&r within.

quests.title: &5Conductors
desc:
Yay, complicated subjects! This time it is &5Conductors&r and &5Train Schedules&r. 

First is getting our &5Conductor&r, these are any Lead-able Mobs or &cBlaze Burners&r. If we have a Seat next to the Train Controls we can Lead a Mob into the Seat where it will wait to become a &5Conductor&r. 

&cBlaze Burners&r work similar, just without the need for a seat, they bring their own. 

Then, we can hand our Mob or &cBlaze Burner&r, a filled out &5Schedule&r to give them that task plus a &5Conductor's Hat&r. 

&5Schedules&r are Items that can be "Coded" to order our &5Conductors&r to preform certain tasks. The tasks are either: go to &5Station&r, pickup or drop off Packages, change title, or change max speed. 

Once we add a task, we can edit its configs to change when it will start the next task! These can be either a certain Time waited, Time of Day, amount of stuff in &5Train&r, or even &4Redstone&r!

quests.title: Controlling your &5Train
desc:
Okay we got our fully Assembled &5Train&r, now how do we use it? 

If you are Controlling it, you'll need to Right Click the &5Train Controls&r. 

Then, you can Hold W to move Forward or Hold S to go Backwards. No, &5Trains&r don't turn like Cars do, they just follow the &7Tracks&r. 

Going Forward you'll pick up a lot of Speed, you can see it in the Bar that replaces your &aExperience Bar&r. Backwards won't give as much Speed. 

If you are getting near a &5Train Station&r and not moving at the speed of light, you can Hold Space to stop the &5Train&f at the &5Station&r. This is helpful for disassembling them or even connecting more &5Boogeys&r.

quests.title: Decorating your &5Train&r
desc:
Like the entirity of Building Tips in &6&lATM10&r, I can't teach you how to design your &5Train&r... but I can give Tips! 

There is tons of different Building Blocks you can use, lots of the &6&lCreate&r Casings look clean and Concretes can help give a more slick look. 

You can also use Doors and Trapdoors within the &5Train&r which can also be used when the &5Train&r is moving. 

What about making it look pretty? Well Stairs, Slabs, and Trapdoors help give Shape to it as well as the Flywheel or &dCogs&r give nice round edges. 

Heck you can even put a Campfire on it to make a Steam Engine!

quests.title: &6&lCreate&r 1.21
desc:
To start with the new &6&lCreate&r &eItems&r we'll need &eCardboard&r! 

Which is made from &6Pressing&r Pulp. 

Pulp is made from &6Mixing&r 4 Saplings and &9Water&f in a &6Mechanical Mixer&r and &8Basin&r. 

You can combine &eCardboards&r to make &eBlocks of Cardboard&r which can make the new &eItems&r in &6&lCreate&r... or &eCardboard Armor&r!

quests.title: &8Chain Conveyor
desc:
&8Chain Conveyors&r won't do much on their own. They need another &8Chain Conveyor&f, &8Chains&f, and &dRotational Power&r! 
&8Chain Conveyors&r will need another &8Chain Conveyor&r near by in order to attach to them with &8Chains&r. 

The &8Chains&r will need to be Right Clicked onto 1 &8Chain Conveyor&r then done the same to another you want to connect it to. 

Once, one is given &dRotational Power&r, the &8Chains&r will move at the same Speed. Don't worry about Direction, there'll be 2 &8Chains&r! 

When the &8Chains&r are a moving, you can connect to them with a &6Wrench&r to move with the &8Chains&r, you can either press Shift or switch Items to drop off the &8Chain&r. 

You can also place &ePackages&r on them, but without the &eItem&r described in the next Quest, they will just go around in a circle!

quests.title: &ePackage Frogport
desc:
&ePackage Frogports&r are adorable and helpful &6Machines&r used for mixing &ePackages&f and &8Chain Conveyors&r! 

First, Right Click a part of the &8Chain &fon a &8Chain Conveyor&r with the &eFrogport&r in Hand, this will set it as the &eFrogports&r destination. 

Then, when placed we can mess with its GUI. Here we can change the name of its Address, determine whether it takes and gives &ePackages&r or just gives &ePackages&r. 

They have 18 Slots to Hold &ePackages&r for moving. 

If the Address of the &ePackage&r doesn't match the Address you gave the &eFrogport&f, the &eFrogport&r will send the &ePackage&r onto the &8Chain Conveyor&r. 

If it matches the Address, the &ePackage&r will be taken into the &eFrogport&r. If there is no matching Address the &ePackage&r will just go in circles! 

&ePackages&r can also be automatically sent and taken from &eFrogports&r with &eFunnels &fand &eBelts&r.

quests.title: &5Postboxes
desc:
&5Postboxes&r will use Addresses and &5Trains&r to deliver &ePackages&r! 

First, &ePackages&r can be held on &5Trains&r with &eDepots&r! Obviously the &eDepot&r needs to be connected to the &5Train &fvia &aGlue&r. 

Next, we can assign the &5Postbox&r to a &5Train Station&r by Right Clicking the &5Train Station&r wtih the &5Postbox&r in Hand. 

We can then place the &5Postbox&r nearby and when a &5Train &farrives at the &5Station&r they will interact with the &5Postbox&r. 

In the &5Postbox's&r GUI we can change its Address, which will effect whether &ePackages&r are delivered or sent from it. If the Address of the &ePackage&r matches the Address of the &5Postbox&r, it will be sent to the &5Postbox&r. If it doesn't match, it will go from the &5Postbox&r to your &5Train&r!

quests.title: &eStock Link
desc:
You like combining Inventories and making a way of viewing and interacting with all those Inventories with a few simple &6Machines&r similar to &b&lAE2&r and &7&lSophisticated Storage&r? 

Then, you'll need some &eStock Links&r! 

&eStock Links&r can be placed on &ePackagers&r to connect to the Inventory the &ePackager&r is connected to. When first placed, a new &eStock Network&r will be created. 

These can connect to Chests, Barrels, and even &eVaults&r! 

You can also Right Click another &eStock Link&r with a &eStock Link&r in hand to tune them to the same &eNetwork&r. When the new &eStock Link&r is placed onto another &ePackager&r, its Inventory Block will be added to the same &eNetwork&r. 

If you'd like to Interact with these &eNetworks&r you'll need other Blocks!

quests.title: &eStock Ticker
desc:
&eStock Tickers&r can be set to the &eNetwork&r by Right Clicking the &eStock Link &fwith the &eStock Ticker&r in Hand. 

Then, place down the &eStock Ticker&r and give it a &eStock Keeper&r by either placing down a &cBlaze Burner&r or a Mob on a Seat nearby. 

You'll know they are a &eStock Keeper&r by their stereotypical &aGreen&r Visor. We can now Right Click the &eStock Keeper&r to view and order &eItems&r from our &eNetwork&r. 

When you order &eItems&r, they'll be placed into a &ePackage &ffrom a &ePackager &fbelow the &eStock Link&r.

quests.title: &ePackagers
desc:
&ePackagers&r are the new and very important &6Machine&r for &6&lCreate&r. In order to use pretty much everything from the Update we'll need a &ePackager&r. 
Combine some of our new-found &eCardboard&r to make a Block of Cardboard. No, these aren't &eBoxes&r yet and they certainly don't do anything. 

Well besides Crafting our &ePackager&r! The &ePackager&r will then be placed onto a Block with an Inventory, like Chest or Barrel. You'll know it is connected when one of the sides changes to appear like a wall. 

Then, when given a &4Redstone Signal&r it will pull all &eItems&r within the Inventory into a &ePackage&r! More on that later! 

The &ePackages&r can then be pulled out by Hand or &eBelt&r. You can also send &ePackages&r back into the &ePackager&r to put the &eItems&r back into an Inventory. 

If you place and name a Sign on the &ePackager&r it will give all &ePackages&r that it makes an Address.

quests.title: &eCardboard Packages
desc:
Now we have our &ePackager&r we can now have &ePackages&r! 

There is 4 varients but that doesn't change anything with them besides apperance. It is entirely random which one you get. 

&ePackages&r are &eItems&r and when Placed on the Ground will become Entities. You can Right Click them after they were Placed to Pick them up, or Break them to get the &eItems&r out. You can also move them like any other Entity! 

&ePackages&r can also be used to interact with other &6Machines&r. Like being placed on &8Chain Conveyors&f or &eBelts&r!

quests.title: &eItem Vaults
desc:
&eItem Vaults&r, while not new, will be used a ton in the new Update! 

&eItem Vaults&r will act like Chests, just we can't put &eItems&r in or out as easily as Chests... 

In order to move &eItems&r we'll need to use &eFunnels&r! Attach them to the &eVaults &fto send &eItems&r in and out. Preferably &eBrass Funnels&r for more &eItem&r Filtering. 

Each &eVault&r has a ton of storage but we can also place them next to each other to combine their Inventories.
