quests.title: &d&lArs Nouveau&r Logs
desc:
&d&lArs Nouveau&r is a very fun magic Mod and with it brings its own set of Wood! 

Archwood comes in 5 different colors of trees that spawn in most Biomes but mostly in their Archwood Biome!

quests.title: Glass
desc:
If you're like me and don't like living in a Box (it reminds me too much of School), then you'll like to have Glass in your Builds to see outside. 

While the normal Vanilla ones are nice of course we can do much better! 

We can even get some use out of it!

quests.title: &3&lGlassential&r
desc:
&3&lGlassential&r is very important Mod for building, even for builds with purposes! 
It's not just normal Glass, these have abilities which can be read while hovering over the Item! 

Like Ethereal Glass which you can walk through but Mobs can't. (I used that for my Bee Dome in 9sky!)

quests.title: &l&9X&cy&aC&8r&aa&cf&9t&r Glass
desc:
&l&9X&cy&aC&8r&aa&cf&9t&r adds plenty of Glasses with it's &lWorld Core&r! 

From ones you can walk through, to glowing ones, to stronger ones!

quests.title: &l&bChipped&r Glass
desc: From normal Glass, to Glass with Panes, to even Mosaics!

quests.title: &l&cChisel Reborn
desc:
&l&cChisel Reborn&r is another Mod based off of &lChiseled&r. 

The essence of the Mod is using the Chisel Tool to change the designs of some Blocks. 

You can Right Click with the Chisel to open its GUI, there you can put up to a stack of Blocks into it, then choose a design you want, and take it out. Or you can keep it in the Chisel, I don't see why you would want to though. 

You can also Left Click a Block with the Chisel to change its design without opening the Chisel GUI! 

Don't worry this one doesn't have Durability.

quests.title: Smart Filter
desc:
While protecting our Nuclear Reactors are important and viewing the contents of them relate to the safety of it. 

The Glass can also be used to make our bases look better! 

And really what's more important: safety and protection of our nuclear reactors? Or making our bases look better!

quests.title: Stone Blocks
desc: You'll get this eventually, it's quite literally the most abundant Block in &2&lMinecraft&r.

quests.title: &l&3Handcrafted&r
desc:
&l&3Handcrafted&r is for everything Decoration wise. 

There's Beds (that look good enough to sleep in, and I'm a picky sleeper!) and Nightstands for the Bedrooms. 

There's Chairs and Tables for Living Room. 

There's an Oven, Plates, and Bowls for the Kitchen. 

Heck there's even Statues just for showing off!

quests.title: &l&cCooking for Blockheads&r
desc:
&l&cCooking for Blockheads&r is all about making the Kitchen your home. 

I recommend using everything it gives as every Item has a use and looks amazing!

quests.title: &l&aSushi Go Crafting&r
desc:
&l&aSushi Go Crafting&r doesn't add many Blocks but the ones it does I highly recommend using in your Kitchen! 

Especially the Rice Cooker; no more using the Microwave for Rice anymore.

quests.title: &l&eFarmer's Delight&r
desc:
&l&eFarmer's Delight&r is all about Farming and Cooking Food Items! We can also use those same Items for Decoration and usage! 

The Stove, Pots, and Pans are perfect for a Kitchen. 

The Food Barrels are great for a Pantry. 

The Farm stuff is great for outdoor decor and the Cabinets are perfect for anywhere!

quests.title: &7&lRailcraft&r Glass
desc:
New types of Glass that can be used with your Trains! Or bases, 

I can't make you use it for anything specific.

quests.title: &l&6Framed Blocks&r
desc:
&l&6Framed Blocks&r is the single most important Building Mod. Infact if you give me a Modpack and &l&6Framed Blocks&r is not in it, I won't play. It is that important! 

&l&6Framed Blocks&r gives us mock Blocks that can be filled in with any Block that isn't a Block Entity (Block Entities are Blocks like Crafting Table, Furnace, or Enrichment Chamber). 

These Frames can be just about any shape or anything! From vertical Slabs, to slopes, even quarter blocks! 

You want &5Netherite&r Stairs? Then use Framed Blocks! You want a Haybale Crafting Table? You can get it! You want perfect angles in your build? Then start making &l&6Framed Blocks&r!

quests.title: &2Vanilla&r Logs
desc:
The Logs from &2Vanilla &lMinecraft&r, found in the different &2Vanilla&r Biomes! 

I shouldn't have to explain anymore than that!

quests.title: &2Vanilla&r Stones
desc: Remember when it was just Stone and Cobblestone?

quests.title: &l&aOh The Biomes We've Gone&r Stones
quests.title_plain: Oh The Biomes We've Gone Stones
desc:
In the new Biomes added by &l&aOh The Biomes We've Gone&r you can find 4 new Stone types: Dacite, Red Rock, Mossy Stone, and Rocky Stone. 

Now I'd like to know what separates the Rocky Stone from any other Stone that earns it the title of Rocky.

quests.title: &l&5Eternal Starlight&r Stones
desc:
&l&5Eternal Starlight&r is a whole new dimension to explore! 

And to those strictly looking for Building in &2&lMinecraft&r, you can find a bunch of new Stones in it! 

To get to the Dimension you'll need to find its Portal!

quests.title: &l&cRegions Unexplored&r Stones
desc:
You can find these new Stone in the &l&cRegions Unexplored&r Biomes! 

No, the Mossy Stone is not the same as from &l&aOh The Biomes We've Gone&r. 

No, it's not the same as Mossy Stone Bricks.

quests.title: &l&bChipped&r Stones
desc: Only some of theses stones are chipped though.

quests.title: &l&6Storage Delight&r
desc:
&l&6Storage Delight&r is all about Item Storage but making it look pretty. 

There's dozens of Drawers with different designs and Colors. 

It has the same use and space as a Barrel.

quests.title: Smart Filter
desc:
While being the most expensive, they also are the prettiest! 

And that is what matters for Builds!

quests.title: &l&6AllTheOres&r Blocks
desc:
&6&lAllTheOres&r is a built in-house mod made to help unify ores.

With that comes a ton of very useful decorative blocks!

&dFluorite&r and &9Sapphire&r both look very cool!

quests.title: &l&7Railcraft&r Stones
desc:
&l&7Railcraft&r, along with Trains, adds some Stones for Decoration! 

Quarried and Abyssal Stone can be crafted together to make Polished, Chiseled, or Brick versions! 

Also don't forget Stairs and Slabs!

quests.title: Colored Blocks
desc:
Color is one of the most important parts of making a Build more lively! 

It gives it life, personality, and color! 

Start with the Dyes!

quests.title: Painted Planks
desc: &l&cRegions Unexplored&r also adds the ability for you to paint Planks as if they were Wool or Glass!

quests.title: &l&7Railcraft&r Colored Blocks
desc: More Blocks added by &l&7Railcraft&r? I'm starting to doubt if it's even about Trains!

quests.title: Wall Lamps
desc:
Works similar to the &lSimply Lights&r, Inverted will Light when no Redstone is applied to it while normal will only work with Redstone. 

These need to be attached to a Wall to be placed though.

quests.title: Plastic Construction Bricks
desc:
Plastic Construction Bricks are Blocks made through &l&7PneumaticCraft: Repressurized&r. 

Just like their real life counter parts they hurt to step on! 

So either wear Shoes or smooth down the Bricks.

quests.title: &l&bChipped&r Wool
desc: Don't worry, these won't set on fire!

quests.title: &l&bChipped&r Concrete
desc:
I've always hated how boring Concrete is, especially in real life. 

Well atleast in &2&lMinecraft&r with the &l&bChipped&r Mod we can get different designs with it!

quests.title: &l&bChipped&r Terracotta
desc: Even Glazed versions!

quests.title: &l&bChipped&r Gem Blocks
desc:
&cRedstone&r, &9Lapis&r, Quartz, &5Amethyst&r, &aEmerald&r, and &bDiamonds&r are all precious Gems. 

So of course we are turning them into Blocks, very pretty precious Blocks to be exact!

quests.title: &l&bChipped&r Metals
desc:
Don't even complain about this one. 

There are dozens of ways of getting Iron and it's needed for even just normal progression. 

You will get Iron, you will make it into a Block, and you will make it pretty!

quests.title: Now you're just showing off
desc: Is this necessary?

quests.title: &l&bChipped &6Copper
desc:
&6Copper&r is the most abundant Ore in &2&lMinecraft&r and its main use is for decoration. 

There's already plenty of different variants added by &2&lMinecraft&r but &l&bChipped&r didn't think it was good enough! So we got more! 

Even variants for the oxidized versions. 

You can make faux &aEmerald Blocks&r.

quests.title: &2&lMystical Agriculture&r Blocks
desc: While they can be expensive they're also plenty stylish!

quests.title: Decor Mods!
desc:
These are Mods that I've found perfect for decorating your house or base! 

Feel free to check out even more than what's shown here!

quests.title: &l&9X&cy&aC&8r&aa&cf&9t&r &lWorld
desc:
&l&9X&cy&aC&8r&aa&cf&9t&r is all about the 5 different Colors, this includes using them for Blocks! 

&aGreen&r, &cRed&r, &9Blue&r, &8Dark&r, and Light Blocks of all sorts!

quests.title: &bMacaw's Mods
desc:
&bMacaw Sketch&r is a very popular Mod Developer. He is known for Decor Mods. 
From Windows, to Pathways, to Drawers. He makes just about everything. 

Can you craft it all?

quests.title: &lBuilding Tips!&r
desc: This is &2&lMinecraft&r, I can't tell you how to build...
{@pagebreak}
But I can give you tips for it!

quests.title: Tools!
desc:
To build you will need Tools. And you will want Tools. 

Tools that can help you get Blocks, Tools to help you get different versions of those Blocks, and Tools to help you place Blocks! 

You'll need to start with a Stick!

quests.title: Decoration!
desc:
The original &2&lMinecraft&r Chair, the stairs. 

Welcome to Modded &2&lMinecraft&r, we have much more than just stairs for decoration. 

There are dozens of mods that add decoration and even more that add items that can be used for decoration!

quests.title: Digging Claws
desc:
This isn't necessary but I find it very helpful. 

The Digging Claws increases your Pickaxe Tier, for your Hands. So you can Mine up to Iron Ore with just your Fists! 

That also includes mining things like Stone, Terracotta, and Concrete. And you can even mine those with the Blocks in your Hands. 

Honestly it basically is needed.

quests.title: Completed &bMacaw&r
desc:
You got one of everything from &b&lMacaw's Mods&r. I think you've earned it. 

And by it I mean you're own &bMacaw&r!

quests.title: Quest 01516BC7
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &l&5Domun Ornamentum&r
desc:
&l&5Domun Ornamentum&r is sort of like &l&6Framed Blocks&r and &l&bChipped&r put together! 

Using the Architects Cutter we can make tons of different Shapes and Variations of Blocks. 

When making a Block first choose which Group: Doors, Lights, ETC. 
Then, choose a Variant. 
After that, we need to add our Blocks we want it made of! Some Blocks will need two different Blocks of choice while others only take one.

quests.title: Changing Blocks
desc:
Minecraft already adds hundreds of Blocks, and Mods add hundreds more! But sometimes it is still not enough. 

With some Mods we can change the Blocks we already have into ones with different shapes, designs, and even into entirely new Blocks!

quests.title: Cheating
desc:
Supply Camps/Ships are Items added by &lMinecolonies&r. They are made to instantly make you a Base to live and start a Colony! 

You can Right Click them to open a Menu, there you'll have to choose the type of Camp/Ship you want! 

Then, you'll need to find a place to place it. The land must be flat, Red outlined Blocks tell you what needs to go! 

Once it is set, your new Camp/Ship will be built entirely for free! 

It'll have Townhalls, Beds, Supplies, and plenty more!

quests.title: Quarries and Mines
desc:
Terraforming is an important part to even the simplest of Builds. But we &2&lMinecraft&r Players just simply don't have the time or effort to do so. 

So why not let Machines do it for us? 

Quarries are very easy ways of doing so but they all start with Block Breakers. The Simple Block Breaker will only break what is in front of it, not the most helpful... 

But the Advanced Block Breaker will Mine a set Area! Much better for Terraforming!

quests.title: &cMr Crayfish's Mods&c
desc:
&cMr Crayfish&r is a name synonymous with Modded &2&lMinecraft&r. 

His most downloaded Mod is the Furniture Mod of course! 

To get started you'll need a Workbench, which needs Energy to work.

quests.title: Bathroom Set
desc:
Sinks, Toilets, and Baths! 

Everything you need to keep fresh and hygenic! 

All of them hold Water and yes you can sit on the Toilets.

quests.title: Bedroom Set
desc: Plenty of Lights and Storage for your place of rest.

quests.title: Kitchen Set
desc:
The Kitchen holds many Blocks that can hold, preserve, and Cook Food! 

Most the Blocks that cook or prepare Food do need Energy, so check out the Electrical Set to learn more!

quests.title: Outdoor Set
desc:
We've seen enough Furniture for the inside, but what about the outside? Can't have a 4th of July BBQ inside! 

The outdoor set gives us Grills, Coolers, and Doorbells for Guests to ring to let us know they have arrived with patriotic hearts!

quests.title: Electric Set
desc:
Tons of the Items in &cMr Crayfish's&r Mod use Energy! 

To power them you'll need an Electricity Generator. These take Coal or other Furnace Fuels to power up! 

Then, you'll need a Wrench to connect the Generator to your Blocks that need Energy. 

When the Generator is turned on with the Switch at the top and it has Fuel, it will power anything connected.

quests.title: &l&cDy&6en&ea&ami&bcs&r
desc:
The 16 Colors &2&lMinecraft&r gives you isn't enough? 

Well I guess you could have 18 more! 

&l&cDy&6en&ea&ami&bcs&r gives us 18 more Dyes all which can be used for the exact same Items and Blocks &2&lMinecraft's&r Dyes do! 

You want a &6Peach&r Candle? You can get one! You want a &dBumblegum&r Shulker? Why not! You want a &eFluorscent&r Bed? Of course!

quests.title: &2&lUndergarden&r Metals
desc:
&bFroststeel&r, &7Cloggrum&r, and &eRegalium&r can be Mined for. 
&cUtheric&r and &aForgotten&r you need to kill for. 

Any other questions?

quests.title: &lCompact Machines
desc:
&lCompact Machines&r allow you to enter a compacted dimension. After placing a &lCompact Machine&r, you can enter it using the Personal Shrinking Device.

The size of the &lCompact Machine&r is dependent on the recipe, ranging from 5x5x5 to 45x45x45!

You can't break the &lCompact Machine&r's walls, and you can exit by Right Clicking the Personal Shrinking Device.

quests.title: Quest 266127E7
desc:
All the beautiful Builds you see on this Quest Page are from people in the ATM Discord! 

Don't worry all have given consent to sharing their Builds and have been credited! 

If you wish to share your Builds as well, check out the artwork-builds-showoff Channel in the Discord! 

(I can not assure that all Builds were made in ATM10 only that they were made by fellow Minecraft Players. Same ways that some might use Shaders, so if your Builds aren't exactly the same that could be why!)

quests.title: &5&lEternal Starlight&r Metals
desc:
Oh did you think &5&lEternal Starlight&r will have you get all these Metals the easy way? 

HA! don't be stupid. You'll have to fight Bosses, dig through Mud, and look for Meteor Showers!

quests.title: &5&lEternal Starlight&r Trees
desc:
The &5&lEternal Starlight&r is home to plenty of unique Items, Mobs, and Blocks. 

Trees aswell! 

You can find these Trees all over the Dimension in almost every Biome.

quests.title: &l&cLuminax
desc:
&c&lLuminax&r is a very simple Mod. You like Colored Lights? You can have Colored Lights. 

They are all one color with no Texturing and can come in different Shapes like Stairs or Slabs or even Pressure Plates! 

They even work with &l&cDy&6en&ea&ami&bcs&r!

quests.title: &l&6Construction Sticks
desc:
Ever miss &lConstruction Wands&r? 

Well I did, and so did &9Mrbysco&r! So he made &l&6Construction Sticks&r! 

There's a few different Tier of &6Construction Stick&r. The more expensive they are, the more Durability they have and the more Blocks they can place. 

They will start by just placing Blocks to fill a space, but their options can be changed by opening their GUI. You'll need to set a Keybind yourself to do it. 

Once you open it, you can change everything about them. Where they place Blocks, in what pattern, and even what Blocks to place down! 

They also have their own Upgrades you can Craft. To use them, combine the Upgrade with your &6Construction Stick&r in a Smithing Table.

quests.title: &9&lCrystalix
desc:
What does &9&lCrystalix&r give us you ask? 
It gives Glass! All different types of Glass! There is Normal, Clear, and Bordered. 

Bordered is the normal &2&lMinecraft&r Glass pattern. It has borders and pixels near corner to let you know it is Glass. Clear has the borders but no pixels near the corners, so the inside is all clear. Normal has no borders or pixels, it is entirely 100% clear and one color. 

Each &9&lCrystalix&r Glass has its own properties as well: Shadeless, Reinforced, Light, and Ghost. 

Shadeless will affect how it reacts to Shaders and even &2&lMinecraft&r lighting. Reinforced will affect Blast Resistance. Light will affect whether it gives Light, ignores Light, or acts like normal Glass, letting Light in. Ghost will be able to change who can walk through the Glass, this one has the most settings.

quests.title: &d&lCamol
desc:
&d&lCamol&r is the answer to camouflaging &lEVERYTHING.&r From Pipez to Mekanism Cables to ATM Stars, and everything but the- no, wait, the Kitchen Sink, too.

Craft the &d&lCamo Block&r together with the block you want to use for the camo, then right click it on the block you want to camouflage, like some kind of cable or something.

By default the &d&lCamo Block&r will take on the collision shape of the camoed block. You can change this to the Shape Retaining version by putting it into a crafting grid by itself. This will make it take on the shape of the camoing block.

If you want to remove a &d&lCamo Block&r, right click the camoed block with another Camo Block.
{@pagebreak}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/building_tips/camol_example.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &6&lATM Star
quests.subtitle: Does this mean you win?
desc:
It does. 

You have created the &6&lATM Star&r, that means you have beat the modpack!

So what's next?

quests.title: &3&lDimensional &2Seed
quests.subtitle: &oGarden of Eden in just a single Seed.

quests.title: &3&lImprobable Probability Device
quests.subtitle: &oLack of wisdom is a thing of the past with this.

quests.title: &d&lPulsating &8Black Hole
quests.subtitle: &oThe unknown but yet it is everything we do know.

quests.title: &6&lThe Star's&r Casing
desc:
The &6&lATM Star&r needs a few Blocks to hold together the different Items, and make its star shape! 

The first Blocks are &5Unobtainium&r - &6Allthemodium&r &5Alloy&r &6Blocks&r. You need to use an Enchanting Apparatus from &d&lArs Nouveau&r to make them! To make 28 to be exact. 

For 17 X3 Netherstar Blocks you'll need 111,537 Netherstars. (Please I am begging you use &l&bHNN&r just don't spawn and kill 111,537, please!)

quests.title: &cMicromissiles
desc:
You can craft these?!?!?! I've always just looted for them. 

You can change if they home in on targets or fly straight. When homing you can change between the settings of &cSpeed&r, &6Damage&r, and &aTurn Speed&r.

quests.title: Quantum Ring
desc:
By combining some Processors, an Energy Cell, and any Dense Cable we get the ME Quantum Ring. 

Usually we'd use it to connect our ME system across Dimensions but we only care about the &6&lATM Star&r!

quests.title: &cManhattan &aModule
desc:
The &cManhattan &aModule&r is a complicated Recipe. It needs &cTNT&r, &dPlutonium Pellets&r, and &5Heisenberg Compensators&r. Okay maybe 2/3 of it is complicated. 

To make &dPlutonium Pellets&r, start by Energizing &5Amethyst Shards&r. This will make &5Fluxite&r, which can be used with &aUranium Dust&r in a &l&5Particle Accelerator&r to make &dPlutonium Dust&r. 

&dPlutonium Dust&r can be Crafted with Plastic Sheets and an Ingot to make our &dPellets&r. 

The &5Heisenberg Compensator&r has 2 Recipes we can use. Each will need the &c&lAtomic Forge&r to &cEngrave&r them with &bAdamant Ingots&r. 

1. Is with &bUnholy Intelligence&r. Which is created by filling a &2Dubious Container&r with &5Strange Matter&r. &5Strange Matter&r is found by putting &cLava&r and an &3Enderic Compound&r through a &d&lFluid Refinery&r with 2 Extra Chambers attached to it. 

2. Is with the &eSuper AI Chip&r. AI in &2&lMinecraft&r? Yes, and it requires a Recipe Tree of &cEngraving&r, with the &c&lAtomic Forge&r, in order to Craft. Lots of &8Silicon&r for sure.

quests.title: &6Stable Wormhole
desc: Through the ritual of &6Eziveus' Spectral Compulsion&r we can combine a &7Wormhole Frame&r, 2 Quartz, and an &3Enderpearl&r to get our Wormhole!

quests.title: &7Paradox Machine
desc:
The &7Paradox Machine&r can, for a price of a lot of Power and &aTime Fluid&r, will take a Snapshot of blocks and entities in the designated area; then it can duplicate it. 

Lots of Blocks and Entities are blacklisted by configs so no duplicating Bees!

quests.title: Psu 4
desc:
Tier 4 Pocket Storage has 64 Slots for Items and each hold 1,048,575 Items. That's 67,108,800 Items total. Move over Backpacks you've been replaced! 

It only costs a few Nether Stars which in Modded honestly isn't expensive for what you get!

quests.title: Crystal Staff
desc:
First you need to place down the Casting Altar and Standing Stones in the pattern specified in JEI. 

Then, you'll need to put a Diamond Block, a Stick, and Blaze Powder into the Altar. 

After that, place down 4 Incense Blaziers around the Altar, put the Block of Coal in one, Acacia Bark in another, Verdant Bark in the third, and Birch Bark in the last. And light them all up with a Flint and Steel! 

Then Shift Right Click the Altar to start the Ritual! If it didn't work check the pattern the Standing Stones are in.

quests.title: &cExplosive Mycelial Generator
desc:
The &cExplosive Mycelial Generator&r does an amazing job at soaking up Explosions. 

We could use that for a &d&lPulsating &8Black Hole&r!

quests.title: &3Lightning Bomb
desc:
You've probably (definitely) seen structures around the world with what looks like Beacons coming out of them. They're made of cobblestone, have 4 legs supporting them, kinda high in the air! 

Hopefully you know it but they're called &8Dark Temples&r and they have an &aEnviromental Accumulator&r which we need. 

You'll have to wait for Thunderstorm to happen to fill your Weather Container. Then, you can make your &3Lightning Bomb&r!

quests.title: Nether Star Crux
desc:
To grow Nether Star Seeds you'll need a Crux below the Farmland. Yes growing Nether Stars needed to be made more expensive! 

To make the Nether Star Crux you'll need &7Withering Souls&r which have a 1/3 chance drop from &8Withers&r.

quests.title: &3Glyph of &8Wither
desc:
Throw a few &8Wither Skeleton Skulls&r and an &dAbjuration Essence&r to make a &8Wither &3Glyph&r! 

If it didn't work you might need more &aEXP&r.

quests.title: Tipped Arrow
desc:
&8Wither&r is an Effect in &l&2Vanilla&r so of course we need our own way of using and abusing it! 

You can Brew an Awkward Potion with a &8Wither Skeleton Skull&r to create it. Then you can craft Arrows with it!

quests.title: Netherstar Generator 64X
desc:
Only the most powerful and expensive Generator from &c&lGenerator Galore&r. 

You'll need an &9Echo Shard&r, a &bConduit&r, and a ton of Netherstar Generators!

quests.title: &4Wither Skull Scroll
desc:
This one can be created with a &5Blood Vial&r and normal ingrediants for Scrolls. 
You will need to make sure it is Level 10 and &6Legendary&r which you can upgrade it to.

quests.title: &8Witherproof Bricks
desc:
The &8Wither&r has a tendency to break and blow up Blocks. 

Most players do not enjoy this, so the &8Witherproof Bricks&r are just what you are looking for! 

They are just like &8Witherproof Blocks&r, just with a better design!

quests.title: &9Heart of the Deep
desc:
When a &9Warden&r dies it has a chance to drop a &9Heart of the Deep&r. 

This can be used for the &6&lATM Star&r, or to activate the Portal in the Ancient City! 

There can't be anything in the Portal to activate it, that includes &9Sculk&r!

quests.title: &8Wither Builder
desc:
The &8Wither Builder&r is one of the greatest Machines you can get from &lIndustrial Foregoing&r, and because of that it's expensive. 

First you will need the parts that make a &8Wither&r and a drop from the &8Wither&r. 

Then, you'll need a &6Supreme Machine Frame&r which you need &bEther Gas&r to make. Guess what you need for &bEther Gas&r? That's right! A &8Wither&r! You'll need a Laser Drill working on a &8Wither&r to get it. 

&8Withers&r like to leave and kill things so a Stasis Chamber would make milking them easier!

quests.title: &8Withered Comb Block
desc:
When your Hives are vacant and in the dark you may find a little Bee visitor, the Skeletal Bee. 

You can then feed your new visitor a &8Wither Rose&r to make them a &8Withered Bee&r.

quests.title: &464x Magmatic Generator
desc:
This one can either eat &cLava&r like no other, or be used for the &6&lStar&r. 

This one's a hard one, I like seeing &cLava&r disappear instead of my stuff disappearing into &cLava&r.

quests.title: &6Awakened Supremium Ingot Block
desc:
&6Awakening&r is a relatively new addition to &2&lMystical Agriculture&r. Through the &6Awakening Ritual&r you can make &6Awakened Essence&r. 

Then you can combine those with Ingots to get this Block!

quests.title: &8Dark Tank&r full of &7Eclipse Ember Fuel
quests.title_plain: Dark Tank full of Eclipse Ember Fuel
desc:
This ones a 2 parter! First, you'll need a &8Dark Tank&r. Simple recipe only needing &8Dark Gems&r, Iron, and Glass. 

Next, you'll need &7Eclipse Ember Fuel&r. That's not so simple... 

To get it you can start, drop an &7Eclipse Ember&r into &3Liquid Voidflame Fuel&r to make it &7Unrefined Eclipse Ember&r. Then, you'll need &9Shadowpulse Goo&r to spread to it to make &7Eclipse Ember Fuel&r. 

By the way you'll need 16 Buckets worth!

quests.title: &6Smelter Prism
desc:
To get later recipes you'll most likely need a &6Smelter Prism&r and don't worry we only need a Tier 1 Forge to get it! 

You can check how much of each Stat in the Forge you need in JEI! Plus you'll need 4 &6Blaze Powder&r, 2 &8Coal&r, and an &bArcane Crystal&r. 

Lastly, you'll need &9Elementarium&r which can be found in Jungle Temples, Desert Pyramids, and Underwater Ruins!

quests.title: &5Insanium Coal Block
desc:
You can combine the Essences from &2&lMystical Agriculture&r to make... &8Coal&r. 

Obviously it works as an amazing Fuel source but &5Insanium Coal&r seems a little too insane for me.

quests.title: &aUranium Quad Fuel Rods
desc:
&aUranium Quad Fuel Rods&r are a combination of multiple different Blast and Radiactive proof Alloys and of course radioactive Materials. 

These will all come together to make a wonderful fuel for a reactor! Or &c&lPhilosphers Fuel&r!  

Or you can just use a &cBlaze Burner&r... but come on that's no fun!

quests.title: &3Ender Generator
desc:
You can upgrade your &5Obsidian Generator&r into an &3Ender Generator&r. 

Then, it can use &3Ender Pearls&r or &3Eyes of Ender&r to make Energy! 

Or make the &6&lStar&r, your choice.

quests.title: 2 &zRainbow Furnaces
desc:
The &zRainbow Furnaces&r will smelt a stack of Items at a time! 

To craft it you will need a &zRainbow Core&r which needs 2 &cNetherite Furnaces&r and all the colors of the &zrainbow&r in Glass! 

Then, you'll need &zRainbow Plating&r which you get from combining almost every other Furnace in the mod. You'll need 2 of them to craft the &3&lImprobable Probablility Device&r.

quests.title: &aInsanite Blocks
desc:
To get &aInsanite Blocks&r you'll need 8 &aInsanite Ingots&r and 1 &cBlock of Inanite&r. Yes, I know it's confusing with only a single letter difference. 

To get &aInsanite Ingots&r you'll need to reprocess &bBenitoite&r with &4Rossinite&r in a Reprocessor. 

&bBenitoite&r needs to be Mined in &c&lThe Nether&r. 

&cInanite Blocks&r are made by combining 8 &cInanite Ingots&r with a &cBlock of Netherite&r! &cInanite&r not &aInsanite&r. 

To get Inanite Ingots you will need to reprocess &dRidiculite&r with &4Rossinite&r in a Reprocessor. 

&dRidiculite&r is another chain of recipes that quite frankly I'm tired of looking at!

quests.title: Mini Exit
desc:
The most expensive Portal we can make. First for &dDragon Eggs&r you don't have to keep milking the &dDragon&r you can use &l&bHNN&r or &l&2MA&r to get them or an Extrator to make more! 

Then, you'll need &dInfused Dragon's Breath&r from Enchanting. 

There you'll need &9Soul-Touched Sculkshelves&r to Enchant it and to make the Portal. 

If you are wondering why the Portal won't work, it's because you are already in the &2&lOverworld&r! Just kidding you can't use it!

quests.title: Mini Nether
desc:
The main part of the recipe for the Miniature Nether Portal is the &3Hellshelf of Masterful Sight&r. Usually it is used to see what Enchantments you'll get but we're here for the &6&lATM Star&r not for Enchantments. 

You'll only need to enchant to an &4Infused Hellshelf&r which you can get from just a few Shelves. Then you need to craft with it to upgrade it even more! 

After that you can craft the Miniature Nether Portal, which no you can't walk through you're too big!

quests.title: Mini End
desc:
The Mini End Portal will need quite a few &dEndshelves&r. These are the last tiers of Shelves you'll get from &5&lApotheosis&r. You'll need &dInfused Dragon's Breath&r to craft them. 

After that you'll just need Eyes of Ender which you'll need to have made them in order to actually get the &dEndshelves&r. 

If you somehow got to &d&lThe End&r and got the Shelves without Eyes of Ender then I'm impressed!

quests.title: &bChain of Souls
desc:
The &bChain of Souls&r works similar to a Grappling Hook. 

You can Right Click for it to send a &bChain&r which will drag you toward the Block you shot it at. You can Right Click again to release it. Plus it has a Range of 90 Blocks give or take a few. 

To make it you'll need a &bTrapped Soul&r, 2 &5Tenacious Vines&r, and a &9Tenacious Petal&r. 

You can get these mobs from killing a &9Lunar Monstrocity&r.

quests.title: &9Soul Lava Bee&r Spawn Egg
desc:
Soul Lava is a part of &6&lAllthemodium&r. It can be found in &b&lThe Other&r very rarely underground, or common in Piglich Villages!

We'll need to take a Bucket of &9Soul Lava&r and pour it over a Ghostly Bee egg to make a &9Soul Lava Bee egg&r.

Then, you'll need to squish them or poke them for it's DNA to make a Spawn Egg!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/soul_lava_process.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &6Piglich Heart Block
desc:
&6Piglich&r is a Boss added by &6&lAllthemodium&r which lives in the Ancient Pyramid in &l&bThe Other&r. 

On death he'll drop 1 of his Hearts! You'll need 9 of them dead to make a Block of it... 

Thankfully there are ways to farm them!

quests.title: &dEnder Dragon &bData Model
desc:
By Right Clicking an &dEnder Dragon&r with an empty &bData Model&r, you can make the &dEnder Dragon &bData Model&r. 

The Quest needs any version of it, but the &d&lDragon Soul&r needs the &bData Model&r to be &6Self Aware&r. 

In order to get it &6Self Aware&r you need to keep killing the &dDragon&r or make a crap-ton of Predictions!

quests.title: &6Socotra Dragon&r Sapling
desc:
To get the &6Socotra Dragon&r Sapling you'll need to Breed &7Wenge&r with &4Cocobolo&r. 

To get &7Wenge&r you'll need to Breed &4Cocobolo&r with &fBalsa&r. 

To get &4Cocobolo&r you'll need to Breed Balsa with &8Dark Oak&r. 

To get &fBalsa&r you'll need to Breed &cAcacia&r with &eTeak&r. 

To get &fTeak&r you can Breed &2Jungle&r and &8Dark Oak&r.

quests.title: &2Dragon Familiar&r Spawn Egg
desc:
Another Ritual of course, this one being &2Ihagan's Enthrallment&r. (BTW in order to sacrifice a Horse you need it nearby while doing the ritual) 

Once done you will be given a Spawn Egg for a &2Dragon Familiar&r. These can either be used in crafting to get the &6&lATM Star&r, or you can spawn the &2Familiar&r. 

This one will follow you around and can be pet by using Shift Right Click on it.

quests.title: &bEmpty Soul Gem
desc:
Through &bStrigeor's Higher Binding&r we can make an &bEmpty Soul Gem&r. 

These can be used to transport Mobs safely, or make the &d&lDragon Soul&r. 

Personally I think we should do both!

quests.title: &dInfused Dragon's Breath
desc:
&dInfused Dragon's Breath&r is obtained by... well Infusing &dDragon's Breath&r. 

You can use 2 &9Soul-Touched Sculkshelves&r, 3 &bHeart-Forged Seashelves&r, 8 Normal Bookshelves, and 1 &6Geode-Encased Bookshelf of Stability&r. 

It'll also be needed for other recipes but we don't talk about that!

quests.title: &zRainbow Coal
desc: &zRainbow Coal&r is obtained by blowing up a &zRainbow Furnace&r.

quests.title: &8Aerial Interface
desc:
&8Aerial Interface&r works as a link between it's own internal storage and your Inventory. Basically whatever goes in it, goes to you. 

You'll need a whole assembly line to craft it, the Quests should help you!

quests.title: 256M Portable Item Cell
desc:
Incase you have to bring 256 Million Items on an Adventure with you! 

You'll need a few simple Items like &8MEGA Item Cell Housing&r, &5ME Chest&r, and a &5Dense Energy Cell&r. 

And we'll then need the &d256M MEGA Storage Component&r... this one is much harder to make. 

If repetitive Crafting makes you hate &2&lMinecraft&r, then you might want to Craft the &2Blastproof Casing&r! 

We'll need either 2 256M Portable Item Cells, 2 &2Blastproof Casings&r, or a mix of both to Craft the &3&lImprobable Probability Device&r.

quests.title: &5Lightning&r Upgrade Orb
desc:
Unfortunately you can't get &5Lightning&r Runes from a Mob drop, instead we'll need to craft them with &5Bottle O' Lightning&r. 

We get &5Bottle O' Lightning&r from using an Empty Bottle on a Charged Creeper. 

Dangerous I know...

quests.title: &9Singularity
desc:
A &9Singularity&r is a theorized point of ultimate density. Scientists believe the Universe we live in once was a &9Singularity&r. Every molecule in our Universe, in a single point smaller than a grain of sand. 

Of course with &l&bAE2&r drifting along the line of theoritical sciences they have their own &9Singularity&r. 

There's 2 ways of crafting it but each require condensing a multitude of Items into one point!

quests.title: &2Blastproof Casing
desc:
You can make &2Blastproof Alloy&r by combining the three strongest Metals available. &5Tungsten&r, &dTitanium&r, and &7Stainless Steel&r. Yes, stains matter apparently. 

With these you can combine them to make the &2Casing&r. 

For the &3&lImprobable Probablity Device&r we'll need either 2 &2Blastproof Casings&r, or 2 256M Portable Item Cells, or we can use a mix of both!

quests.title: 2 &5Antimatter Pellets
desc:
Late Game &5&lMekanism&r is just insane. For 1 &5Antimatter Pellet&r you need to crystallize 1,000mb &5Antimatter&r. 

For 1mb of &5Antimatter&r you need to power 1,000mb of &3Polonium&r through the SPS. 

To get 1mb of &3Polonium&r you'll need to activate the Neutrons of 5mb of &2Nuclear Waste&r. 

And &2Nuclear Waste&r you get from processing &9Fissile Fuel&r through a Fission Reactor!

quests.title: &2Eternal Stella
desc:
The &2Eternal Stella&r is quite expensive. You'll need a Tier 3 Forge first! 

Then, you'll need &7Stellarite Piece&r which you can mine for. And you have to get 3 &aXpetried Orbs&r which you can no longer mine for. Instead you'll have to feed a Black Hole &aEXP&r to get it! 

Finally, you'll need an &6AllTheModium Ingot&r to get the &2Eternal Stella&r. It makes sense why it is so expensive as it can be combined with any Tool to make it Invincibile!

quests.title: 2 &4Piercing Vengeance Focuses
desc: You'll need a lotta &8Dark Gems&r!

quests.title: &5Mace of Destruction
desc:
First and easiest part of this recipe is &5Evil Sticks&r. Just need &8Dark Gems&r which you Mine for, and &cUndead Planks&r which you get from &cUndead Trees&r. 

Next, is the &5Empowered Inverted Potentia&r. It's not that hard to make simply craft an &7Inverted Potentia&r then keep it in an &aEnviromental Accumulator&r and have it get struck with Lightning! 

Last part has a huge line of &aEmpty Promises&r; you'll be infusing a whole lot. 

Hope you got plenty of &4Blood&r! Speak of the devil you'll also need to fill the &5Mace&r with &4Blood&r.

quests.title: &6Large Advanced Motor
desc:
I don't even know what to say for this. I'm getting lost looking through the recipes. I'd rather list out all the Family Trees for &l&2Productive Trees&r. 

Get &6Advanced Motors&r and combine them with &dTitanium Rods&r and a &9Processing Unit&r to make the &6Large Advanced Motor&r. 
Or you can use a &6Mechanical Arm&r, but I can't promise you that those are easier to Craft!

quests.title: Infinity Card
desc:
3 &cNetherite Ingots&r, 3 Wireless Boosters, and a bunch of &2fancy &eGears&r we can get an Infinity Range Booster! 

The most confusing parts are the Gears. We can't make the Ingots directly we need to mix Dusts together then Smelt the result to get the Ingots.

This doesn't work across Dimensions sorry!

quests.title: &4Quantum Computer Multi-Threader
desc:
When working on &4Computers&r, especially Quantum ones, the Hammers and Pliers on the Crafting Table won't be able to craft us what we need, we'll need a &bCrystal Assembler&r. 

For this one we'll need a whole bunch of &9Singularities&r!

quests.title: Module Gravitational Modulating Unit
desc:
This Module, when put into the &aMekaSuit&r Chestplate, will give you Creative Flight. 
You only need some of the most expensive Items in the game to craft it!

quests.title: &dUniversal Wireless Terminal
desc:
The recipe may look confusing but trust me it is pretty easy. Craft any &dWireless Terminals&r then craft them together to make the &dUniversal Wireless Terminal&r. 

It will also keep whatever you had on the &dTerminal&r like Extended Patterns, that is very helpful for using &b&lAE2&r but doesn't matter for the &6&lATM Star&r!

quests.title: &cNitro Player Transmitter
desc:
The &cPlayer Transmitter&r will supply energy to anyone with the Binded Card. That includes energy to all armor, tools, and items in their inventory. 

The &cNitro Tier&r is needed for the &6&lStar&r, which is of course the last and hardest one to get.

quests.title: 4 &5Insanium Blocks
desc:
For &5&lCreative Essence&r you'll need 4 &5Insanium Essence Blocks&r. Each Block is 9 &5Essence&r now let me do the math... 

You'll need 9,216 &aInferium Essence&r to get just one of these Blocks. So you'll need 36,864 &aInferium Essence&r total!

quests.title: 4 &5Insanium Gemstone Blocks
desc:
Each &5Insanium Gemstone&r is 2 &5Insanium Essence&r. So each &5Gemstone Block&r is 18 &5Insanium Essence&r. 

That means we can take our 9,216 &aInferium Essence&r for the &5Insanium Blocks&r and double it to get 18,432 &aInferium Essence&r for just the 4 &5Insanium Gemstone Blocks&r.

quests.title: &cMaster Infusion Crystal
desc:
Like its inferior brother, the &bInfusion Crystal&r, the &cMaster Infusion Crystal&r does everything the former can as well. 

This one just has Infinite Uses and can upgrade 4 Blocks of Essence to the next one in Block form! 

It does require &cSupremium&r to make it, but trust me it's worth it!

quests.title: &b&lApplied Energistics
desc:
&b&lApplied Energistics&r isn't a Storage Mod, it is &lTHE&r Storage Mod. 

I personally don't know much about the Mod but the Quest page should help you learn it!

quests.title: &b&lOccultism
desc:
I think this Mod is unrealistic. I don't care what Books or Items you have, I don't think the Demonic will follow your every command and work as a slave for you. 

Regardless you can follow the Quests to do so.

quests.title: &2&lProductive Trees
desc:
Guys I think you didn't hear me right I said &e&lProductive Bees&r! Oh wait there's another Mod! 

This one is related to &e&lProductive Bees&r as you'll need them for breeding Trees. 

No, Trees do not use Wheat to breed, they use Bees. 

&oThe Trees and the Bees&r.

quests.title: &e&lProductive Bees&r
desc:
&2&lMinecraft&r Bees are adorable but the limited things Honey gives us isn't enough to justify the work to get it. 

Well unless you can get just about anything from the Bees, then that'd be different!

quests.title: &e&lIron's Spells and Spellbooks
desc:
Iron has blessed us with a very fun Exploration and Magic Mod! Fighting with and for Magic! Nothing is cooler than that! 

It has a Quest Page which you are welcome for.

quests.title: &4&lPneumaticCraft
desc:
No pressure! Well actually you'll need a lot of Pressure with using &4&lPneumaticCraft&r. 

That's kinda what it's all about...

quests.title: &lIndustrial Foregoing
desc:
&lIndustrial Foregoing&r is a Tech Mod with tons of Machines and Tools. All following the same Color Code! 

You'll need to start with Rubber and yes there is a Quest page for it!

quests.title: &7&lIron Furnaces
desc:
Furnaces just aren't fast enough in normal &2&lMinecraft&r, so how do you think they're going to fair in Modded!?

Thankfully &7&lIron Furnaces&r helps speed them up by a lot! 

It also has a Quest page it is just rooming together with &c&lGenerator Galore&r.

quests.title: &2&lMystical Agriculture
desc:
&2&lMystical Agriculture&r is a mod about agriculture, but what are you farming for?

Pretty much anything, from Honey to Steel to Wither Skeletons.

You'll need to do a lot of farming with this mod to make the &6&lATM Star&r!

quests.title: &d&lArs Nouveau
desc: &l&dArs Nouveau&r is all about using Glyphs in Spellbooks to be able to cast them as Spells!

quests.title: &a&lExtreme Reactors
desc:
Nuclear Reactors can be pretty scary to some especially with the dangerous effects of them! 

Luckily the only thing scary about &a&lExtreme Reactors&r is how confusing it can be to follow the recipes! 

Not the explody part they don't do that.

quests.title: &5&lMekanism
desc:
&5&lMekanism&r is one of the most popular Machine and Technology Mods. Quite frankly I have a hard time summarizing it as it has so much in it! 

It has so much we even had to make 2 Quest Pages for it! 

The stuff we need for the &6&lATM Star&r is in the Reactors page but you'll need to get through the Mekanism page to get there.

quests.title: &c&lPowah
desc:
&c&lPowah&r is about power! Generating Power like FE to use Machines from other Mods like &5&lMekanism&r or &lIndustrial Foregoing&r! 

There's different Tiers you'll have to craft up to and of course we'll need the last one for the &6&lStar&r!

quests.title: &5&lApothic&r Mods
desc:
The &5&lApothic&r mods have multiple cores, each changing different parts of &2&lMinecraft&r.

The Attributes and Enchanting mods are what you'll need to follow to get the &6&lATM Star&r!

quests.title: &4&lEvilCraft
desc: Blood, flesh, rituals, if it's evil you can bet it's from &4&lEvilCraft&r!

quests.title: &5&lEternal Starlight
desc:
Around the &2&lOverworld&r you can find &5&lEternal Starlight&r Portal Ruins. There you can challenge the Gatekeeper to a fight! 

If you win he'll give you some Items and with them you can enter the Portal to a whole new world to explore!

quests.title: &c&lGenerator Galore
desc:
&c&lGenerator Galore&r gives us tons of helpful and simple Power Generators! 

Some can even be combined with each other to be more powerful. 

There is a Quest page for them it's just roomates with &7&lIron Furnaces&r.

quests.title: &7&lModern Industrialization
desc:
&7&lModern Industrialization&r is a mod as big as its name! 

It has multiple tiers of machines and thankfully we don't need to go to the last one for the &6&lStar&r. 

Infact now, it is entirely optional! If you'd rather play with &6&lCreate&r to create (get it?) the &6&lATM Star&r you can!

quests.title: &l&6Allthemodium
desc:
&6&lAllthemodium&r is a mod added specifically by the &6AllTheMods Team&r to add more content after Netherite! 

You'll need to adventure through it to get some Items needed for the &6&lATM Star&r. 

There is a Quest page now that you can follow for it!

quests.title: &a&lRoots Classic
desc:
&a&lRoots Classic&r may look small in JEI but I can promise you there's so much to it! 

Roots is all about using nature's gifts to make rituals.

Trust me you'll find these items everywhere!

quests.title: &3&lJust Dire Things
desc:
Direwolf is a name synonymous with Modded Minecraft and &3&lJust Dire Things&r is one of his babies. 

It revolves around Goo, yeah I know sounds enticing!

quests.title: &b&lHostile Neural Networks
desc:
&b&lHostile Neural Networks&r is all about simulating Mobs for farming their Loot! 

Not much else to it.

quests.title: &9&lDeeper and Darker
desc:
If only that giant portal in the Ancient City did something! Oh wait with &9&lDeeper and Darker&r it can! 

You only need a...

quests.title: &6&lForbidden \& Arcanus
desc:
&6&lForbidden \& Arcanus&r is all about using the Arcane to do rituals with the Forge to become stronger! 

Or what most know it for, Eternal Stella. There's more to the Mod you know!

quests.title: &l&7Pocket Storage
desc:
&l&7Pocket Storage&r is a mod that adds simple handheld storage. 

Right Click to open it and you can put Items in. They will have a max count that it can hold, and anymore Items put in past it will be voided. It will also vacuum up Items on the ground that are the same as in it. 

There's also ways you can dump it into Chests or take out of Chests quickly. 

The different Tiers the higher the Slots and Max Items will be.

quests.title: &l&6Runic Star Altar
quests.subtitle: Crafting the &l&6ATM Star
desc:
The &6&lRunic Star Altar&r is a Multiblock made by our very own &3Drack.ion&r via &7&lModern Industrialization&r! 

It is a 15x8x15 Structure which starts with the &5Runic Star Altar Block&r. Place it down then use a &eWrench&r (from &7&lModern Industrialization&r) on it. Doing so will give you highlights you can follow to build the Mulitblock. 

After you've built it (with help from the 2nd Page of the Quest or &eWrench&r) on each side of the &6&lAltar&r you can replace the &9Polished Darkstone&r next to the &6Arcane Polished Darkstone&r with Hatches. These are needed for the actual &6&lStar&r Crafting. 

Use Item Input Hatches (all from &l&7Modern Industrialization&r), these are where the Recipe will be placed into. Item Output Hatches are where &6&lThe Star&r will come from. And Energy Inputs are needed to power the &6&lAltar&r! 
Talking about Energy, the &6&lStar Altar&r will need a boost for getting enough FE/t. To get that we can use stacks of Upgrades from &7&lModern Industrialization&r. These are placed into the &5Altar Block&r and when we Hold Shift when viewing the Item, we can see how much it boosts the &6&lAltar&r! 

You can check the &5Altar Block&r to start Recipes with the &6&lAltar&r or if it is not built correctly, it will tell you. 

(BTW the Loot Bag used in its recipe is from the &5&lLunar Monstrosity&r. Also the direction of blocks like &9Stairs&r or &6Pillars&r do not matter for the &6Altar&r).
{@pagebreak}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap2/atmstar_layer1.png width:125 height:75 align:center}
1st Layer is just &9Polished Darkstone&r, &9Polished Darkstone Stairs&r, and &6Arcane Polished Darkstone&r, along with the &5Altar Block&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap2/atmstar_layer2.png width:125 height:75 align:center}
2nd Layer is more &9Polished Darkstone&r, &9Stairs&r, and now &6Gilded Chiseled Polished Darkstone&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap2/atmstar_layer3.png width:125 height:100 align:center}
3rd adds &bArcane Crystal Obelisks&r, &7Rune Blocks&r, &6Arcane Chiseled Polished Darkstone&r, and &9Polished Darkstone Slabs&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap2/atmstar_layer4.png width:125 height:100 align:center}
The 4th Layer is where we have our &6Darkstone Pedestals&r, a &7Magnetized Darkstone Pedestal&r in the middle, and &6Arcane Polished Darkstone Pillars&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap2/atmstar_layer5.png width:125 height:100 align:center}
5th Layer is pretty simple, just some more &6Pillars&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap2/atmstar_layer6.png width:125 height:100 align:center}
6th Layer needs more &6Pillars&r plus a &7Quantum Injector&r above the &7Magnetized Darkstone Pedestal&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap2/atmstar_layer7.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
7th is very simple as well, just more &6Pillars&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap2/atmstar_layer8.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
The last Layer, needs more &6Pillars&r of course, in addition with more &7Rune Blocks&r and &bArcane Crystal Blocks&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap2/atmstar_layer9.png width:125 height:100 align:center}
Now we can add our Utrem Jars! The &5Altar Block&r seemed pissy when the Jars weren't full...
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap2/atmstar_layer10.png width:200 height:100 align:center}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap2/atmstar_layer11.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

Last thing we need to do to start the &6&lAltar&r, is adding our Hatches. Place them on the outside of the &6Arcane Polished Darkstone&r like shown, you'll need some Item Inputs, Outputs, and Energy Inputs.

quests.title: Quest 31B0267C
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &8&lImmersive Engineering
desc:
&8&lImmersive Engineering&r is all about Multiblock Machines, fun Tools, and of course engineering. 

Don't worry you won't need 4 years of college for this! But a Manual might help you get started.

quests.title: &6Tesla Coil
desc:
The recipe for the &6Tesla Coil&r might seem complicated, especially in a recipe tree, but we can break it down to be simpler!

The &7Aluminum Plates&r are very simple, just needing to use a Hammer on Ingots or the Metal Press Multiblock.

The &8Iron Mechanical Component&r is simple as well, just a few Iron Plates and a &6Copper Ingot&r.

&eElectrum Coil Block&r will need a bunch of &eElectrum Ingots&r cut up into Wires. &eElectrum&r is an alloy of &eGold&r and Silver.

The &6Advanced Electronic Component&r is a whole array of using the Engineers Workbench and &9Blueprints&r. It's Duroplast Sheet requires a lot of refining and fermenting with Multiblock Machines!

The last item, the &cHV Accumulator&r needs some simple Items like &8Steel&r, &7Aluminum Plate&r, &cRedstone Acid&r, and &4Treated Wood&r. It also needs a more complicated Item called &8HOP Graphite Ingot&r.

quests.title: &3Snow Queen &eTrophy
desc:
The &3Snow Queen&r lives in the &bAurora Palace&r within the Glacier Biome. 

You'll need to kill the Alpha Yeti in order to enter the Glacier Biome. 

Once usurped, she will drop a ton of loot, Trophy included!

quests.title: &5Galadorian Drills
desc:
&5Galadorian Drills&r are the greatest Drills we can attach to our Carts. 

Because of its greatness, that also means crafting it will be more difficult... 
Let's just say you'll need a lot of &3Stabilized Metal&r! Follow the recipes!

quests.title: &9&lTwilight Forest
desc:
&9&lTwilight Forest&r is one of the most well known and recognized Mods, and for good reason. It has practically defined Adventure Mods! 

To get there simply have a 2x2 pool of Water, surround it with Flowers, and drop a Diamond into it! 

Then, your Portal shall open up, and you can enter the &l&9Twilight Forest&r. 

Here you'll need to follow a strict order of Bosses to kill and progress!

quests.title: &l&bSteve's Carts
desc:
&b&lSteve's Carts&r is all about upgrading... well your Carts! 

What sort of upgrades? Pretty much everything but the kitchen sink! 

From Drills, to guns, to arcade machines! What more could you want with your Carts?

quests.title: &6Awakened &5Unobtainium&f-&3Vibranium&r Alloy Block
desc:
Another part of the &6&lATM Star's&r juicy insides is the &6Awakened &5Unobtainium&f-&3Vibranium&r Alloy Block, which I am going to just called &6Awakened Alloy&r block. 
To get this you'll need a &6&lStar Altar&r multiblock, (check out Crafting the Star Quest for more info!) 

There you'll need to input the &5Unobtainium&f-&3Vibranium&r Block, 4 Unbreaking I Books, 4 &6Awakened Supremium Gemstones&r, and 4 &6Awakened Supremium Essence&r. 

You'll then need to give it 85 Million FE... After that, your Alloy should now be Awakened!

quests.title: &6&lCreate
desc:
Finally! &6&lCreate&r has been updated and it is definitely worth the wait! 

&6&lCreate&r is all about rotating and using Rotational Power... well for practically everything! Crafting, crushing, mixing, brewing, ETC. 

If it has been so long that you don't remember how to use &6&lCreate&r, you can use &7&lModern Industrialization&r to Craft the &6&lATM Star&r.

quests.title: &cBlaze Burner
desc:
The &cBlaze Burner&r is actually probably one of the easiest &6&lStar&r Ingrediants! 

First, we'll need an &cEmpty Blaze Burner&r. These are just 4 &7Iron Plates&r and a single &cNetherrack&r. 

Then, take your &cEmpty Blaze Burner&r and find a &cBlaze&r. You should know where they spawn but incase you don't: &cBlazes&r spawn in Structures in &c&lThe Nether&r. Just Right Click the &cBlaze&r with the &cEmpty Blaze Burner&r to capture it! 

Once captured, it can be used in exchange for the &aUranium Quad Fuel Rods&r to make the &c&lPhilosopher's Fuel&r.

quests.title: &6Mechanical Arm
desc:
The &6Mechanical Arm&r is a very confusing but also very helpful Machine from &6&lCreate&r. Thank God, I don't need to explain how to use them, only how to Craft them! 

First, and simplest is the &8Andesite Alloy&r. That is just 2 &8Andesite Blocks&r and 2 &7Zinc/Iron Nuggets&r. 

Next, is the &eBrass Plates &fand &eCasing&r. Both obviously require &eBrass&r which is an Alloy made of &6Copper&r and &7Zinc&r! 

Last, is definitely the most difficult of these, the &ePrecision Mechanism&r. You'll need a whole set up of &6Deployers &fand &eBelts&r to keep moving our &eGold Plate&r to add more Items to it. 

1st step: is using the &6Deployer&r to add a &dCogwheel&r to our &eGold Plate&r. 2nd: is using similar to add a &dLarge Cogwheel&r to it. 3rd step: has us adding an &7Iron Nugget&r with the &6Deployer&r. 

We'll need to repeat this 5 times to hopefully get our &ePrecision Mechanism&r! Yep, there is an 20% you won't get the Item in the end! 

Hey, if you don't like all this work, you can always Craft the &6Large Advanced Motor&r.

quests.title: &4&lCataclysm
desc:
&4&lCataclysm&r is an adventure Mod that is all about adding new Bosses! And everything from and around them! 

You'll find the Structures all around the &2&lOverworld&r, &4&lThe Nether&r, and &5&lThe End&r. 

Within will be new Mobs, Minibosses, and very difficult Bosses. You can kill them all to get new Weapons, Armor, and Items!

quests.title: &5Abyssal Sacrifice
desc:
The easiest Item we'll need for the &6&lATM Star&r from &4&lCataclysm&r is the &5Abyssal Sacrifice&r. 

The most basic Items needed is the Blocks of Ingots and Amethyst which are just &2&lVanilla&r Items. 

Then, you'll need a Nautilus Shell and a Heart of the Sea. These are &2&lVanilla&r Items which are rare to get... unless you kill &5Deeplings&r which can drop them! 

You'll also need an Athame which is a weapon used by &5Deepling Warlocks &fand &5Priests&r and dropped by them on death. 
The last part gives us a choice, either Crystallized Coral or Coral Chunk. Both are drops from &5Coral Golem&r and &5Coralssus&r.

quests.title: &4Meat Shredder
desc:
The &4Meat Shredder&r is made from &4Witherite&r, which is a Drop from &4&lThe Harbringer&r. 

You'll need to find the &4Ancient Factory&r which lies deep underground in the &2&lOverworld&r. 

Then you'll find the powered down &4&lHarbringer&r, to power it up we'll need to feed it a Nether Star! 

Then, after a very difficult and long boss fight, you can Craft the &4Meat Shredder&r!

quests.title: &dVoid &cForge
desc:
Now this ones hard to get... we'll need to kill 2 Bosses and a Miniboss to get everything for the &dVoid &cForge&r. 

First, we'll need a &4Mechanical Fusion Anvil&r. To get it, visit the &4Ancient Factory&r which lies beneath the &2&lOverworld&r. 

Then, feed &4&lThe Harbringer&r a Nether Star to power it up and kill it! &4&lThe Harbringer&r will drop &4Witherite&r which can Craft the &4Mechanical Fusion Anvil&r. 

Next, we'll need the &cInfernal Forge&r. That is a Drop from the &c&lNetherite Monstrosity&r. 

Go to &c&lThe Nether&r to find the &cSoul Blacksmith&r structure. Then, fight and kill the &c&lNetherite Monstrosity&r to get your &cInfernal Forge&r! 

Last and probably easiest is the &dVoid Core&r. Thankfully it isn't dropped from a Boss, instead it is a Miniboss! 

Visit &5&lThe End&r to find a &dRuined Citadel&r, within you'll find the &dEnder Golem&r. This one will drop us our &dVoid Core&r. 

Once you have everything, use the &4Mechanical Fusion Anvil&r to combine the &cInfernal Forge&r and &dVoid Core&r to create the &dVoid &cForge&r.

quests.title: Either or &2Blastproof Casings&f and 256M Portable Item Cells
quests.title_plain: Either or Blastproof Casings and 256M Portable Item Cells
desc:
We can use either or both &2Blastproof Casing&r or 256M Portable Item Cells to Craft the &3&lImprobable Probability Device&r. 

Wait did I say either or both? 

Yes I did! We can use 2 &2Blastproof Casings&r or 2 256M Portable Item Cells or one of each.

quests.title: &6Mechanical Arm&f or &6Large Advanced Motor
quests.title_plain: Mechanical Arm or Large Advanced Motor
desc:
The &7&lNexium Emitter&r needs something to move it around, that can be either the &6Mechanical Arm&f or &6Large Advanced Motor&r! 

Both move, so either work!

quests.title: &cBlaze Burner&f or &aUranium Quad Fuel Rods
quests.title_plain: Blaze Burner or Uranium Quad Fuel Rods
desc:
To make the &c&lPhilospher's Fuel&r we get a choice of whether we want to use &cBlaze Burners&r or &aUranium Quad Fuel Rods&r. 

Whichever you find easier to Craft! 

(AKA the &cBlaze Burner&r!)

quests.title: &6&lOritech
desc:
&6&lOritech&r is a Tech Mod (go figure!) known for lots of &lMultiblock Machines&r, Dangerous Blocks, and Colorful Titled Blocks! 

You'll need a bunch of Machines, many different Alloys and Materials, and lots of time. 

You'll need a &6Magnetic Coil&r to start, and good luck!

quests.title: Visit an &6Ancient City&r
desc:
The &6Ancient City&r is only the most dangerous Structure in &2&lVanilla Minecraft&r. So of course that is just the start to &3&lDeeper and Darker&r! 

Here we can find &3Sculk&r galore, along with Loot and the &9&lWarden&r. We'll also find the Portal Frame made of &8Reinforced Deepslate&r. 

But until then, Loot all you can! And be careful of the...
{image:atm:textures/questpics/allthemodium/all_city.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Kill the &9&lWarden&r
desc:
The &9&lWarden&r. The most difficult boss in &2&lMinecraft&r, of course being within the most difficult Structure. 

He's spawned from a &3Sculk Shrieker&r being activated 3 times, or any amount after the first &9&lWarden&r. 

He has 500 &4Hearts&r and does a ton of Damage from either hitting you with his fists or his &bSonic Blast&r! 

He does have a weakness though, that being that he is Blind. He can only find you with Sound, or Smell if you are close enough! Keep your distance, like 23 Blocks up.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/gettingstarted/warden_roar.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &9Heart of the Deep
desc:
The &9&lWarden&r will drop quite a few Items but the &9Heart of the Deep&r is most important. 

We can use the &9Heart of the Deep&r on a frame of &8Reinforced Deepslate&r to get our Portal to the &3&lOtherside&r. There can't be any Blocks blocking the Portal Frame or else it won't work. 

He also drops &9Warden Carapace&r and &9Echo Shards&r, both will be useful for Crafting other Items!

quests.title: The &3&lOtherside
quests.subtitle: Hello from...
desc:
The &3&lOtherside&r is the birthplace of &3Sculk &fand &3Sculk creatures&r, including the &9&lWarden&r. 

Here you'll find many of his distant cousins, but don't worry there's also a few plus-sides to the &3&lOtherside&r! 

There's plenty of new Building Blocks and Items we can find and &3Sculk&r everywhere for tons of &aXP&r! 

So get your Hoe ready and adventure into the &3&lOtherside&r!

quests.title: &bBlooming Caverns
desc:
The &bBlooming Caverns&r are more like Lush Caves than normal Caves. I say that because of the abundance of PLANTS! 

You'll find Plants growing from the ceiling to the floor, Plants growing from the floor to the ceiling, Plants growing from the &9Water&r, and Plants not even Growing at all! 

The floor is covered in &bBlooming Sculk Stone&r and even &bBlooming Moss&r. 

There's even Water Ponds here, the only place you can find &9Water&r in this &3&lDimension&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/deepndark/dnd_cave.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &9Deeplands
desc:
The &9Deeplands&r are most similar to the &3Deep Dark&r. 

They are full of &3Sculk &falong with &3Shriekers &fand &3Sensors&r, which yes can still spawn the &9&lWarden&r. 

Here you'll also find more &3Sculk Creatures&r and Plants, and even the one Structure the &3&lOtherside&r has!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/deepndark/dnd_land.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &5Echoing Forest
desc:
The &5Echoing Forest&r is a little plain but it also houses the &5Echoing Trees&r! 

The &5Echoing Trees&r act like normal Trees, you can Mine their &aLogs&r for Crafting and their &5Leaves&r will drop Saplings. You can also find Sculk Gleam within the Leaves. 

Around it you will find &5Echoing Soil&r all over the surface. These unfortunately can not be made into Farmland or Dirt, they're just Blocks.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/deepndark/dnd_forest.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &cOvercast Columns
desc:
The &cOvercast Columns&r are much more Hot and &6Orange&r than any other Biome here. 

Here &3Sculk&r is replaced with &cGloomy Sculk&r and &3Sculk Stone&r is replaced with &cGloomslate&r. 

You'll also find Soul Sand/Soil plus &cMagma &fwith &cLava&r beneath them. 

With the temperatures being so Hot, Mobs won't normally spawn here, but there is a few Plant life!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/deepndark/dnd_column.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &9Shattered
desc:
&9Shattered&r spawn in quite a few Biomes in the &3&lOtherside&r. 

They act like mini &9&lWardens&r, being Blind relying on &3Sculk&r to find Enemies. They also attack all non-&3Sculk&r Mobs. 

&9Shattereds&r have 50 &4Hearts&r and pack quite a punch! So careful to not attract too many. 

If you can kill them, they'll drop &9Sculk Bones&r. These will be needed for a few Recipes.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/deepndark/dnd_shattered.png width:100 height:150 align:center}

quests.title: &3Sculk Centipede
desc:
&3Sculk Centipedes&r are long neutral Mobs that spawn in the &3&lOtherside&r. 

They have 10 &4Hearts&r and will attack in a group if Hit, like Wolves. 

They only drop &aXP&r and maybe String, so best to leave them be!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/deepndark/dnd_centipede.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &3Sculk Snapper
desc:
&3Sculk Snappers&r are tiny but angry Mobs! 

I've seen them spawn in &9Deeplands &fand &cBlooming Caverns&r. 

They have 6 &4Hearts&r and will drop &3Soul Dust&r on Death.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/deepndark/dnd_snapper.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &9Angler Fish
desc:
&9Angler Fish&r spawn in &9Water Ponds&r within &bBlooming Caverns&r. 

They act like normal Fish, obviously needing &9Water&r to breathe. 

They have 3 &4Hearts&r and will attack you when you are near. 

They don't drop anything on death unfortunately... sorry Fishies!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/deepndark/dnd_fish.png width:100 height:120 align:center}

quests.title: &bSludge
desc:
&bSludges&r spawn in &bBlooming Caverns&r and act like Slimes! 

Their largest form has 8 &4Hearts&r and does a ton of Damage. On death they will spawn 2-4 Medium &bSludges&r. 

Their medium forms have 2 &4Hearts&r and do much less Damage. On death they'll spawn 2-4 small &bSludges&r. 

The small form has only a half a &4Heart of Health&r and won't do any Damage.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/deepndark/dnd_sludge.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Shriek Worm
desc:
Shriek Worms spawn from stepping on &3Infested Sculk&r in &9Deeplands&r. 

They are Mini bosses with 100 &4Hearts&r. 

If you get too close they'll bite you, causing a ton of Damage! But if you go too far they'll retreat back down into the ground. 

They don't drop anything but a bit of &aXP&r, which I don't think is worth the trouble.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/deepndark/dnd_worm.png width:100 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: &9Warden Upgrade Template
desc:
To upgrade from &cNetherite&r to &9Warden Gear&r, you'll need a &9Smithing Template&r! 

These are found in Chests in &6Ancient Cities&r. 

They can then be duplicated with 7 Diamonds and a &3Sculk Block&r!

quests.title: &9Warden&r Weapons
desc:
No, the &9&lWarden&r doesn't use Swords and Axes. But we can! 

Both the &9Warden Sword &fand &9Axe&r are upgrades of their &cNetherite versions&r with a &9Reinforced Echo Shard &fand &9Warden Upgrade Template&r. 

They each have 1 &4Heart&r of Damage more and even more Durability! 

Yes, the Axe can still efficiently chop down Trees.

quests.title: &9Warden&r Tools
desc:
Not much change from &cNetherite&r to &9Warden&r for these Tools. 

The Pickaxe is same Tier and same Speed. Shovels can still make Pathways and again same Speed. Hoes can still make Farmland and also same Speed. 

Only real change is higher Attack Damage for all of them. 

Funny enough that means &9Warden Hoes&r have higher Damage than all &2&lVanilla&r Hoes!

quests.title: &6Ancient Temples
quests.subtitle: The only structure
desc:
The &6Ancient Temple&r is the important and necessary Structure found within the &9Deeplands&r. 

It looks like a Mayan Pyramid made of &8Deepslate &fand &3Sculk&r. There's tons of &3Sculk Sensors &fand &3Shriekers&r as well as Chests and Ancient Vases. 

Within the higher floors you'll find mostly just Chests and Ancient Vases but within the &6Pyramid&r we'll find even &eBlocks of Gold&r and other Materials.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/deepndark/dnd_temple.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &3Sculk Transmitter
desc:
The &3Sculk Transmitter&r is a very rare Item we can find within Chests of the &6Ancient Temple&r. 

Once you do find one, it'll be your Bestfriend! 

To use it, simply Shift Right Click a Block that has a GUI, think of: Chests, Crafting Tables, and Furnaces. Then, the &3Transmitter&r will be bound to that Item. 

After that, we can use the &3Transmitter&r to remotely access that Block from wherever! 

To unbind the Block, Shift Right Click the Air with the &3Transmitter&r.

quests.title: &9Warden&r Armor
desc:
&9Warden Armor&r is direct upgrade to &cNetherite&r. Just use a &9Warden Upgrade Template&r, a &9Reinforced Echo Shard&r, and a piece of &cNetherite Armor&r to make it. 

Each piece has 1 more Armor Point and 1 more Armor Protection compared to its &cNetherite&r counterpart. 

No more Knockback Resistance though. 

They atleast look much cooler than &cNetherite&r though! The &9Helmet&r has giant horns like the &9&lWarden&r and the &9Chestplate&r has a heart spot.

quests.title: &3Soul Elytra
desc:
The &3Soul Elytra&r works just like a normal &8Elytra&r, just now with more Durability and Armor Points! 

They can't be repaired with &7Phantom Membranes&r like normal &8Elytras&r... but Enchantments can still repair them! 

To Craft one you'll need an &8Elytra&r, 4 &3Sculk Bones&r which drop from &3Shattered&r, 2 &3Soul Dust&r which drop from &3Sculk Snappers &for &3Sculk Leeches&r, and a &3Soul Crystal&r which drops from the &3&lStalker&r.

quests.title: &bBlooming Wood
desc:
&bBlooming Stems&r aren't like Trees, they're more like if Chorus and Bamboo had a baby. 

They spawn within the &bBlooming Caverns&r and need other &bBlooming Stems&r to keep up! This is the only way to find them. 

You can still Strip them or make Planks out of them. The Planks have a &bLight Blue color&r to them, and so will whatever you make out of them!

quests.title: &aEcho Trees
desc:
&aEcho Logs&r are made from &aEcho Trees&r which spawn in the &5Echoing Forest&r... is there an echo in here, why do I hear it so much? 

&aEcho Trees&r have &5Purple Leaves&r and Sculk Gleam within them. While their Logs have a &7Light Grey Bark&r and a very &aLight Green Log color&r. 

All the Planks and Wood Items made from it are all the &aLight Green Color&r, almost Mint like. 

The Trapdoors and Doors even have cool unique patterns!

quests.title: &3Sculk Stone
desc:
&3Sculk Stone&r spawns pretty much everywhere but &cOvercast Columns&r. 

It works like normal &7Stone&r, like in every single way. You can smelt Cobbled versions to get &3Sculk Stone&r which can then be made into many other Building Blocks. 

Unfortunately it can't be used to make Stone Tools though... wait what do you care you killed the &9&lWarden&r! Why do you need Stone Tools?!?!?!

quests.title: &cGloomslate
desc:
&cGloomslate&r replaces &3Sculk Stone&r in the &cOvercast Columns&r. 

It works just like &3Sculk Stone&r, just more Brown.

quests.title: &bGlowing Roots
desc:
&bGlowing Roots&r spawn in &bBlooming Caverns&r. 

They can't be Climbed and don't drop Food... I think they are just for decor.

quests.title: &6Bloom Berries
desc:
&6Bloom Berries&r grow from &bGlowing Vines&r on the roof of the &bBlooming Caverns&r. 

Within the &bGlowing Vines&r, &6Bloom Berries&r might spawn and will wait for you to pick them off the &bVine&r with Right Click! 

This is the only Food Source in the &3&lOtherside&r.

quests.title: &3Sculk Vines
desc:
&3Sculk Vines&r are the &3Sculk&r version of &4Weeping Vines&r. 

They can spawn within &bBlooming Caverns&r and &9Deeplands&r.

quests.title: &bIce Lilies
desc:
&bIce Lilies&r are Plants that grow on the &9Water Ponds&r within the &bBlooming Caverns&r (I told you it has a lot of Plants). 

There's 2 parts to the Plant, the &bLily&r and the &bIce Flower&r. The &bLily Pad&r is what floats on &9Water&r and allows you to walk on it. The &bIce Flower&r lies on top of the &bLily Pad&r and looks pretty!

You'll need Shears to nab them.

quests.title: &bBlooming Moss
desc:
&bBlooming Moss&r comes from the... you guessed it! &bBlooming Caverns&r! 

It will spawn on the ground just waiting for you to collect it. 

They don't spread like normal &2Moss&r nor do they have any Recipes.

quests.title: &5Echo Soil
desc:
&5Echo Soil&r covers the floor of the &5Echoing Forests&r. 

They do not act like normal &2Grass&r or Dirt besides allowing &5Echoing Saplings&r to grow on them. 

No normal Saplings.

quests.title: Sculk Gleam
desc:
Sculk Gleam has properties of Shroomlights. They don't need a Tool to collect, but break fastest with a Hoe. 

They spawn within &5Echoing Trees&r and rarely underground.

quests.title: &cGloomy Geyser
desc:
&cGloomy Geysers&r are Blocks you can find within &cOvercast Columns&r. 

When you Walk over them they will shoot you high up into the Air! Be careful though, you'll still take Fall Damage. 

You can pick them up with Silk Touch.

quests.title: &6Gloomy Cacti
desc:
&6Gloomy Cacti&r are just like normal &2Cacti&r, just these spawn within &cOvercast Columns&r. 

I mean they like the Heat, they don't need &9Water&r to grow, they hurt to touch, are there even any differences? 

Oh yeah, these can be Smelted into &6Orange Dye&r instead of &2Green&r!

quests.title: &6Crystallized Amber
desc:
&6Crystallized Amber&r spawns within &cOvercast Columns&r. 

You'll need Silk Touch to grab them. 

They don't do much, but they look pretty!

quests.title: &bSonorous Staff
desc:
You ever wish you, yourself can use the &9&lWardens&r &bSonic Blast&r? 

Well with the &bSonorous Staff&r you can! Just simply Hold Right Click to charge it up, then release to send a &bSonic Blast&r. 
There is a slight cooldown to it and it does have Durability, so use with risk! 

To Craft one you'll need a &9Heart of the Deep&r from the &9&lWarden&r, 2 &3Soul Crystals&r from the &3&lStalker&r, and 2 &3Sculk Bones &ffrom &3Shattereds&r.

quests.title: &3Sculk Tendrils
desc:
&3Sculk Tendrils&r are like &bTwisting Vines&r... just &3Sculky&r. 

They spawn rarely in &9Deeplands&r.

quests.title: &3Soundproof Glass
desc:
&3Soundproof Glass&r is made by combining &3Soul Dust&r and Glass. 

These work at dampening Sound just like Wool! If a &3Sculk Sensor &for &3Shrieker&r has one covering them, they won't hear Sounds. 

Just these you can see through!

quests.title: &3Sculk Jaw
desc:
&3Sculk Jaws&r are Blocks we can find within the &9Deeplands&r. 

When you accidentally walk over them they'll bite you, this drags you down and deals Damage when you are stuck in them. 

You can take them by using Silk Touch.

quests.title: &3&lStalker
desc:
The &3&lStalker&r is a Boss that can be spawned by breaking Ancient Vases. 

He has 200 &4Hearts&r and a Boss Bar to keep track. We'll need to kill him to get &3Soul Crystals&r. 

He is very fast and does a ton of Damage if he Hits you. Thankfully he is Blind, like the &9&lWarden&r. But he also has an amazing sense of hearing which allows him to hear everything nearby. 

He has a few attacks, normally he will just Hit you. Sometimes he might cause an AOE attack and can summon &3Sculk Leeches&r to attack you! 

He'll also attack every non-&3Sculk&r Mob.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/deepndark/dnd_stalker.png width:100 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: &3Sculk Grime
desc:
&3Sculk Grime&r is &3&lDeeper and Darker's&r version of Clay! 

You can find it within a few Biomes and when you mine it you'll get &3Grime Balls&r. 

These can then be made back into &3Sculk Grime&r or made into &3Grime Bricks&r.

quests.title: Home, Sweet Home!
desc:
To get back to the &2&lOverworld&r, we can leave the same way we came! 

Use the &9Heart of the Deep&r on a Frame of &8Reinforced Deepslate&r. 

Luckily we get one of those within the bottom of the &6Ancient Temple&r.

quests.title: &3Sculk Leech
desc:
&3Sculk Leeches&r can sometimes spawn from broken Ancient Vases. 

It acts as a little surprise for you when 2 spawn out! 

They only have 2 &4Hearts&r and will attack you despise that. 

On death they will drop &3Soul Dust&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/deepndark/dnd_leech.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &9Reinforced Echo Shard
desc:
&9Reinforced Echo Shard&r is a Crafted Item that requires a few Items. 

First, and easiest to obtain are &7Phantom Membrane&r! &7Phantoms&r will spawn after the Player hasn't slept in a few days. The more restless nights, the more &7Phantoms&r! 

Second, is the &9Echo Shard&r. These can be found in quite a few ways but easiest is Looting in &6Ancient Cities&r. 

The last is the &9Warden Carapaces&r. These are Drops from the &9&lWarden&r on death. Don't worry he usually drops more than one!

quests.title: Quest 01ECFBB5
desc: This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.
As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.
This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: Kanthal Dust
desc: Mixing &#99F0F0Stainless Steel&r, &#ADDBDBAluminium&r and &#E9A8F7Chromium Dust&r will give us &#EBA844Kanthal Dust&r.

quests.title: Kanthal Hot Ingot
desc: &#EBA844Kanthal Dust&r must be smelted in an &#816DF7Electric Blast Furnace&r.

quests.title: Kanthal Ingot
desc: The &#EBA844Kanthal Hot Ingot&r can be cooled down using the &#6DC0F7Vacuum Freezer&r.

quests.title: Kanthal Coil
desc: The &#EBA844Kanthal Ingot&r can be processed into Fine Wire, which can be molded into Cable to finally make the &#EBA844Kanthal Coils&r.
&#EBA844Kanthal Coils&r allow our &#816DF7Electric Blast Furnace&r to run at much higher &#F76D6Dtemperature&r, allowing more recipes to work.
You must switch the coils in the GUI of &#816DF7Electric Blast Furnace&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/modernindustrialization/switch_to_kanthal.png width:150 height:75 align:center}

quests.title: Titanium Hot Ingot
desc: &#CFB951Kanthal Coils&r will allow us to process &#C356C4Raw Titanium&r into &#DF9DE0Titanium Hot Ingots&r. This process requires &#D49B70Manganese Sulfuric Solution&r.

quests.title: &#F069F0Titanium Ingot
desc: &#DF9DE0Titanium Hot Ingots&r can now be cooled down in the &#5CD1CFVacuum Freezer&r to get usable &#F069F0Titanium Ingots&r.

quests.title: Raw Tungsten
desc: You can find &#6E2D6ETungsten Ore&r around the world easily. Breaking it will yield &#A140A1Raw Tungsten&r.

quests.title: Tungsten Dust
desc: You can crush down the &#A140A1Raw Tungsten&r in one of many ways to get &#C452C4Tungsten Dust&r.

quests.title: Tungsten Tiny Dust
desc: &#C452C4Tungsten Dust&r needs to be broken down to a much smaller variant to allow its processing.

quests.title: Tungsten Nugget
desc: An &#3ABEC7Electric Compressor allows you to turn &#CE5ADBTungsten Tiny Dust&r into &#AF22BFTungsten Nuggets&r.

quests.title: Mixed Ingot Blastproof
desc: The &#A57DE3Packer&r will now allow us to combine &#7DD2E3Stainless Steel&r, &#B37DE3Tungsten&r and &#E37DDBTitanium Ingot&r into a new &#3946E3Mixed Blastproof Ingot&r.

quests.title: Blastproof Alloy Plate
desc: As of now, you can very inefficiently make &#986FC7Blastproof Alloy Plates&r in an &#6F93C7Electric Compressor&r using the &#3946E3Mixed Blastproof Ingot&r.

quests.title: Implosion Compressor
desc: The &#DB62DEImplosion Compressor&r uses the power of explosives to combine resources. It can be used to get more efficient &#8762DEMixed Blastproof Alloy Ingots&r as well as many more useful resources.

quests.title: Distillation Tower
quests.subtitle: Efficiency matters
desc: The &#6AADD9Distillation Tower&r is the upgraded form of &#A3D2F0Distillery&r. Its major benefit is that it gives you multiple outputs for the same input.

To build the structure, you must open the GUI of the &#6AADD9Distillation Tower&r block and choose the height. Height depends on how many outputs you need. To process &#76759ECrude Oil&r, you need a height of 3 blocks.

quests.title: Processing Array
desc: The &#94C0E3Processing Array&r is a large multiblock that allows you to simulate machines running in parallel. Maximum parallel operations are &#94E3A264&r.
To build the multiblock, firstly select the amount of parallel machines you wish to simulate in the GUI of the controller block.
