If you use &6Honey Bottles&r, you can &6Extract&r the Bottles out from the Port on the Right Side. 

The &2&lFermenter&r will need &cEnergy&r which will come from a Port on Top of the &2&lFermenter&r!
{@pagebreak}
Pretty simple start, make a backwards n out of &8Steel Scaffolding&r and within it place &bFluid Pipes&r and on the corner place a &eLight Engineering Block&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_fermenter1.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

Above the &eLight Engineering Block&r place another. To the right of it, skip a Block, then place a &4Redstone Engineering Block&r. To the left of the &eLight Engineering Block&r we'll place a 2x2 of Cauldrons.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_fermenter2.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
Another simple step, just place &7Iron Sheetmetal&r above all the Cauldrons!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_fermenter3.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
Right Click the Cauldron between the &eLight Engineering Block&r and &4Redstone Engineering Block&r with a &6Hammer&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_fermenter.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &9&lSqueezer
desc:
The &9&lSqueezer&r is a simple Machine that squeezes &eItems&r to make other &eItems&r or &bFluids&r. 

We can use the 2 Ports in the Back to &9Input &eItems&r. We'll then need to use the Port on the Right Side of the Barrels to take &eItems&r &6out&r. The Port below that one will &6Output &bFluids&r. 

This will mainly be used to squeeze Plant Oil out of Crop Seeds like Wheat Seeds or Hemp Seeds! 

Some Seeds give more Oil, check the &6Guide&r to see what each gives. 

We'll also need to use the &9&lSqueezer&r to get &0HOP Graphite Dust&r from 8 &0Coke Dust&r.
{@pagebreak}
Literally the exact same start as the &2&lFermenter&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_squeezer1.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
Just like the &2&lFermenter&r as well, just instead of Cauldrons use Barrels!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_squeezer2.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
Above the Barrel between the &eLight Engineering Block&r and &4Redstone Engineering Block&r place a Piston. On top of the other 3 Barrels place &8Steel Fence&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_squeezer3.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
Very easy &6Hammer&r Right Click on the Barrel beneath the Piston.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_squeezer.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &l&aRefinery
desc:
The &a&lRefinery&r will take 2 &bFluids&r and combine and refine them into 1 better &bFluid&r! 

The 2 &bFluids&r can be &9Input&r from the Ports and the Left and Right sides. The Fluid Output will come out the Front Port. 

You can use &bBuckets&r to deposit &bFluids&r into the Tanks as well! Don't forget to Right Click the &a&lRefinery&r to open its GUI. There we will need to place in a Catalyst, in order to start the Machine. 
Along with a Catalyst, it'll need &cEnergy&r which can be added via the Port in the Back!
{@pagebreak}

To start make a line of 5 &bFluid Pipes&r. In the middle place &eLight Engineering Block&r on one side, and a &7Heavy Engineering Block&r on the other. Next to the rest of the &bFluid Pipes&r place &8Steel Scaffolding&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_refinery1.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

Place more Engineering Blocks on the previous ones. To the right of the &7Heavy Engineering Block&r, skip 1 Block and place a &4Redstone Engineering Block&r. Next to the &eLight Engineering Block&r place 2 2x2 of &7Iron Sheetmetal&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_refinery2.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
Now just a few more &7Iron Sheetmetals&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_refinery3.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
For this one we'll need to Right Click the top &7Heavy Engineering Block&r with our &6Hammer&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_refinery.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &5&lAssembler
desc:
The &5&lAssembler&r, unlike most Machines, work mostly in its GUI. 

Right Click the Machine and set up 3 Recipes, by putting them into the Grids at the top of the screen. The order they are in, is the order it will follow for priority. 

You can &9Input &eItems&r from the &eBelts&r and they will &6Output&r out of the back &aBelts&r. You can also &6Input &bFluids&r which will be used to refill &bBuckets&r or &bTanks&r used in Crafting! 

You'll also need to power it with &cEnergy&r from the Top.
{@pagebreak}
Place 2 parallel lines of 3 &8Steel Scaffolding&r with a Block of space in between them. Between them place a &eLight Engineering Block&r in the center, and &4Redstone Engineering Blocks&r around it.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_assembler1.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

On the sides with &4Redstone Engineering Blocks&r place &7Iron Sheetmetal&r. Then, above the &eLight Engineering Block&r we of course will need another. After, place &eConveyor Belts&r going to and through the &eLight Engineering Block&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_assemble2.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
This one might be confusing just be sight alone; place &7Iron Sheetmetal Slabs&r on our previously placed &7Iron Sheetmetal&r. Then, between them place full &7Iron Sheetmetal&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_assembler3.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
To build our &5&lAssembler&r Right Click the first &eConveyor Belt&r with our lovely &6Hammer&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_assembler.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &l&6Automated Workbench
desc:
Another Multiblock that uses &eBelts&r, I'm seeing a pattern. First, we need to set a &9Blueprint&r. Right Click the &6&lAutomated Workbench&r to open its GUI and place a &9Blueprint&r in the Right most slot. 

Then, we can have our &eItems&r go through the &eBelts&r to be used in Recipes if possible. 

After that, the Crafted &eItem&r (and &eItems&r that were accidentally put on the &eBelts&r) will go out the &eBelts&r. 

This is useful for automating Bullets, &0HOP Graphite&r, and &7Mechanical Components&r.
{@pagebreak}

We start a lot of these with shapes using &8Steel Scaffolding&r, this time it is a diagonal line. On the smaller corner we'll place a &7Heavy Engineering Block&r. On the bigger corner we'll place 2 &eLight Engineering Blocks&r and a &4Redstone Engineering Block&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_automated1.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

Next, we'll place more &eLight Engineering&r and &7Heavy Engineering Blocks&r on top of their former selves. Above the &4Redstone Engineering Block&r and the &8Steel Scaffolding&r to the left of it we'll place Treated Wood Slabs. Within the rest of the space we'll place &eConveyor Belts&r in the order shown.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_automated2.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
To get our &6&lAutomated Workbench&r, smack the left Treated Wood Slab with the &6Engineer's Hammer&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_automated.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &8&lArc Furnace
desc:
The &8&lArc Furnace&r is a massive and helpful Machine. It makes most other Machines useless! 

To start you'll need &cEnergy&r Input from the outlets in the Back of the &8&lArc Furnace&r. It'll then need Fuel which are &0Graphite Electrodes&r. These can only be placed into its GUI, they can't be automated. 

You'll then need to &6Input&r the &eItems&r into the Top Ports, near where the &0Graphite Electrodes&r are. When fueled and powered it'll melt down, just about anything. From &7Iron Rods&r to &7Iron Ingots&r, to &bFroststeel Helmets&r to &bFroststeel&r, to &eGold Pickaxes&r to &eGold&r! 

The melted down &eItems&r will be &6Output&r into the Back below the Power Outlets. 

It can also make Alloys from Metals!
{@pagebreak}

1st layer starts off with a U made of &8Steel Sheetmetal&r with the center being &7Heavy Engineering Block&r and the tips being &8Steel Blocks&r. The rest will be &8Steel Sheetmetal Slabs&r with a stray &8Steel Scaffolding&r and Cauldron.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_arc1.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

2nd layer starts with, above the &7Heavy Engineering Block&r and the 2 Blocks next to it will be &eLight Engineering Blocks&r. Then, the sides of the U will be &7Heavy Engineering Blocks&r. With more &8Steel Blocks&r above the previous ones. We'll also need a 2x3 of &4Reinforced Blast Bricks&r above the &8Slabs&r. Don't forget the &4Redstone Engineering Block&r above the &8Scaffolding&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_arc2.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
3rd has more &8Steel Blocks&r, more &eLight Engineering Blocks&r, and an extension of our &4Reinforced Blast Bricks&r. We'll also need 1 &8Steel Sheetmetal&r on each side.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_arc3.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

4th needs a &eLight Engineering Block&r placed in the middle above the others. Next to it will be 2 &8Steel Scaffolding&r. And we'll need to add more &4Reinforced Blast Brick&r but this time a Block of length short!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_arc4.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
5th and final layer is just 2 more &8Steel Scaffolding&r on top of the others. Then, &eLight Engineering Blocks&r above the previous one and in a line in front of it.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_arc5.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
Finally Right Click the Cauldron with the &6Hammer&r to finish it!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_arc.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &l&cExcavator
desc:
What's that? It's only the hardest and most expensive Multiblock in &8&lImmersive Engineering&r. The &c&lExcavator&r! 

This giant behemoth will automatically collect Ores and Blocks from the Ground. 

The Items it picks up will be &6Output&r from a Port in the Back of it. If there's no Inventory next to it, it will dispense the Items. 

This is also a super &cEnergy&r hungry Machine, you'll need to use the Energy Ports on the Left Side of it to feed it!
{@pagebreak}
Place a &8Steel Block&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_excavator1.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
Add 3 &8Steel Scaffolding&r above the &8Steel Block&r and place 2 &8Steel Blocks&r on the ends.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_excavator2.png width:175 height:100 align:center}

After that place a 3x3 of &8Steel Scaffolding&r above the previous &8Scaffolding&r, and an extra one on each of the &8Steel Blocks&r. Then, using &8Steel Sheetmetal&r make a hoop off of the &8Scaffolding&r, including a &eLight Engineering Block&r and a &8Radiator Block&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_excavator3.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

Above the &8Steel Scaffolding&r add more, with a &8Steel Block&r in the middle. Then, attach more &8Steel Blocks&r to the ends of those. On one side it'll be 3 &eLight Engineering Blocks&r and the other will be 3 &7Heavy Engineering Blocks&r. Above the &eLight Engineering Block&r in the last layer, will be another. And above the &8Radiator Block&r will be a &4Redstone Engineering Block&r. Next to it will be another &7Heavy Engineering Block&r and the rest will be &8Steel Sheetmetal&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_excavator4.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

Now for the middle part we'll be repeating what we did below the half, so now it's just &8Steel Scaffolding&r. On the side next to it with &eLight Engineering Blocks&r will be 3 more, same with the random &eLight Engineering Block&r on the otherside. Next to the 3 &eLight Engineering Blocks&r will be 2 &8Radiator Blocks&r, and everything else is &8Sheetmetal&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_excavator5.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
Above the &8Steel Scaffolding&r will be 1 &8Steel Block&r followed by 3 &8Scaffolding&r and another &8Block&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_excavator6.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
The final cherry on top, &8Steel Block&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_excavator7.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
Then, we just Right Click the &7Heavy Engineering Block&r in the back with our &6Hammer&r and it'll become the mighty &c&lExcavator&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/immersive/immersive_excavator.png width:125 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Blastfurnace Preheater
desc:
Let's get these flames burning! 

The Preheater is a very simple addition to the &l&4Improved Blast Furnace&r. 

Simply place them on the Left and Right of the &l&4Improved Blast Furnace&r. Then, connect power to the top of it and it will start speeding up the &l&4Improved Blast Furnace&r.

quests.title: Blastfurnace Preheater
desc: It's the same as the other Preheater I just wanted it to be symmetrical :D.

quests.title: &6Engineer's Workbench
desc:
The &6Engineer's Workbench&r is a necessary Block needed for many Crafts and Upgrades. 

We can use it with &9Blueprints&r to Craft special Items that we can't Craft elsewhere. Put the &9Blueprints&r in the Left Slot, and our &eCrafting Items&r into the Right Slots.

Or we can throw our Tools into it, to add Upgrades to them, like the Revolver or Mining Drill! 

Also when you add &eItems&r and &9Blueprints&r you can see them on the &6Block&r itself, pretty cool!

quests.title: &6Engineer's Crafting Table
desc:
Everybody loved the Crafting Stations from &lTinker's Construct&r and apparently so did the &8&lIE&r Devs! 

The &6Engineer's Crafting Table&r will act like a normal Crafting Table, with an added 18 Slots of Storage in it, plus it keeps your &eItems&r in the Grid when you stop viewing it! 

What more could you want!

quests.title: &d&lRevolver
quests.subtitle: Do you feel lucky, Punk?
desc:
The most basic Gun we can find in &6&lATM10&r, the &d&lRevolver&r! 

Shift Right Click to open the &d&lRevolver&r, then move some Ammo into the Slots. After that, just Right Click to shoot! 

You can apply 2 Upgrades to it. The Upgrades being: Bayonet, Speedloader, Extended Magazine, Amplifier Electron Tubes, and Precision Scope. 

The &d&lRevolver&r can only hold 2 Upgrades but the Speedloader is technically different.

quests.title: &4&lMining Drill
quests.subtitle: Would you kindly?
desc:
The &4&lMining Drill&r does as the name suggests, it Mines! 

It works like a Pickaxe, just needing &8Drill Heads&r and &2Bio-Diesel&r. &8Drill Heads&r determine its Mining Level and have Durability which means they'll need to be replaced. You can attach &8Drill Heads&r in the &6Engineer's Workbench&r, in the Top Slot. 

&2Bio-Diesel&r is a &bLiquid Fuel&r which has a very difficult recipe to make... that's for a different Quest though we're just looking for how to Fuel it! You can use the &4&lDrill&r on any &bTank&r or Machine holding &2Bio-Diesel&r to fill it. 

The &4&lMining Drill&r will mine in a 3x3 or 2x2 area, unless you are Shifting while breaking! 

You can also Hit Mobs with it to do the same amount of Damage as a Netherite Sword, this takes up Fuel as well as Durability though. 

The &4&lMining Drill&r can hold 1 Drill Head and 3 Upgrades.

quests.title: &5&lRailgun
desc:
Yes, it is just like the ones on giant Battleships! 

The &5&lRailgun&r is a special Gun. For 1. it uses special Ammo, not Cartridges like the Revolver uses 2. it uses &cEnergy&r and needs to charge before shooting. 

The Ammo it uses is &eItems&r from your Inventory: &7Aluminum&r, &7Iron&r, and &8Steel Rods&r, &0Graphite Electrodes&r, Sawblades, Enderpearls, Tridents, Blaze Rods, and End Rods. 

It'll take whatever is in your Inventory, to change what it Shoots, Hold Shift and Scroll. 

Next, it needs &cEnergy&r within it to Shoot, to charge it we can use any &cItem Charger&r, including the one added by &8&lImmersive Engineering&r! 

Once we have all this, Hold Right Click until the Railgun gets to Level 99, then release! 

The &5&lRailgun's&r Upgrades are: Precision Scope and Heatsinks. 

It can hold 2 Upgrades, well that makes sense it can't use anymore than that!

quests.title: &b&lChemical Thrower
desc:
This one is supposed to shoot Chemicals like &bFluids&r or Gases... but it won't do it for me. 

It can hold 2 Upgrades atleast! Those work!

quests.title: &bFluid Pump
desc:
&bFluid Pumps&r aren't just used for Bottlers, they can also be used to move &bFluids&r... quicker! 

Using an &6Engineer's Hammer&r we can set Sides of the &bFluid Pump&r to &9Inputs&r and &6Outputs&r. 

Then, we can Power it with &4Redstone&r or &cEnergy&r, with &cEnergy&r moving &bFluids&r much faster than &4Redstone&r.

quests.title: &bFluid Router
desc:
&bFluid Routers&r sort and filter &bFluids&r passing through. 

You'll need to set configs within its UI to set the Filters and which Side. Once you do that, it will take all &bFluids&r coming in and send them to where they are set to go!

quests.title: &bFluid Outlet
desc:
Now this is a fun one! 

&bFluid Outlets&r can be set to &9Input &bFluids&r, and then we can have it so it places those &bFluids&r as Source Blocks next to the &6Output&r Sides! 

This means we can automate placing of &9Water&r, &cLava&r, or pretty much any &bFluids&r!

quests.title: Smart Filter
quests.subtitle: No Ladders?
desc:
Chutes can take &eItems&r (and some Entities) and drop them without worry of despawning! 

They also drop &eItems&r pretty darn quickly. 

You can use the &6Engineer's Hammer&r to make a Chute curve to toss the &eItems&r onto a &eBelt&r!

quests.title: Types of &eBelts
desc:
&eBelts&r come in all different shapes and sizes and uses! 

First, all &eConveyor Belts&r can be Crafted with &8Steel Scaffolding&r to give them covers. &eCovered Belts&r will make it so &eItems&r can't be picked up from Players while on it. 

The first and simplest version of the &eBelt&r is the &eVertical Belt&r. It simply takes &eItems&r upwards! 

&eSplitting Belts&r... split the directions the &eItems&r going in, go. It will switch for every &eItem&r: 1 goes Left, 1 goes Right, 1 goes Left, 1 goes Right. 

&eDropping Belts&r will drop the &eItems&r either into an Inventory below it, or if there is open space it will just drop the &eItems&r. These can be configured with &4Redstone&r to not drop &eItems&r. 

The last is the &eExtracting Belt&r, this one will automatically take &eItems&r out from Inventories and deploy it on its &eBelt&r. These can also be used with some Machines!

quests.title: &eItem Router
desc:
&eItem Router&r will &9Input &eItems&r and &6Output&r them to certain locations based on the Filtering set in its UI! 

These can be set to &eBelts&r, Crates, or other Inventories.

quests.title: &eItem Batcher
desc:
&eItem Batcher&r works kinda like the line for a Roller Coaster. 

The Roller Coaster won't leave until all seats are filled! The same way the &eBatcher&r won't &6Output&r &eItems&r until the set Filter and Amount has been matched. 

Perfect for stuff like &5&lMekanism&r Ore Processing which needs certain amounts of &eItems&r &9Inputed&r or else it will bottleneck.

quests.title: &9Arc Furnace Electrodes Blueprints
desc:
These can't be Crafted, instead they are last Trades from a Machinist Villager. 

&0Graphite Electrodes&r are used as Fuel for the &8&lArc Furnace&r (also for Fluorescent Lights). 

To get them we'll need this special &9Blueprint&r.

quests.title: &9Banner Patterns Blueprints
desc:
This &9Blueprint&r, like many others, can be Crafted. 

&8&lImmersive Engineering&r comes with it's own Banner Patterns! 

You'll need &9Blueprints&r to craft them though.

quests.title: &9Crafting Components Blueprints
desc:
These can be Crafted. 

The &9Crafting Component Blueprint&r is one of the most important &9Blueprints&r. 

It is used to help the &6Engineer's Workbench&r make small Mechanical Components for cheaper than Crafting Tables. 

It also can be used for Crafting unique Items like Light Bulbs and Circuits!

quests.title: &9Warning Signs Blueprints
desc:
These &9Blueprints&r can be Crafted and boy are they cheap! 

Warning Signs are very simple decorations we can make with &7Metal Plates&r, Dyes, and this &9Blueprint&r.

quests.title: &9Specialized Projectiles Blueprints
desc:
These can only be Traded with Gunsmiths for. 

Specialized Projectiles are ones that do unique things! 

Homing, Explosive, and Flares are needed to be Crafted with these &9Blueprints&r.

quests.title: &9Common Projectiles Blueprint
desc:
Can be Traded with a Gunsmith or Crafted. 

Guns aren't much fun without Bullets, so let's Craft some! In order to Craft them though we'll need this &9Blueprint&r.

quests.title: &9Metal Press Molds Blueprints
desc:
&9Metal Press Mold Blueprints&r can be Crafted. 

&7&lMetal Press Multiblock&r will automate the creation of &7Metal Plates&r and &eItems&r. 

To press the &7Metals&r we'll need Molds. 

In order to make the Molds will need these &9Blueprints&r!

quests.title: &6&lEngineer's Skyhook
quests.subtitle: Booker catch!
desc:
The &6&lSkyhook&r works both as a Tool and Weapon. 

You can just smack Mobs with it as if it were a Sword or you can use it for moving around you base! 

When you get close to a &cWire&r (&6LV&r, &eMV&r, &5HV&r, Insulated, Hemp, &8Steel&r, &4Redstone&r) you can Hold Right Click to attach to them. Then, you can move around to slide down the &cWires&r! 

If you want to use it on active &cWires&r, you'll need some Upgrades! Upgrades like: High Torque Motor, Insulated Grip, and Heavy Impact Hooks. 

It can hold 2 Upgrades.

quests.title: &2&lBuzzsaw
desc:
The &2&lBuzzsaw&r works similar to the &4&lMining Drill&r, just for &2Trees&r! 

It requires &2Bio-Diesel&r as Fuel, which I won't explain how to get here either! 

And some sort of &8Sawblade&r. Which you can attach via the Top Slot in the &6Engineer's Workbench&r. 

Simply break Logs on a &2Tree&r and every Log, Leaf, and Birds Nest will come down with it! You can hold Shift to not break everything attached. 

The &2&lBuzzsaw&r also does 10 Damage! Dang, why even use a Sword? Oh yeah &8Saws&r have Durability and it needs &2Bio-Diesel&r. 

The &2&lBuzzsaw&r can hold 1 &8Blade&r or &8Disk&r and 2 Upgrades.

quests.title: &8&lHeavy Plated Shield
desc:
The &0&lHeavy Plated Shield&r is used just like a normal Shield, hold it in your Offhand and use it to defend yourself. 
The &0&lHeavy Plated Shield&r does have much more Durability and protects from more Damage. 

Oh yeah it also has Upgrades! These upgrades can be added on with the &6Engineer's Workbench&r. 

The Shield can hold 2 Upgrades.

quests.title: Toolupgrade Shield Flash
quests.subtitle: Blitz?
desc:
It's like Thorns but doesn't Damage, just disorients Attackers. 

It'll just stop Mobs for a little, it is much more effective (and aggravating) to Players!

quests.title: Toolupgrade Shield Shock
quests.subtitle: Clash?
desc:
With this Upgrade everyone who attacks you will 1. be Stunned which will stop them for a second 2. hurt them and 3. destroy any Projectiles. 

I think it's worth the Upgrade!

quests.title: Toolupgrade Shield Magnet
desc:
It is supposed to Equip your &8&lHeavy Plated Shield&r when you Double Tap S... emphasis on supposed to. 

Reminder that &8&lIE&r is in Beta still! Mod Development takes a lot of time and effort, be respectful of such!

quests.title: Toolupgrade Skyhook Slope
desc: Gotta go fast!

quests.title: Toolupgrade Skyhook Insulation
desc:
Live &cWires&r (&cWires&r transporting &cEnergy&r are Live &cWires&r) will hurt you when using a &6&lSkyhook&r on them. 

Unless you Insulate your Grip!

quests.title: Toolupgrade Skyhook Mace
quests.subtitle: Press LMB to Skystrike
desc:
These make the &6&lSkyhook&r act similar to a Mace, you'll do extra Damage hurting Mobs if you are falling while you hit them. 

In Bioshock Infinite it's called a Skystrike!

quests.title: Toolupgrade Railgun Scope
desc:
The Precision Scope can be used on both the &5&lRailgun&r and the &d&lRevolver&r. 

With the &d&lRevolver&r and &5&lRailgun&r you can press down Middle Click to use the Scope, then you can Scroll to adjust the magnification.

quests.title: Toolupgrade Railgun Capacitors
desc:
Advanced Heatsinks are our only &5&lRailgun&r exclusive Upgrades. 

It will make it so the &5&lRailgun&r charges up much faster!

quests.title: Toolupgrade Revolver Bayonet
desc: Now it shoots and smacks!

quests.title: Speedloader
quests.subtitle: Did I shoot 6 times? Or only 5?
desc:
The Revolver Speedloader isn't actually an Upgrade, rather it is a seperate Item that's used to help. 

Fill it with Cartridges like the &d&lRevolver&r, but now whenever you need to Reload the &d&lRevolver&r you can just Right Click with it to instantly reload!

quests.title: Toolupgrade Revolver Electro
desc: With this added on to your &d&lRevolver&r, your Bullets will give the Mobs you hit the Stunned Effect.

quests.title: Toolupgrade Revolver Magazine
desc: This Upgrade gives space for 6 more Bullets! Making the total up to 14.

quests.title: &c&lAccumulator Backpack
desc:
The &c&lAccumulator Backpack&r doesn't do much on your own, we'll need to give it an &cAccumulator&r in order to get some work out of it! Any &cAccumulator&r it's not judgy! 

Once you give it an &cAccumulator&r in an &6Engineer's Workbench&r, you can now charge it up. Once charged it will provide &cEnergy&r to Items in your Hand and Armor you are wearing. 

You can wear it on your Back Slot in Curios, your Chestplate Slot, or combine it with a Chestplate in a Crafting Table. 

The Backpack can hold 1 &cAccumulator&r and 3 Upgrades.

quests.title: &e&lEngineer's Toolbox
desc:
The &e&lEngineer's Toolbox&r works as a segregated Shulker. 

It has sections: Food, which you can only put Food in. Tools, which can hold &8&lIE&r Tools or other Tools just not &bBuckets&r. &cWiring&r, which can have &cWires&r, &cConnectors&r, or &cRelays&r. And Anything, which doesn't discriminate. Try to be more like the Anything section! 

Some Items can't be held within it though, like &bBuckets full of Fluids&r or Accumulator Backpacks. 

You can Shift Right Click to place down the &e&lToolbox&r to make it act like a Chest, then you can do the same to pick it up.

quests.title: Toolupgrade Powerpack Antenna
desc:
You can't wirelessly charge your &c&lAccumulator Backpack&r... but you can charge it &cwired&r! 

Simply attach your Charging Antenna to your &c&lAccumulator Backpack&r and walk up to any &cWires&r transporting &cEnergy&r and some of it will come to your &c&lBackpack&r.

quests.title: Toolupgrade Powerpack Induction
desc:
The &c&lBackpack&r by default will only charge &eItems&r in your Hand and Armor you are wearing. But what if we wanted to charge more than that! 

Then we'll need the Induction Charger! With this attached, every &eItem&r in your Inventory that can take charge, will charge.

quests.title: Toolupgrade Powerpack Magnet
desc:
This one can attach to your &c&lAccumulator Backpack&r. 

When the &c&lBackpack&r is worn, &eItems&r nearby will be sucked into your Inventory!

quests.title: Toolupgrade Powerpack Tesla
desc:
The Miniture Telsa Coil will act like the Thorns Enchantment. 

Anyone who hits you, while you are wearing the &c&lBackpack&r, will be Shocked. Dealing Damage and giving an Effect!

quests.title: Toolupgrade Drill Lube
quests.subtitle: Stop laughing at its name!
desc:
The Advanced Lubrication System will act like Unbreaking to our &8Drill Heads&r and &8Buzzsaw Blades&r. 

They will lose less Durability on use.

quests.title: Toolupgrade Buzzsaw Spareblades
desc:
The Blade Quiver allows you to hold more &8Blades&r or &8Blade like Items&r on the &2&lBuzzsaw&r. 

To switch between the &8Blades&r (or &8Blade like Items&r) Hold Shift and Scroll. 

This is useful for replacing broken &8Blades&r or even switching to &8Grinding Disks&r!

quests.title: Toolupgrade Drill Capacity
desc:
The &4&lMining Drill&r, &2&lBuzzsaw&r, and &b&lChemical Thrower&r normally hold 1,000mB or 1 Bucket worth of &bFluid&r. 

Normally doesn't mean always! With the Large Tank they can now hold 2,000mB or 2 Buckets worth. 

It doesn't sound like a lot but trust me it is.

quests.title: Toolupgrade Drill Waterproof
desc:
In order to mine Blocks &bunderwater&r you'll need this Upgrade. 

It also gives you Aqua Affinity! (That means being in &bWater&r doesn't slow down your Mining.)

quests.title: Toolupgrade Drill Damage
desc:
The Additional Augers are Sharpness... just for the &4&lDrill&r though! 

Oh yeah and you can have 3 at a time, for stacked power.

quests.title: Toolupgrade Drill Fortune
desc:
The &8&lIE&r Dev forgot the &4&lMining Drill&r can also be used for Mining so last minute he put in Fortune III. 

That being the Rock Softening Acid.

quests.title: Toolupgrade Chemthrower Focus
desc:
With this the &b&lChemical Thrower&r will be more of a Chemical Shooter. 

The range will be increased but the spray width will be decreased. So it is more accurate!

quests.title: Toolupgrade Chemthrower Multitank
desc:
Why just have 1 Tank, when we can use 3! 

You can now hold 3 different &bFluids&r in your &b&lChemical Thrower&r. Hold Shift and Scroll to switch between them. 

This can't be used with the Large Tank though...

quests.title: &8Drill Heads
desc:
The &4&lMining Drill&r doesn't have many choices, we have an &7Iron Drill Head&r or a &8Steel Drill Head&r. 

&7Iron Drill Heads&r Mine in a 2x2 Area at the Tier of an &7Iron Pickaxe&r. It also does 6 Damage and has less Durability than the... 

&8Steel Drill Heads&r Mine in a 3x3 Area at the same Tier of a &bDiamond Pickaxe&r. These do 7 Damage and have more Durability!

quests.title: Ammo for &2&lBuzzsaw&r
desc:
First, is the &8Sawblade&r. This is used for cutting down &2Trees&r. It will chop every Log and Leaf in the &2Tree&r above the Log that is cut. 

Second, is the &8Rockcutter Blade&r. This one can not break &2Trees&r, rather it is used as a Pickaxe with Silk Touch. It will break Stone and give you Stone instead of Cobble. 

Third is the &8Grinding Disk&r. It won't break &2Trees&r or Stone rather it'll break &7Metal Blocks&r! Good for &8Steel Scaffolding&r and scraping Oxidization off &6Copper&r!

quests.title: Safe for &6&lSkyhook&r usage!
desc:
Hemp Rope and &8Steel Cables&r are placed like normal &cWires&r on &cConnectors &fand &cRelays&r but won't transfer &cEnergy&r. 

Instead they are for Decor or using the &6&lEngineer's Skyhook&r!

quests.title: &5&lRailgun&r Ammo from &8&lIE&r
desc:
&7Aluminum Rod&r - 10 
&7Iron Rod&r - 16 
&8Steel Rod&r - 24 
&8Sawblade&r - 12 
&0Graphite Electrode&r - 30

quests.title: &5&lRailgun&r Ammo from &2&lMinecraft
desc:
&dEnd Rod&r does 10 Damage as well as hits Endermen. 
&5Enderpearls&r won't hit Mobs, rather they will teleport you much farther when shot. 
&3Trident&r acts like a normal &3Trident&r throw, dealing 8 Damage. 
&cBlaze Rods&r deal 10 Damage and set the Mobs on Fire!

quests.title: Common Projectiles
desc:
Casull Cartridges are the default Bullets. They deal 5 Hearts of Damage, and that's it! 

Armor Piercing Cartridges will have a higher chance of ignoring Armor Points. This is perfect against Mobs like the Bulwark. 

Buckshot Shells will instead of shooting 1 Projectile, it will shoot multiple Projectiles. Use in close range for best effects! 

Silver Cartridges will act like Casull Cartridges but with higher Damage to the Undead Mobs: Zombies and Skeletons!

quests.title: Specialized Projectiles
desc:
High Explosive Cartridges will shoot explosives at your Enemies, blowing up everything nearby like TNT would! 

Dragon's Breath Shells work like Buckshot, but now the Projectiles are on Fire!!!!! 

Phial Cartridges give Potion Effects based on the Potion used in its creation. 

Flare Shells work like Fireworks in a Crossbow. 

Homing Cartridges will aim after whatever Mob is closest to you... let's hope it's a dangerous Mob. 

Wolfpack Shells are like Buckshot Shells but now the Projectiles are Homing Cartridges!

quests.title: Tesla Coil
desc:
The Telsa Coil is a very fun and &cEnergy&r hungry home defence! 

First, power it with &cEnergy&r from any of its Ports. Then, either give it a &4Redstone Signal&r to turn it on, or use a &6Engineer's Screwdriver&r to make it always on! 

Once it is on it will be actively using &cEnergy&r and when a Mob comes near it, it will Stun them and hurt them! Hurting Mobs makes it take more &cEnergy&r though. 

You can Shift Right Click with an &6Engineer's Screwdriver&r to set it to low power mode. It will take less &cEnery&r but also have less Range and deal less Damage!

quests.title: Turret Chem
desc:
The Chemthrower Turret has the same exact targeting as the Gun Turret so check there for more info! 

Just like the Gun Turret, the Chemthrower Turret needs &cEnergy&r from its ports. But it will also need &bFluids&r Piped in to hold and shoot. &9Input &bFluids&r with Pipes as you can't use &bBuckets&r to fill it, only &bPipes&r. 

The Chemthrower Turret has a storage of 4,000mB or 4 &bBuckets&r. You can also press a Button to Ignite &bFluids&r that are thrown. This will set Flammable &bFluids&r, on fire!

quests.title: Turret Gun
desc:
Gun Turrets will act as a &d&lRevolver&r with a Computer brain! 

They'll need &cEnergy&r from below it, and a &4Redstone Signal&r to turn on. Or use an &6Engineer's Screwdriver&r on it to make it always on. 

It uses the same Ammo as a &d&lRevolver&r, that includes Speciality Projectiles! You can &9Input&r Bullets into it and &6Output&r the Casings, or just have them dropped out with the Expel Casing Button. 

Before it starts shooting, we'll need to set its targeting. First, it won't attack the person who placed it. We also have a Type Bar we can add any Player or Mob name to Add in. These will make it so it spares them! 

It is automatically set to Blacklist, if it is Blacklisted that means it'll Shoot what is listed. We then have Animals which means Passive Mobs. Players means just Players. Neutral stands for any Neutral Mobs and Villagers. Don't worry it was always target Hostile Mobs!

quests.title: Razor Wire
desc:
Razor Wire works like Cobwebs... just sharper! 

The Razor Wire will Damage and Slow anything that tries to go through it, including us! 

We can safely take it apart with our &6Engineer's Wirecutters&r. 

Or we can use &6LV &cWires&r to make it do more Damage and a Stun Effect!

quests.title: Offense and Defense
desc:
To start a war we need to first declare it! 

Just kidding, we just go straight to shooting! No diplomatic crap around here! 

To start, shoot a Pillager with a &d&lRevolver&r. 

This will start the spawning of new and harder Pillagers!

quests.title: Fusilier
desc:
The Fusilier is the medium unit of the new Pillagers! 

They have 12 Hearts and no Armor. 

Their weapon of choice is a &5&lRailgun&r that is charged by their Accumulator Backpack they wear! 

On death they will drop &aEmeralds&r and &7Iron Rods&r.

quests.title: Commando
desc:
Commandos are the light troops. 

They have 12 Hearts and no Armor. 

Their weapon is a &d&lRevolver&r and a Shield they hold in their Offhand. 

On death they will drop Revolver parts with different stats, similar to Apotheosis stats!

quests.title: Bulwark
desc:
The Bulwark are the heavy units of these militants. 

They have 12 Hearts with 18 Armor Points! 

Their weapon is the &b&lChemthrower&r with a &8&lHeavy Plated Shield&r in the Offhand. 

If you somehow kill one you will get &aEmeralds&r and Masterwork Shader Bags!

quests.title: Furnace Heater
desc:
The External Heater can be used with Furnaces, like the &2&lVanilla&r ones, not &c&lCrude Blast Furnace&r! 

It takes in &cEnergy&r from the Bottom and uses it for Heat. 

The Heat comes out of the other sides of it, to adjacent Blocks. 

It is technically used for the &4&lImproved Blast Furnace&r, by Crafting the Preheaters but I don't count that!

quests.title: Cloche
desc:
Our beloved Garden Cloche! It is an automatic Farm, and with this Quest is simple to use! 

To start it will need &cEnergy &6Input&r from either the Left, Right, or Top! 

It will then need &9Water&r from Back Port, (try using a &9Sink&r). 

Next, we'll need to Input our Seeds, Farmland, and optional Fertilizer by the &eItem &6Input&r at the Bottom! 

It will need the correct Farmland for the Seeds, you can check this all by Right Clicking the Cloche to see its GUI BTW! 

Once it has all that, it will quickly grow and harvest your Crops and &6Output&r them on the Front of the Dome. 

Last notes: it will keep the original Seed and Farmland and won't use them up, Dirt will be made into Farmland, and the Fertilizers are Sulfur, Slag, Nitrate, and Industrial Fertilizer.

quests.title: Turntable
desc:
Turntable is pretty simple. The Top face with the &7Grey&r square will be the moving part. 

The other faces are the &4Redstone Ports&r, where you will give a &4Redstone Signal&r to activate it. 

When activated it will rotate whatever Block is attached to the Top. 

You might need to use your &6Engineer's Hammer&r on it to change how it rotates!

quests.title: Charging Station
desc:
A lot of things will need &cEnergy&r, including some &eItems&r that can't be placed down, like the &5&lRailgun&r! So how do we charge them? 

The Charging Station is our man for that job! 

Simply &6Input &cEnergy&r from either the Back or Bottom, and it will be ready to charge any &eItem&r put within it! 

This includes &5&lRailguns&r, &cAccumulators&r, and stuff from other Mods! It can't charge Blocks near it though...

quests.title: Small Machines
desc:
Some Machines in &8&lIE&r aren't Multiblocks, rather they are single-blocked! 

Don't think that, just because they are made with 1 Block that, they aren't important though!

quests.title: Electromagnet
desc:
The Electromagnet is &8&lIE's&r take on the Absorption Hopper. 

Well, kinda! It won't hold the &eItems&r rather they will be moved closest to the Top face of the Electromagnet. 

This can be used to get them onto &eBelts&r or hoppers! 

It will require &cEnergy&r to be used though.

quests.title: Quest 6F3C8207
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks. 

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission. 

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &lModular Routers
desc:
&lModular Routers&r is a logistics mod. 

It all starts with the Router! So make one! 

Also the Buffer is the single item slot in the Router where items will come and go through. And it will need Redstone signal for most modules to work.

quests.title: &lModules
desc:
Modules determine the action the Router preforms.

They can make it so your Router pulls items from Chests, or put items into chests, or even both! And much more!

Modules go into the Router themselves and multiple can be installed.

Filtering and Upgrades go into the Modules themselves.

quests.title: &lUpgrades
desc: Upgrades go directly into the Router and the Router can hold 5 of them. Upgrades directly affect all Modules that they can and usually can stack!

quests.title: &lAugments
desc: Augments are similar to Upgrades but for the individual Modules!

quests.title: Blast Upgrade
desc:
Sometimes a Router might be in a dangerous situation, like spawning a Wither. 

In order to protect it you'll need a Blast Upgrade. 

TNT won't break it, Wither won't break it, only you.

quests.title: Camouflage Upgrade
desc:
This upgrade makes the Router similar to a Framed Block. 

Sneak Right Click a Block to change the Routers appearance to it. 

Just don't lose it!

quests.title: Energy Upgrade
desc: Takes more Energy with the Energy Modules!

quests.title: Fluid Upgrade
desc: Fluid doesn't stack like Items do, so its upgrade is a little different. Still moves more just at a different rate.

quests.title: Muffler Upgrade
desc:
Routers can be noisy, and noise definitely stacks when you have hundreds of them.

Might be nice to invest in Muffer Upgrades then!

quests.title: Security Upgrade
desc:
It's my stuff, no touchy. 

Only you can use and mess with the Router after putting in the Upgrade.

quests.title: Speed Upgrade
desc:
A Router does it's action every time it has one of it's ticks. 

Default is 20 Ticks or 1 Second. 

This can be made to less Ticks with the Speed Upgrade!

quests.title: Stack Upgrade
desc:
Normally the Router moves 1 item each of it's Ticks. This can be doubled and stacked! with the Stack Upgrade. 

1 Stack Upgrade is 2 Items, 2 Stacks 4 Items, and 6 Stacks is 64 Items a second.

quests.title: Sync Upgrade
desc:
This one is unique as it's not used for just 1 Router but for multiple. 

If you want mutliple Routers working at the same time then each needs a Sync Upgrade. 

Will need to be tuned in its own GUI.

quests.title: Fast Pickup Augment
desc:
Why wait? Usually items dropped in Minecraft have a second they need to hit the ground to be picked up again. 

But why wait?

This upgrade lets the Vacuum Module not wait and immediately pick up the items. 

Very good for less lag!

quests.title: Filter Round Robin Augment
desc: We've seen Filters and we've seen Round Robins, now we're seeing both! This is useful for keeping the Items in a select order like for when making Mystical Agriculture Seeds!

quests.title: Mimic Augment
desc:
Used with the Extruder MK2, blocks extruded will mimic the actual blocks. Redstone Blocks will emit Redstone, Glowstone will emit light, Grass will act transparent. But only with this Augment! 
Doesn't work with Block Entities like Furnaces or Enrichment Chambers.

quests.title: Regulator Augment
desc:
When moving items Routers can get pretty greedy, taking every single item they can get their grubby antennas on! 

With Regulator Augment you can limit how much is moved.

quests.title: Pickup Delay Augment
desc:
Why wait? Oh you have valid reasons for waiting? Like items that might despawn. Huh wasn't thinking about those. 

With Pickup Delay Augment the Vacuum Module will wait 10 ticks with every Augment in it to pick up dropped items!

quests.title: Pushing Augment
desc:
The Extruder pushes blocks and entities by why not push it some more! 

The entities not the blocks.

quests.title: Range Down Augment
desc: You don't want everything to do their actions at a larger range? You want your Vacuum to leave some room for dropping items in your World? Then I guess you can range down.

quests.title: Range Up Augment
desc:
Just can't reach what you need to? Try Ranging Up! 

With this everything will do their actions but farther. Vacuum has higher range for picking up items. Energy goes farther. Flinger flings with more strength!

quests.title: Redstone Augment
desc:
Usually the Router commands the Modules but with this Augment the Module goes rouge! AWOl! Pure anarchy! 

It will listen to it's own Redstone activation rather than the Routers.

quests.title: Stack Augment
desc: Sometimes you don't want every Module to move multiple stacks at a time, so when you just want 1 Modules to do so use an Augment! This does not stack with Upgrades though... infact it overrides them.

quests.title: Xp Vacuum Augment
desc:
Now even more like the Absorption Hopper! 

Vacuum Module will now pickup XP Orbs as well as Items. Whatever you do with the XP is up to you!

quests.title: Activator Module
desc:
Don't you hate Right Clicking everything? From Sheeps with Shears to Cows with Buckets? It's the 21st Century we should have Robots to everything! Or atleast Routers do everything. 

With Activator Module it will act as if it were you Right Clicking things. 

You can set what it will Right Click, if it will Attack or Use the Mob or Block, if you Shift Right Click, and how close they need to be in the Module.

quests.title: Breaker Module
desc:
Did you play around with the Placer too much and need to Break those Blocks? 

Its Tier and Enchants are determined by the Pickaxe its Crafted with. 

Now set the area and hopefully put a Filter and let it run! 

Can be used with a Placer to do stuff like turning Ores into Items.

quests.title: Detector Module
desc:
If you know how a Detector Rail works then this Module will be explanatory for you. 

Basically if a certain Item is in the Router, it will emit a Redstone Signal out of the Router. 

In the Module you can set the Item, where the Signal comes from, and how strong a Signal.

quests.title: Distributor Module
desc:
The Distributer is the half siblings of the Sender Modules. (The MK3 to be exact, on the MK2 side). 

Instead of sending to 1 Inventory it will send to multiple that are selected. 

It can send in multiple modes: Round Robin, Random, Nearest First, or Farthest First. Round Robin does an even amount to each in a row, like a dealer in Poker. Random will randomly choose an inventory to feed. The others are determined by the distance from the Router.

quests.title: Dropper Module
desc:
I wonder what Droppers do? 
I think they drop things... 

Any item in the Buffer will be dropped on the ground. 

Could be helpful with something like Botania!

quests.title: Energy Distributor Module
desc:
Why set a location to where the Energy can go? Why not let it go free! 

Like freeing a bunch of Bees, the Energy will go everywhere almost instantly (with less buzzing). Any blocks needing Energy nearby will be charged wirelessly.

quests.title: Energy Output Module
desc:
Energy is something used by practically everything so you need to send it almost everywhere. Thankfully the Energy Module will help with that! 

The Energy Module will move any energy pushed into it, somewhere else! To wherever you set it to!

quests.title: Extruder Module 1
desc:
Extrude is such a prude word. 

The Extruder will place the blocks in the Router's Buffer in a line in front of the Router when given a Redstone Signal. When the Signal is disabled it will break all those blocks. 

Useful for Doors!

quests.title: Extruder Module 2
desc: Similar to the Extruder MK1 but this one is more evolved! Can be used with Patterns so when Blocks are placed they will go in that pattern!

quests.title: Flinger Module
desc:
Droppers drop,
Dispensers dispense, 
And Flingers fling! 

Instead of nicely setting down items from the Buffer, the Flinger Module will throw them? How far? You determine that!

quests.title: Fluid Module
desc:
Water in. 
Water out. 

The Fluid Module will either take Liquid Sources from near the Router and put it into a Tank in the Buffer or take Liquid from a Tank in it's Buffer and place it in front of it. 

Only works for adjacent blocks to the Router, if you want bigger range you'll need...

quests.title: Fluid Module 2
desc:
The Fluid MK2! 

Any Liquid Source nearby can be used with this one, not just adjacent.

quests.title: Placer Module
desc:
This one does as the name suggests, it places Blocks. 

Set the Direction you want the Block placed, preferably set the Filter, then throw the Module and Blocks into the Router! Once the Redstone is set the Blocks will be placed!

quests.title: Player Module
desc:
The Router giveth and the Router taketh. 

This Module is helpful for Builders or even Miners! It can be set to send items from its Buffer to your Inventory or take items from your Inventory into its Buffer. 

Perfect for Strip-Mining, have it take all the Cobble and Deepslate from your Inventory and put it in a Trash Can.

quests.title: Puller Module 1
desc:
Pull..! Pull..! Pull..! 

The Puller is the opposite of the Sender, it pulls items from Inventories into the Router's Buffer. 

The Inventory has to be adjacent to the Router.

quests.title: Puller Module 2
desc: Like the MK1 this pulls! Just not only from adjacent Inventories, but any Inventory nearby!

quests.title: Sender Module 1
desc:
The Sender Modules will move Items in the Router's Buffer Slot into another Inventory. 

MK1 will only move items into Inventories on the same XYZ axis as the Router and with direct line of sight. If there is a block in the way, the MK1 Sender will not send.

quests.title: Sender Module 2
desc:
Sender Module MK2 works similar to MK1 but with less restrictions. 

MK2 doesn't need direct line of sight or to be on same XYZ axis. 

Will have to be in the same Dimension though, unless you have...

quests.title: Sender Module 3
desc:
MK3 doesn't worry about XYZ axis, line of sight, or Dimension. 

As long as the Inventory is in the same Minecraft World it can move items into it. 

Heck I'm not even sure if the Inventory has to be in the game of Minecraft to send to!

quests.title: Vacuum Module
desc:
Mean these Suck! Literally! 

Vacuum Module will suck up any items in the set area and move them to the Routers Buffer. Similar to the Absorption Hopper. 

Also can be used with Experience Augment!

quests.title: Void Module
desc:
If you are using Routers I hope you have some game knowledge. 

Just incase, to void an Item means to delete it. 

Any items that come into the Router, will be deleted forever! 

Recommend using Filters with this one...

quests.title: Quest 71FDF8CD
desc:
HAHAHA did I scare you with the Creative item in the quests?

Don't worry you won't need the item to finish this chapter, I just wanted to scare you

I can have fun sometimes...

quests.title: Bulk Item Filter
desc:
Modules only have so many slots for Filtered Items, if you need more than use this! Bulk Item Filter. 

You can put many more Items in to Whitelist or Blacklist in it. Then throw it in where normal Filters go! 

Will be needed to craft more unique Filters!

quests.title: Inspection Filter
desc:
Durability, Fluid Level, Energy Level, Enchantment Level, and Food Value are all categories we can use with Inspection Filter.

Then we select if we want it Greater than, Lesser than, Equal to, or a mix of those with the Numbered Amount.

Next we give it a Numbered Amount and hit the Plus Button to add it to the Filter.

This can be used to only keep Tools with high Durability or Food with high Food Value.

quests.title: Mod Filter
desc:
Filtering per mod can be very helpful.

To use it, put an item in from a certain mod, then it will show the mod name, and hit the Plus button to add it!

quests.title: Regex Filter
desc:
Is this code? I'm not a coder!? I just wanted to make these quests! 

Here you can type in a Regex into the Search Bar and click the Plus Button to add it to the Filter. Whenever that Regex comes up it will be filtered out.

quests.title: Tag Filter
desc:
Tags are an essential part of Minecraft. 

For all who don't know they work as an organization tool to help choose similar items for the same task. Like Crafting Table being made with any Planks or Trees being Chopped down fastest with any Axe. 

To filter by Tag put an item in, then select the tag from the groups. Like Iron Ore for Ores.

quests.title: Routers for Mob Farms
desc:
Here's a good example of using Modular Routers to make a super easy organized Mob Farm. (Does not include way of killing mobs). 

For it I'll use a Wither Skeleton Farm as example. 

First, you want to get Items into the Buffer with a Vacuum Module. Next, get rid of the Stone Swords with a Void Module. To make sure it doesn't delete everything use a Whitelist Filter with the Stone Sword in it and not matching Damage. After, that you'll need a place to put the Loot, I recommend a Drawer System. Then, use a Sender Module to send the Loot to the Storage System. 

That's all you need!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/router/router_mob.png width:200 height:65 align:center}

quests.title: Routers for Mining
desc:
Don't feel like Mining a bunch of Ores you got? Why not let Routers do it for you? 

You can use a Placer to place down the Ores, then let an Enchanted Breaker Mine the Ores. Breaker needs the Pickaxe used to craft it to be Enchanted first, the Module itself can't be Enchanted. 

You might need another Router to pick up the dropped Ores.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/router/router_break.png width:150 height:80 align:center}

quests.title: Routers for Farming
desc:
Routers can also be used for Farming!

First start off with a simple Farm. Then you'll need an Activator Module and direct it toward the Crops. After that, put a Vacuum Module in your Router to collect the Crops. Finally put it all in the Router, Power it with Redstone, and let it farm!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/router/router_farm.png width:60 height:150 align:center}

quests.title: Quest 2BB57691
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks. 

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission. 

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &3Refined Storage
quests.subtitle: Version 2
desc:
&3Refined Storage&r (RS or RS2) is a mass storage mod that offers a network-based storage system.\
\
To get started with the mod, you'll want to make the &3Controller&r.\
\
The Controller is the 'Core' of your storage network. When provided with power, it gives life to all RS components connected.

quests.title: &8Advanced Storage Housing
desc: Advanced Storage Housing&r is required in order to craft high tier &9Storage Disks&r.

quests.title: &3Autocrafter
quests.subtitle: Automated crafting!
desc:
The &3Autocrafter&r is how we store Patterns for our network to know how to craft items. Once a recipe is placed into the machine, you'll be able to 'Request' an item to be crafted from your &3Grid&r. You can do this by pressing Control + Shift whilst clicking on the item you have a recipe for to bring up the crafting interface.

This block can also be placed facing a machine to use &6Processing Patterns&r. For example, if you point the &3Autocrafter&r at a Furnace, you can put a recipe inside for a recipe you need a Furnace for, like smelting Raw Processors. As long as the &3Autocrafter&r is attached to your system and the Furnace has an Importer attached to it, the Crafter will allow you to request the smelted version of the Processor!

quests.title: Elite Autocrafter
desc: The Elite Autocrafter has 18 Pattern slots and works 2x faster.

quests.title: &bUltra Autocrafter
desc: The &bUltra Autocrafter&r has 36 Pattern slots, works 5x faster, and has a &eStack Upgrade&r integrated.

quests.title: &4Mega Autocrafter
desc: The &4Mega Autocrafter&r has 54 Pattern slots, works 8x faster, and has a &eStack Upgrade&r integrated.

quests.title: Cables
quests.subtitle: Connecting the System
desc:
&9Cables&r are used to connect blocks and items to your system.\
\
Early on, you can get by with placing blocks next to each other to connect them to your system, but Cables allow you to extend out! This is a staple for any large RS network.

quests.title: Importer
quests.subtitle: Importing Items!
desc:
The &9Importer&r is an interface that can be used to pull items from a connected block.

For example, you can use these on Furnaces to pull the finished product out into your system.

You can also filter what items are pulled.

quests.title: Destructor
quests.subtitle: Breaking Blocks!
desc:
The &4Destructor&r is an interface that will automatically break the block it is attached to.

You can also set it to whitelist blocks, which is useful for automating certain processes, like making Casings in &6Create.&r

quests.title: Constructor
quests.subtitle: Placing Blocks!
desc:
The &bConstructor&r is an interface that will place a designated block in the direction it is pointed.

You can designate the block within the GUI. This can be useful for automation!

quests.title: Exporter
quests.subtitle: Exporting Items!
desc:
The &9Exporter&r is used to push items from your system into a block from your network storage.

This can be used to fill Furnaces with ores or fuel, push materials into designated chests, etc.

You can also filter what items are pushed.

quests.title: Elite Importer
desc: The Elite Importer has 18 filter slots and works 2x faster.

quests.title: &bUltra Importer
desc: The &bUltra Importer&r has 36 filter slots, works 5x faster, and has a &eStack Upgrade&r integrated.

quests.title: Elite Destructor
desc: The Elite Destructor has 18 filter slots and works 2x faster.

quests.title: &bUltra Destructor
desc: The &bUltra Destructor&r has 36 filter slots, works 5x faster, and has a &eStack Upgrade&r integrated.

quests.title: Elite Constructor
desc: The Elite Constructor has 18 filter slots and works 2x faster.

quests.title: &bUltra Constructor
desc: The &bUltra Constructor&r has 36 filter slots, works 5x faster, and has a &eStack Upgrade&r integrated.

quests.title: Elite Exporter
desc: The Elite Exporter has 18 filter slots and works 2x faster.

quests.title: &bUltra Exporter
desc: The &bUltra Exporter&r has 36 filter slots, works 5x faster, and has a &eStack Upgrade&r integrated.

quests.title: External Storage
desc:
External Storage is a type of cable interface that is one of the most important items one can make in their &3Refined Storage&r journey.

This type of cable interface connects an external storage to your network. It basically lets RS look into the storage container to let you access it within your &3Grid&r!

This works on many things, including but not limited to: Chests, Barrels, Drawers, Drawer Controllers, and more!

If you can't make drives and have a bunch of chests everywhere, this is your best bet in creating a storage network!

quests.title: &3Security Manager
quests.subtitle: Secure your Grid!
desc:
The &3Security Manager&r allows you to grant access and permissions to users within your network.\
\
When placed in your system, you'll need a &3Security Card&r for each player you'd like to configure permissions for. When no cards are present, everyone has access to all permissions.\
\
To restrict permissions and access to all unconfigured players, configure a card that isn't bound to a player and put it into the manager. The person who placed the &3Security Manager&r will always have access to it.

quests.title: &3The Grid
quests.subtitle: Don't go off the Grid
desc:
Great! We can store things virtually, but how do we see what's in the network?

To access the system, you'll need to create a &3Grid&r. This is the most basic form of 'Display' for the items in your network.

The &3Grid&r can store Items, Fluids, Energy, Source, Souls, and Chemicals.

quests.title: &3The Better Grid
desc:
The &3Crafting Grid&r lets you access your storage, but with a crafting interface!

Let's be honest, nobody uses regular &3Grids.&r

quests.title: &3Pattern Grid
desc:
The &3Pattern Grid&r allows you to imprint recipes onto Patterns for your network.

The easiest way to create a recipe for a Pattern is to look up the item in JEI, then click the '+' button on the bottom right of the recipe. This will then place the recipe into the grid.

On the right side, the top slot is used for storing blank Patterns. With a blank Pattern inside, you should be able to click the Arrow underneath to imprint the recipe onto the Pattern.

You'll then want to put the Pattern into an &3Autocrafter&r!

quests.title: Wireless Grid
quests.subtitle: On-The-Go Grid
desc: Allows you to access your network storage wirelessly.

quests.title: Wireless Autocrafting Monitor
desc: Allows you to access your network crafting queue wirelessly.

quests.title: Wireless Crafting Grid
desc: Allows you to access your network storage wirelessly with a crafting interface built in.

quests.title: Portable Grid
desc:
The &9Portable Grid&r is a portable storage system that isnt connected to a network.

It allows you to interact with a &9Storage Disk&r while not being connected to a network.

quests.title: Disk Drive
quests.subtitle: Floppy Time!
desc:
To store your items, you'll need to create disks, which can be stored inside &9Disk Drives&r that are attached to your network.

These have 8 slots for Storage Disks

quests.title: Autocrafting
quests.subtitle: Follow the Pattern
desc: &9Patterns&r are the bread and butter of autocrafting. These store recipes to let your RS network know how to craft items.

quests.title: Storage Monitor
desc: When connected to your system, the &9Storage Monitor&r will display the current number of an item within your network.

quests.title: &5Wireless Access
quests.subtitle: The 21st Century
desc:
If you want to access your RS network wirelessly, you'll need to start by creating a &3Wireless Transmitter&r.

You can attach this anywhere on your system. This is needed in order to use &9Wireless Grids&r.

quests.title: Storage Housing
desc:
It's time to create the 'Hard Drives' of Refined Storage. To do this, we'll need a &9Storage Housing&r that we'll combine with a &6Storage Part&r to create a &9Storage Disk&r. Just simply make the desired size of the part, then combine with a Storage Housing to create a disk.

The &9Storage Disk&r is used to store your items virtually once placed inside of the &9Disk Drive&r. It has to be put in a &9Disk Drive&r. The Storage Disk wont despawn when dropped in the world.

quests.title: &3Grid Networks
quests.subtitle: Wirelessly Connecting Networks
desc:
Because of the Controller limit, you'll probably end up wanting to connect different systems to your main hub without a billion cables connecting them.

This is done using &3Network Transmitters&r and &3Network Receivers&r.

&9Transmitters&r should be connected to your main system, wherever your Controller is.

The &9Receiver&r should go wherever you want your external network to be. For example, this can be a separate part of your base where you have Bees, a mob farm, etc.

To connect the Receiver to your main network, you'll need to use a &3Network Card&r. To bind the Network Card, right-click on the Receiver, and then place the Network Card into the Transmitter that is attached to your main system

quests.title: Destructor Upgrades
desc:
These upgrades add enchantments to your &4Destructor&r.

Wondering why you would use this? Imagine having a Builder or Quarry pump Silk-Touched Ores into your system. You can have a &bConstructor&r place these ores, then a &4Destructor&r with &eFortune&r on it to break it for even more raw ores.

quests.title: &eSpeeding Everything Up!
desc:
The &eSpeed Upgrade&r does exactly what it says it does. It increases the speed at which the interface/block works. Need an importer to pull faster? Want your crafters to work faster? This is the upgrade!

The &eStack Upgrade&r increases the speed of transfer to a stack of items, rather than just one. Combine with Speed Upgrades for more efficient networks!

quests.title: &bIncreasing Wifi Range
quests.subtitle: Better Signal
desc:
To increase the range of the wireless connection to your system, you can craft &bRange Upgrades&r.

The Wireless Transmitter can only hold 4 total.

quests.title: &cRegulator Upgrade
desc:
The &cRegulator Upgrade&r allows you to maintain a certain amount of items within a block or machine. A great example of this is telling your network that you want to keep 64 Coal within a Furnace. You'd place the upgrade in an Exporter attached to a Furnace, then set it to 64. Your system will then try to keep the Furnace full of fuel!

But what if you need an item that is crafted? The &6Crafting Upgrade&r does exactly this. If you have the recipe inside of an Autocrafter, adding this upgrade to an interface will let it know to craft it if you run out.

Using our example from before, let's say we have a &aMystical Agriculture&r farm going and have Coal Essence. We can then put the Coal recipe in an Autocrafter connected to our system, then place this upgrade in the same Exporter that is keeping the Furnace fueled. If you run out of Coal in your system, the &6Crafting Upgrade&r allows your system to craft some more!

quests.title: &3Monitoring Autocrafting
desc:
When attached to your system, the &9Crafting Monitor&r allows you to see what items are currently in your crafting queue.

You'll need one of these if you want to be able to cancel crafts that aren't working or are bugged.

quests.title: &3Wrench
quests.subtitle: You spin me right round'
desc:
The &3Wrench&r is a tool that can do two things:
- Rotate blocks.
- Break Refined Storage covers.

Simply sneak + right-click when using the Wrench.

quests.title: &3Managing Autocrafters
desc:
The &3Autocrafer Manager&r allows you to access all your &3Autocrafters&r from one block.

Hope you don't try to organise everything, for your sake.

quests.title: &4Mega Constructor
desc: The &4Mega Constructor&r has 54 filter slots, works 8x faster, and has a &eStack Upgrade&r integrated.

quests.title: &4Mega Destructor
desc: The &4Mega Destructor&r has 54 filter slots, works 8x faster, and has a &eStack Upgrade&r integrated.

quests.title: &4Mega Importer
desc: The &4Mega Importer&r has 54 filter slots, works 8x faster, and has a &eStack Upgrade&r integrated.

quests.title: &4Mega Exporter
desc: The &4Mega Exporter&r has 54 filter slots, works 8x faster, and has a &eStack Upgrade&r integrated.

quests.title: &dInterdimensional Wireless Transmitter
quests.subtitle: TLDR: Good Wifi
desc: The &bInterdimensional Wireless Transmitter&r is an upgraded version of the &3Wireless Transmitter&r that has infinite range, even across dimensions.

quests.title: &5Other Storage Parts
desc:
On top of items and fluids, &3Refined Storage&r can also be used to store &aChemicals&r, thanks to the Refined Storage - Mekanism Integration mod.

You can also store &4Energy&r, &5Source&r and &9Souls&r, thanks to the Refined Types mod.

quests.title: &dWireless Universal Grid
desc: The&9 Wireless Universal Grid&r allows you to access your network storage, your storage network with a crafting interface built in, and your crafting queue, all wirelessly.

quests.title: Quest 34F7325C
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: Disk Interface
quests.subtitle: No more Manipulation!
desc: The Disk Interface allows you to take items and fluids from one disk and put it into another grid's disks.

quests.title: Elite Disk Interface
desc: The Elite Disk Interface has 18 filter slots and works 2x faster.

quests.title: &bUltra Disk Interface
desc: The &bUltra Disk Interface&r has 36 filter slots, works 5x faster, and has a &eStack Upgrade&r integrated.

quests.title: &4Mega Disk Interface
desc: The &4Mega Disk Interface&r has 54 filter slots, works 8x faster, and has a &eStack Upgrade&r integrated.

quests.title: Fully Automated &6&lATM Star
desc:
With the Infused &dPatrick &aStar&r, 5 &6Star Fragments&r, &5Corrupti Dust&r, &cMundabitur Dust&r, and the Lens of the &4Killer&r we can rebuild &6&lATM Stars&r, 100% automated! 

Now these &5Creative&r Items will be a breeze to craft!

quests.title: &b&lRunic Crucible
desc:
Alright another &lMultiblock&r! This one requiring more ports than any Naval Base has seen!

We'll need &3Fluid Input &fand &3Output&r hatches and &6Item Input &fand &6Output&r hatches.

Now, this ends up being a bit of a process so follow along carefully!

First, we'll need &7Unrefined Liquid Souls&r which comes from using a Fluid Extractor (from &lIF&r) on a Soul Tree.

Next, we need &dLiquefied Source&r which we can get using a &9Source Condenser&r. A &9Source Condenser&r will pull Source from nearby Source Jars and turn it into &dLiquefied Source&r!

Then, we can use the &b&lRunic Crucible&r to combine Souls, &7Unrefined Liquid Souls&r, and &dLiquefied Source&r together into Liquid Souls!

Finally, we'll use the Liquid Souls, &dLiquefied Source&r, and some items from &l&5Mekanism&r to craft &5Obsidiansteel&r.
{@pagebreak}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_crucible1.png width:125 height:100 align:center}

First layer of the &l&bRunic Crucible&r has a &6Gilded Chiseled Polished Darkstone&r in the middle, around it is &9Polished Darkstone&r. Then, on the sides we'll have upside down &9Polished Darkstone Stairs&r, with &7Rune Blocks&r on the corners.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_crucible2.png width:125 height:100 align:center}

Smack dab in the middle we'll put an &bArcane Crystal&r with &9Polished Darkstone Stairs&r around it. On the sides will be &6Arcane Polished Darkstone Pillars&r, &9Polished Darkstone&r which will be replaced by Hatches, and &6Arcane Polished Darkstone&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_crucible3.png width:125 height:100 align:center}
Just place &bArcane Crystal Blocks&r on each corner and call it a day!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_crucible4.png width:125 height:100 align:center}
Finally, with a block of space, place the &7Quantum Injector&r above the middle &bArcane Crystal Block&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_crucible5.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_crucible6.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
The &9Polished Darkstone blocks&r in the middle layer are where we'll place our Hatches!

quests.title: &c&lAutomatic Hepheastus Forge
desc:
One of the most important &lMutliblocks&r, mostly because we need it for the other &lMultiblocks&r. 

Here you'll need &bFluid Input&r (each &bInput&r can only hold 1 type of &bFluid&r so you'll need multiple), &cEnergy Input&r, and &eItem Input&r and Output Hatches. 

Using those Hatches we can input all the &eItems&r, &bFluids&r, and &cEnergy&r and it'll craft our Items, like the other &5Multiblock Controllers&r! 

Or craft our Items needed for the &6Star Parts&r! You'll need a lot of &4Blood&f, &bAureal&f, Souls, and &cEnergy&r for them!
{@pagebreak}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_forge1.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

First layer is pretty simple. Just some &9Polished Darkstone Blocks &fand &9Stairs&r. Along with the &7Rune Blocks&r and &6Arcane Polished Darkstone&r. Oh wait, I almost forgot the most important Block! The &5Forge Block&r
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_forge2.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

Next layer will have more &9Darkstone&r in &9Blocks&f, &9Stairs&f, and &9Slabs&r and even &6Gilded Arcane Polished Darkstone&r and &6Chiseled Polished Arcane Darkstone&r. Can't forget the 4 &bArcane Crystal Obelisks&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_forge3.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
This one's very easy! Just a &9&lTier 5 &6Forge&r square in the center with 8 &6Darkstone Pedestals&r 2 Blocks away from it.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_forge4.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
We're going to skip a layer because nothing is added there! Instead, with a Block of space between them. Place the &7Quantum Injector&r above the &9&lTier 5 &6Forge&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_forge5.png width:200 height:100 align:center}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_forge6.png width:200 height:100 align:center}
Last is placing a few more Hatches! We'll need them!

quests.title: &6&lRunic Star Altar
desc:
Just like making the &6&lATM Star&r normally, automating it needs to be within the &6&lRunic Star Altar&r! 

Check out the Quest in Chapter 3 to learn how to build and use it.

quests.title: &5&lRunic Enchanter
desc:
One thing that bugs many Modded Players is that &5Enchanting&r can't be completely automated! And you can't choose which &5Enchants&r you want, you have to get Lucky! 

Well don't worry both those wishes have been fulfilled! With the &5&lRunic Enchanter&r. 

To use it, you won't have to touch the &5Enchanting Table&r, just pipe in the right Items, &dSource&r, and &aXP Fluid&r. 

&aXP Fluid&r will need to be obtained by bottling some form of &aLiquid XP&r with the Bottling Machine from &8&lImmersive Engineering&r, then processing it through &7&lExtended Industrialization&r Canning Machine. 

You'll need to make &dInfused Dragon's Breath&r and &5Mending Books&r to remake the &6&lATM Star&r!
{@pagebreak}
(&bLight Blue Carpet&r is &bSoul-Touched Deepshelf&r
&5Purple Carpet&r is &5Echoing Sculkshelf&r
&9Blue Carpet&r is &9Soul-Touched Sculkshelf&r)
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_enchanter1.png width:125 height:100 align:center}
The base of the &5&lRunic Enchanter&r is full of practically everything! It has &9Darkstone&r galore, Bookshelves, &7Rune Blocks&r, and &bArcane Crystal Blocks&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_enchanter2.png width:125 height:100 align:center}

We will continue in a similar way, just replace our &7Rune Blocks&r and &bArcane Crystal Blocks&r with &6Gilded Chiseled Polished Darkstone&r and &6Darkstone Pillars&r. Yeah those new looking funny squares are the tops of &6Darkstone Pillars&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_enchanter3.png width:125 height:100 align:center}
Don't worry it is getting easier! Keep a few more Bookshelves as well as adding &6Darkstone Pedestals&r and an &5Enchanting Table&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_enchanter4.png width:125 height:100 align:center}
Heck this one is even easier! Just 4 &bSoul Lanterns&r on top of the last Bookshelves.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_enchanter5.png width:125 height:100 align:center}
Okay this one is too easier! Just place a &7Quantum Injector&r a Block above the &5Enchanting Table&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_enchanter6.png width:150 height:150 align:center}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_enchanter7.png width:150 height:150 align:center}
Probably should have told you earlier but the Hatches go in the Bottom of the &5&lRunic Enchanter&r... sorry!

quests.title: &l&cEnergy Cell &5(Creative)
quests.subtitle: Unlimited Powah!
desc:
For this &5Creative &cEnergy Cell&r, not to be confused with the other &5Creative &dEnergy Cell&r, you'll need 4 &cNitro Cells&r. 

Each &cNitro Cell&r needs 2 &aSpirited Cells&r, and each &aSpirited Cell&r needs 2 &bNiotic Cells&r. This goes on for awhile... 

I'm not doing this math, get a Recipe Tree, I got more important things to do!

quests.title: &5&lCreative &aEnergy Cube
desc:
Don't be confused there is a full and empty &5Creative &aEnergy Cube&r. 

&aEmpty Cubes&r work as an Energy Trash Can, voiding any Energy coming into it. 

&aFull Cubes&r work as an infinite energy storage. You'll need &aempty Energy Cubes&r to make it though... and those are expensive! 

Energizing 4 &aempty Energy Cubes&r with an &6&lATM Star&r you can get the full one.

quests.title: &5&lCreative Jetpack
desc:
Don't you hate when you run out of Energy in your Jetpack? Well you'll neever need to worry about that again! 

You might need to make every Jetpack before it, an &6&lATM Star&r, plus more expensive Items but hey it is worth it! 

Just put it on and use it as normal, just with less charging.

quests.title: &5&lCreative &7Compressed Iron Blocks
desc:
For 8 Stacks of &7Compressed Iron Blocks&r and an &6&lATM Star&r you can get the &5Creative &7Compressed Iron Block&r! 

This can be set to any temperature you want it to be set to, which can then be used in your Machines. 

8 Stacks of &7Compressed Iron Blocks&r equals 4,608 &7Compressed Iron Ingots&r... good luck!

quests.title: &5&lCreative &8Compressor
desc:
The &5Creative &8Compressor&r allows you to choose any Bar Pressure you want! Positive, Negative, even 0! It can be used within Machines. 

You'll need 4 stacks of Advanced Pressure Tubes, Advanced Liquid Compressor, Advanced Air Compressor, Electrostatic Compressor, and a Flux Compressor. 

I don't know what's harder getting the &6&lStar&r or remembering all the Items you need to make this!

quests.title: &5&lCreative &eSpellbook
desc:
This one might be a bit confusing, there is quite a few &5Creative &eSpellbooks&r! But the one we want is from &d&lAllTheArcanist Gear&r. 

To make this one we need to craft the one from &l&dArs Nouveau&r. That &eSpellbook&r needs an &eArchmage Spellbook&r, &6&lATM Star&r, and a few extra Items. 

It has the same configs as an &eUnobtainium Spellbook&r but has infinite Mana and all Glyphs unlocked! 

All the Spell Power BWAHAHAHAHA!

quests.title: &5&lCreative &dSource &fJar
quests.subtitle: Get this first!
desc:
Currently a pretty simple recipe, only needing 4 &dSource Jars&r, 4 &dSource Gem Blocks&r, and a &6&lStar&r. Don't worry this will be changed to be even harder! 

This jar is always full of &dSource&r and can be linked to anything needing &dSource&r. Including the &6&lATM Star&r multiblocks.

quests.title: &5&lCreative &3Energy Battery
desc:
The easiest infinite Energy storage, only needing 4 &3Energy Batteries&r (from &3&lID&r) and a &6&lStar&r! 

You'll need to energize them all with... well as much Energy as &2&lMinecraft&r can handle... Quite literally the integer limit!

quests.title: &5&lCreative &dEnergy Cell
desc:
This one works like normal infinite energy storage, just this one can connect to your system though! Never have to worry about if your System has enough Power! And that includes the &5Quantum Armor&r. 

You'll need 4 &dSuperdense Cells&r and an &6&lATM Star&r. Each &dSuperdense Cell&r needs 8 &dDense Cells&r, each &dDense Cell&r needs 8 &dEnergy Cells&r. 

256 &dEnergy Cells&r... plus a lotta energy!

quests.title: &5&lCreative &8Locomotive
desc:
Apparently this one didn't have a recipe by default! It's like the Mod Dev didn't want you using your &5Creative&r Locomotives in Survival. 

I didn't think they were too OP so enjoy your &5Trains&r! 

They work like normal &3Locomotives&r just without needing Fuel or Energy! Just need &6Rails&r.

quests.title: &5&lCreative &4Blood Drop
desc:
&lWait!&r Stop the mass genocide of animals it appears that PETA has given a compromise. You stop killing innocent animals and they will give you the &5Creative &4Blood Drop&r! 

With this you can fill any container that needs &4Blood&r infinitely! 

To craft it you'll need 4 &bPromise of Tenacity&r, an &6&lATM Star&r, along with 4 other Items that need to be full of &4Blood&r.

quests.title: &dPatrick &aStar&r... Bee?
desc:
In order to automate &6&lATM Star&r crafting, we'll need &6Star Shards&r. In order to get &6Star Shards&r we'll need &6Starry Bees&r. 

And of course, to get &6Starry Bees&r we'll need &dPatrick &aBees&r! You can rarely get &dPatrick &aBees&r by fishing in Warm Oceans! 
If you don't wish to convert them, you can also farm &dPatrick &aStars&r with them.

quests.title: &6Starry Bee&r!
desc:
By Right Clicking a &dPatrick &aBee&r with an &6&lATM Star Block&r, you'll get a &6Starry Bee&r! 

You'll need another &6&lATM Star Block&r for them to pollinate... I probably should have told you that before... 

The &6Starry Bees&r will make &6Starry Combs&r which can then be used in a Centrifuge to rarely get &6Star Shards&r!

quests.title: &6Star Shards&r
desc:
Now that you got &6Star Shards&r, you can start making the different parts to remake our &6&lStars&r! 

You'll need 262 &6Star Shards&r total to remake 1 &6&lStar&r... hope you've got a good Bee set up!

quests.title: &9Sea Prism
desc:
Honestly just use &2&lMA&r for this one. It is the easiest way to get all of them.
