Please don't make mass &2Turtle&r breeders and mass &bGuardian&r slaughter farms. TPS is important!

quests.title: &7Terrastomp Prism
desc:
This ones a little more expensive but also a little more fun! 

&bDiamonds&r can be gotten through practically any Mod. 

&7Flint&r can be obtained through many different ways of processing Gravel: Squeezing, Crushing, Enriching...? 

Dripstone and Dripstone Blocks (which are just 4 Dripstones) can be created from Extrators or Mixers, both do need original Dripstones to make more though.

quests.title: &fWhirlwind Prism
desc:
This one I'd argue is the easiest to automate. 

Phantom Membranes, Feathers, and Wool can be automated via &b&lHNN&r. 

Only the &7Bat Wing&r is more difficult needing to be farmed via spawners!

quests.title: &cSmelter Prism
desc:
Very simple recipe, only needing &7Coal&r, &cBlaze Powder&r, and an &bArcane Crystal Block&r. 

&7Coal&r and &bArcane Crystal&r can be obtained via Quarries, &6&lBees&r, or &2&lMA&r. 

&cBlaze Powder&r can be gotten from the last two Mods mentioned, or Farms and &b&lHNN&r. There's too many ways of getting &cBlaze Powder&r.

quests.title: &dSoul Binding Crystal
desc:
The &dSoul Binding Crystal&r is the most difficult one to craft. 
&3Ender Pearl Fragments&r can be crafted from &3Ender Pearls&r which can be farmed from &5Endermen&r. You can use an Extractor to get infinite &5Amethyst&r. Quartz can be farmed from &2&lMA&r. 

Now we need to focus on the Souls. To start we need normal Souls! Which we usually use a Soul Extractor on Soul Sand to take the Soul out of it. 

But that's from using an Item, and it changes the Soul Sand... First, we can replace ourselves by using a Clicker from &3&lJust Dire Things&r! 

Now we just need to replace the Souless Sand with Soul Sand, which can be used with Block Breakers and Placers, also from &3&lJust Dire Things&r. 

Now we can combine Souls with &5Corrupti Dust&r and Trapped Souls (farmed Items from &5Lunar Guardian&r) to get Corrupt Souls. 

Finally, combine Souls with Liquid Aureal and the Holy Hand Grenade to make Enchanted Souls. The Holy Hand Grenade is from a line of recipes from &c&lReliquary&r.

quests.title: But why?
desc:
Technically you can also use the Crusher to make the &6&lATM Star&r into 5 &6Star Shards&r... 

But you'll need 262 to make a new &6&lStar&r... 

So why would you?

quests.title: Atomic Reconstructor
desc:
For such a simple recipe you actually get a pretty darn useful Machine! 

Simply place it down, (how you place it changes where it aims like a dispenser!) give it some Power, and set how it works with a &4Redstone Torch&r. 

If it's set to deactivate that means it will deactivate when a &4Redstone Signal&r is sent to it. On Pusle that means it will activate whenever a &4Redstone Signal&r is given to it. 

We are just looking to automate the &6&lStar&r so I won't go too in depth, we'll start with a Lens!

quests.title: Lens of &3Certain Death
desc:
Drop a Lens Item infront of the Atomic Reconstructor and when it activates it'll transform into a Lens of &cC&eo&al&bo&3r&r. 

Drop a Lens of &cC&eo&al&bo&3r&r infront of it, and when it goes it will make a Lens of &cDetonation&r. 

Keep doing this until you get Lens of &3Certain Death&r.

quests.title: Lens of the &4Killer
desc:
Don't worry there's no more dropping at this stage! 

Now we just need to craft! Craft the Lens of &3Certain Death&r, with a &bDiamond Sword&r, and &5Enchanted Book of Sharpness V&r. 

You can get the &5Enchanted Books&r from the &5&lRunic Enchanter&r! Which you can learn more in another Quest!

quests.title: Infused Breath
desc:
The two Items we need via &5&lRunic Enchanter&r is &dInfused Dragon's Breath&r and &5Mending Books&r. 

&dInfused Dragon's Breath&r is pretty simple, just &aFluid XP&r, &dSource&r, and &dDragon's Breath&r! 

&dDragon's Breath&r can be farmed pretty easily with &b&lHNN&r or even better, an Extractor from &l&9X&cy&aC&8r&aa&cf&9t&r. 

&5Mending Books&r can be automated with &aFluid XP&r, &dSource&r, &9Lapis Lazuli&r, &4Supremium Enchanting Base&r, and the hardest part the &aExperience Rod&r. 

&9Lapis&r can be from &2&lMA&r, &6&lBees&r, or even just Quarries. 

&aExperience Rod&r will need two alloys from &a&lEnderIO&r: Soularium and Energetic Alloy. Both can be made from Alloy Smelter. 

The &4Supremium Enchanting Base&r is a new Item made for the &5&lRunic Enchanter&r, you'll need to use tons of &aEXP Essence&r and Tiered Essences to get from a Book and Quill (which can be automated via &b&lHNN&r) to the &4Supremium Enchanting Base&r!

quests.title: Infused &dPatrick &aStar
desc:
In order to remake the &6&lATM Star&r we'll need an Infused &dPatrick &aStar&r, which also needs a &dPatrick &aStar&r for it. Both are made via &6&lRunic Star Altar&r. 

The other items needed to make Infused &dPatrick &aStar&r are the 4 &5Mending Books&r and &dInfused Dragon's Breath&r which are obtained through &5&lRunic Enchanting&r. 

&6Star Shards&r which we get from our Bees! 

And Alloy Ingots: &3Vibranium&f-&6Allthemodium&r, &5Unobtainium&f-&6Allthemodium&r, and &5Unobtainium&f-&3Vibranium&r Ingots. 

All three are crafted in their own unique ways described in the &6&lAllthemodium&r chapter! 

Throw all of these into a &6&lRunic Star Altar&r, plus 85MFE, and we'll get our Infused &dPatrick &aStar&r!

quests.title: &cMundabitur Dust
desc:
1. You'll most likely just loot &dEnd Cities&r for it. 

2. To automate it you'll need to get all the items. 

Bonemeal, &7Gunpowder&r, &4Redstone&r, &cBlaze Powder&r, and Phantom Membrane can all be automated with &b&lHNN&r or &2&lMA&r. 

&bArcane Crystals&r will need either &6&lBees&r or &2&lMA&r for it then smelt it into &bDust&r.

quests.title: &5Corrupti Dust
desc:
Most of the &5Corrupti Dust&r is easily automated. 

&4Nether Wart&r can be made with any auto-farm. &cBlaze Powder&r and &3Enderpearl Fragments&r can be made from &b&lHNN&r. And &bArcane Crystals&r are shown in another Quest. 

Just &5Obsidiansteel&r will need to be automated from the &b&lRunic Crucible&r.

quests.title: &bArcane Crystals
desc:
You can get &cMundabitur Dust&r in many different ways so I'll just give you a quick introduction to &bArcane Crystals&r! 

Which yes are a crafting ingrediant if you want to craft it. 

You'll have to mine for &bArcane Crystals&r first; then, you can use &2&lMA&r or &6&lBees&r to make more!

quests.title: Carbon Dust
desc: Centrifuging &8Coal&r will make &7Carbon Dust&r.

quests.title: Superconductor Ingot
quests.subtitle: Conducting superly
desc: Mixing together &#40B36AYttrium&r, &#DBA146Annealed Copper&r, &#33CC3ANeodymium&r and &#D6D290Iridium&r Dusts will make &#5EDEE0SuperConductor Dust&r. This can be cooked in a &#E3CE54Kanthal EBF&r to be cooled down in the &#4CBBD9Vacuum Freezer&r.

quests.title: Annealed Copper Ingot
desc: Cooking &#ED8C61Copper Dust&r with &#90F0E7Oxygen&r in a &#E3CE54Kanthal EBF&r will give you &#E87848Annealed Copper Hot Ingot&r. This can be cooled down in a &#4CBBD9Vacuum Freezer&r to get &#E87848Annealed Copper Ingot&r. These ingots can be macerated for the &#E87848Annealed Copper Dust&r.

quests.title: Quest 0AE83A6C
desc: Electrolysing a &#3127F5Singularity&r will make &#DA27F5UU Matter&r. In this process, the &#3127F5Singularity&r is &n&aNOT&r consumed.

quests.title: The Gatekeeper and The Gate
desc:
In order to get to the Starlight Dimension you'll need to find Portal Ruins in the Overworld. 

There you will find a Gatekeeper, Right Click to initiate a conversation and challenge them to a duel! Careful, they are very tough. 

Once you win the duel you'll be gifted a few Items, the Orb of Prophecy being one. Right Click the Portal with the Orb to activate it! Then, walk in to get to the...

quests.title: Eternal Starlight
desc:
The Starlight! 

A Dimension where it is constantly Dusk, and no you can't change that. 

There is dozens of Biomes, Mobs, Bosses, and even just Blocks to find! Can you discover them all?

quests.title: Cursed Garden
desc:
Let's see how do I describe the Cursed Garden... it's a big freakin' maze! 

There's entrances on each side and you must find your way to the middle where the Lunar Monstrosity is! 

All around the maze you can find chests full of Loot and Tangled!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_maze.png width:150 height:150 align:center}

quests.title: Golem Forge
desc:
Using your Seeking Eyes you might become confused why they've suddenly gone underground. That's probably because the Golem Forge is deep underground, like in the negative Y levels. 

There's many winding rooms each full of Loot, Lava, and Freezes! The room we are looking for holds the Starlight Golem!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_golemforge.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Crystallized Desert
desc:
Crystallized Desert looks like a normal Desert but shaded Purple. 

Also with added giant crystals, I don't think normal Deserts have that...
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_desert.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Blue Starlight Crystal Block
desc:
Starlight Crystals can be found all over and even under the Crystallized Deserts. 

They work similar to Amethyst and even sound like it!

quests.title: Dead Lunar Log
desc:
There is Trees in the Desert! 

No, wait, there was Trees...

quests.title: Lunaris Cactus
desc:
It is a Desert of course there's Cacti! 

The Cacti when fully grown can grow Fruit on top of them!

quests.title: Dark Swamp
desc:
Dark Swamps litter the world of the Starlight. 

Here you can find plenty of plants, animals, and of course Mud.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_swamp.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Starlight Mangrove Sapling
desc: Like normal Mangrove but these aren't ugly.

quests.title: Nightfall Mud
desc:
Nightfall Mud can only be found within the Dark Swamps. 

You can make more Blocks out of it!

quests.title: Lunar Reed
desc:
It's just a neat plant. 

You'll need a Swamp Silver Sickle to collect it! 

I don't know why I've never cared about plants but Reeds are cool to me. Maybe it's the being by Water, or Cattails looking like Corndogs. I don't know but I like them.

quests.title: Ether River
desc:
Ether River is something you'll know when you see it. 

It's bright, very bright and might appear red in your Map, that's a bug ignore that.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_ether.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Thioquartz Block
desc:
When Ether touches Water Thioquartz will form. This can happen naturally with random generation or you can make it happen! 

These aren't how we get Shards though, those are from Budding Thioquartz!

quests.title: Ether Bucket
desc:
All living things will die in Ether as if it were Lava. Funny enough you can put it in a Bucket though! 

The only way to get it is finding it in the Ether River. 

When Water touches Ether it will form Thioquartz Blocks!

quests.title: Scarlet Forest
desc:
IT'S PINK! 

Here you will find Scarlet Trees with their dropped leaves piled below them. You can also find Glowing Mushrooms here!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_scarlet.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Scarlet Sapling
desc:
Scarlet Trees range in size and shape and even sometimes fallen down! 

But all have pink leaves! Including the ones on the ground.

quests.title: Shimmer River
desc:
Shimmer Rivers are friendly rivers. These won't go out of their way to kill you. 

They sometimes connect Seas together and go through Forests. 

Clearly they have Water but within the Water is plenty of goods!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_river.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Moonlight Lily Pad
desc: There's plenty of plant life on top of the Shimmer River, some you can stand on!

quests.title: Abyssal Fruit
desc:
Abyssal Fruit technically can spawn in any body of water but its the only one that lives within the Shimmer Rivers. 

It grows like Kelp from the floor up, but also works like Glowberries as in Fruit grows and can be collected from it.

quests.title: Dense Starlight Forest
desc: Just like the normal Starlight Forest just with much less spacing within Trees!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_dense.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Lunar Sapling
desc:
Lunar Trees can range from massive towering Trees, to itty bitty ones. They adapt to take as much room as they can! (That would explain Dense Forests). 

They plant like normal Saplings and can have Lunar Berries spawn from their leaves!

quests.title: Lunar Berries
desc:
The Lunar Berries are an excellent Food Source, plus very easy to get! 

They spawn growing down from Lunar Tree Leaves, you can pluck the Berries off the Vines like Glow Berries. 
Just these give much more Food Points and Saturation!

quests.title: Starlight Forest
desc:
A Forest as blue as the Ocean. 

The Starlight Forest is by far the most common biome in the Starlight. 

It has dozens of Lunar Trees covering it entirely with plenty of Mobs, passive and hostile, below it.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_forest.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Permafrost Forest
desc:
Highest points in the Starlight is the Permafrost Forests which lie upon Mountains. 

Being so far up makes them much colder making them covered in Snow and Ice! 

Atleast the friendly Mobs seem to enjoy the Cold!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_permafrost.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Northland Sapling
desc:
The Northland Trees are big sturdy Trees up in the Permafrost Forests. 

They look like Spruce but much lighter! Maybe they're an albino Spruce. 

Their saplings need to be placed on Dirt, not Grass, and in a 2x2 formation.

quests.title: The Abyss
desc:
The Abyss are deep trenches within Starlit Seas. These going as far down as -50! 

They have multiple colored layers of Stone lining them and hold many different Blocks, Mosses, and Fish!

quests.title: Cryobyssal Magma Block
desc:
Magma and Geysers both spawn on the bottom of The Abyss. 

Magma will help you get down below and help keep your breath. 

Geysers just look cool!

quests.title: Velvetumoss
desc:
Velvetumoss spawns within The Abyss. 

You can mine green ones to get Velvetumoss Balls which can either be eaten or made into a Slimeball! 

The Red ones will spawn pretty plants!

quests.title: Torreya Forest
desc: A bright and beautiful Forest, full of Torreya Trees and Vines.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_torreya.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Torreya Sapling
desc:
Torreya Trees are huge purple/pink Trees that stand around 40 Blocks tall. 

The leaves will sprout out in every direction and the Torreya Vines hang from them.

quests.title: Torreya Vines
desc:
Torreya Vines are found hanging from Torreya Trees. 

They are hanging because they can't be placed any other way... 

The bulb at the bottom of them will emit Light!

quests.title: Glowing Mushroom
desc:
Glowing Mushrooms are huge Mushroom plants you can find in the Scarlet Forests! 

They function just like Brown or Red Mushrooms just these ones Glow much brighter! 

(If you didn't know Brown and Red Mushrooms actually emit a Light Source level of 1).

quests.title: Warm Shore
desc:
The Warm Shore is a pretty boring Biome and is mostly for connecting the Starlit Sea and land. 

It has Twilight Sand with Stone beneath it. I also found, more than usual, Saltpeter here.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_shore.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Saltpeter Powder
desc:
Saltpeter can be found anywhere Underground but very common in the Warm Shore Biome. 

It needs a Stone Pickaxe to mine it and when mined it will drop a couple Saltpeter Powder. Yes, Fortune works on it! 

The Powder can be used as a replacement for other Niters.

quests.title: Starlit Sea
desc:
Starlit Seas are huge bodies of Water sitting neatly between the Warm Shores and land. 

They hold many wonders within them and growing in them! 

Hope you brought your goggles!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_starlitsea.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Dead Tentacles Coral Block
desc:
The Starlit Seas spawn their own versions of Coral! 

Just don't be like me and forget Silk Touch to pick them up...

quests.title: Orbflora Light
desc:
Orbflora are plants that grow from the Sea floor. 

They can be harvested anytime but if you want the Orbflora Lights you'll need to wait! 

When they grow to the Sea Level they will flower. After flowering they will grow the Light!

quests.title: Dusted Gravel
desc:
Lining the Sea floor is Dusted Gravel. 

It can be used as a replacement for normal Gravel and can rarely drop Dusted Shards which can make other Blocks!

quests.title: Jingling Pickle
desc: It has a funny name!

quests.title: Lunar Monstrosity
desc:
The Lunar Monstrosity has 200 Hearts and will only take 1 damage from each hit unless you use Fire. 

It has a few attacks including Ground Spikes, Projectiles, and Exploding Tangled Heads! 

When you kill it, it will drop Arrows, Ingots, Tangled Skulls, Tenacious Petals, Trapped Souls, and a chance at a rare Weapon!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_lunar.png width:100 height:125 align:center}

quests.title: Starlight Golem
desc:
The Starlight Golem has 220 Hearts and 2 Modes. 

1st mode is his attack mode, here he can't be damaged instead you'll have to wait for his attacks to go before hitting him. He attacks with Fireballs, Ground Pound, or a devastating Laser Beam! 

His 2nd mode is his charging mode; in this one he'll begin taking power from the Energy Blocks which will need to be turned off in order to damage him. 

On death he will drop plenty of Ingots and Arrows, Golem Steel, Forge Armor Trim, and maybe even the Energy Sword!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_golem.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Twilight Gaze
desc:
Twilight Gaze are a neutral Fish located in The Abyss. 

If you hit one, all will attack you, similar to Wolves or Zombified Piglins. If you get too far from The Abyss they will stop following you and swim back to the depths. 

They don't drop anything on death so maybe don't hit them...
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_gaze.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Nightfall Spiders
desc:
Nightfall Spiders, like Lonestar Skeletons, are Hostile and spawn anywhere. 

They have 5 Hearts and attack by hitting you. After hitting you they will give you the Glowing effect for a few seconds. 

On death they will drop String and their eyes!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_spider.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Finding the Bosses
desc:
The Bosses in the Starlight live in their structures. These aren't common (thankfully) so you might need assistance aka the Seeking Eyes. 

Seaking Eyes work like Ender Eyes, Right Click with them to throw them and follow them to get to the structures. 

To set the structure you'll need a certain Item in your Offhand, items like...

quests.title: Shimmer Lacewing
desc:
Shimmer Lacewings don't do or drop anything, they just add atmosphere. 

They also resemble the only bug I tolerate!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_shimmer.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Yetis
desc:
The Yeti is a name that strikes fear into all those who explore the Cold! An abominable furry creature that lives in the harshest coldest climate eating anything that dare venture there! 

Well not this Yeti, these ones are cute and friendly! They'd rather roll around than eat you. 

Heck they don't even fight back and only have 10 Hearts. 

On death they will drop their Fur and String, the former which can be used as a replacement for Wool.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_yeti.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Aurora Deer
desc:
Aurora Deers are friendly hooved animals who also live in the cold. 

These Deers won't try to harm you but if you get in their way when you run you might feel some Antlers. 

Antlers which can also be dropped by them on death which can be used as either a weapon or a hoe! 

They might also drop Leather or Aurora Deer Steak.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_deer.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Glacite Shard
desc:
Glacite can be found deep underground in the Permafrost Forests. 

It can be used to craft Armor and Tools which help against Freezing damage!

quests.title: Raw Amaramber
desc:
Amaraber is found rarely by stripping Torreya Logs. 

It can be crafted into Ingots to make Armor and Tools or used in other recipes like a campfire which will you give you regen!

quests.title: Swamp Silver Ingot
desc:
Swamp Silver can be rarely found within the Nightfall Mud. 

It can be used to craft Armor and Tools!

quests.title: Ratlins
desc:
Ratlins are peaceful Mobs that can spawn on the Surface. 

On death they will drop Ratlin Meat, Leather, and Cave Moss. 

The latter which can be used to Breed them together!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_rat.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Ents
desc:
Ents are another peaceful Mob spawning on the Surface of the Starlight. These spawning in the forests! 

These little trees can drop Sticks, Lunar Berries, and Lunar Leaves on death. 

You can use Lunar Berries to Breed them!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_ent.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Thermal Springstone Ingot
desc:
Around the Starlight you might find Hot Ponds. 

(These aren't a biome or structure so you'll need to just look around to find them!) 

Within them you can find Thermal Springstone.

quests.title: Aethersent Ingot
desc:
Very rarely in the Starlight Dimension a Meteor Shower might occur. 

Most times the Meteors are tiny and disappear before hitting the ground. 

But some are bigger and survive, there you will find Aethersent Ore!

quests.title: Atalphaite
desc:
Atalphaite Ore can be found when Mining anywhere underground in the Starlight. 

It can't be made into Tools or Armor but it can make different types of Lights!

quests.title: Lonestar Skeletons
desc:
Lonestar Skeletons are hostile Mobs that can spawn anywhere. 

They have 10 Hearts and will throw their Sword at you to attack you. 

On death they can drop Bones, Swamp Silver Nuggets, Shattered Swords, and the drops added by Corail for Undead Mobs.

quests.title: Stellagmite
desc:
Stellagmite can be found underground in the Starlight. 

It works as a normal Stone being able to be made into other Blocks. 

Its Molten version works as a normal Magma Block!

quests.title: Thirst Walker
desc:
Thirst Walkers are neutral Mobs that spawn on the surface of the Crystallized Deserts. 

When aggro-ed they will hit you and give you Hunger. 

They have 20 Hearts and can drop Tooth of Hunger on death.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_thirst.png width:100 height:125 align:center}

quests.title: Crystal Crossbow
desc:
The Crystal Crossbow is a crafted like a Mechanical Crossbow just with Crystals instead of sticks. 

It shoots Arrows and does same damage as a normal Crossbow but this one gives Crystal Infection. Crystal Infection does 1 damage every second with the Crystals that spawn on them! And yes it will kill them.

quests.title: Mechanical Crossbow
desc:
The Mechanical Crossbow is made like a normal Crossbow just with Golem Steel. 

It works like a normal Crossbow just much stronger! And can be enchanted to do even more!

quests.title: Crescent Spear
desc:
To get the Cresant Spear you will need to either craft it from Items dropped by the Lunar Monstrosity and the Tangled Hatred, or have it dropped from the Lunar Monstrosity. (You'll have to kill him regardless basically). 

You can use the Spear like a Trident and just smack Mobs or you can hold Right Click to be sent flying forward with it. If you hit any Mobs with the second attack, any Mobs nearby will also take damage.

quests.title: Moonring Bow
desc:
The Moonring Bow can only drop from the Lunar Monstrosity. 

It shoots Arrows like a normal Bow but Ground Spikes will come the same direction the Arrow went!

quests.title: Wand Of Teleportation
desc:
Wand of Teleportation is another drop from the Lunar Monstrosity, and only that! 

You can hold Right Click with the Wand to start it, then when you release it will teleport you to the Block you were looking at last! 

There is a range but it's pretty far. And there is a cooldown after use!

quests.title: Chain Of Souls
desc:
The Chain of Souls can only be crafted from drops by the Tangled Hatred and Lunar Monstrosity. 

It's a grappling hook! Tap Right Click to send it and once it hits something it will start reeling you in. Then, you have to Right Click again to detach it. 

Also needed for the ATM Star!

quests.title: Moonring Greatsword
desc:
The Moonring Greatsword needs to be crafted from drops by both Bosses! Obviously making it the hardest to get and the most powerful! 

It works like a normal Sword, just before 1.9. It can block attacks like a shield, but it can't be spammed for full damage.

quests.title: Energy Sword
desc:
The Energy Sword can only be dropped from the Starlight Golem. 

It works like a normal Sword but with Right Click you can dash at them while swinging it, like Genji from Overwatch!

quests.title: Shattered Sword
desc:
Shattered Swords can either be dropped from Lonestar Skeletons or crafted using the dropped Blades. 

The Shattered Sword is used more like a Trident than a Sword, instead of hitting you'll throw it. Then, you can Right Click to bring back the Blade like a Loyalty Trident, and Right Click again to reload it if needed.

quests.title: Dagger Of Hunger
desc:
The Dagger of Hunger is made with the Teeth of Hunger. No, I am not saying Tooths. 

The Dagger has a Hunger Value. When you hit Mobs it will go up, when it's inactive it will decrease. When it gets to 100% you'll get boosts. And if it goes to 0% it will start killing you. 

When you hit Mobs (or Players) it will also give the Hunger effect. 

I don't blame it, I get angry when hungry too.

quests.title: Tangled Skull
desc:
Tangled Skulls can be dropped from... well Tangled Skulls. 

They can be used as a projectile like a Wither Head thrown from a Wither. 

It will be used up when you do that though.

quests.title: Orb Of Prophecy
desc:
The Orb of Prophecy can be crafted or obtained through beating the Gatekeeper! 

It's main use is activating the Portal, but there will be more uses for it!

quests.title: Golem Items
desc:
Redstone, Golem Steel, and Oxidized Golem Steel are Items used for finding the Golem Forge. 

Hold one of these (most likely Redstone which does spawn in the Starlight underground) in your Offhand and use the Seeking Eye to find the Golem Forge which btw is underground!

quests.title: Monstrosity Items
desc:
Vines, Red and Blue Crystal Moss Carpets, Lunar Berries, Cave Moss, and Red and Blue Crystal Roots. 

These can be used in your Offhand with the Seeking Eye to find the Cursed Garden.

quests.title: Tangled
desc:
Tangled are enemies that spawn within the Cursed Garden. 

They have 10 Hearts and will attack by smacking you. If you get hit, you'll get a small amount of poison. 

On death they will drop Vines and Bones but also will spawn a Tangled Skull! 

Tangled Skulls act similar to Vexes, they will fly around through blocks and hit you. They only have 5 Hearts and on death will give you them as an Item.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_tangled.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Freeze
desc:
Freezes work similar to Blazes, they'll fly up and shoot a ball at you. 

Just Freezes only throw 1 ball and it will make you cold instead of warm. 

They have 16 Hearts and will drop Frozen Tubes on death.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_freeze.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Saltpeter Matchbox
desc: Works like Flint and Steel!

quests.title: Aurora Deer Antler
desc:
Aurora Deer Antlers are dropped by Aurora Deers on death. 

It can be used as a Sword or a Hoe.

quests.title: Powering down
desc:
In order to damage the Golem you'll need to turn off his power supply! 

To do so you'll need to Right Click the Energy Blocks when they turn blue. 

You can usually find 2 in the corners of the boss room and 2 above him!

quests.title: Crystallized Moth
desc:
Crystallized Moths spawn deep below the Crystallized Deserts. 

They are neutral and I recommend not hitting them because they do a ton of damage! 

They also have 10 Hearts and can drop Starlight Crystals or Shivering Gel on death.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_moth.png width:125 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Sonar Bomb
desc:
Sonar Bombs are made with Shivering Gel which is dropped from Crystallized Moths. 

They can be thrown to damage any Mob (and Player) in a huge area! It will also shake the players screen and play a loud sound effect. 

It is disorienting so only use it on your friends!

quests.title: Gleech
desc:
Gleeches are tiny little mobs that spawn in the Crystallized Desert. 

They relentlessly want your blood and that means even through violent ways. Thankfully they only have 4 Hearts! 

On death they might drop their Eggs which can be thrown as a projectile.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_gleech.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Burn it!
desc:
In order to kill the Lunar Monstrosity you'll need to set it on Fire! 

You can use Flint and Steel or a Saltpeter Matchbox. 

Personally I think the Matchbox is more fitting!

quests.title: Frozen Tube
desc:
Frozen Tubes are dropped from Freezes in the Golem Forge. 

They can be thrown like Potions to hurt whoever it hits.

quests.title: Soulit Spectator
desc:
The Soulit Spectator is crafted with a Trapped Soul and a Nightfal Spider Eye. 

It works similar to a Sticky Camera from Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell. You can Right Click to send the Spectator and after a bit you will be able to see out of it. You can even see yourself with it! 

It can't be ended early so careful when you use it. It also has durability and a cooldown.

quests.title: Luminaris
desc: Acts exactly like a Luminofish just these have a horn on their head!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_fish2.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Luminofish
desc:
The Luminofish is a glowing fish that lives within The Abyss.

They act just like normal Fish. You can fish for them, put them in a Bucket, you can even cook them!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/eternal/starlight_fish1.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Quest 03422483
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &6&lForbidden \& Arcanus
desc:
Welcome to &6&lForbidden \& Arcanus&r! 

To start this Mod we'll need to start Mining underground... deep underground. 

Like Y Level 1 and below.

quests.title: &bArcane Crystals
desc:
&bArcane Crystals&r can spawn from Y Level 14 to -40. 

It is fairly common; but trust me, you'll need a lot of it, so be thankful! 

Like &bDiamonds&r there is a Y Level that it spawns most common at, for &bArcane Crystals&r that Y Level is -13.

quests.title: &9Darkstone
desc:
&9Darkstone&r appears deep underground near Lava Lakes, like at Y Level -54. 

It is the most used Block for &6&lForbidden \& Arcanus&r, all Multiblocks will use them for their base. 
Make sure to grab a ton of them!

quests.title: &7Runes
quests.subtitle: These used to be &5Purple&r!
desc:
&7Runes&r can spawn from Bedrock to Y Level 2. That includes near &9Darkstone&r! 

They're more useful than &2Stellarite&r but less useful than &bArcane Crystals&r.

quests.title: &2Stellarite Pieces
desc:
&2Stellarite&r spawns between Y Level 42 and -44. 

You'd think, with having such a huge radius it'll be easy to find! It isn't, it is very rare! 

Be careful when Mining it though, when broken it will EXPLODE!

quests.title: &cMundabitur Dust
desc:
For a few Mob Drops plus &bArcane Crystal Dust&r you can make &cMundabitur Dust&r! 

This is a very important part in crafting and making of Multiblocks! 

And you can find it in &dEnd Cities&r which most just end up doing...

quests.title: &6Deorum
desc:
Combining &cMundabitur Dust&r, &bArcane Crystal Dust&r, &8Charcoal&r, and a &eGold Ingot&r we'll get our first Alloy! The &6Deorum Ingot&r! 

This is the foundational Ingot of &6&lForbidden \& Arcanus&r, you will need dozens of it! 

It is especially used for Building Blocks for our Multiblock Machines.

quests.title: &bArcane Crystal Dust
desc:
&bArcane Crystal Dust&r is pretty simple, just Smelt &bArcane Crystals&r and boom! 

You can also use the Clibano Multiblock in order to get a few bits of &bArcane Crystals&r back!

quests.title: Building the &6&lForge
desc: {image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_forge1.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
To start making your Forge, place down our &9Polished Darkstone&r, &6Arcane Polished Darkstone&r, and &6Gilded Chiseled Polished Darkstone&r in this pattern.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_forge2.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

"Next place our Smithing Table on the inner &6Gilded Chiseled Polished Darkstone&r and smack it with &cMundabitur Dust&r, you'll get the &6&lHephaestus Forge&r!

Lastly place our &6Darkstone Pedestals&r on top of the 8 outside &6Gilded Chiseled Polished Darkstone&r!"

quests.title: &bAureal
desc:
&bAureal&r is the first and most important Slot in the &6&lForge&r. 

You can either automate it with &bArcane Crystal Obelisks&r or deposit &bAureal Bottles&f/&bPotions&r! 

You can either find &bAureal Bottles&r in Chests in most Structures, or you can craft them with &bArcane Crystal Dust&r and a Potion of Regeneration II.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_aureal.png width:135 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Souls
desc:
Souls is the 2nd Slot needed for the &6&lForge&r, also the smallest one: only needing 10 to fill it! 

Each Soul and Corrupt Soul will count as 1 Soul. While Enchanted Souls count as the whole 10!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_souls.png width:135 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &4Blood
desc:
&4Blood&r is the 3rd Slot needing filling in the &6&lForge&r. 

You can either kill Mobs on/near the &6&lForge&r in order to add &4Blood&r. 

Or you can deposit filled Test Tubes to put that &4Blood&r into the &6&lForge&r. 

To fill a Test Tube, have it in your Offhand when killing Mobs.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_blood.png width:135 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &aExperience
desc:
&aExperience&r is the 4th Slot and material needed for the &6&lForge&r. 

To add in &aExperience&r you'll need to put 1 of 3 things into the &aExperience Slot&r. 

1. &aXpetrified Orbs&r, these give the most &aEXP&r. 

2. &aBottle 'O Enchanting&r, gives a little bit of &aEXP&r but easy to get! 

3. &5Enchanted Item&r, the &6&lForge&r will scrap the &5Enchantments&r off of it keeping it as &aEXP&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_experience.png width:135 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &l&cTier 1 &6Forge
desc:
The &6&lForge&r is the most important Block in &6&lForbidden \& Arcanus&r! Now that you made the Multiblock you can break the &6&lForge&r block and move it, even though it only works while on the Mutliblock. 

You'll need to fill it with all 4 Essences: &bAureal&r, Souls, &4Blood&r, and &aExperience&r! 

Then, put in Relics if necessary. 

After that, put the center Item in the Recipe, in the middle Slot of the &6&lForge&r, and the outer Items on the &6Pedestals&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_gui.png width:135 height:100 align:center}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_tier3.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &l&3Tier 2 &6Forge
desc:
&c&lTier 1&r not enough for you? Then, you'll need to upgrade it! 

Put an Edelwood Plank in the center Slot of the &6&lForge&r and place 4 &bArcane Crystals&r and 4 Spawner Scrap onto the Pedestals. 

Smack it with a Gavel and your &c&lTier 1&r will upgrade into a &3&lTier 2 &6Forge&r! 

Now, new Rituals will be available, the &6&lForge&r can hold more Essences, and you can use a second Relics!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_tier1.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Ferrognetic Mixture
desc:
Pretty simple recipe needing Clay, Iron, Slimeballs, and more... 

Lodestones are best to loot for, Mods add these in Loot Pools all over &c&lThe Nether&r so don't craft one just find one! 

Wax is a new Item added by &6&lForbidden \& Arcanus&r which is a mix of Bottle of Honey and Slimeballs! 

You can use it on a &6Darkstone Pedestal&r to get &7Magnetized Pedestals&r which work in hand with Hoppers (and Hopper like Items like Pipes). 

You can also use it with Boots to increase how close Items can be to get dragged into your Inventory!

quests.title: &cSmelter Prism
desc:
&cSmelter Prism&r is probably the most used Item from these Rituals, like how it is needed for the &6&lATM Star&r! 

You'll need 4 &cBlaze Powder&r, 2 &8Coal&r, and a block of &bArcane Crystal&r to make it. And don't forget the &3Elementarium&r Relic! 
Obviously and what you are most likely wanting the &cSmelter Prism&r for is the &6&lATM Star&r. It can also be used with Tools to Smelt the Items that they break: Raw Ore to Ingots, Logs to Charcoal, Sand to Glass. 

You can also use it for Furnace Fuel, but it kinda sucks. Which is dumb because the name suggests it would be better!

quests.title: Quantum Catcher
desc:
The Quantum Catcher is a very useful Tool for moving Mobs. 

Simply Right Click a Mob to "catch" them, then Right Click again to let them go. 

You'll need a set amount of &bAureal&r on you in order to use it though, this is dependent on the Health of the Mob. More Health, more &bAureal&r needed! It won't cost anything to let Mobs go though, that's free. 

Oh wait, I probably should tell you how to Craft it! You'll need a &7Quantum Core&r which is crafted with &7Runes&r, &cMundabitur Dust&r, and &8Flint&r! 

The Spawner Scraps are drops from Mining a Spawner without Silk Touch, so it'll break the Spawner.

quests.title: &7Terrastomp Prism
desc:
The only recipe which needs &3&lTier 2&r, the &7Terrastomp Prism&r! 

You'll need &7Dripstone&r, &7Dripstone&r, and &8Flint&r along with a &bDiamond Block&r! 

Like the other Prisms this will need &3Elementarium&r Relic in order to be made. 
Like the &cFiery Prism&r, the &7Terrastomp Prism&r can be used with Tools. These Tools will be able to mine in a 3x3 Area, instead of only 1 Block Mined it'll mine 9!

quests.title: &e&lTier 3 &6Forge
desc:
This is where it gets fun! 

Use 4 &6Deorum&r Ingots, 4 &bArcane Crystals&r, and a &9Chiseled Polished Darkstone&r to upgrade from &3&lTier 2&r to &e&lTier 3&r. 

Now we can hold even more Essences, even more Relics, and even more Recipes!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_tier2.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &9Sea Prism
desc:
This one is probably one of the most annoying to craft, it needs &bPrismarine&r, &2Turtle Scute&r, &9Lapis&r, and a &3Heart of the Sea&r. 

Hope you like &2&lMA&r! 

It combines with Helmets... most likely to give Respiration or Aqua Affinity, but I can't get it to work...

quests.title: &aEternal Stella
desc:
The poster child of &6&lForbidden \& Arcanus&r, the &aEternal Stella&r. 

For 1 &6Allthemodium&r Ingot, 3 &aXpetrified Orbs&r, and a &2Stellarite Piece&r we can make one of the most overpowered Items in this Modpack! 

You can use the &aEternal Stella&r with an Item and an Apply Item Modifier to make Items lose their Durability. No, wait I mean lose their need for Durability! Basically Indestructible Items. 

This can be used on almost every Item with Durability from &bDiamond Axes&r, to Fishing Rods, to even &eRefined Glowstone Armor&r! 

There are some limitations, it only works with Items with Durability not uses: like Infusion Crystals or Energy: like Meka-Tool!

quests.title: &7Quantum Injector&r
desc:
4 &7Quantum Cores&r and a &cMundabitur Dust&r and you can get the &7Quantum Injector&r. 

&7Quantum Injectors&r aren't used much at this stage but will be needed later!

quests.title: Whirlwind Prism
desc:
Honestly the only difficult part of this recipe is the Bat Wing, how many times are you killing Bats let alone Farming them? 

This one is pretty new and doesn't combine with Armor, it is only used for the end game!

quests.title: &l&dTier 4 &6Forge
desc:
This one needs another &9Chiseled Polished Darkstone&r, just now with 4 &7Runes&r and 4 &2Stellarite&r Pieces. 

This &6&lForge&r is the last for the basic &6&lForbidden \& Arcanus&r. 

Of course it has the rest of the Recipes plus every space for Relics is open now!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_tier4.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Boss Catcher
desc:
Don't you hate those stupid limitations on your Quantum Catcher? Can't put Wardens in your friends base! 

Well now there is no worries for we can upgrade our Quantum Catcher with 3 &2Stellarite Pieces&r and a Nether Star to make the Boss Catcher. 

Now we can transport our Bosses wherever we want!

quests.title: &dSoul Binding Crystal
desc:
The last of the Prisms, well this one's a &dCrystal&r but you get the idea! 

First, you'll need a &eDivine Pact&r Relic, which are found in &b&lThe Other&r. 

Then, you'll need &3Enderpearl Fragments&r, &5Amethyst&r, and Nether Quartz. Don't worry it gets harder! 

Now we'll need every type of Soul. I taught you how to get Souls and &9Corrupt Souls&r in other Quests now I'll teach you about &dEnchanted Souls&r. 

Find a Lost Soul flying around in your world, then toss a &bSplash Potion of Aureal&r at them! Then, they'll become a &dLost Enchanted Soul&r, kill them! 

With that you can now make the &dCrystal&r, which can be applied to Tools and Armor to give it Soulbound. This means when you die, you'll respawn with these Items in your Inventory still.

quests.title: &l&9Tier 5 &6Forge
desc:
The last most powerful &6&lForge&r so of course that means it is the most expensive! 

You'll need 2 &5Dark Nether Stars&r which are made from combining 4 &5Obsidiansteel&r and a Nether Star. 

2 &dDragon Scales&r which are dropped when the &dEnder Dragon&r on death. 

4 &3Sculk Catalysts&r which are dropped from the &3Warden&r, or can be Silk-Touched in the Deep Dark. 

And &2Stellarite Block&r which are just 9 &2Stellarite Pieces&r! 

This allows even more Essences and End Game Recipes.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_tier5.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &3Elementarium
desc:
Prisms are important for many of &6&lForbidden \& Arcanus&r recipes and other Mods later! 

In order to craft them we'll need &3Elementarium&r, which is found in Jungle Temples, Desert Pyramids, and Underwater Ruins. 

I think it would be easier to tell us where you can't find it!

quests.title: &eDivine Pact
desc:
&eDivine Pact&r is the most difficult to obtain, you'll need to search Piglin Villages and Ancient Pyramids in &b&lThe Other&r to find them! 

It's used to craft the Soul Binding Crystal and the End Game Multiblocks!

quests.title: &bArcane Crystal Obelisk
desc:
You want to slowly automate &bAureal&r for your &6&lForge&r? Then, you'll need 2 &bArcane Crystal Blocks&r, &6Arcane Polished Darkstone&r, and &cMundabitur Dust&r! 

Place down the &6Arcane Polished Darkstone&r, then on top of it place both &bArcane Crystal Blocks&r. 

Once you get this 1x3x1 Structure, Right Click it with &cMundabitur Dust&r to make the &bObelisk&r! 

You can place these, where the Pedestals usually go, in the &6&lForge Multiblock&r in order to automate &bAureal&r!

quests.title: Soul Extractor
desc:
The best way of getting Souls is via the Soul Extractor! 

For a few Nether Items and Blocks and an Utrem Jar (which does need Edelwood to craft) you can get your tool to Soul-Finding! 

Hold Right Click with it on Soul Sand and it'll extract the Souls from it. 

Leaving it as Sand... no wait it is Soulless Sand... what the heck is Soulless Sand?!?!?!

quests.title: &8Black Hole
desc:
&8Dark Matter&r is created by Smelting Edelwood. 

&5Corrupti Dust&r is made with &5Obsidiansteel&r and some Mob Drops. 

Throw both these on the ground together and a &8Black Hole&r will spawn! 

The &8Black Hole&r will void every Item or Projectile that comes near, but what we want to feed it is &aExperience&r! 

When you feed it enough &aEXP&r it will give back an &aXpetrified Orb&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_blackhole.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &b&lClibano
desc: The &b&lClibano&r is a new Multiblock which acts sort of like a Jumbo Furnace! To make it follow these steps!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_clibano1.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
First layer is a 3x3 Area, with the corners made of &9Polished Darkstone&r and the rest filled with &9Polished Darkstone Bricks&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_clibano2.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
The second layer uses only &9Polished Darkstone Bricks&r and the &bClibano Core&r. Remember to keep the middle Block empty!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_clibano3.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
The final layer is just like the first... just above the other two layers!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_clibano4.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
Finally Right Click the Multiblock with &cMundabitur Dust&r to finish it!

quests.title: &6Artisan Relic
desc:
The &6Artisan Relic&r is found within a few Buildings in Villages. 

When used in the &l&bClibano&r it will allow you to make &5Obsidiansteel&r. 

When used in &6&lForges&r it will give you a discount on &aExperience&r used!

quests.title: &5Obsidiansteel&r
desc:
An Alloy added by &6&lForbidden \& Arcanus&r is &5Obsidiansteel&r. 

It's created in the &l&bClibano&r, by combining Raw Iron and &5Obsidian&r. 

You'll need an Artisan Relic in order to actually make the Alloy! 

Also you'll get &6Copper&r as residue, which probably isn't supposed to happen...

quests.title: Finishing the Ritual
desc:
We got our Items on Pedestals, we got our &bAureal&r, Souls, &4Blood&r, and &aExperience&r... and it isn't finishing? Why isn't it finishing? 

In order to actually finalize the Ritual we'll need to use a Gavel! 

It works like a Pickaxe but it also has a limited amount of uses for finishing Rituals, just Right Click the &6&lForge&r with it!

quests.title: &5Obsidian Skull
desc:
The &5Obsidian Skull&r is a Helmet that when worn can protect you from Fire/Lava damage! 

Overtime it will wear down to which you'll need to repair it with &5Obsidiansteel&r. 

That is also how you craft it, a Skeleton Skull with 8 &5Obsidiansteel&r.

quests.title: Edelwood Log
desc:
Don't be afraid, this isn't an oogly boogly, it's a fully grown Edelwood! 

The Tree will have a Carved Edelwood Log on top and Edelwood Branches coming from it, these can be broken for Edelwood Sticks. 

The Logs are hollow on the inside, similar space as a Cauldron. Funny enough it can also hold Water like a Cauldron!

quests.title: Edelwood Bucket
desc:
Ever want a "better Bucket"? Well you can with the Edelwood Bucket! 

For just a few Edelwood Planks you can get a better Bucket, which can hold 4 Buckets of Water or Milk. 

You can also hold 3 Buckets of Lava! It weighs more so you can only hold 3 instead of 4.

quests.title: &6Spectral &4Eye &7Amulet
quests.subtitle: Very popular in ATM6!
desc:
Quite expensive recipe but most definitely worth it! 

Using the &6Spectral &4Eye&r will give you the &4Spectral Vision Effect&r. This Effect gives &eGlowing&r to every Mob within a 100 Block radius in every direction! 

Perfect for finding structures underground, or Bastions in the &c&lNether&r, or even finding your friends hidden Axolotl farm!

quests.title: &5Soul Looting Enchantment
desc:
In order to get our &9Corrupt Souls&r we'll need to do some &5Enchanting&r! 

We are looking for the &5Soul Looting Enchantment&r. It goes on Weapons, and everytime you kill a Mob it has a chance to spawn a &9Corrupt Soul&r. 

These can then be killed to get them as Items. Try to do it quickly as they like to fly away. 

Maybe they know you want to kill them?

quests.title: &9Corrupt Souls
desc:
&9Corrupt Souls&r are used for 2 things! 

1. Crafting recipe with the &l&dTier 4 &6Forge&r, which we don't need to worry about right now. 

2. Growing Edelwood! 

Growing Edelwood acts as the Sapling for Edelwood, these are the only way of getting Edelwood now.

quests.title: Buying Edelwood
quests.subtitle: From Wandy T'
desc:
If you'd rather not use &9Corrupt Souls&r to grow Edelwood, you can rest on Luck! 

The Wandering Trader has a chance of selling Growing Edelwood to you, which can be planted to grow Edelwood. 

Wandering Trader is very random though, try using Trader Carpets to atleast know where he'll spawn!

quests.title: Lost Souls
desc:
&c&lNether&r too scary for you? Then, you can look for Souls in the &2&lOverworld&r!

Within your World (I made you go to Dark Forests because old &l&6Forbidden \& Arcanus&r used to have Blocks there) you might find some Lost Souls wandering around.

You can kill them for the Souls that they drop! It is much less efficient though...
If you are having troubles finding Souls, you might wanna look into Soul Looting enchantment on your sword. Killing mobs with this enchantment will occassionally spawn Souls.

quests.title: &cCrimson Stone
desc:
Crimson Stones are found within Pillager Outposts, they are a little rare but doesn't help they only give us 2 Chests! 

They aren't used for new Recipes rather they will decrease Soul usage in the &6&lForge&r.

quests.title: &lRelics
desc:
Relics are rare finds around your &2&lMinecraft&r World! 

They can be used in your &6&lForge&r, in the squares around the center slot, these open up more the more you upgrade the Tiers! 

Or you can use them in the &l&bClibano&r. 

Some are Creative Mode only, don't worry we know how much you love your OP Items and will be looking into ways of adding them!

quests.title: Automatic Souls
desc:
To get Souls automatically we'll need a few Machines from &3&lJust Dire Things&r. 
We'll need a Block Placer, set to place Soul Sand. 

We'll then need an Advanced Clicker with a Soul Extractor set to where the Soul Sand we'll be placed. The Clicker needs to be configured to Hold Click, for quite a few Ticks. 

Finally, we'll need an Advanced Block Placer set to break where the Soul Sand will be. Remember to set its filter to only break Soulless Sand, and equip it with a Tool! 

All these machines will need Power (beside Block Placer if you use the normal version) and Advanced Breaker and Advanced Clicker will need their tools which have Durability.
{@pagebreak}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_autosoul.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
In this image the Breaker is on the Left, the Placer is Below, and the Clicker is on the Right but its placement does not matter!

quests.title: Farming for &4Blood&r and &aExperience&r
desc:
The best way to automate the &aFluid XP&r and &4Blood&r in order to fuel our &c&lAutomatic Forge&r we'll need a Spawner! 

We'll need a Spawner that gives the best bang for our buck, I recommend using Piglin Brutes as they give a ton of &aXP&r and have a lot of &4Health&r. But whatever you use is up to you! 

Also don't forget to give them No AI with a &dChorus Fruit&r so they don't escape. 

Feel free to use Fans or Entity Conveyors to move the Mobs who get spawned.

quests.title: Auto &4Blood&r
desc:
We got our Spawner, we got some way of moving the spawned in Mobs, now how do we get &4Blood&r from them? 

We can use Spikes or Mob Mashers to kill them normally but if we want &4Blood&r from them we should use a &4Powered Sanguinary Pedestal&r with &7Spiked Plates&r on top of them! 

When on top of a &4Pedestal&r, &7Spiked Plates&r will deal damage to Mobs that hit them and deposit that &4Blood&r into the &4Pedestal&r. The more &4Health&r the Mobs have, the more &4Blood&r you can get! 

The &4Blood&r will be in Fluid Form and can be moved with Pipes from the &4Pedestal&r to our &c&lForge&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/forbidden/forbidden_pedestal.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &b&lRunic Crucible&r
desc:
The &b&lRunic Crucible&r is a Multiblock which will be our way of getting half of our automatic Essences: Liquid Souls and &bLiquid Aureal&r! 

Check the next page in the Quest Description to see how to build it! 

We'll need to Pipe in Items and Liquids into the Ports, then fill it with &dSource&r in order for it to start working. Both Liquid Souls and &bLiquid Aureal&r we'll need to input Items and Liquids. 

The &b&lRunic Crucible&r can also be used to craft &9Corrupt Souls&r, &dEnchanted Souls&r, and &5Obsidiansteel&r!
{@pagebreak}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_crucible1.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

First layer of the &l&bRunic Crucible&r has a &6Gilded Chiseled Polished Darkstone&r in the middle, around it is &9Polished Darkstone&r. Then, on the sides we'll have upside down &9Polished Darkstone Stairs&r, with Rune Blocks on the corners.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_crucible2.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

Smack dab in the middle we'll put an &bArcane Crystal&r with &9Polished Darkstone Stairs&r around it. On the sides will be &6Arcane Polished Darkstone Pillars&r, &9Polished Darkstone&r which will be replaced by Hatches, and &6Arcane Polished Darkstone&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_crucible3.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
Just place &bArcane Crystal Blocks&r on each corner and call it a day!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_crucible4.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
Finally, with a block of space, place the &7Quantum Injector&r above the middle &bArcane Crystal Block&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_crucible5.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
The &9Polished Darkstone blocks&r in the middle layer are where we'll place our Hatches!

quests.title: Automating &bArcane Crystals
desc:
While yes you can use Quarries or Void Miners to get the Ores but if you really want the best way of automating &bArcane Crystals&r then you'll need &6&lBees&r! 
&bDiamond Bees&r to be more exact. Simply feed a &bDiamond Bee&r a &bBlock of Arcane Crystals&r and they will become an &bArcanus Bee&r! 

&bArcanus Bees&r need &bBlocks of Arcane Crystals&r as Flowering Blocks as well, then they will make &bArcanus Comb&r! Which can be made into &bArcane Crystals&r.

quests.title: Auto &aExperience
desc:
Another Essence needed for our &c&lAutomatic Forge&r is &aExperience&r! Well it's &aFluid XP&r from &3&lJust Dire Things&r. 

To get &aXP Fluid&r we'll need an &aExperience Holder&r, these can be set to collect &aXP&r in a set area with the Collect XP option. 

Don't worry, Mobs killed by &7Spiked Plates&r will still drop &aXP&r, so put these next to your Farms! 

You can also deposit other forms of &aFluid XP&r into it or even your own &aXP&r levels!

quests.title: Infinite &9Water&r!!!
desc:
To make the &bArcane Crystal Dust&r into &bLiquid Aureal&r, we'll need a liquid! Infact we'll need THE Liquid... which is &9Water&r! 

Just pipe &9Water&r from a &9Sink&r, it's infinite.

quests.title: Unrefined Liquid Souls
desc:
To get our Unrefined Liquid Souls we'll need to use a Fluid Extractor on Soul Tree Logs! 

Soul Tree Saplings can not be breed for, they are a treasure Sapling. You'll need to look in &dEnd Cities&r for the Saplings.

quests.title: Liquid Souls
desc:
By combining 500mB of Unrefined Liquid Souls with a singular Soul, we can create 500mB of Liquid Souls! 

This will need twice the amount of &dSource&r that the &bLiquid Aureal&r needs, at 2000 &dSource&r.

quests.title: &bLiquid Aureal
desc:
For 250mB of &9Water&r and 2 &bArcane Crystal Dust&r, in the &b&lRunic Crucible&r, we can get 250mB of &bLiquid Aureal&r! 

You will need 1000 &dSource&r to get it started though...

quests.title: &4Blood
desc:
Don't need anymore processing, this isn't a &4Blood&r Test, it's just fuel! 

Just Pipe the &4Pedestal&r to the &c&lForge&r and watch the &4Blood&r flow in!

quests.title: &aXP Fluid&r
desc: Now that we have our &aExperience Holder&r collecting &aXP&r, we can just pipe the &aXP Fluid&r into our &c&lAuto Forge&r!

quests.title: Auto Forge
desc:
One of the most important &lMutliblocks&r, mostly because we need it for the other &lMultiblocks&r. 

Here you'll need &bFluid Input&r (each &bInput&r can only hold 1 type of &bFluid&r so you'll need multiple), &cEnergy Input&r, and &eItem Input&r and Output Hatches. 

Using those Hatches we can input all the &eItems&r, &bFluids&r, and &cEnergy&r and it'll craft our Items, like the other &5Multiblock Controllers&r! 

Or craft our Items needed for the &6Star Parts&r! You'll need a lot of &4Blood&f, &bAureal&f, Souls, and &cEnergy&r for them!
{@pagebreak}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_forge1.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

First layer is pretty simple. Just some &9Polished Darkstone Blocks &fand &9Stairs&r. Along with the &7Rune Blocks&r and &6Arcane Polished Darkstone&r. Oh wait, I almost forgot the most important Block! The &5Forge Block&r
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_forge2.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

Next layer will have more &9Darkstone&r in &9Blocks&f, &9Stairs&f, and &9Slabs&r and even &6Gilded Arcane Polished Darkstone&r and &6Chiseled Polished Arcane Darkstone&r. Can't forget the 4 &bArcane Crystal Obelisks&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_forge3.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
This one's very easy! Just a &9&lTier 5 &6Forge&r square in the center with 8 &6Darkstone Pedestals&r 2 Blocks away from it.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_forge4.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
We're going to skip a layer because nothing is added there! Instead, with a Block of space between them. Place the &7Quantum Injector&r above the &9&lTier 5 &6Forge&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_forge5.png width:200 height:100 align:center}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/chap3/creative_forge6.png width:200 height:100 align:center}
Last is placing a few more Hatches! We'll need them!

quests.title: Upgrades
quests.subtitle: Automatic Hephaestus Forge does not work without upgrades
desc: All recipes have a &#DE552Cminimum&r energy requirement. This can be viewed by hovering over the upgrade in the recipe page.
This energy requirement can be fulfilled by giving the machines appropriate upgrades.
{@pagebreak}
1. &n&#A839EDRunic Attuned Crystals&r from &#39EDA5Forbidden and Arcanus&r. This will add &#EDE02F512 EU/t&r worth of capacity. This skips &#EDA439Modern Industrialization&r progression.
2. &n&#2278F2Any Upgrades&r from &#EDA439Modern Industrialization&r. Different upgrades will increase energy capacity by different amounts.
Basic upgrades add &#EDE02F2 EU/t&r, Advanced adds &#EDE02F16 EU/t&r, Turbo adds &#EDE02F64 EU/t&r, Highly Advanced adds &#EDE02F512 EU/t&r and Quantum adds &#EDE02F1,000,000,000 EU/t&r.

quests.title: Industrial Foregoing
quests.subtitle: Tier: &a1
desc:
&bIndustrial Foregoing&r (IF for short) is a tech mod that adds many machines with various different uses.

To get started, craft a &aPity Machine Frame&r.

quests.title: Fluid Extractor
desc:
Extracts latex from logs, runs faster when given power.

Check JEI for acceptable logs and Latex amounts. The best log to use is Acacia.

quests.title: Pitiful Generator
desc: The Pitiful Generator generates a small amount of FE using burnable fuels like Coal.

quests.title: Latex Processing Unit
desc: Turns Latex into Dry Rubber.

quests.title: Dryrubber
desc: When Rubber is smelted it turns into Plastic, which is the main resource in Industrial Foregoing.

quests.title: Plastic
desc: Plastic is the main resource of &bIndustrial Foregoing&r, you now have access to some very useful machines!

quests.title: Dissolution Chamber
quests.subtitle: The Crafting Table?
desc:
The Dissolution Chamber is used to craft more advanced machines.

You will need to put a certain fluid in it along with the items needed for what you are crafting. Check JEI.

quests.title: Mob Slaughter Factory
desc: Passive Mobs -> More Pink Slime
Hostile Mobs -> More Meat

quests.title: Pink Slime \& Liquid Meat
desc:
Passive Mobs -> More Pink Slime.
Hostile Mobs -> More Meat.

quests.title: Blocks
desc: These machines are used to automate block placing/breaking. This is especially useful when automating latex.

quests.title: Bio Power
desc: The Bioreactor uses Biofuel made from the Biofuel Generator to generate FE.

quests.title: Sewer
desc: The Sewer is used to make Sewage, which is used to make Fertilizer.

quests.title: Meat Feeder
desc: Meat through a tube, yummy.

quests.title: Laser Drill
quests.subtitle: Void Miner
desc: Suggestion: Use some sort of Wither-Proof Glass.

quests.title: Quest 0FAAE744
quests.subtitle: Mycelial Reactor, huh?
desc:
The &bMycelial Reactor&r consists of all the Mycelial Generators working at the same time, near the reactor block, and it produces a total of &a25MFE/t&r.

All sounds good, but you need to automate some stuff to get it working, see what each Mycelial Generator consumes to work, and automate it, most things are simple, but others, not that much... &olooking at Disenchanting Mycelial Generator&r.

But after you get it all automated, you don't need to stop at one, you can make more reactors.

quests.title: Quest 3CB7884B
quests.subtitle: Ether Gas? Huh?
desc:
Getting your first &bEther Gas&r might be a little bit scary.

&bEther Gas&r is made from drilling a Wither, using a Fluid Drill with a &5Purple Lens&r.

But don't worry about the Wither, Industrial Foregoing has a machine just to help you with that task. The &4Stasis Chamber&r is a machine that freezes in place anything that is on top of it in a 3x3 area, including the Wither.
&cHope you don't run out of power, because if you do... I hope you're ready to fight the &0Wither&c.

quests.title: Latex and Plastic? Huh?
quests.subtitle: Latex and Plastic? Huh?
desc:
In &bIndustrial Foregoing&r, one of the main resources is &fLatex.&r Its used to craft Machine Frames, needed to make machines and upgrades.

Making Latex is pretty simple, &aFluid Extractor&r extracts Latex from &6Logs&r (Acacia gives the most).

------------------------

Now about making Plastic: Plastic results from smelting Dry Rubber - which is made in the &aLatex Processing Unit&r, that transforms Latex into Dry Rubber.

&bSo basically Latex -> Dry Rubber -> Plastic.

quests.title: Quest 2F69010E
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks. 

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission. 

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: Mob Imprisonment Tool
desc: Used to trap and transport mobs easily.

quests.title: Smart Filter
desc: Used to make machines better.

quests.title: &4&lMahou Tsukai
desc:
Welcome to &4&lMahou Tsukai&r. 

No, you can't instantly get the &4&lMorgan Sword&r you'll need to actually play the mod a little. 

To start take some damage. You'll have a bleeding effect. Before it fades, hold shift and press M on a solid block to place your first &cMahou Circle&r. 

AKA &cMahoujin&r!

quests.title: How to grow your &4Mahou&r
desc:
&4Mahou&r is the life source of everything &4&lMahou Tsukai&r. You'll need to increase it and have tons to use &eSpells&r and make Weapons. 

When you use &4Mahou&r your limit goes up. 
An easy way of spending &4Mahou&r is using Attuned &aEmerald&r or &bDiamond&r to store more &4Mahou&r. 

Once you have a high enough &4Mahou&r you can try these &eSpells&r...

quests.title: &eSpells&r on the go!
desc:
Some &eSpells&r can be put into &7Scrolls&r to be used wherever needed. 

First, you'll need a &7Spell Cloth&r and place it down. Then, do the same ritual but onto the &7Spell Cloth&r. 

Once all the &4Blood&r and &bPowder&r is done Right Click the &7Spell Cloth&r and BOOM &7Scroll&r! 

Some &eSpells&r can not be turned into &7Scrolls&r, so I am not held liable to wasted materials for that.

quests.title: &9Mortar and Pestle
desc:
In order to get &eSpells&r you'll need Powdered Items. 

To get Powdered Items you'll need a &9Mortar and Pestle&r.

quests.title: Boundary of Life Drain
desc:
Once you've got at least 200 &4Mahou&r you might want to make a Boundary of Life Drain. 

For every Mob that dies in that boundary, you get 10 &4Mahou&r back, but this is a SLOW process.

quests.title: Durability Exchange
desc:
Or, make a Durability Exchange and toss strong (but not too strong) Items into it. 

I recommend Items like &5Netherite Shovels&r!

quests.title: Chronal Exchange
desc:
Another option is using Chronal Exchange; gain &4Mahou&r for 12 hours, then spend it for 12 hours. 

If you make a second Chronal Exchange circle, when the first starts spending, it becomes a loop.

quests.title: Getting &4&lMorgan
desc:
I know why you all are here for, you're here for the &4&lMorgan Sword&r. 

One of the powerful Swords of all the &6&lATM Modpacks&r. 

Follow these Quests and you'll become an unstoppable force!

quests.title: &3Mahou Lake
desc:
Once the Ritual has started you will notice the &3Lake&r being made. 

It will grow to about a 20x20 block area full of &3Murky Water&r. 

The &3Murky Water&r will not kill you; unless you forget to go for air.

quests.title: Power Consolidation Ritual
desc:
In order to get &4&lMorgan&r you need &e&lCaliburn&r. 

In order to get &e&lCaliburn&r you need the &3Mahou Lake&r. 

In order to get the &3Mahou Lake&r you'll need the Power Consolidation Ritual. 

Which can be done like any other ritual just with 2 powdered diamonds and 1 powdered emerald. 

FYI don't do it near your base, the Ritual will be the middle of the &3Lake&r!

quests.title: Enough &4Mahou&r? Probably!
desc:
Attuned &bDiamond&r/&aEmeralds&r are &4Mahou&r batteries and you'll need lots of &4Mahou&r for getting &4&lMorgan&r. 

Attuned &bDiamonds&r hold 2000 &4Mahou&r and Attuned &aEmeralds&r hold 1000. 

You'll need 5000 &4Mahou&r for the Ritual, so you might need a few!

quests.title: &e&lCaliburn
desc:
&e&lCaliburn&r requires a few things, some already stated in quests, some not yet. 
First, you need the &3Mahou Lake&r and 5000 &4Mahou&r. 

Then, you'll need an Enchanted &bDiamond Sword&r with &5Smite&r (the higher the level, the better). 

Finally, throw the &bSword&r into the &3Lake&r and you'll find &e&lCaliburn&r at the bottom of it!

quests.title: Upgrading &l&eCaliburn
desc:
&e&lCaliburn&r will start off not much better than a &bDiamond Sword&r but once upgraded; the &bDiamond Sword&r looks more like a normal Stick than &e&lCaliburn&r! 
Both &4&lMorgan&r and &e&lCaliburn&r have their actual Damage and their Innate Cap. 

Innate Cap is max Damage it can be increased to. To increase the Innate Cap of &e&lCaliburn&r, enchant it with &5Smite&r then toss it in the &3Lake&r with Nether Stars. 

To get the Max Cap you need 6 Nether Stars. Once upgraded it can't be upgraded anymore so make sure you toss in all 6 at once! 

To increase the normal Damage you'll need to enchant it with &5Smite&r then back in the &3Lake&r it goes! You'll need more damage in order to...

quests.title: Got &4&lMorgan
desc:
To get &4&lMorgan&r you need to kill a pet Dog with &e&lCaliburn&r. 

Also &e&lCaliburn's&r Innate Cap will be &4&lMorgan's&r Innate Cap. 

Good luck!

quests.title: Maxed out &4&lMorgan
desc:
The only way to increase &4&lMorgan's&r Damage is by killing Villagers. Baby Villagers give even more Damage! 

Hopefully you have a farm set up. Then, after many, many, many Villager deaths you'll have a maxed out &4&lMorgan&r. 

Also you can hold Right Click with &4&lMorgan&r to do a special attack.

quests.title: &7Scroll of Strengthening
desc:
In order to get more fun, little &4&lMahou Tsukai&r weapons, you'll need a &7Scroll of Strengthening&r. 

To get one, place down a &7Spell Cloth&r, then do the Ritual of Strengthening on top of it and pick up the &7Cloth&r.

quests.title: Strong Stick
desc: Hold a Stick in your off hand and the &7Scroll of Strengthening&r in your main and hold Right Click.

quests.title: &9&lEmrys
desc:
I wonder what you need to do to get a &9Lightning Staff&r? 

Could it be getting struck by &9Lightning&r while holding the Strengthened Stick?

I think so! 

Once you have &9&lEmrys&r hold it in your off hand and hold Right Click, the results will be SHOCKING!

quests.title: Strong Sword
desc: Hold a &bDiamond Sword&r in your off hand and the &7Scroll of Strengthening&r in your main and hold Right Click.

quests.title: &d&lClarent
desc:
Take your &bStrengthened Diamond Sword&r in a pool of &dDragon's Breath&r and you will get &d&lClarent&r! 

&d&lClarent&r works as a Shield and Sword. 

Hold Right Click to block with &d&lClarent&r and any attacks it blocks it'll deal the same damage it blocked.

quests.title: Strong Shield
desc: Hold a Shield in your off hand and the &7Scroll of Strengthening&r in your main and hold Right Click.

quests.title: &7Scroll of Damage Exchange
desc:
One &7Scroll&r, you'll need applied to get &8&lReplica&r is the &7Scroll of Damage Exchange&r. 

To get it do the Ritual of Damage Exchange: with 1 Powdered Iron and 2 &aPowdered Emeralds&r.

quests.title: Souls
desc:
The last thing you need for &8&lReplica&r, obviously involves another &7Scroll&r. 

&7Scroll of the Mystic Eyes of Death Collection&r. 

It will allow you to collect Souls from watchings mobs die. 

Each death is only a very little bit of Souls so you'll need to see a lot of death. 

Once you have 5 whole Souls, you'll be ready to get &8&lReplica&r.

quests.title: &7Scroll of Immunity Exchange
desc:
The Second Scroll you need activated to get &8&lReplica&r is the &7Scroll of Immunity Exchange&r. 

To get it you'll need the Ritual of Immunity Exchange; which needs 1 &3Powdered Eye&r and 2 &aPowdered Emeralds&r.

quests.title: &8&lReplica
desc:
Now this ones complicated. 

To get &8&lReplica&r first have 5 Souls, Damage Exchange, and Immunity Exchange ready. 

Then, hold your Strengthened Shield to block an attack, then you'll get &8&lReplica&r!

quests.title: Strong Bow
desc: Hold a Bow in your off hand and the &7Scroll of Strengthening&r in your main and hold Right Click.

quests.title: &5&lNobu
desc:
What does every Magic Mod need? Did you say a gun! I hope you said a gun! 

The Nobu is a gun, which of course has 3 different firing Modes.

quests.title: &7Scroll of Explosive Mana Condensation
desc:
Pretty simple &7Scroll&r recipe for something so powerful! Just 2 &ePowdered Gold&r and 1 &bPowdered Diamond&r. 

Use this on a &7Spell Cloth&r with a &cMahoujin&r on it, once set Right Click it to obtain the &7Scroll&r! 

Then, use the &7Scroll&r in order to get your &c&lExplosive Staff&r!

quests.title: &c&lExplosive Mana Condensation
desc:
This &c&lStaff&r has 3 Modes: Beam, AOE, or Big Explosion, each changed via Shift Right Click! (Don't worry all cause Explosions!) 

Beam works as foretold, it'll shoot a giant Beam to where you are pointing, annihlating every Block and Mob in its way! 

AOE summons a dozen circles in front of you, each shooting an Explosive blast to where it is aimed. 

Big Explosion is the most fun Mode, simply Hold Right Click at a target... keep holding. It'll take a little bit, once all the lines are done growing. Then, release! 

BOOM! a massive nuke will go off! Destroying a giant area, so don't use near your base. Infact don't use any of these Modes near it...

quests.title: &7Scroll of Spatial Disorientation
desc:
2 &ePowdered Gold&r and 1 &3Powdered Enderpearl&r (don't confuse them or you'll get Ascension!). 

Use these on a &7Spell Cloth&r to get our &7Scroll&r! 

Then, using that &7Scroll&r we'll get our less Explosive but still fun &a&lStaff&r!

quests.title: &a&lSpatial Disorientation
desc:
Use the Force! 

This one's another fun &a&lStaff&r, you can use it to fling Entities! Including yourself! 

Hold Right Click at what you want flung, if it's yourself aim at the ground. Then, move your Mouse in the direction you want flinging to happen! 

The longer you hold the stronger the fling! After awhile it will max out and fling regardless.

quests.title: &7Scroll of Proximity Projection
desc:
Just 2 &bPowdered Diamonds&r and 1 &3Powdered Enderpearl&r (trust me the &3Enderpearl&r is important for it!). 

Use these 3 Powders onto a &7Spell Cloth&r in order to get our &7Scroll&r! 

Use your &7Scroll&r to get your &7&lKeys&r, now you can unlock any Door! 

No, wait wrong keys...

quests.title: &7&lKeys of Proximity Projection
desc:
These fun little &7&lKeys&r, act similar to Wolverine Claws, which they look very similar to! 

When holding them a Circle will appear around a Target, use Left Click to TP onto the Target and Hit them! 

This can be used for a huge distance! (Over a hundred Blocks is what I found). 

It does around same Damage as an Iron Sword.

quests.title: &7Scroll of Weapon Projectiles
desc:
This one needs 2 &bPowdered Diamonds&r and 1 &ePowdered Gold&r, opposite of the &c&lExplosive Staff&r! 

Use these onto a &7Spell Cloth&r to get our &7Scroll&r, then we can use the &7Scroll&r to get our &b&lBow&r!

quests.title: &b&lBow of Weapon Projectiles
desc:
You ever wish to shoot Diamond Swords from a Bow? Or Netherite Hoes? Or basically any "Weapon"? 

Then, the &b&lBow of Weapon Projectiles&r is your man! 

It has two Modes which can be changed via Shift Right Click: Normal and Projection. The only thing that changes is whether it takes any Weapon from your Inventory (Normal) or just from your Offhand (Projection). 

The Weapons shot from the &b&lBow&r will act like a thrown Trident, being able to be retrieved like one as well. 

The Weapons will do the same damage as a normal Swing!

quests.title: &bProsperity Shards
quests.subtitle: Can we finally have Prosperity?
desc: Prosperity Shards are a core crafting ingrediant in the mod. To find some Prosperity Ore, go mining.

quests.title: &aMystical Agriculture!
desc: &aMystical Agriculture&r is a resource generation mod that allows you to grow a large variety of vanilla and modded resources using &aSeeds&r.

quests.title: &bProsperity Seed Base
quests.subtitle: I'm all about that (Seed) Base
desc: You will need &bProsperity Seed Bases&r in order to create resource crops.

quests.title: &4Infusion Altar
quests.subtitle: Creating Seeds
desc:
The &aInfusion Altar&r is how you make all of the seeds. Place down the Altar first and it'll show you where to place the Pedestals after.

In order for the Infusing to start, the Alter requires a &4Redstone signal&r.

quests.title: &fUnattuned Augment
desc: The Unattuned Augment is used in an Infusion Alter to create various augments. Get &eHaste&r, &1Night Vision&r, &bFall Damage Resistance&r, &6Fire Resistance&r, and much more with these amazing augments!

quests.title: Seed Reprocessor
quests.subtitle: Recycling!
desc: The Seed Reprocessor can convert essence seeds back into essences.

quests.title: &4Master Infusion Crystal
desc: The &4Master Infusion Crystal&r works the same as the Infusion Crystal but it never breaks.

quests.title: Tinkering Table
desc: The Tinkering Table is how you add these augments to your essence gear!

quests.title: Soulium Spawner
desc: The Soulium Spawner uses mob essences to spawn mobs. For example if you put in some Ghast Essence you can spawn a Ghast.

quests.title: &aInferium Farmland
desc:
You'll want to start growing &aInferium&r as soon as you can!

While not required for growing these seeds, you can also create &eEssence Farmland&r that will increase the growth speed of the seeds (especially Inferium Seeds). However, certain seeds will require certain farmlands to be planted on.

quests.title: Creating Mob Seeds
desc: Most seeds are simple to make, but to make &9Mob Seeds&r, you'll need to head to the Nether to pick up some &8Soulium&r.

With the stone and ore that you find, you'll need to use these to make the &3Soulium Dagger&r and &3Soul Jars&r. Using the dagger to kill mobs, you'll be able to gather their &bsouls&r, which are used in the Infusion Altar to create the respective mob seeds.
Alternatively, you can fill Soul Jars inside of the &3Soul Extractor&r by inserting a jar and using mob items to fill them. For example, adding Rotten Flesh will give a portion of a Zombie Soul.

quests.title: &aInferium
quests.subtitle: Tier: &e1
desc:
&dEssence&r is the starting point for all of your growing needs in Mystical Agriculture.

&eInferium Essence&r is the base tier of all essences. You can get this from mining, killing mobs, or by making seeds to grow them! 

To make the bigger and better essences, you'll need to make an &9Infusion Crystal&r.

quests.title: &aInferium Growth Accelerator
quests.subtitle: Range: &e9&r Blocks
desc: &9Growth Accelerators&r very slightly increase the growth speed of a seed when placed directly underneath the farmland. Each tier has a range of how many blocks 'up' it can accelerate, with Inferium being the lowest at 9.

Note: Growth Accelerators of all tiers provide the same rate of growth ticks. Higher tiers however have a larger range, so you can stack more of them below a single plant. It doesn't matter which tier you use as long as the Growth Accelerator is placed within its max range.

quests.title: &aInferium Apple
desc:
Buffs:

 - Absorption II (3:00)

quests.title: &aInferium Armor
desc:
To start your journey making &aEssence Gear&r, you'll need to make the Inferium Armor first.

This gear can be upgraded to higher tiers, just like the Essences. You can also &9Augment&r them with the &bTinkering Table&r!

quests.title: &aInferium Tools
desc:
Starting with Inferium Essence, you can create ingots to make both Essence &9Tools&r and &9Armor&r.

Essence tools can be upgraded to higher tiers, and just like the Armor, they can be &5Augmented&r in the &3Tinkering Table&r.

quests.title: &bInfusion Crystal
desc:
The &bInfusion Crystal&r is need in order to "tier up" seeds. For example if you combine the crystal with 4 Inferium Essence you will get 1 Prudentium Essence.

Later on you will be able to craft an Infusion Crystal that doesn't break.

quests.title: Cow Seeds
quests.subtitle: Tier: &a2
desc: Meow meow I'm a Cow...

quests.title: Sheep Seeds
quests.subtitle: Tier: &a2
desc: Beep beep I'm a Sheep

quests.title: &2Prudentium Apple
desc:
Buffs:

 - Absorption II (3:00)
 - Speed II (3:00)

quests.title: &2Prudentium
quests.subtitle: Tier: &a2
desc: This is the Tier 2 Essence, made by combining 4 Inferium together with an Infusion Crystal.

quests.title: &cTertium Apple
desc:
Buffs:

 - Absorption II (3:00)
 - Speed II (3:00)
 - Resistance II (3:00)

quests.title: &cTertium
quests.subtitle: Tier: &63
