desc: This is the Tier 3 Essence, made by combining 4 Prudentium together with an Infusion Crystal.

quests.title: Smart Filter
desc: Sickles tools that can be used to clear large amount of organic materials. Sickles break blocks in an area around the block you mine.

quests.title: Smart Filter
desc: Scythes are tools that can farm large areas of crops all at once. They can also be used as a fairly good weapon.

quests.title: &9Imperium Apple
desc:
Buffs:

 - Absorption II (3:00)
 - Speed II (3:00)
 - Resistance II (3:00)
 - Regeneration II (3:00)

quests.title: &9Imperium
quests.subtitle: Tier: &b4
desc: This is the Tier 4 Essence, made by combining 4 Tertium together with an Infusion Crystal.

quests.title: &4Supremium Apple
desc:
Buffs:

 - Absorption II (3:00)
 - Speed II (3:00)
 - Resistance II (3:00)
 - Regeneration II (3:00)
 - Strength II (3:00)

quests.title: &4Supremium
quests.subtitle: Tier: &c5
desc: This is the Tier 4 Essence, made by combining 4 Imperium together with an Infusion Crystal.

quests.title: &6Awakened Supremium
quests.subtitle: Tier: &c5 - Awakened
desc: This is the Tier 5 - Awakened Essence, made by combining 4 Cognizant Dust, 10 of each Elemental Essence and 1 Supremium Block together in an Awakening Alter.

quests.title: &dThe Awakening&r
desc:
To awaken your Supremium Essence, you'll need to create a new Altar and 4 new Pedestals, as well as 4 &cEssence Vessels&r.

The Essence Vessels will require the starter Element Essences to fill: Fire, Water, Earth, and Air.

quests.title: &5Cognizant Dust&r
desc: This special &eDust&r is dropped from the Wither and the Ender Dragon when killed by an &dEssence Weapon&r enchanted with &dMystical Enlightenment&r.

quests.title: Automating Awakened Supremium
desc: Awakened Supremium and other tiered essences can be farmed using the &6Productive Bees&r mod.

quests.title: &5Insanium Farmland
desc: To grow Tier 6 or Magical Seeds you need to have a certain Crux placed directly below the Farmland they are growing on.

quests.title: &5Insanium Apple
desc:
Buffs:

 - Absorption II (3:00)
 - Speed II (3:00)
 - Resistance II (3:00)
 - Regeneration II (3:00)
 - Strength II (3:00)
 - Haste II (3:00)

quests.title: &5Insanium
quests.subtitle: Tier: &56
desc: This is the Tier 6 Essence, made by combining 4 Supremium together with an Infusion Crystal.

quests.title: Allthemodium Seeds
quests.subtitle: Tier: &bMagical
desc: Allthemodium Seeds require Magical Soil placed below in order for them to grow.

quests.title: Vibranium Seeds
quests.subtitle: Tier: &bMagical
desc: Vibranium Seeds require Magical Soil placed below in order for them to grow.

quests.title: Unobtainium Seeds
quests.subtitle: Tier: &bMagical
desc: Unobtainium Seeds require Magical Soil placed below in order for them to grow.

quests.title: Nether Star Seeds
quests.subtitle: Tier: &56
desc: Nether Star Seeds require a Nether Star Crux placed below in order for them to grow.

quests.title: Dragon Egg Seeds
quests.subtitle: Tier: &56
desc: Dragon Egg Seeds require a Dragon Egg Crux placed below in order for them to grow.

quests.title: Nitro Crystal Seeds
quests.subtitle: Tier: &56
desc: Nitro Crystal Seeds require a Nitro Crystal Crux placed below in order for them to grow.

quests.title: "Furnace"
desc: The "Furnace" is an upgraded version of a vanilla Furnace that can be upgraded for faster speed and better efficiency.

quests.title: Watering Can
desc: To use a Watering Can you'll need to fill it with Water by right-clicking on a Water source block. Once it's filled with Water you can hold right-click on a crop to water the crops within the Watering Can's AOE.

Essence Watering cans have the ability of auto-watering. Just shift-right-click the Watering Can in the air to toggle auto-watering on or off. It will look like the Watering Can is enchanted when it's turned on.

quests.title: Smart Filter
desc: Machine Upgrades are used to speed &aMystical Agriculture&r machines.

quests.title: &0Witherproof Blocks
desc: Witherproof Blocks, Witherproof Bricks and Witherproof Glass have a very high blast resistance and cannot be destroyed by the Wither or the Ender Dragon.

quests.title: Harvester
desc: The Harvester can auto-harvest crops and re-plant them. Items collected by the Harvester are put into it's internal inventory.

quests.title: &dMystical Fertilizer
desc: Mystical Fertilizer works as Bonemeal, but better. It instantly grows whatever it is used on to full maturity.

quests.title: &bEnchanter
desc: The Enchanter is a block that allows you to add enchantments to enchantable items using items and essences.

quests.title: &2Wand
quests.subtitle: You're a Wizard (Insert your name)!
desc: The Wand can be used to activate the Infusion Alter, just right-click on the altar to activate the infusion process.

quests.title: Soul Extractor
desc: The Soul Extractor allows you to fill up Soul Jars by inserting a jar and using mob items to fill them. For example, adding Rotten Flesh will give a portion of a Zombie Soul.

quests.title: Quest 23C36E4B
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &5Creative Essence
quests.subtitle: Tier: &5Creative
desc: Creative Essence is needed to craft the &6ATM Star&r.

quests.title: Insanium Coal Block
desc: Great for smelting a ton of items!
An Insanium Coal Block is needed to craft the &6ATM Star&r.

quests.title: Awakened Supremium Ingot Block
desc: An Awakened Supremium Ingot Block is needed to craft the &6ATM Star&r.

quests.title: &aWelcome to &9Powah&r!!!
desc:
&9Powah&r is a tech mod that's all about generating, storing, and transmitting &dPower&r. Ranging from basic FE generation to &aReactors&r that produce &b250k FE/t&r, Powah has you covered!

To get started, go out and mine some &aUraninite&r!

quests.title: Starting with Dielectric Mats
desc:
Almost every single machine you can make in the mod will require a &9Dielectric Casing&r.

You'll need to make the &bPaste&r first, as well as some &aRods&r to progress!

quests.title: The &9Energizing Orb
desc:
In the beginning, you can get by with creating the &7Starter&r and &bBasic&r tier machines using Iron, but you'll eventually need to create energized mats using the &9Energizing Orb&r.

The &9Energizing Orb&r will energize items using nearby &aEnergizing Rods&r within a 9x9 area around it, creating better materials for you to use to progress through the &eTiers&r in Powah.

To power the orb, you'll need to attach Energizing Rods to Energy Cables that are being supplied with energy. If you want the Orb to energize faster, either make more rods, upgrade to higher tier rods, or both! To see if the Rods are connected, set your &aWrench&r to link mode and you can link any Rod to the Orb.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/powah/powah_energizing.png width:200 height:200 align:1}

quests.title: Thermo Generator Starter
desc:
One of the best options for "Passive Power", the &9Thermal Generator&r will produce FE when placed over a &cHeat Source&r and given a steady supply of water.

There are currently 3 blocks you can place this over: a Magma block which produces the lowest, a lava source block which is a little better, or a &cBlock of Blazing Crystal&r, which provides the most heat.

quests.title: Furnator Starter
desc: The &7Furnator&r will burn items like coal and wood to produce FE.

quests.title: Solar Panel Starter
desc: The Solar Panel generates FE when given direct access to the sun. However, you can use a &7Lens of Ender&r to ignore blocks in its way.

quests.title: Magmator Starter
desc: The &cMagmator&r will generate FE when supplied with Lava.

quests.title: Reactor (Starter)
desc:
The &9Reactor&r is a 3x4x3 multiblock generator that burns &aUrananite&r as fuel to produce FE.

To build it, you'll need to make a total of 36 Reactor Blocks. While holding 36 in hand, placing one block will auto-build the reactor. Make sure to clear out some room first!

You'll want to cool the reactor down for it to create more FE, and you can do this with either solid or liquid &bcoolant&r. To use a solid coolant, you'll also need to give it some liquid coolant as well. &bDry Ice&r makes for a great solid coolant! (Note: 1 Water Bucket will do).

You can also increase the FE generation by keeping the fuel buffer full, as well as adding both Coal and Redstone to the Reactor. Using Blocks of either will also work!

quests.title: Ender Gate Starter
desc:
&5Ender Gates&r are used to transfer power wirelessly to and from an adjacent block into the &7Ender Network&r.

Think of these like wireless access points to your wireless network of power.

Note: You can only add &apower storage capacity&r using an Ender Cell.

quests.title: Energy Cable Starter
desc: The basic cables for transferring power.

quests.title: Player Transmitter Starter
desc: The &9Player Transmitter&r will charge a player's items wirelessly. You must first bind this to a player using a &9Binding Card&r. This is the basic card which allows the transmitter to only work in the same dimension. You can upgrade this by using a &dBinding Card (Dimensional)&r instead.
Note: To get a Player Aerial Pearl, use an Aerial Pearl on a Zombie or Husk.

quests.title: Energy Hopper Starter
desc: The &9Energy Hopper&r will charge any chargeable item inside of the inventory of the block it is pointed to, like a chest.

quests.title: Energy Discharger Starter
desc: This block will drain FE from any charged item.

quests.title: Energy Cell Starter
desc:
The &9Power Bank&r of Powah.

These can also be used to upgrade the total power storage capacity of your wireless &7Ender Networks&r.

quests.title: Ender Cell Starter
desc: The &5Ender Cell&r will store power for a channel in your &7Ender Network&r. To increase the power capacity of the network, right click on the Ender Cell to open up the interface, then add either a &aBattery&r or an &9Energy Cell&r to increase the overall capacity.

quests.title: Battery Starter
desc: These can be used to charge items in your inventory, or can be used to increase the overall power capacity of an &7Ender Network&r channel.

quests.title: Energizing Rod Starter
desc: Used to energize items using the Energizing Orb.

quests.title: Quest 08245411
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &lPylons
desc:
Pylons is a wonderful mod made by our very own &aMutant Gumdrop&r!

Don't let the size of the mod make you underestimate it! It provides many Pylons which can be used for many things to help make playing Minecraft easier.

To get started you'll need some Polished Blackstone to make them.

quests.title: Expulsion Pylon
quests.subtitle: Get off my lawn!
desc:
The Expulsion Pylon works as a way of keeping people off your lawn. 

When placed down it will keep any Players who aren't whitelisted from a set amount of Chunks around it. 

The Chunks are set in it's GUI in the top left from 1x1, 3x3, or 5x5 Chunks. 

Also no it can't be set too close to Spawn. We know what you trolls want and we ain't giving it! 

To Whitelist players check the Player Filter Quest!

quests.title: Interdiction Pylon
desc: This Pylon is all about blocking Mob Spawns.
You can use Mob Filters to block spawns of only certain Mobs or use the Lifeless Filter to block all Mob spawns!
You can stack multiple Mob Filters to block off more spawns. Plus you can change the Working Area for how far it blocks those Mob Spawns.
If you use the Lifeless Filter it will ignore all those settings.

quests.title: Harvester Pylon
desc: Harvester Pylons work as a very simple Auto-Farm. Put the Pylon on or in the Water Source and it will automatically harvest and replant Crops that are fully grown in the set area around it.
The area can be set to 3x3, 5x5, 7x7, or 9x9 Blocks around the Pylon.
It will need a Hoe to use on the Plants and will need an Inventory like a chest above it to put the Crops. Do all that and if it's turned On it will start farming!

quests.title: Infusion Pylon
desc:
The Infusion Pylon works similar as a Beacon just much better and cheaper! 
When a Potion Effect is put in by a Potion Filter, it will continuously give you the Potion Effect no matter where you are! 

You heard me right, no longer is there a set radius for the Infusion Pylon, now it will reach you wherever.

quests.title: Player Filter
desc:
The Explusion Pylon pushes players out of the area, but what if you want &lsome&r players nearby! Then you'll need a Player Filter. 

Right Click a Player with it to set them in it, and then put it into the Pylon to Whitelist them! 

So when everyone else is pushed out, your friend won't be! 

Also by default the Owner of the Pylon won't get expuled.

quests.title: Mob Filter
quests.subtitle: He's uninvited!
desc:
To set the Mob Filter you just have to click the Mob you never want to see again, with the Mob Filter. 

Each Filter can only hold 1 Mob so if you want Zombies, Skeletons, Spiders, Creepers, and Endermen to no longer spawn you'll need 5 Mob Filters. 

You can exchange the Mob in it by simplying clicking a different Mob with it.

quests.title: Potion Filter
desc:
In order to put Potion Effects into you'll need to fill a Potion Filter. 

To do so: have a Potion Effect on you, then right click with the Potion Filter to remove it from you and add it to the Filter, and repeat until it's filled and active. 

This also works with modded Potion Effects or ones you can't usually get through Potions like Haste or Resistance.

quests.title: Smart Filter
desc:
The Harvester Pylon needs a Hoe to work. 

(Hoes that can't break will work forever, Hoes that can will need to be replaced).

quests.title: Quest 5E02AE66
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks. 

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission. 

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: Lifeless Filter
quests.subtitle: Finally peace and quiet.
desc: With the Lifeless Filter you will never have to worry about any Mob spawns within a 25x25 Chunk area.
This doesn't include Forced Spawns though, that is Mobs spawned from Spawners or even Spawn Eggs!
The 25x25 will cover every distance Mobs spawn near the player. Hostile or Passive.
This includes every Y Level as well, above or below the Pylon, so no more worrying about lighting up caves!
There's no Whitelisting with this Filter, it will prevent every Mob Spawn.

quests.title: Infinite &9Water&r
quests.subtitle: Can be used as Reactor Coolant
desc:
Easy item to automate infinite &9water&r. 

Need more &9water&r? Make another!

quests.title: Personal Shrinking Device
quests.subtitle: Honey I Shrunk Myself
desc: Use this item to shrink. Helpful for working on automation and also just overall fun.

quests.title: Tool Belt
desc:
A quick way to switch between tools.

Upgrade with belt pouches in an anvil to increase capacity.

quests.title: Quest 0C856BBB
quests.subtitle: And Other Useful Items!
desc: On this page, you'll find some useful items and info to help you on your journey!

quests.title: Compasses for Searching
quests.subtitle: Helps Find Biomes/Structures
desc:
The Nature's Compass gives you a list of biomes you can search for.

Select a biome, then hit 'Search.' You'll see some info in the top left, and the compass will point in the direction of the biome.

The Explorer's Compass works the same but works for structures, instead of biomes.

quests.title: Crafting... on a Stick!
quests.subtitle: Less Placing, more Crafting
desc: Need a portable Crafting Table? How about a portable Smithing Table?
&l&8Crafting On A Stick&r adds portable versions of some of your favorite crafting stations! This is a must have in the early game.

quests.title: &l&2Easy Villagers
quests.subtitle: Villagers, made easy
desc:
In &l&2Vanilla&r, Villagers can be really frustrating to deal with. Cycling trades is not easy at all, and professions can sometimes be tough to deal with.

&l&2Easy Villagers&r is a mod to make all of it much easier to deal with! For starters, you can pick up a villager by sneak-right clicking them. They can then be easily placed in the world, or in specific blocks from the &l&2Easy Villager&r mod!

You can search &d@EasyVillagers&r in JEI to see blocks the mod offers!

quests.title: &l&cBuilding Gadgets&r
desc:
Diamonds also allow us to create some cool gadgets to help us build using the mod &l&cBuilding Gadgets&r.

These are great tools to help you build bigger bases, or for clearing out space using the &cDestruction Gadget&r.

You can even link these to an AE2 network by putting it into a Wireless Access Point!

quests.title: &l&7Functional Storage&r
quests.subtitle: Storage Drawers?
desc:
&l&7Functional Storage&r adds &7Drawers&r that can hold several stacks of an item. These can be upgraded to hold even more stacks!

This is great for items you get a lot of, like Cobblestone or Seeds!

quests.title: Quest 0152938E
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: Smart Filter
quests.subtitle: No more Annoying Traders!
desc:
Trapped Trader Carpets will kill any Wandering Traders that spawn near it instantly!

These might be the best items in the entire pack.

quests.title: &l&9Simple &4Magnets
desc:
Don't you hate when your breaking something and the Blocks fall just out of your reach! 

Well worry no more for we have &4Magnets&r! Simply Right Click while holding the &4Magnet&r to turn it on. Then, all dropped Items and Blocks in a 5 Block Radius will come to you. 

You can also equip the &4Magnet&r in your Curios to keep using it! 

If you don't wish to continue using the &4Magnet&r (I find this happens near Mob Farms) then just Right Click with it again to disable it. 

It can also be upgraded to increase the range!

quests.title: &l&6Iron Jetpacks
desc:
&6Jetpacks&r are a beloved way of getting around. 

To start making them you'll need to start with a &6Wood Jetpack&r! This can be upgraded all the way to a &5Creative Jetpack&r. 

While it does have many versions each work all the same. They all can be placed in your Chestplate Slot, or Back Curio, or Curio Curio. 

All of them also need FE to work, you can use any Item Charger to charge them! They will use FE to fly and yes you will drop if you run out of Energy. 
To fly you'll need to turn on your Engine (V), then when you hold Space you'll fly up and drop when you let go. 

For those who don't enjoy dropping, then you can turn on Hover (Unbinded), when set on you will Fly at the same altitude; being able to go higher with (Space) and lower with (Shift). 

To adjust how fast you fly, change your Throttle. Decreasing it is (,) by default and increasing it is (.) by default!

quests.title: &l&5Multi&f-&2Piston
desc:
The &5Multi&f-&2Piston&r is a confusing but helpful little Machine made for moving Blocks! 

Right Click the &2Piston&r to open its GUI, there we can set the Sides, Spacing, and Speed. 

The Sides are the Colors of the Piston: &eYellow&r is &eUp&r, &6Orange&r is &6Down&r, &9Blue&r is &9North&r, &2Green&r is &2East&r, &4Red&r is &4South&r, and &5Purple&r is &5West&r. 

You'll need to set the Colors of the Input and Output, which sides you want the Blocks to move from and to! 

Spacing is how many Blocks you want moved from that side, if you make it 3, it'll move 3 Blocks from one side to the other. If you set it to 30, 30 Blocks will be moved. 

Speed is just how quickly it moves them. 

It will need a &cRedstone Signal&r to actually work, and some Blocks like Chests, it can't move.

quests.title: &l&9Ranged Pump
desc:
The &9Ranged Pump&r is so special it gets its own Mod! 

The &9Pump&r will collect &9Water Sources&r beneath it and replace them with Stone. 
It does need Energy to work though, but it's worth it, it has a huge range! 

The &9Water&r collected in it will need to be Piped out.

quests.title: &l&bDis-Enchanting Table
desc:
The &bDis-Enchanting Table&r is a probably the most helpful Tip here. 

Simply put an Enchanted Item in the Left Slot and a Book in the Middle Slot. Then, the Enchants will go to the Right Slot in Book form! 

You can also use Enchanted Books instead of the Item to split up its Enchantments.

quests.title: &l&aCharging Gadgets
desc:
The &aCharging Station&r is a very helpful Early Game Block. 

It is clearly used for charging Items. Either Pipe in Energy or use Furnace Fuel to make Energy in the form of FE. 

Then, you can put any Item that needs charging into the Right most Slot.

quests.title: Mo' Professions
desc:
&l&2Modded Minecraft&r introduces us to new Villager Professions! 

Forge Hammer: &5Industrialist&r 

Charger: &bFluix Researcher&r 

Advanced Beehive: &6Beekeeper&r 

Coffee Maker: &9Engineer&r 

Arcane Core: &dShady Wizard&r 

Foragers Table: &aForager&r 

Powered Rolling Machine: &eCartman&r 
Manual Rolling Machine: &eTrackman&r 

Engineer's Workbench: &7Gunsmith&r 
White Banner: &7Outfitter&r 
Engineer's Circuit Workbench: &7Electrician&r 
Engineer's Crafting Table: &7Machinist&r 
Turntable: &7Structural Engineer&r 

Charging Station: &4Pressure Mechanic&r 

Saw: &8Carpenter&r

quests.title: &2Gorgon Temple
desc:
The &2Gorgon Temple&r is what safely holds one of the &2&lGorgon sisters&r. 

The &2Temples&r are massive &7Stone Brick&r Structures that spawn in &7The Other Soul Sand Valleys&r. 

Within them you'll need to flip the correct Levers in order to open the Staircase to the Basement where the &2&lGorgon&r lies.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_struct_gorgon.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: A &2&lGorgon
desc:
&2&lGorgons&r were vain women who were cursed for it. Now they have been turned into half Snake half Woman monsters with Snakes for hair. 

&2&lGorgons&r have 300 &4Hearts&f and 2 &7Armor Points&r. 

They have one very powerful Attack that will kill any Mob they see. Turning them into &7Stone Statues&r by looking into their Eyes. 

This Attack will turn any Mob into a &7Statue&r, this will kill the Mob but won't give Drops. This will also instantly kill the Player. 

Unless you wear a Blindfold! This will give you slight Blindness but will prevent instant Death. Besides that they can also just Hit you.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_gorgon.png width:100 height:150 align:center}

quests.title: &2Gorgon Head
desc:
The &2Gorgon Head&r is the confirmed and only Drop from the &2&lGorgon&r. 

It has only 1 use, when you use it, it will be voided. 

When you Hold Right Click with it while looking at a Mob, then let go, the Mob will be turned into a &7Stone Statue&r. 

The Mob will Die but won't give any Drops...

quests.title: &cSiren Island
desc:
&cSiren Islands&r show up in &7The Other Soul Sand Valley&r. 

They are pretty much just little Islands made of &7Stone Blocks&r, the only real unique part of them is the &cSirens&r! 

You might want to wear Earplugs first... their Songs are pretty catchy!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_struct_siren.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &cSirens
desc:
&cSirens&r look just like Mermaids, half Woman half Fish. 

The top half is the woman part by the way. And they will change form when aggrovated. 

They spawn in groups in &cSiren Islands&r. Don't worry, even being half Fish they can still move on Land to Kill you... just slower. 

They have 150 &4Hearts&r and no Armor. To make up for the lack of Armor they will &cHypnotise&r you with their Song if you aren't wearing Earplugs. 

Besides &cHypnotism&r, they also have some Attacks. In the &9Water&r they will charge at you and Bite you. On land they will smack you with their Claws.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_siren.png width:250 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &bShiny Scales
desc:
&cSirens&r on Death will Drop &3Prismarine Shards&f, &3Crystals&f, and... &bShiny Scales&r!!! 

The &bShiny Scales&r can be used to Craft a few Items, including: &9Tide Guardian Armor&f, &cSiren Flutes&f, and &9Water Breathing Potions&r. 

I am glad they are so abundant then!

quests.title: We haven't moved yet!
desc:
The &bHippocampus&r and &9Sea Serpents&r haven't been moved to &b&lThe Other&r yet! 
They are still found within &9Oceans&r within the &2&lOverworld&r!

quests.title: &bHippocampus
desc:
&bHippocampus&r are basically what we wish Seahorses were like. 

They have Heads and front Hooves like Horses while their back is more like Fish. Their whole Bodies are also covered in &bScales&r and Fins. 

They come in Red, Orange, Yellow, Light Green, Green, Light Blue, and Blue! 

&bHippocampus&r have 20 Hearts and are entirely Passive. They won't fight back! 

On Death they will Drop &bShiny Scales&r and very rarely their &bHippocampus Fin&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_hippocampus.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &9Sea Serpents
desc:
&9Sea Serpents&r are what Sailors tell stories of. Giant Monsters deep in the &9Ocean&r leaping out of the &9Water&r and devouring dozens of men with only one bite! 

&9Sea Serpents&r range from a few Blocks long to over 30! Their size also increases their &4Health&r from 50 to over 250 &4Hearts&r. 

Their appearance remains the same besides Color and Size. All have no limbs, only Head to Body to Tail. 

They have quite a few Attacks depending on your Range from them. If you are close to them, they'll Bite you which will deal quite a bit of Damage! If you are far they will shoot &9Water Streams&r at you which will do Damage over time. If you are out of the &9Water&r but within Range, they might leap into the air and dive at you! 

That Attack will deal a ton of Damage and Knockback every Mob nearby.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_serpent.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &bHippocampus Slapper
desc:
With a &bHippocampus Fin&r and a Stick, we can Craft the greatest Weapon in all of Modded &2&lMinecraft&r! 

The &bHippocampus Slapper&r! 

No, it won't do the most Damage... but it will inflict the Mobs hit with it with Slowness III and Nausea III! 

Okay, okay it isn't the greatest, it is more of a joke Weapon... but still!

quests.title: &aHydra Cave
desc:
Hidden within the &bAncient Warped Forests&r we can find &aHydra Caves&r. You're most likely to accidentally find one when you are wandering around, since they are so well hidden. 

They are little hollow hills within &bAncient Warped Forest&r with &7Stone Bricks&r and Skeleton Skulls within them. 

You won't find too much Loot within them, mostly just &7Manuscripts&r and Skulls. Rarely &eGold &for &aEmeralds&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_struct_hydra.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: The &a&lHydra
desc:
&a&lHydras&r are some of the toughest &b&lIce &fand &cFire&r has to offer. 

They can be Green, Teal, or Red. All are 3 Headed Lizards with no arms or legs. 

&a&lHydras&r have over 450 &4Hearts&r but only 2 &7Armor Points&r. 

They have quite a few Attacks with the simplest being a Bite. They can also use &aPoison Breath&r in front of them, similar to &dDragon's Breath&r. The most dangerous is when they use their &aVenom&r, which will make their other Attacks now inflict &aPoison&r! 

When enough Damage is dealt, &a&lHydras&r will lose a Head. Unless they are on &cFire&r, the Head will spawn 2 more in its place. The more Heads, the more Damage they can deal... let's prevent that! Because of that Regeneration they also gain back almost all Damage they take, so you'll definitely need some &cFire&r! 

By the way, they can have up to 9 Heads. Did I tell you to bring &cFire&r?
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_hydra.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &aHydra Heart
desc:
The &aHydra Heart&r is a very rare Drop from &a&lHydras&r but trust me, it is worth the effort! 

When it is within your Hotbar, including Main Hand, it will give you Regeneration. 
But wait, that Regeneration will increase in Levels the less &4Hearts&r you have!

quests.title: &aHydra Arrows
desc:
&aHydra Teeth&r are a common Drop from &a&lHydras&r. 

We can use them instead of Flint to instead of making normal Arrows we can make &aHydra Arrows&r. 

&aHydra Arrows&r will give the Mob they Hit, &aPoison&r, and will give you back some &4Health&r they took.

quests.title: &4Cyclop's Cave
desc:
&4Cyclops Caves&r are fortunately not beneath the Ground! Instead they spawn above Ground in &eThe Other Desert&r. 

You can recognize them by their look, which is just a big dome made entirely of &7Stone&r! 

Within the &4Cyclops Cave&r you'll find the &4&lCyclops&r and his Sheep! The Sheeps are within their pens and are either White or &eYellow&r. 

The Loot in the &4Cave&r is mostly related to the Sheep, from Wool to Shears, to even Mutton... On nicer terms there is also &eGold Piles&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_struct_cyclops.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: The &4&lCyclops
desc:
The &4&lCyclops&r can be found in or around their &4Caves&r. 

They are giant Human like beings. Around 10 Blocks tall and wear only a Wool kilt. Like Humans they can spawn with Beards or not, like some Humans and not others they only have 1 Eye, and definitely unlike all Humans they have a Horn on their head. 

&4&lCyclops&r have 650 &4Hearts&r and 20 &7Armor Points&r. 

They only have one Attack and that is to pick you up and Bite off your head. Yeah, this Attack does a ton of Damage and ignores Armor. 

They might also charge at you if you are far away. They can run through some Blocks like Leaves but the rest they'll get stuck on. 

Their only Attack is very close Ranged, so it is best to fight them from a distance with a Bow or Magic! If you are a good shot with the Bow, you can Hit them in the &4Eye&r (seems closer to the Horn) to Blind them! 

This will do 10 &4Hearts&r of Damage and will make it harder for them to find you.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_cyclops.png width:100 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: &4Eye of Cyclops
desc:
On Death the &4&lCyclops&r will Drop a few Sheep related Items like Mutton and Wool and even Leather? 

Very rarely though it might Drop its Skull or its &4Eye&r! 

The &4Eye of Cyclops&r, when held will make all Hostile Enemies that are near have Weakness II. 

I recommend holding it in your Offhand so your Main Hand can use your Weapons!

quests.title: &3Ampitheres
desc:
&3Amphitheres&r are giant Neutral half Bird half Snake Monsters found within &eThe Other Desert&r, most likely praised as Gods from Mesoamerican Tribes. 

They have the body of a Snake with the wings and head of a Bird. These wings allow them to Fly above the &eThe Other Desert&r. 

They also come in these Colors: Magenta, Red, Orange, Cyan, and Blue. 

They all have 50 &4Hearts&r with no Armor. They don't need Armor when they have Speed! 

When Flying they won't Attack you, even if you provoked them. Instead they will try running away. If you hit them with a Projectile though, they will come Crashing down and forced to stay on the Ground. 

On the Ground they will Bite you, Whip their Tail at you, and even use their powerful wings to throw gusts of wind at you!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_amphithere.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &9Sea Serpent Scales &fand &9Fangs
desc:
If you are sea-worthy enough to kill a &9Sea Serpent&r they will Drop their &9Fangs&f, as well as the &9Scales&r related to their Color. 

The &9Fangs &fand &9Scales&r will be needed to Craft &9Tide Arrows &fand &9Tide Tridents&r but only &9Scales&r are used for &9Tide Guardian Armor&r!

quests.title: &aGraveyard
desc:
&aGraveyards&r spawn commonly throughout the &3The Other&r. They look like Graveyards by the way. 

Here we can find naturally spawning &aCursed Chests &fand &aGraveyard Soil&r. 

We can also find &0Wither Roses&r and Skeleton Skulls, as well as Loot within the &aCursed Chest&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_struct_ghost.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &aGhosts
desc:
G-g-g-g-&aGhosts&r! will spawn either from a &aCursed Chest&r being Opened, or from &aGraveyard Soil&r at &9Nighttime&r. 

They are Glowing, transparent, and either White, &aGreen&f, or &bBlue&r. 

&aGhosts&r have 140 &4Hearts &fand 2 &7Armor Points&r. 

They will mostly just Hit you like Zombies to Attack you but unlike Zombies, &aGhosts&r can Fly and go through Blocks to keep Hitting you!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_ghost.png width:100 height:150 align:center}

quests.title: &eDeath Worms
desc:
&eDeath Worms&r are leach like Monsters burrowing through the Sands of the &eDesert&r. 

They have 3 Colors: White, Tan, and Red. They all have the same appearance though. A big toothy mouth, and a Body with dark Spikes on it. That's it! No eyes, noses, ears, or anything else really. 

They come in tons of different sizes, from barely a quarter of a Block in width, to 3x3 Blocks in width. Their size will determine their Health as well, from 50 &4Hearts &fto over 300 &4Hearts&r. All have 4 &7Armor Points&r though! 

All &eDeath Worms&r will dig under &eSand&r and charge at you through it when you are spotted. They will then come up to Bite you! If they are bigger in size some might even leap out of the &eSand&r and come crashing down at you. This will throw &eSand&r everywhere if they are big enough! 

You'll need to wait for them to come out of the &eSand&r to Attack them... or Light some &4T&0N&4T&r near them and they'll swallow it!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_worm.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &dPixie Village
desc:
While taking a stroll through a &cCrimson Forest&r you might hear some giggling. 

While it might be cute to hear at a park or at home, in the &cForests&r it is a little scarier! 

But don't you worry, that giggling is very friendly. It is from the &dPixies&r within the &dPixie Villages&r! 

&dPixie Villages&r are tiny Logs and Mushrooms that have been turned into housing for &dPixies&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_struct_pixie.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &dPixies
desc:
&dPixies&r are Winged, Glowing, tiny ladies who live within and around their &dPixie Villages&r! 

They look like Players just closer to a Vexes size. They also come in a few different Colors: Blue, Green, Yellow, Pink, and Purple. This will be important later. 

They only have 5 Hearts and are entirely Passive! Finally a nice Mob! 

Instead of slaughtering them (they don't seem to like it, they tend to complain) we can Tame them or enslave them! 

Don't worry you terrible immoral monsters, enslavement grants more Rewards than murder!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_pixie.png width:100 height:125 align:center}

quests.title: &8Trolls
desc:
All &8Trolls&r will have 500 &4Hearts &fand 10 &7Armor Points&r. 

They will swing their &8Weapons&r at you to deal a bit of Damage, but if they can't reach you they will smack the Ground with their &8Weapon&r to deal more Damage and Knockback! 

Thankfully &8Trolls&r have a weakness! Just like real life Trolls, they hate the &eSun&r and will turn to &7Stone&r when exposed to it! If only it wasn't always &9Nighttime&r in &b&lThe Other&r. 

All &8Trolls&r are around 4 Blocks Tall and have Tusks with Glowing Eyes. They also can all hold &8Troll Axes &fand &8Hammers&r. 

&8Forest Trolls&r have Grey Skin with no hair but Yellow Eyes. They will hold, along with the &8Axes &fand &8Hammers&r, &8Mossy Stone Columns&r and &8Tree Trunks&r. These spawn in &cAncient Crimson Forest&r. 
&8Frost Trolls&r have Light Blue/Grey Skin, with White hair. They will also hold &8Frosted Tree Trunks&f and &8Frosted Columns&r as Weapons. The spawn in &bAncient Warped Forests&r. 

&8Mountain Trolls&r look like a lighter version of &8Forest Trolls&r, but these ones will hold regular &8Stone Columns&r and won't hold &8Tree Trunks&r. These spawn in &3The Other&r Biome.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_troll.png width:100 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: &8Troll Leather &fand &8Tusks
desc:
Trolls can Drop a dozen different Items! These are mostly determined by their Biome. 

But all Trolls will Drop Tusks, their Leather, and their Weapons they hold. 

The Tusks and Leather are both used for Troll Leather Armor.

quests.title: &cFire Dragon Roost
desc:
&cFire Dragon Roosts&r are Nests found above the ground made of &cCharred Blocks&r and Ash. 

They will spawn with &lStage 1&r to &lStage 3 &cFire Dragons&r. And the bigger the &c&lDragon&r, the bigger the &cRoost&r! 

These &cRoosts&r will have Piles of &eGold&r along with Chests. The Chests will only hold up to &bDiamonds&r, but are still very helpful!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_struct_fireroost.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &bIce Dragon Roost
desc:
&bIce Dragon Roosts&r spawn above the ground as nests for the &lStage 1&r to &lStage 3 &bIce Dragons&r. 

They are made of &bFrozen Blocks&r which are basically just &bIce&r. 

They are full of Piles of &7Silver&r and have Chests, mostly with &7Silver&r in them.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_struct_iceroost.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &5Lightning Dragon Roost
desc:
&5Lightning Dragons&r will spend their days within their Roosts above the ground. 

They look just like &cFire Dragon Roosts&r, just instead of &cCharred&r it is &5Crackled&r! And instead of &eGold&r it is &6Copper&r! 

Yeah, the most difficult &5&lDragon&r gets the worst &6Ingot&r... makes sense. 

These will be where &lStage 1&r to &lStage 3&r spawn.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_struct_lightningroost.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &cFire Dragon Cave
desc:
Deep within the ground we can find a giantic &cCharred Cave&r. 

One dozens of Blocks long, wide, and high. Filled to the brim with &eGold&r and Chests. 

Because of the Dark more Mobs may spawn within. But within the Cave will lie the massive &c&lFire Dragon&r. 

The same exact ones that wrecked Villages in the Dark Ages. One more powerful than any above the surface. 

These are the &lStage 4&r and &l5 &cFire Dragons&r. 

They are what nightmares are made of.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_struct_firecave.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &bIce Dragon Cave
desc:
Those unfortunate enough to fall under the &bIce&r to around Y Level 0 might come accross a terrifying and cold Cave. 

A Cave full of slippery &bIce &fand &bIcicles&r pointing down at them. 

Of course a &bCave &rbelonging to the most powerful &b&lIce Dragons&r. The &lStage 4 &rand &l5 &bIce Dragons&r. 

Atleast it is also filled with &7Silver&r and Chests galore! 

And also Mobs including &8Frost Trolls&r...
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_struct_icecave.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &5Lightning Dragon Cave
desc:
I can tell from the spark in the Air, this isn't an &dAmethyst Geode&r, it is a &5Lightning Dragons Cave&r. 

More specifically a &lStage 4&r and &l5 &5Lightning Dragon&r. 

These &5Caves&r are full of &6Copper &fand &dAmethyst&r and Chests for tons of Loot. 

As well as Monsters and the &5&lDragon&r. Yeah, it is very hard to forget those!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_struct_lightningcave.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &lStage 1-3 &cFire Dragon
desc:
&lStage 1&r through &l3 &cFire Dragons&r will Spawn in &cFire Dragon Roosts&r. 

&c&lFire Dragons&r will come in these Colors: &4Red&f, &2Emerald&f, &6Bronze&f, and &8Grey&r. They also have 4 Horns on their Head and a club like Tail. 

&c&lFire Dragons&r can be found at Day Flying around Smoking all Mobs near their &cNests&r. Once you come close, they will Attack you. So what should you expect them to do? 

Their &cFire Attacks&f is &cFire Breath&r which only &lStage 2&r and above can use. This one will Shoot &cFlames&r at you Burning whatever is in its way. They also have a &cFireball Attack&r this is like the Ghast Fireball... just much worse! Only &lStage 3&r and above can use them. 

If you get close enough they might also Smack you with their Tail, Bite you, or thrash you around in their Mouth after Biting you. 

Want to try running? They'll Fly after you. Want to try hiding? They can Break Blocks with their Body! Sounds like you'll need to Fight! 

Early &lStages&r &cElemental Attacks&r aren't the biggest worry, rather it is their ability to Fly and follow you that is the worst. Either bring some way of preventing their escape like Chain Links, or use Projectiles to Attack them!
{@pagebreak}

Once you slay the &c&lFire Dragon&r it will lay unmoving on the ground as a Corpse. 

Right Click with an Empty Hand to remove its &cScales&r. Then, it will remove its &cFlesh &fand &cHeart&r. 

Or you can use an Empty Bottle to instead of getting &cScales&f, &cFlesh&f, and &cHeart&r you'll fill each Bottle with &cFire Dragon Blood&r. 

Once all of it is removed it will turn into the &7Skeleton&r of a Dragon. Just like the ones in the Wild, Right Click with an Empty Hand to take down the &7Bones&f and later &7Skull&r.

quests.title: &lStage 1-3 &bIce Dragon
desc:
&lStage 1&r through &l3 &bIce Dragons&r will Spawn in &bIce Dragon Roosts&r. 

&b&lIce Dragons&r come in &bBlue&f, White, &9Sapphire&r, and &7Silver&r Colors. They also have 6 Horns on their Head and another on their Nose. Plus a fan like Tail. 

&b&lIce Dragons&r can be found Flying or even Swimming around their &bIce Dragon Roosts&r in the Snowy Biomes. When they found an intruder they will use a dozen different terrifying Attacks to deal with you. Like... 

Their &bIcey Breath&r which will &bFreeze&r Players and Blocks in their way. Only &lStage 2&r and above &b&lIce Dragons&r can use &bIcey Breath&r. If that isn't enough, they can also Shoot an &bIceball&r at you. These will explode and &bFreeze&r every Mob nearby! Thankfully only &lStage 3&r and above can use this Attack. 

They don't just use &bElemental Attacks&r though, they can also Tail Whip you, Bite you, or mangle your Body with their Mouth! Plus Flapping their Wings to throw you back from them. 

Their &bIcey Attacks&r can &bFreeze&r and Damage you so it is best to avoid that as much as possible. Keep your range as much as you can and don't be afraid to seek shelter. Flying Pets won't help too much if they get &bFrozen&r in the Sky!
{@pagebreak}

After you survived fighting the &b&lIce Dragon&r and won, the &b&lIce Dragon&r will become a Corpse. Try not to lose it among the Snow and Ice. 

Then, Right Click the Corpse with an Empty Hand and it will remove the &bScales&f, &bFlesh&f, and &bHeart&r from the &b&lIce Dragon&r. 

Instead of Right Clicking with an Empty Hand, why not use an Empty Bottle! This will give us &bIce Dragon Blood&r instead of &bScales &for &bFlesh&r. 

Once all the tasty parts are removed, it will become a &7Dragon Skeleton&r. Then, you can remove the &7Bones&f and &7Skull&r, same way you got the &bScales &for &bBlood&r!

quests.title: &lStage 1-3 &5Lightning Dragon
desc:
&lStage 1&r through &l3 &5Lightning Dragons&r will Spawn in &5Lightning Dragon Roosts&r. 

They come in &9Electric Blue&r, &dAmethyst&f, &6Copper&f, and &0Black&r. &5Lightning Dragons&r have 6 Horns which are only on their Head, as well as having a Spiky Tail! 

Wait, these &5&lDragons&r aren't awake at &9Daytime&r! Oh they are Nocturnal! They will be Sleeping during the &eDay&r and hunting during &9Nighttime&r. They just Sleep standing which can get confusing. 

&5&lLightning Dragons&r are considered the strongest &5&lDragons&r simply for the Damage they can cause to the Player. Their &5Elemental Attacks&r won't cause an Effect like &bFreezing &for &cBurning&r, instead it will compensate with even more Damage! 

Their &5Lightning Breath&r will follow you wherever you are while their &5Lightning Ball&r will cause a huge Explosion! 

Don't worry that's not all they can do! They can also Hit you with their Spiky Tail, Bite you, rip you to shreds, and toss you back with the force of their Wings. 

It is best to fight &5&lLightning Dragons&r at &eDay&r so there is less Mobs and they will be asleep. You'll also want lots of Armor and Resistance to tank their Damage!
{@pagebreak}

You Killed one? A &5&lLightning Dragon&r? How? 

Well, if you aren't lying and they aren't just asleep they should be a Corpse now. 
Right Click the &5&lLightning Dragon&r Corpse with an Empty Hand to take off its &5Scales&f,&5 Flesh&f, and &5Heart&r. 

If you Right Click the Corpse with an Empty Bottle you won't get &5Scales&f, &5Flesh&f, or &5Hearts&r instead you'll get &5Lightning Dragon Blood&r. 

After you stripped it of its &5Scales &for &5Blood&r it will become a &7Dragon Skeleton&r. 

Just Right Click the &7Skeleton&r with an Empty Hand to get the &7Bones &fand &7Skull&r from your Kill!

quests.title: &lStage 4-5 &cFire Dragon
desc:
&lStage 4&r and &l5 &cFire Dragons&r are found sealed deep below the surface safely within their &cCaves&r. Only the dumbest would be willing to venture down there and fight them! 

The &cFire Dragon Caves&r are massive Structures but are still closed in. This means the &c&lDragon&r can't easily Fly away and escape... but neither can you. 
If you want to fight these massive &c&lDragons&r you will need the best Gear, Enchants, and Potions. Especially ones to prevent the &cBurning&r from Killing you! 
Their Attacks do more Damage as well as their &cElemental Attacks&r spreading and &cBurning&r even more than before! Not to forget them having the same &4Health&r as a &3&lWarden&r and &7Armor Points&r that match full &cNetherite&r! 

If you do Kill a &lStage 4&r or &l5 &cFemale Fire Dragon&r (and don't use Bottles on it) it might Drop an &cEgg&r. These &cDragon Eggs&r are much better than &2&lVanilla&r &dDragon Egg&r because...

quests.title: &lStage 4-5 &bIce Dragon
desc:
The toughest of &b&lIce Dragons&r are the ones who spawn in &bIce Dragon Caves&r, these are the highest &lStages&r at &lStage 4&r and &l5&r! 

Their &bIce Dragon Caves&r are massive with lots of pointy and &bIcey Blocks&r, so be careful with walking around. 

Oh yeah plus an &b&lIce Dragon&r, that one takes up the most room! Don't worry they won't be Flying or Swimming here, just Fighting! 

These &bElemental Attacks&r do even more Damage and &bFreeze&r even more Blocks and Mobs. As well as their normal Attacks doing much more Damage than before. 

And if the Damage isn't bad enough, they also has hundreds of &4Hearts&r and up to 20 &7Armor Points&r! These bad boys aren't kidding around! 

If the &b&lDragon&r you slay is &lStage 4&r or &l5&r, is Female, and you didn't use Empty Bottles you might get an &bIce Dragon Egg&r. These can be used with...

quests.title: &lStage 4-5 &5Lightning Dragon
desc:
Are you sure there's a &5&lDragon&r here? All I see is &9Electric Blue&f/&5Amethyst&f/&6Copper&f/&0Black&r? 

Wait... that is the &lStage 4&r or &l5 &5Dragon&r within the &5Lightning Dragon Cave&r! 

The &5Cave&r might be huge, but the &5&lDragon&r is almost the same size! This means the &5&lDragon&r won't be Flying around too much, but that does mean it will focus more on its Attacks. 

Yeah, judging by the fact that &5&lLightning Dragons&r do the most base Damage, and now they do even more Damage... you might be screwed. 

Take your time with fighting them, you can regen and respawn! They can't! 

When you Kill them and you didn't use Bottles on them, they might Drop a &5Lightning Dragon Egg&r. Oh yeah they have to be a Female for that as well... do I really need to tell you that only Females lay Eggs?

quests.title: &8Stymphalian Birds
desc:
&8Stymphalian Birds&r are apparently angry Birds made of &8Metal&r. At least, that is my presumption from being near and attacked by them. 

They are Brown Birds with &8Grey beaks &fand &8talons&r. They also move in groups and are all Hostile. 

&8Stymphalian Birds&r have 12 &4Hearts &fand 4 &7Armor Points&r. 

They have 2 Attacks: 1. is a very basic Attack of just spamming their &8Feathers&r at you. They don't do much Damage but have horrible Knockback and are fast! 2. is just a simple Bite which will do more Damage than &8Feathers&r. 

They can also fly at you or retreat very quickly! 

One &8Bird&r by itself isn't much of a problem, but they don't usually come by themselves! It is best to take them on one at a time and quickly get close to them.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_bird.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &c&lFire DragonForge
desc:
The &c&lFire DragonForge&r is a 3x3x3 Multiblock of &cDragon Parts&r! 

First layer starts with a Cross of &cFire DragonForge Bricks&r. Then, fill the corners with &7Dragon Bone Blocks&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/chap3_fire1.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

Second layer will have the &cFire DragonForge Core&r in the center with a &cDragonForge Aperature&r next to it within the middle of a wall. And fill the rest of the layer with &cFire DragonForge Bricks&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/chap3_fire2.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
Last layer is a repeat of the first layer!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/chap3_fire4.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
{@pagebreak}

The &c&lFire DragonForge&r is a Multiblock. Wait, I thought we were supposed to be Fighting and playing with Monsters? 

Once it is Built we can place our Items in the &c&lFire DragonForge&r. Either &7Iron &fand &cFire Dragon Blood&r or Alloy Materials. 

Then, we will need some &cHeat&r! Preferably from a &c&lFire Dragon&r! 

We can use a &c&lTamed Fire Dragon&r which is nearby to &cHeat &rit, or Chain up a &c&lWild Fire Dragon&r near the &c&lDragonForge&r. 

Wild or Tamed, the &cFire Breath&r will Hurt if you walk through it.

quests.title: &b&lIce DragonForge
desc:
The &b&lIce DragonForge&r is a 3x3x3 Multiblock made of &b&lIce Dragon&r Drops and &bBricks&r! 

The first layer starts with a Cross made of &bIce DragonForge Bricks&r. To fill in the square we'll need &7Dragon Bone Blocks&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/chap3_ice1.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

The second layer is more tricky. Place the &bIce DragonForge Core&r in the dead center, with an &bIce DragonForge Aperature&r next to it. The rest of this layer is made of just &bIce DragonForge Bricks&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/chap3_ice2.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
Remember the first layer? Let's redo that, just on top now!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/chap3_ice4.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
{@pagebreak}

The &b&lIce DragonForge&r uses the internal insulation of &b&lIce Dragons&r to &bFreeze&r Items so cold that they forge together! 

Whether &7Iron &fand &bIce Dragon Blood&r to make &bIce Dragon Steel&r or other Alloy Items! 

We'll need to throw those Items into the &b&lDragonForge&r, and then Cool it down. 

Wait, &3Blue Ice&r isn't enough? What's even &bColder&r than &3Blue Ice&r? 

&bIce Dragon Breath&r! We can use any &b&lIce Dragon&r nearby for it, whether Tamed on its own accord or Wild and Chained up.

quests.title: &5&lLightning DragonForge
desc:
Hope you got Rubber Gloves to Build this 3x3x3 Multiblock! You don't? Oh well! 

First, place down a cross of &5Lightning DragonForge Bricks&r with &7Dragon Bone Blocks&r next to them.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/chap3_light1.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
Then, place a &5Lightning DragonForge Core Block&r in the middle. Next to it, place a &5Lightning DragonForge Aperature&r and fill in the rest with &5DragonForge Bricks&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/chap3_light2.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
The last layer looks familiar... Probably because it is just the first layer!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/chap3_light4.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
{@pagebreak}

Some Items will need to be &5Zapped&r with Energy to be forced together! No, not FE, AE, or MF... what will we need? 

So why not use the &dMagic &fof &5&lDragons&r! With the &5&lLightning DragonForge&r! 

Place the Items into the &5&lDragonForge&r and &5Zap&r it with the &5Lightning Attacks&r of the &5&lLightning Dragon&r. 

The &5&lDragon&r can be Tamed or Wild, but Wild aren't the nicest or calmest... so let's make sure they can't run off by using Chain Links!

quests.title: &8Stymphalian Dagger
desc:
With 2 &8Stymphalian Feathers&r (and a Stick) we can Craft a &8Stymphalian Dagger&r! 

It only does as much Damage as an Iron Sword but much faster Attack Speed. 

Almost twice as fast as normal Swords, and three times as fast as an Axe!

quests.title: &8Stmphalian Arrows
desc:
&8Stymphalian Feathers&r can be used to make Arrows instead of Chicken Feathers to make &8Stymphalian Arrows&r. 

These Arrows are harder to Craft but will make up for it! 

The Arrows fly faster, farther, and won't drop as quickly.

quests.title: &cSiren Flute
desc:
To make the &cSiren Flute&r you'll need the previously mentioned &bShiny Scales&r, plus a &cSiren Tear&r. 

&cSiren Tears&r are rare Drops from &cSirens&r and will make the &cFlute&r or the Banner. 

The &cSiren Flute&r will basically give Weakness 1 Million to the Mob you are looking at. They will fall in Love, and when in Love they won't Attack you. 

The &cFlute&r does have a Cooldown though.

quests.title: &aPhantasmal Blade
desc:
&aPhantasmal Ingots&r (and &aEctoplasm&r) are Drops only from &aGhosts&r that spawn from &aGraveyard Soil&r. 

We can combine a &aPhantasmal Ingot&r with a &7Dragon Bone Sword&r to Craft the &aPhantasmal Blade&r! 

Currently, it Attacks like a normal Sword, but when fixed it will shoot out toward Mobs Hitting them even through Blocks!

quests.title: &mManatee&r &bHippocampus&r Taming
desc:
&bHippocampus&r can be Tamed! By Feeding it Kelp. 

Once Tamed, we can Right Click them with a Saddle, to be able to Ride them like a Horse. 

They can Crawl slowly on land or Swim quickly &9Underwater&r. When &9Underwater&r on their Back, you'll get &9Water Breathing&r! 

They can even Jump! Just not too high...

quests.title: &9Tide Arrows
desc:
With &9Sea Serpent Scales &fand &9Fangs&r plus a Stick we can make a &9Tide Arrow&r. 

These work just like normal Arrows but won't be slowed down by &9Water&r.

quests.title: &9Tide Trident
desc:
&9Tide Tridents&r are exactly like Tridents, just better in every way! 

These are Craftable, have more Damage, and pierce Mobs! 

And they still take normal Trident Enchants. 

What more could you want!

quests.title: &8Troll Weapons
desc:
All &8Trolls&r will hold Weapons. They use these &8Weapons&r to try and Kill you. 

Very rarely they'll Drop their &8Weapon&r upon Death. 

All these &8Weapons&r are massive! Yet the Player can still Hold and Use them! They do a ton of Damage but are very slow to Swing.

quests.title: &8Troll Leather Armor
desc:
&8Troll Leather Armor&r is made from the certain Biomes of &8Trolls&r. The different Biome doesn't change anything besides the look. 

Each full set will give the &7Armor Points&r between Iron and &bDiamond&r, at 17 total &7Armor Points&r. 

Each of the &8Armor&r will take less Projectile Damage though! Kinda like having Projectile Protection on all your Armor while also being able to get Protection! 

Plus you'll look like a &8Troll&r!

quests.title: &eDeath Worm Gauntlet
desc:
With some &eDeath Worm Chitin &fand &eDeath Worm Tongues&r (plus a Chain Line) we can make &eDeath Worm Gauntlets&r! 

These basically act as the dangerous parts of &eDeath Worms&r. 

We can Right Click to send the &eDeath Worm Tongue&r toward Mobs. If it hits them, it'll deal some Damage and pull them toward you. 

Unfortunately it does have a Cooldown... the &eTongue&r needs to go back in.

quests.title: &eDeath Worm Chitin
desc:
All &eDeath Worms&r will Drop &eChitins&r related to their Color. 

&eChitins&r can be used to Craft &eDeath Worm Chitin Armor &for &eDeath Worm Gauntlets&r! 

You'll need to use the same Color &eChitins&r for both of those though, no mix-n-matching.

quests.title: &eDeath Worm&r Surfing!
desc:
We can Tame &eDeath Worms&r by obtaining a &eDeath Worm Egg&r, by Killing &eDeath Worms&r. Just toss the &eEgg&r like a Chicken Egg and it'll spawn a &eTamed Death Worm&r. 
&eTamed Death Worms&r won't act like normal Pets though, they won't follow or protect you... what do they do? 

For one, they'll grow up overtime gaining more &4Hearts&r and size! 

Also they will wander a certain range from where they were Spawned from. Within that area they won't Attack you or any Passive Mobs, but will Attack Hostile ones! 

We can also use a Fishing Rod in both Hands, to Ride &eDeath Worms&r, even if they aren't Tamed! 

We can Ride them like Horses but we also get an Attack we can use with them by Pressing (G). This Attack is the same way &eGiant Death Worms&r will use!

quests.title: Hippogryth
desc:
Hippogryths are mixtures of Horses and Eagles. Their back half is that of a Horse and their front half is like an Eagle. 

They are very fast Flyers because of their Wings, they also have 20 &4Hearts&r. 

Hippogryths won't come charging for a Fight but if you get too close they will defend themselves. They will use their Claws to deal a bit of Damage or Kick you high in the air to take Fall Damage. 

Might be better to try and Tame them... unless you really want the Hippogryth Talon Sword.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_hippogryth.png width:130 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Rule the &bSkys&r with the Hippogryth
quests.title_plain: Rule the Skys with the Hippogryth
desc:
Hippogryths can be Tamed! 

Just from a distance with Rabbit Feet. Toss some Rabbit Feet near them and they will Eat it. 

They are like most Tame by Food Mobs, who knows how many they need! They might only want 1 Rabbit Foot while another might need an entire Stack of Rabbits Feet! 

Once they lay down, that is how you know they are Tamed. Then, you can Shift Right Click it to open its Inventory. Now we can give it Saddles to Ride it, Chests to Store Items, and even Armor! 

When Flying you can use Space Bar to Fly up, this needs time to accelerate. WASD to move forward, back, left, or right. And (X) to go down. 

We can even use (G) to Attack Mobs like with a &eDeath Worm&r!

quests.title: Hippogryph Sword
desc:
The Hippogryth Talon is a rare Drop from when a Hippogryth dies. 

We can use it to make a Sword! 

This Sword is very similar to an Iron Sword, but will always do a Sweeping Attack. 

This will Hit every Mob nearby in Range, not just one! Most Swords only do it at a full charge, but the Talon Sword doesn't wait! 

This will do more Damage making it closer to a Diamond Sword.The Hippogryth Talon is a rare Drop from when a Hippogryth dies. 

We can use it to make a Sword! 

This Sword is very similar to an Iron Sword, but will always do a Sweeping Attack. 

This will Hit every Mob nearby in Range, not just one! Most Swords only do it at a full charge, but the Talon Sword doesn't wait! 

This will do more Damage making it closer to a Diamond Sword.

quests.title: &3Amphithere Arrows
desc:
&3Amphithere Arrows&r are made by replacing the Chicken Feather with an &3Amphithere Feather&r. 

These &3Arrows&r are basically Punch II within their own! 

When a Mob is Hit with one, they will be Knockbacked and will be sent upwards. 

I've heard if you use &3Amphithere Arrows&r on a Punch II Bow, the Mob will explode when Hit! (This is a lie).

quests.title: &3Amphithere Macuahuitl
desc:
The Macuahuitl was a Weapon used by many Mesoamerican Tribes. It was usually a Club with &5Obsidian Shards&r casted into it. 

&5Obsidian&r in real life is much more fragile, and sharp than in &2&lMinecraft&r. When people were hit with Macuahuitls they would be torn apart with the &5Obsidian&r and the chunks of it would break off in them doing irreparable Damage! 

The &3Amphithere Macuahuitl&r is used and made similar to real life, but the &3Amphithere Feathers&r just make it even more powerful! 

Now, it will toss your Enemies back and stun them so hard they can't even defend themselves with a Shield!

quests.title: Taming the &3Amphithere
desc:
Taming an &3Amphithere&r is similar to how Humans Tamed Wolves into Dogs. It involves a lot of biting... 

First, you'll need to hit a &3Flying Amphithere&r with a Projectile to knock it out of the &bSky&r. 

Then, you can Right Click it to hop on its Back. Like you would with a Horse! But this Horse will swing its head back to Bite you. 

In order to Tame it, you'll need to Survive each Bite and stay on it. In time it will give up and love you. 

Once they love you, you can Ride them! The Controls are a bit wonky but once you play with them a bit (and read this Querst) hopefully you'll understand them better! 

When Riding, you can Press and Hold Space to make the &3Amphithere&r Fly upwards. This will make it Fly directly up from where it is at. When you let go, it will start Dropping back to the Ground. 

When Flying you can use WASD to move in each direction, but you can also use your Mouse Cursor to direct it to Glide upwards or downwards when not using the Space Bar. 

Like &eDeath Worms&r, when Riding you can use (G) to Attack with the &3Amphithere&r.

quests.title: &8Cockatrice
desc:
You ever hear people say that Birds are the closest relatives to Dinosaurs? Well, the &0Cockatrice&r is why they say that! 

&0Cockatrice&r have the shape and killing power of Raptors from Jurassic Park, while looking almost exactly like Chickens! 

Technically they are Neutral and have 140 &4Hearts&r with 2 &7Armor Points&r. 

They are Neutral like &5Endermen&r, don't Hit them, try to Hit them, or look into their Eyes. 

Yes, &0Cockatrice Eyes&r are deadly, if you look into them you'll get &0Wither&r, Nausea, Slowness, and Weakness. You can wear a Blindfold to block their &0Eye Attack&r but then, they will take that as a threat and use their other Attack. Which is to just Kick you. 

I don't even blame them, the only reason you'd wear a Blindfold is to kill a &2&lGorgon&r or a &0Cockatrice&r, and I don't see any Gorgons around here!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iceandfire/iaf_cockatrice.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &8Cockatrice Specter
desc:
The &0Cockatrice Specter&r is made from &0Cockatrice Eyes&r and &0Wither&r parts. Wait another Eye? Why are we collecting Eyes? 

With the &0Specter&r we can give (some) Mobs &0Wither&r III for 2 Seconds. 

It has a range of about 20 Blocks and does have a Cooldown.

quests.title: &0Rotten Egg
desc:
Sometimes Chicken Eggs may be special. Like having 2 Yolks or Hatching 4 Chickens! Or Hatching Dinosaurs! 

Wait... what? 

Sometimes Chickens will lay &0Rotten Eggs&r. &0Rotten Eggs&r can be thrown to Hatch a &0Baby Cockatrice&r! 

These &0Baby Cockatrices&r will automatically be Tamed and will need to grow up.

quests.title: Won the staring contest
desc:
We can Tame &0Cockatrice&r in 2 different ways. 1. &0Rotten Egg&r 2. Hard work. 

Toss a &0Rotten Egg&r to get a &0Baby Cockatrice&r that is tamed. Or survive staring at a &0Cockatrice&r for long enough. 

&0Tamed Cockatrice&r will not Hurt you when you look in their &0Eyes&r, actually they'll defend you! 

Like Dogs they will Attack Monsters, Kill whatever Attacks you, and even use their &0Eye Beams&r on them!

quests.title: In game Guide
desc:
The &4Bestiary&r is the Guide for &b&lIce &fand &cFire&r... 

Okay, is mine broken? Why is it empty? 

We'll need the &4Bestiary Lectern&r in order to add &7Manuscripts&r to it to get pages of the Monsters. 

Just toss both the &4Bestiary&r and some &7Manuscripts&r into the &4Bestiary Lectern&r and select which you want to learn about. This will use up the &7Manuscripts&r and add to your Guide.

quests.title: Befriending &dPixies
desc:
Apparently &dPixies&r like Cake. If you hand it to them by Dropping it right at them, they'll become your Friend! 

When they are your Friend, they will Follow you, unless told to Sit and stay. 

Here is when their Colors become important, because each Color will give a different Effect to you when near and befriended! 

&bBlue&r: gives Speed. 

&dPink&r: gives Strength. 

&eYellow&r: gives Haste. 

&aGreen&r: gives Luck. 

&5Purple&r: gives Jump Boost.

quests.title: Enslavement of &dPixies
desc:
Jars can be used to capture and enslave &dPixies&r. Yes, of course one of the only Passives Mob in &b&lIce &fand &cFire&r we'll put through slavery! 

If it makes you feel better, atleast they make 1 &dPixie Dust&r every few Days. 
First, simply use the Jar on a &dPixie&r and they'll get Captured in it. 

Then, you can Break it to set them free or leave it and wait to get &dPixie Dust&r. 

You'll know &dPixie Dust&r is ready when they are Sitting Down! Just Right Click them to collect it.

quests.title: &dPixie Wand
desc:
Very rarely &dPixies&r might lose their &dWings&r on Death. They won't need them anymore, they're Dead... but you should still feel bad for Killing them! 

Or instead of grieving the loss of innocent life you can Craft a Weapon with their remains! 

Man, you are such a monster. 

The &dPixie Wand&r will use up &dPixie Dust&r to Shoot a &dPixe Beam&r! These will Damage and give Levitation and Glowing to whatever they Hit.

quests.title: &c&lDragons&r and their &lStages
desc:
&c&lDragons&r are only the most dangerous and important Monsters in all of &b&lIce &fand &cFire&r! 

The Element of &c&lDragon&r determines what Biome they spawn in. 

They have different Stages (1 through 5). These determine their &4Health&r, Damage, Drops, and Spawns. 

We'll need to find, kill, and even Tame some in order to get some of the best Loot in &6&lATM10&r! 

Try finding some deceased &c&lDragons&r first in order to get their &7Bones&r.
{@pagebreak}

&lStages 1-3&r will spawn in &cRoosts&r while &lStage 4&r and &l5&r spawn in &cCaves&r. Only &l4&r and &l5&r will Drop &cEggs&r. The higher the &lStage&r, the darker their Colors and bigger their Size! 

&lStage 1&r: will have from 50 &4Hearts &fto 350 &4Hearts&r as well as 2 &7Armor Points&r to 6! &lStage 1&r will only be able to Bite their opponents, they can't use their &cElemental Breath&r. 

&lStage 2&r: have 350 &4Hearts &fto 600 &4Hearts&r. They can also have 6 &7Armor Points&f to 10 &7Armor Points&r. Now they can use &cElemental Breath&r to Fight. 

&lStage 3&r: can have 600 &4Hearts &fto 900 &4Hearts&r with 10 to 12 &7Armor Points&r. Now these &c&lDragons&r will have all their Attacks from &cElemental Breath&f to their &cElemental Charges&r. 

&lStage 4&r: will keep all the same Abilities and Attacks as well as now Dropping &cEggs&r. &lStage 4&r will have between 900 &4Hearts&r all the way to 1200! Plus an additional 12 to 16 &7Armor Points&r. 

&lStage 5&r: only the biggest and most powerful &c&lDragons&r. These can have 1200 to 1500+ &4Hearts&r! With 16 to 20 &7Armor Points&r. Basically wearing &cNetherite Armor&r, because they are that powerful!

quests.title: Cooking your &cEgg
desc:
Hatching a &c&lFire Dragon&r is pretty easy. 

SET THE &cEGG&r ON &cFIRE&r! 

Easiest way is Placing the &cEgg &fon &cNetherrack&r then setting it on &cFire&r with Flint and Steel. 

After 6 Minutes the &cEgg&r will Hatch and your &c&lBaby Fire Dragon&r will Spawn Tamed to you! 

And no, the &c&lBaby&r won't take Damage from &cFire&r, it is a &c&lFire Dragon&r!

quests.title: Ice Bucket Challenge!
desc:
&bIce Dragon Eggs&r are the opposite from &cFire Dragons&r. 

Instead of needing the warm loving embrace of &cFire&r, they need the cold desolute isolation of &bIce&r! 

Throw an &bIce Dragon Egg&r in some &9Water&r and it will &bFreeze &fthe &9Water&r. 

After 6 Minutes it will Hatch from the &bEgg &fand &bIce&r! 

Don't worry they can get out of both without assistance.

quests.title: Leave your &5Egg&r in the Rain
quests.title_plain: Leave your Egg in the Rain
desc:
&bIce Dragons&f need &bIce&r, &cFire Dragons &fneed &cFire&r, what does the &5Lightning Dragon Egg&r need to be left outside in the Rain! 

Oh wait it actually does? 

Just leave the &5Lightning Dragon Egg&r out on the Ground exposed to the &bSky&r, and when it Rains it will begin Hatching. 

After 6 Minutes of constant Rain, &5Lightning&r will Strike the &5Egg &fand the &5&lLightning Dragon&r will Hatch. 

The &5Lightning&r can start a &cFire&r, which can Hurt the &5&lBaby&r, so you want to be careful with that!

quests.title: Taming &b&lIce &fand &cFire&r Mobs
desc:
There's dozens of Pets and Tamed Mobs within &b&lIce &fand &cFire&r. Thankfully almost all can be controlled in the same way! 

With a Stick! 

By Right Clicking on a Tamed Mob with a Stick we can change their instructions. 

All have different instructions but the list is: Sitting/Staying, Wandering, Patrolling, and Following/Escorting. 

Sitting will keep the Mob where it is. They won't Move or Fight other Mobs unless Hurt where they will stop Sitting. 
Wandering will let the Mob move freely around where you are at. If the Tamed Mob likes to Attack Mobs, then it will do so when Wandering. 

Patrolling will have the Mob walk only in a certain distance from its set Home. So like Wandering just not around you, instead it is around its Home! 

Following will have the Mob follow you wherever you go! 

You can set a Tamed Mobs Home by Shift Right Clicking them with a Stick.

quests.title: Commanding your &c&lDragon
desc:
The &c&lDragon&r is now ours! How do we use it? 

First, we'll need some Tools! The &7Dragon Command Staff&r, to give it instructions. The &7Dragon Horn&r to hold and transport &c&lDragons&r. And the &7Dragon Flute&r to call &c&lFlying Dragons&r down. 

You can Shift Right Click &c&lDragon&r to view its Inventory and UI. Here we see its Age, &4Health&f, &lStage&r and change its Inventory. What Armor it is wearing and if it is wearing Banners! 

We can use the &7Dragon Command Staff&r on them to change if they are Escorting, Wandering, or Staying. Escorting means they will follow you and Fight with you. Wandering means they will Fly around a certain area, Atacking any Monsters within it. Staying just means it will Sit where it is and do nothing! 

The &7Dragon Horn&r can be used on a &c&lDragon&r to put them in it. Here they will safely and compactly be held in the Item where you can see its Age, Gender, and Name. 

The last Item, the &7Dragon Flute&r is used for all Tamed Flying Mobs. If they are Flying when you use the &7Flute&r, they will come down to the ground.

quests.title: Feeding your &c&lDragon
desc:
&c&lTamed Dragons&r will Grow over time. Increasing in &lStage&r, &4Hearts&f, &7Armor&r, and more! 

It will take Time... and we don't like that. 

Make some &cDragon Meal&r then! 

When a &c&lTamed Dragon&r Eats some &cDragon Meal&r they will Age a few Days in just a Bite!

quests.title: Chain
desc:
Leads can be helpful, but they are very Weak! 

Why not get an upgrade? 

Chain Links will Tie to Mobs (including dangerous ones like &c&lDragons&r) and can be used to move them. 

Or restrain them like Leads by attaching the Chain Link to a Wall. Yes, like a Stone Wall! 

No matter how much the Mob tries to escape the Link won't break! 

If you do use it on a &c&lDragon&r though, make sure your walls cannot be broken by &c&lDragons&r...

quests.title: &cFire Dragonsteel
desc:
&cFire Dragonsteel&r is made by combining &cFire Dragon Blood&r and &7Iron&r in a &c&lFire DragonForge&r. 

We can make Weapons with it! These will deal a ton of Damage, plus will Knockback Mobs and set them on &cFire&r. 

Along with the Weapons also comes Armor. This Armor gives a ton of Stats, and looks great! Plus it Protects us extra from the &cDragons Elemental Attacks&r! 

Why just get Armor for us though? What about our &c&lDragons&r too! This costs a ton more, but will give a ton of Protection for your &c&lDragon&r especially against other &c&lDragons&r.

quests.title: &bIce Dragonsteel
desc:
&bIce Dragonsteel&r is made by combining&b Ice Dragon Blood&r and &7Iron&r in a &b&lIce DragonForge&r. 

We can make Weapons with it! These will deal a ton of Damage, plus &bFreeze&r Mobs that are Hit. 

Along with the Weapons also comes Armor. This Armor gives a ton of Stats, and looks great! Plus it Protects us extra from the &bDragons Elemental Attacks&r! 

Why just get Armor for us though? What about our &b&lDragons&r too! This costs a ton more, but will give a ton of Protection for your &b&lDragon&r especially against other &b&lDragons&r.

quests.title: &5Lightning Dragonsteel
desc:
&5Lightning Dragonsteel&r is made by combining &5Lightning Dragon Blood&r and &7Iron&r in a &5&lLightning DragonForge&r. 

We can make Weapons with it! These will deal a ton of Damage, plus will Summon &5Lightning&r on every Hit. 

Along with the Weapons also comes Armor. This Armor gives a ton of Stats, and looks great! Plus it Protects us extra from the &5Dragons Elemental Attacks&r! 

Why just get Armor for us though? What about our &5&lDragons&r too! This costs a ton more, but will give a ton of Protection for your &5&lDragon&r especially against other &5&lDragons&r.

quests.title: &9Tide Guardian Armor
desc:
&9Tide Guardian Armor&r is made from &bShiny Scales&r and &9Sea Serpent Scales&r. 

The Color of &9Sea Serpent Scales&r will determine the Color of &9Tide Guardian Armor&r. And no Color mixing! 

The total Armor Points from the &9Tide Guardian Armor&r is 23, which is more than even &cNetherite&r! 

Each piece of Armor also gives you &9Water Breathing&r. Even if you use just the &9Boots&r. They also give a level of &4Strength&r for each piece of Armor worn. Full set giving &4Strength IV&r!

quests.title: Quest 3D88FEFA
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &b&lIce &fand &cFire&r
desc:
Welcome to &b&lIce &fand &cFire&r! Now in &b&lThe Other&r 

This Mod adds countless Monsters and Mobs, all either related to some form of Mythology or some are entirely unique to the Mod! 

You'll find these Monsters all over &b&lThe Other&r, but be careful, not all of them are friendly!

quests.title: &3The Other
quests.subtitle: The Biome
desc:
&3The Other&r, different from &b&lThe Other&r. &3The Other&r is the Biome, while &b&lThe Other&r is the Dimension. 

See how helpful the Color and Bold is? 

The Biome is made of &3Ancient Trees&r and &3Ancient Grass&r. As well as having massive Mountains to help distinguish them. 

I think the Color of this Biome fits &3Ancient Stone&r the best!

quests.title: &7The Other Soul Sand Valley
desc:
No, not like in &c&lThe Nether&r. Okay well it is like the one in &c&lThe Nether&r. 

It is full of &7Soul Sand&r. 

Just take out the Fossils and add more Holes and you'll get this one! 

Plus it is in &b&lThe Other&r!

quests.title: &bAncient Warped Forest
desc:
The &bAncient Warped Forest&r is another Forest within &b&lThe Other&r. 

It has a &bWarped Nylium&r floor with &cNetherrack&r below it. 

Instead of &bWarped Trees&r/Mushrooms/whatever, it has &bSoul Trees&r!

quests.title: &eThe Other Desert
desc:
&eThe Other Desert&r is the easiest Biome in &b&lThe Other&r to identify. It is flat, &eSandy&r, and flat. 

It is made of &eSand&f, &eSandstone&r, and whatever is beneath it. Plus you can find &4Cyclops Caves&r here. 

There is no Cacti or Dead Bushes but there are more &b&lIce &fand &cFire&r Mobs here than any other Biome!

quests.title: &cAncient Crimson Forest
desc:
A rival to the &bAncient Warped Forest&r. 

This &cForest&r has a &cCrimson Nylium&r ground also with &cNetherrack&r below. 

Instead of &bSoul Trees&r though, this &cForest&r has &cDemonic Trees&r. Ouuu scary!

quests.title: &eSpellBooks&r!
desc:
&eSpellbooks&r! Where else would you put &3Spells&r? 

You can add &3Scrolls&r to a &eSpellbook&r by putting both into an Inscription Table. They have a certain amount they can hold but no longer having to worry about Rarity. 

When &3Scrolls&r are added to your &eSpellbook&r they won't be consumed but rather Mana will be consumed.

quests.title: Ancient Codex
desc:
A Craftable &eSpell Book&r... yeah it's not easy to craft. 

Hardest to get would be the Ruined Book, which you can find in &9Ancient City&r Chests. &4Blood Vials&r can be obtained from either putting a Mob (or even yourself) into a Cauldron above a Campfire or an Alchemical Cauldron. &5Bottle O' Lightning&r comes from using a Bottle on a Charged Creeper. 

Once you do all that you can craft the Ancient Codex. Its 12 &3Spell&r Slots is very helpful!

quests.title: &6Allthemodium&r Spell Book
desc:
Combine an Ancient Codex with an &6Allthemodium Ingot&r and Template in a Smithing Table.

You can get the Template from Brushing Suspicious Clay in an &9Ancient City&r.

quests.title: &3Vibranium&r Spell Book
desc:
Combine the &6Allthemodium&r &eSpell Book&r with a Vibranium Ingot and Template in a Smithing Table.

This template can be obtained from Brushing Suspicious Soul Sand in a Bastion.

quests.title: &5Unobtainium&r Spell Book
desc:
The best &eSpell Book&r you can imagine! 15 &3Spell&r Slots! Are there even 15 &3Spells&r?!?! Oh wait yeah there is 15 isn't that much... 

Do the same as before: previous Book, Ingot, and Template.

quests.title: Flimsy Journal
desc:
The most basic &eSpellbook&r, which also makes it the cheapest! 

It can only hold a total of 5 &3Spells&r.

quests.title: Ironbound Journal
desc:
Not much better than the Flimsy one... 

This can hold a single &3Spell&r more than the Flimsy Journal! That's one more very powerful &3Spell&r at the ready!

quests.title: Apprentice's Spell Book
desc:
Another craftable &eSpellbook&r, this one's a little more expensive! It'll need Hogskin which is a drop from Hoglins. 

This one can hold 8 &3Spells&r which is technically still on the low side but it's better!

quests.title: Enchanted Spell Book
desc:
Another Craftable &eSpell Book&r and following the pattern this one is even more expensive. It requires Arcane Clothes, Gold, and an Enchanted Book. It's not picky on which Book just needs to be Enchanted! 

It has 10 &3Spell&r Slots and grants a huge Mana Boost!

quests.title: Rotten Spell Book
desc:
It's here! It's there! It's everywhere and it's rotten! You can find these in most Chests. 

They can hold 8 &3Spells&r but give you less Spell Resistance.

quests.title: &aGrimore of Evokation
desc:
