&aEvokers&r are known as being a powerful and deadly Miniboss of Minecraft. So of course &lIron&r added an even more powerful and deadly version! And yes this &eBook&r is a rare drop from both! 

It has 10 Spell Slots but 3 are occupied. &aFang Strike&r, &aFang Ward&r, and &aVex Swarm&r all come with the &eBook&r and can not be moved. 

Also gives a boost to &a&lEvocation&r!

quests.title: Necronomicom
desc:
To obtain this special Spell Book you'll need to slay the &4&lDead King&r! 

It has 10 &3Spell&r Slots but 4 are taken up already. &4Blood Slash&r, &4Blood Step&r, &4Ray of Siphoning&r, and &4Blaze Storm&r come on it already and can't be taken off.

quests.title: &cBlaze Instruction Manual
quests.subtitle: Hot! Hot! Hot!
desc:
This &eSpell Book&r is a rare drop from &cBlazes&r. I remember that because I was confused when I got 1 from my &cBlaze&r Farm. 

It gives a Boost to &cFire Spells&r and has 10 &3Spell&r Slots.

quests.title: &6Villager Bible
desc:
This one takes awhile to explain so have patience. 

First, find an &aEvoker Fort&r. 
Next, find a Research Book hidden in it. Then, have a Trader who's hostage in the &aFort&r translate it. (Like our hostage Quest Translators!) 
Once, it's translated bring it to a &6&lPriest&r in a &6Village&r to trade it for the &eSpell Book&r! 

It gives a boost to &6Holy Spells&r and don't worry the hostage Traders are very very rare, keep looking!

quests.title: &2Druidic Tome
desc:
&2&lNature's&r &eSpell Book&r. 

It has 10 &3Spells&r and gives a boost to &2Nature Spells&r! 

You need a Rotten Spell Book to craft it though...

quests.title: &dDragonskin Spell Book
desc:
Another that needs the Ruined Book to Craft. You can find the Ruined Books in &9Ancient City&r Chests. 

You'll also need Dragon Skin which drops from the &dEnder Dragon&r! 

It will have 12 &3Spell&r Slots and give a boost to &dEnder Spells&r!

quests.title: Inscription Table
desc:
A very important block and a very common one! Can be crafted or found in most &lIron Spells&r Structures. 

These are used for adding and removing &3Scrolls&r from &eSpell Books&r! Throw the &eSpell Book&r in the Book Slot then the &3Scroll&r below it. If you want to remove a &3Scroll&r, click it then take it from the right and into your Inventory.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_table_gui.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Arcane Anvil
desc:
The Arcane Anvil has the most uses out of any block in &lIron Spells&r. 

You can combine &3Spells&r with the same Ink to level it up. 
It can combine &3Scrolls&r into Weapons to be used with them, like a Sword. 
You can also set an Affinity to Rings using Upgrade Orbs, or add Upgrade Orbs to Weapons and Gear.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_anvil_gui.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Scroll Forge
desc:
Scroll Forge, you can guess what it does! 

It makes &3Scrolls&r! 

Add an Ink to set the Rarity. Paper for the actual &3Scroll&r. Then the Item of what type of &3Spell&r you want (&cBlaze Rod&r for &c&lFire&r, &2Poisonous Potato&r for &2&lNature&r, ETC). Finally chose the &3Spell&r you want and it'll be created!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_scroll_gui.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Alchemist Cauldron
desc:
Definitely better than a Normal Minecraft Cauldron! 

The Alchemist Cauldron can: 
1. Be used to get &4Blood&r by cooking Mobs or the Player. 
2. Make and upgrade Potions. 
3. Have half a chance at getting Ink from a Scroll. 
4. Combine 4 Ink of a Rarity to a higher Rarity.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_cauldron.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &5&lLightning
desc:
Ride the &5Lightning&r! &5&lLightning&r is all about using Electricity to kill and support yourself. Some attacks even work as real &5Lightning&r! 

&5&lLightning's&r Focus Material is &5Bottle 'O Lightning&r which you get from using an Empty Bottle on a Charged Creeper. You need the &5Lightning&r to make more &5Lightning&r! 

Its &5Scrolls&r are &7Grey&r with &bLight Blue&r text.

quests.title: &lClasses
desc:
&7Runes&r are how we make our Classes and their parts. To get a &7Blank Rune&r you can either kill the &4&lDead King&r or wipe clean an Inscribed Rune with a Shriving Stone. 

There's 8 different classes (1 secret one) each having their own &3Scrolls&r, Focus Material, Upgrades, and Outfits.

quests.title: &c&lFire
desc:
&c&lFire&r is obviously related to &cFire&r. Most of the Scrolls are with using &cFire&r to burn and hurt things. 

&c&lFire's&r Focus Material is &cBlaze Rods&r. You can craft &cFire Runes&r or get them from killing the &c&lPyromancer&r. 

Its &cScrolls&r are &cLight Red&r with &8Grey&r text.

quests.title: &b&lIce
desc:
&b&lIce&r is all about Winter time Spells. Using &bIce&r and &bSnow&r to chill and harm enemies. 

&b&lIce's&r Focus Material is the &bFrozen Bone&r which are drops from &bStrays&r. You can use those to craft the &bIce Rune&r or kill the &b&lCryomancer&r to get it. 

Its &bScrolls&r are &bLight Blue&r with a &9Darker Blue&r text.

quests.title: &d&lEnder
desc:
&d&lEnder&r is used for taking all the powers of &dEndermen&r and the &dEnder Dragon&r, and of course using it for ourselves. &dTeleporting&r, &dFireballs&r, and &dDragon's Breath&r are only a few of these! 

&d&lEnder's&r Focus Material is the &dEnder Pearls&r. 

And its &dScrolls&r are &5Purple&r with &dPink&r text.

quests.title: &6&lHoly
desc:
&6&lHoly&r is for all the Medic/Support players. It's mostly meant for healing and helping. 

&6&lHoly's&r Focus Material is &6Divine Pearls&r which are crafted. You can make Runes with those or kill the &6&lPriest&r to get &6Holy Runes&r. 

&6Holy Scrolls&r are &fWhite&r with &6Gold&r texts.

quests.title: &4&lBlood
desc:
This one is single-handly taking us from E10 to Teen rating. &4&lBlood&r is all about slaying enemies for your own &cHealth&r! Most attacks will heal you back. 

&4&lBlood's&r Focus Material is &4Blood Vials&r which you get from cooking a Mob or Player in a Cauldron. 

Its &4Scrolls&r are Brown (there's no color for Brown) with &4Dark Red&r texts.

quests.title: &a&lEvocation
desc:
&n&aEvocation:&r
To invoke a Spirit or Deity. 

&a&lEvokation&r is all about what &aEvokers&r do, mainly summoning. Whether it be &aFangs&r or &aVexes&r if it's summoned it's most likely an &aEvokation&r. 

&a&lEvokation's&r Focus Material is &aEmeralds&r. You can either craft the Rune or get it from the &a&lArchevoker&r. 

&aEvokation Scrolls&r are &fWhite&r with &0Black&r texts.

quests.title: &2&lNature
desc:
&2&lNature&r is made for using the Earth to our advantage by &2Poisoning&r and &2Weakening&r our enemies! Just like what Big Corporations do to the Earth itself! 
&2&lNature's&r Focus Material is &2Poisonous Potato&r. 

The &2Scrolls&r are &aLight Green&r with &2Dark Green&r text.

quests.title: &dEnder&r Upgrade Orb
quests.subtitle: Why is it wet? Was it in a Lake?

quests.title: &cPyromancer Outfit
desc: I hope you didn't steal this from the &c&lPyromancer&r, he's the nice one!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_outfit_pyromancer.png width:50 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &bCryomancecr Outfit
desc: He was mean you can steal it I don't care.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_outfit_cryomancer.png width:60 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &5Electromancer Outfit
desc: When's this one going to come to the Mod?
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_outfit_electromancer.png width:50 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &dShadow-Walker Outfit
desc: {image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_outfit_shadow.png width:60 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &6Priest Outfit
desc: I heard you can just take online classes to become one now.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_outfit_priest.png width:60 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &4Cultist Outfit
desc: {image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_outfit_cultist.png width:60 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &aArchevoker Outfit
desc: He may be evil, but he still is fashionable.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_outfit_archevoker.png width:60 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &2Plagued Outfit
desc: Very popular around Halloween!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_outfit_plagued.png width:60 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &4Catacombs
desc:
The biggest and hardest Structure from &lIron's Spells&r. 

These are deep underground structures similar to Trial Chambers. You can also use Wayward Compasses to help find it! 

In it are plenty of Spawners, Trial Spawners, and of course Loot. 

The most important room is the Throne Room, once you arrive there, the Skeleton of the &4&lDead King&r will reanimate! (If it doesn't you might need to click him).
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_catacombs.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &4&lThe Dead King
desc:
Sitting on the Throne lies the remains of a past &4&lKing&r. But once you come close, and touch them, you will see them reanimate; the &4&lKing&r is dead no longer! But only murder will keep him alive... and well you're the closest living thing. 

&4&lThe Dead King&r is the hardest Boss, he has 400 &cHearts&r and is the only to have an actual Boss Bar (and music). He can use a variety of &3Spells&r from any class, &2Poison Arrow&r from &2Nature&r to &6Blight&r from &6Holy&r to even &aFangs&r from &aEvokation&r! He can also teleport, summon the dead, and hit you with the &4Blood Staff&r. 

If you can kill him he will drop &3Scrolls&r of all sorts, &7Blank Runes&r, and possibly drop the &4Blood Staff&r and Necronomicon.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_king.png width:100 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: &aEvoker Fort
desc:
The heavily guarded &aFortress&r is home to the &a&lArchevoker&r and his followers. 
You'll know you see it by its huge Spruce Walls and the giant Stone &aFortress&r inside of them. 

Illagers, Vindicators, &aEvokers&r, and Ravagers can be found within the Walls and &aFortress&r. Once you get past them you can find your way up the stairs, parkour to the Roof, and meet the &a&lLeader of the Fort&r at the top. 

With it being heavily guarded of course there is a ton of loot within the &aFort&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_evokerfort.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &a&lArchevoker
desc:
At the top of the &aFort&r lies the &a&lArchevoker&r. Hostile to only the Player and whoever attacks him. 

He has 60 Hearts, and attacks like a normal &aEvoker&r plus more! &aFireworks&r, &aShield&r, and &aBlast of Wind&r! 

Once killed he will drop Arcane Essence, Inks, &aEvokation Runes&r, &aEvokation Scrolls&r, and rare drop of the &aGrimore of Evokation&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_evoker.png width:100 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: &2Mangrove Hut
desc:
Deep in the muddy Mangrove Swamps lies the refuge of the hermit like Mob called the &2&lApotheocarist&r. 

With nobody near, and only what he needs for his Potions is around. 

You can find the &2&lApotheocarist&r in his &2Hut&r. 

There you can also find Cauldrons and Brewing Stands with Potions!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_magrovehut.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &2&lApothecarist
desc:
Just like the Piglins the &2&lApotheocarist&r resembles, he is also Neutral. He doesn't care about &eGold&r like his fellow Piglins though, just people who attack him. 

You can trade with him: giving him either Emeralds or Potion Ingrediants for Potions, Potion Ingrediants, and &2Nature Scrolls&r. 

If you wish to slay him he has 60 Hearts. He will attack you with Potions and &2Nature Spells&r. When hurt he will try to heal with Potions, (I think he really likes Potions). 

When killed he will drop Arcane Essence, Inks, &2Nature Runes&r, and &2Nature Scrolls&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_apotheocarist.png width:100 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: &cPyromancer Tower
desc:
The &cBurned Tower&r of the &c&lPyromancer&r. Some say if you're close enough to see the &cTower&r, then you're close enough to feel the heat from it. 

The &cPyromancer Tower&r is a burned tower of mainly Stone types with the inside being made of Spruce and Oak. There is also a second Building close to the &cTower&r that is part of the structure as well. 

At the top you will find what's causing the smoke as well as an &5Armor Pile&r. 

If you'd like to find the &c&lPyromancer&r you'll need to venture down into the Basement!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_pyromancertower.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &c&lPyromancer
desc:
The &c&lPyromancer&r (different from the Pie Romancer) is another Neutral Mob added by &lIron's Spells&r. He will maybe set Mobs that are close to him on &cfire&r though... 

You can trade him all things &cFire&r, Ink, and even &cFire Scrolls&r. 

If you want to risk all the hair on your body by fighting him be prepared, he has 60 Hearts. He will set you on &cFire&r with &cFire Spells&r, not even a question. 

On death he will drop Arcane Essence, Inks, &cFire Runes&r, and &cFire Spells&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_pyromancer.png width:100 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: &bMountain Tower
desc:
High above the Mountains, high above the Clouds rests another &bTower&r. This one giving you shivers down your spine. 

The &bTower&r is made of Stone, Dark Oak, and Deepslate. It has a second Tower branching off of it. There is a staircase on the outside that leads to the first floor. From there you can climb the inside staircase to go up to the bedroom or second tower. 

Or you can venture behind that staircase down the Ladder to the Basement, where the &b&lCryomancer&r will most likely be. 

In the &bTower&r you can find Inscription Tables, Amethyst, and Loot Chests!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_mountaintower.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &b&lCryomancer
desc:
Shouldn't have come into the &bTower&r, the &b&lCryomancer&r does not like Players, they are Hostile to you. 

The &b&lCryomancer&r will immediately start attacking you with &bIce Spells&r. Might even use animals against you! Sacrificing animals to win a fight, he really is cold-hearted! 

Once killed he will drop Arcane Essence, Inks, &bIce Runes&r, and &bIce Scrolls&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_cryomancer.png width:100 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: &5Ancient Battleground
desc:
&5Ancient Battlegrounds&r are only a fragment of the past. 

Who knows what happened. 

Who knows who fought who. All we have now are parts of the walls and these &5Piles of Armor&r. Might as well just pick them up by Mining them with your Pickaxe.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_battleground.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &5&lAncient Knight
desc:
After trying to harvest the &5Piles of Armor&r they appear to come back to life as if there was a body using it. They can also come from Spawners. 

They have 60 &4Hearts&r and they are different from other bosses as they don't use magic, rather I believe they are something made from magic. They will attack using their Sword either by swinging it or charging at you with it. 

From what I've seen they will attack everything they see besides other &5&lKnights&r! 

Once killed they dropped Netherite Scraps and &cCinder Essence&r. Rarely they will Drop their &5Weapon&r and the ones in the &cCitadel&r will Drop Decrepit Keys.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_knight.png width:100 height:150 align:center}

quests.title: &lIron's Spells 'N Spellbooks
desc:
&lIron&r has brought us a wonderful and very fun Magic Mod! &lIron's Spells 'N Spellbooks!&r 

&lIron's Spells&r is all about making and using &3Spells&r! Each &3Spell&r has a Rarity, Level, and Class! And everyone of them can be used in a Spellbook. 

You won't be able to just make whatever you want with &7Iron&r and &cRedstone&r, you'll need to get off your butt, Adventure, and Fight!

quests.title: &6Village
desc:
Just about every &6Village&r can have &6&lPriests&r in them. This includes modded &6Villages&r. 

Usually they hang in the middle of the &6Village&r like by the Markets. Not every &6Village&r will have one.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_village.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &6&lPriest
desc:
The Neutral protector of the &6Village&r. He will attack all nearby Hostile Mobs. Like an Iron Golem but he look familiar for some reason? Could it be someone we know in a costume? 

You can trade Healing Potions with him and Emeralds for a Furled Map which will soon be made to help against &aEvoker Forts&r! 

If you do wish to kill him he will repeatedly attack you with &6Holy Spells&r. He will also Heal himself when getting low. 

Once killed he will drop Arcane Essence, Inks, &6Holy Runes&r, and &6Holy Scrolls&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_priest.png width:100 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: &lAdventure Time!
desc: There's 6 structures in the &2Overworld&r that the bosses can spawn in! (There's a 7th but no boss in there).

quests.title: Necromancers
desc:
These can spawn almost anywhere &2Vanilla&r Hostile Mobs spawn in. They aren't bosses, just more Enemies! 

They have 25 Points of &cHealth&r and have mulitple attacks: &aFangs&r from the ground like what &aEvokers&r do and a &bSnowball&r they can shoot you with. 

They can also summon Zombies and Skeletons to help fight you. These won't drop anything and spawn with Armor from the ground. 

They will drop Arcane Essence on death along with sometimes a &3Scroll&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_necromancer.png width:100 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: The Last Class...
desc:
There is a final class of &3Spells&r I forgot to mention. Well all knowledge of these &9Spells&r have been forgotten so it's not just me. 

In order to regain memories we need to walk, quietly, down memory lane. Which happens to be the &9Ancient City&r.

quests.title: Into the Ancient City
desc:
You can find the fragments of Ancient Knowledge spread out in the Chests of the &9Ancient City&r. 

You'll also need &9Echo Shards&r to 1. Combine the Fragments to learn of the &9Spells&r and 2. Actually make the &9Spells&r.

quests.title: &9&lEldritch
quests.subtitle: 9th Class
desc:
When you finally combine the Ancient Knowledge Fragments you'll get the... &9Eldritch Manuscript&r! That's what the last class is! 

&9Eldritch&r is the last class, the most powerful of all &3Spells&r. They are crafted with &9Echo Shards&r and need to be learned from the &9Manuscript&r to use them. Each &9Manuscript&r is only one use.

quests.title: Quest 2D84DA54
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks. 

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission. 

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &4Vampiric Spellbook
desc:
Who knows &4Blood&r like Vampires do! Nobody, that's who! 

This &eSpellbook&r isn't that hard to make besides the Ruined Book. 

The other Items are just &5Arcane Ingots&r and &4Bloody Vellum&r. &4Bloody Vellum&r is made by dipping &dHogskin&r into an Alchemist Cauldron full of &4Blood&r. 

The &eSpellbook&r has 10 Spell Slots, and it will give an extra Level to &4Blood Slash&r and &4Blood Step&r!

quests.title: &bFrostbanded Spellbook
desc:
This &eSpellbook&r definitely makes you work for the 12 &3Spell Slots&r! 

You'll need &bIce Venom Vials&r, which are made from &bIcy Fangs&r or Looted from &bIce Spider Den&r. 

&5Arcane Cloths&r which are very easy to make. As well as &bMithril Scraps&r which you'll need to Mine for! 

Judging by how cold the &eSpellbook&r feels, I think it helps with &bIce Spells&r.

quests.title: &bIce Spider Den
desc:
While exploring the Snowy Biomes you may come accross what might look like a run-down Church. 

Except what is in it, isn't &6Holy&r! 

Travel down into the Basement to the Catacombs. Here will be plenty of Stray Spawners, Powder Snow traps, and Loot! 

As well as &bIce Spider Eggs&r... try Breaking them and you will alert the...

quests.title: &b&lIce Spider
desc:
The &b&lIce Spider&r. 

This is an Enemy with 50 &4Hearts&r and 20 Armor Points. 

If you get near they will Bite you or Smack you with one of their many Arms! 
If you get farther they will either Shoot some sort of &bIcy cocoon&r? I think? Whatever it is, it Damages you and &bFreezes&r you in place. Or they might send a line of &bIce Rocks&r toward you from the ground to Damage you. 

On Death they'll Drop String, &5Arcane Essence&r, and sometimes an &bIcy Fang&r.

quests.title: &5Decrepit Flamberge
desc:
The &5Decrepit Flamberge&r is the Sword of choice for &5Ancient Knights&r and some &5Cursed Armor Stands&r. 

That is also where we can get it from, Killing those guys! 

It looks like a &5Netherite Sword&r, just if it was wiggling when being made. 

It does 11 &4Hearts of Damage&r but is slightly slower than a Sword. 

It can be upgraded with &6Pyrium&r to increase its Attack Speed.

quests.title: &cCitadel
desc:
The &cCitadel&r is the biggest Structure &lIron's Spells&r gives us. It is almost entirely made of &0Blackstone&r. 

It has huge Walls and Towers surrounding and connecting to the main building. These have &5Ancient Knight&r Spawners and Barrels of Loot. 

The main building has the Library/Research Room on the first floor. This one has billions of Books as well as Chests and more &5Ancient Knights&r! 

The floor above will have the Citadel Vaults as well as &5Cursed Armor Stands&r. Careful trying to take their Loot off, they might defend their property! 

The top floor is the arena...

quests.title: &cDecrepit Scythe
desc:
&cDecrepit Scythe&r is what the &c&lEcho of Tyrus&r uses to Kill you. Just our version is much smaller. 

It has very similar stats to the &5Decrepit Flamberge&r, just a slightly and I mean slighty quicker Attack Speed. 

It can also be upgraded with &6Pyrium&r, this will give it more Damage plus a &3Spell&r! 

The &3Spell &cHellrazer&r gets is &cRaise Hell&r. This will send a Wave of &cFire&r in all directions around you. This won't spread &cFire&r but it will do a ton of Damage to all Mobs near!

quests.title: &c&lEcho of Tyrus, First Flamebearer
desc:
&c&lEcho of Tyrus&r is the first real Boss we get from &lIron's&r! 

He has 1000 &4Hearts&r with 16 Armor Points. As well as the Ability to summon &5Ancient Knights&r to Fight with him! 

As you can guess by his title of &c&lFirst Flamebearer&r, you'll know he uses &cFire Magic&r to Attack. 

He can swing his &cScythe&r to Hit you or smack the Ground to release a Wave of &cFire&r in all directions. 

A few more Attacks involve &cFirey Swords&r, he can throw a bunch at you in a row or summon dozens to rise out of the Ground to Damage you. 

Last Attacks he has is using &cFireballs&r, which he will Throw at you either standing still or leaping high into the air! 

When you do a quarter of his &4Health&r he will kneel down. This is when you can Hit him the hardest! But once he gets to 300 &4Hearts&r he will upgrade his Weapons and Armor. Even upgrading his &5Ancient Knights&r too! 

If you can somehow Kill him, he will Drop his &cScythe&r and a &dDivine Soulshard&r. Plus Essences but who cares about those we got a &cScythe&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/iron_spells/spells_echo.png width:125 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Getting &bMithril
desc:
&bMithril&r is an Ore that only spawns wayyy below the &2&lOverworld&r. 

It will spawn around Y Levels -40 to &8Bedrock&r. Just around where the &cLava Pools&r are! 

You'll need a &5Netherite Pickaxe&r to Mine it and it will only Drop 1 &bRaw Mithril&r unless you use Fortune. 

This &bRaw Mithril&r can be Smelt to make &bMithril Scraps&r. These can be used in Recipes, or we can combine 4 of them to make a &bMithril Ingot&r!

quests.title: &bWizard Gear
desc:
The &bWizard Gear&r is the default Armor for &lIron's Spells&r! 

Every other Armor will be Crafted with it, or Crafted from something Crafted from it! 

It will only need &5Arcane Cloths&r to Craft. 

It will give a huge boost in Max Mana, same Armor Points as &bDiamond Armor&r, and gives a Spell Power Boost!

quests.title: &bWeapon Parts
desc:
&bWeapon Parts&r will be needed to Craft a few Weapons. 

And yes, we'll need to Craft these as well. 

They're pretty simple, just 3 &bMithril Ingots&r and 2 &5Arcane Ingots&r. 

&5Arcane Ingots&r are made from 1 &6Copper Ingot&r and 8 &5Arcane Essence&r.

quests.title: &dAmethyst Rapier
desc:
The &dAmethyst Rapier&r is decently cheap for what it does! 

It is just &bWeapon Parts&f, &dAmethyst&r, and Chains. 

The &dAmethyst Rapier&r does 8 &4Hearts of Damage&r, same as the &5Netherite Sword&r. Just this one Swings much faster with an Attack Speed of 2.3. 

The special part of the &dAmethyst Rapier&r is the built in Spell it gets! &dEchoing Strike&r. 

By pressing (V) while holding the &dRapier&r, and you'll get the &dEchoing Strike Effect&r. Any Mob Hit with the &dRapier&r will have a shockwave come out of them. This will Damage other Mobs near it.

quests.title: &3Spellbreaker
desc:
&3Spellbreaker&r is an expensive and powerful Weapon we can Craft. 

We'll need &bWeapon Parts&r, &bDiamonds&f, and 2 &bMithril Ingots&r to make it. 

&3Spellbreaker&r does 10 &4Hearts of Damage&r and is slightly faster than a Sword. 

It also has a &3Spell&r within it, &3Counterspell&r. When a Mob is using a &3Spell&r against you, use this one to stop them from using it!

quests.title: &bBoreal Blade
desc:
The &bBoreal Blade&r is a cool Sword! Both personality wise and temperature wise. 

It's made from &bWeapon Parts&r, &bIce&r, &bMithril Ingots&r, and &bIce Venom Vials&r. 

Check out the &b&lIce Spider&r Quest to get &bIce Venom&r! 

This Blade does a ton of Damage! At 16 &4Hearts&r. It is slow to swing though, same speed as an Axe. 

The &3Spell&r that comes with &bBoreal Blade&r is &bFrostbite&r. It's another Effect... not sure what it does.

quests.title: Staffs, Rods, and Canes
desc:
Staffs and... Staff like Items, are Weapons which will give Magic Boosts when they are Held! 

Plus they're stylish!

quests.title: &4The Blood Staff
desc:
&4The Blood Staff&r is a Drop from &4&lThe Dead King&r. Probably because it is quite literally his Staff! 

This Staff does 8 &4Damage&r, more than the previous ones. 

It gives 5% &3Spell Power&r to all &3Spells&r and 15% to just &4Blood Spells&r as well as 10% Summon Power.

quests.title: &7Graybeard Staff
quests.subtitle: When will it become Whitebeards?
desc:
The &7Graybeard Staff&r is a very cheap Staff. Cheap in price and quality. 

It will only do 3 &4Damage&r but gives 25% Mana Regeneration and 10% &3Spell Power&r. 

Pretty helpful if you're just using &3Spells&r to Kill!

quests.title: &bIce Staff
desc:
&bIce Staff&r confused me for quite a bit but thankfully I now know! 

You'll need a &bPermafrost Shard&r and a &bFrosted Helve&r. The &bPermafrost Shard&r is Loot within the Ice Breaker Structure. These are Shipwrecks in Icy Biomes. 

The &bFrosted Helve&r is a Crafted Item. It uses &5Arcane Ingots &fand&b Frozen Bones&r. The latter is Drops from &bStrays&r. 

The &bIce Staff&r does 5 &4Damage&r and gives 25% Mana Regeneration. It gives 5% &3Spell Power&r to all &3Spell&r, and 15% for just &bIce Spells&r.

quests.title: &eArtificer's Cane
desc:
&eArtificer's Cane&r is more expensive than &7Graybeard Staff&r and because of that it is more powerful. 

It will now do 4 &4Damage&r and gives 15% Reduction Cooldown and Cast Time as well as 10% &3Spell Power&r. 

I only said it was better, I didn't say it was much better!

quests.title: &5Rod o' Lightning
desc:
This one is a fun one to get! We'll first need a &5Lightning Rod&r as well as an &5Energized Core&r. 

Then, when it is Storming, Right Click the &5Energized Core&r onto the &5Lightning Rod&r. If done correctly, &5Lightning&r will Strike. This will turn the &5Lightning Rod&r into the &5Rod o' Lightning&r! 

This Rod does 5 &4Damage&r and keeps the 15% Cast Time Reduction. But now it will only give 5% &3Spell Power&r and gives 15% &3Spell Power&f for &5Lightning Spells&r.

quests.title: &6Pyrium Staff
desc:
The &6Pyrium Staff&r is the most powerful Staff... well &4Damage&r wise, not Power Wise. 

It needs 2 &6Pyrium Ingots&r, a &5Netherite Ingot&r, and &5Arcane Cloth&r. 

&5Netherite Ingots&f and &5Arcane Cloths&r are easy, &6Pyrium&r... not so much. You'll need to Open 2 Vaults at the &cCitadel&r. 

The &6Pyrium Staff&r will give 5% &3Spell Power&r and 15% to &cFire Spells&r. As well as 10% less Cast Time!

quests.title: &lArmor
desc:
If you've played &2&lMinecraft&r before, you should know what Armor is and what it does! 

&lIron's Spells&r adds their own types of Armor as well. 

These work like normal Armor but each will grant different boosts to your magical powers. Like higher &3Spell Power&r, more Mana, and even Elemental boosts.

quests.title: &9Wandering Magician Outfit
desc:
The &9Wandering Magician Armor&r is the weakest &lIron's Spells&r can offer. 

It is literally an upgrade to &7Leather Armor&r! Who even makes &7Leather Armor&r?!?!?! 

Just toss your &7Leather Armor&r with &5Arcane Essence&r in a Crafting Table to Craft it. 

This will make each piece give more Armor Points as well as a slight Mana Boost!

quests.title: &4Scarecrow Outfit
desc:
The &4Scarecrow Outfit&r is slightly better than the &9Wandering Magician&r, with 3 times the Mana and more Armor Points. 

This one will need more Items to Craft though. 

It now needs &5Arcane Cloth&r instead of &5Essence&r, as well as &eHay Bales&r and &6Pumpkins&r.

quests.title: &6Lightbringer Chestplate
desc:
&6&lPriest&r not &6Holy&r enough for you? Well you can Craft the &6Lightbringer Chestplate&r! 

First, you'll need the &6Priest Robes&r, which you can Craft. 

You'll need 3 &bMithril Weaves&r which are made from &bMithril&r and Chains. 

Then, you will have to get the &dDivine Soulshard&r and you can Craft the &6Chestplate&r. 

This &6Chestplate&r has the same Armor Points as the &6Priest Robes&r, but everything else gets much better! 

You get Armor Toughness, Knockback Resistance, and of course more &3Spell Power&r and Mana.

quests.title: &aBoots of Speed
desc:
&aBoots of Speed&r are the best Boots you can get here. 

First, we'll need the &aArchevokers Boots&r. If you don't like hand-me-downs, I'd recommend Crafting them yourself. 

Then, we'll need a &bMithril Weave&r. This is a combination of &bMithril Ingots&r and Chains. These are only used for Crafting Armor so you'll pretty much just need a few. 

Last is the &dDivine Soulshard&r. 

These &aBoots&r will give more Mana than any other Boots, more &3Spell Power&r, plus they make you faster? How do they make you faster? By increasing your Movement and &3Spell Casting&r Speed!

quests.title: &cNetherite Battlemage Armor
desc:
Funny enough, this doesn't upgrade much. 

&3Spell Power&r stays the same, Mana stays the same, even Armor Points stay the same. Only change is the addition of Armor Toughness. 

That makes sense though, it is only a &5Netherite Upgrade&r for &bWizard Gear&r!

quests.title: &aMagehunter
desc:
The &aMagehunter&r is a very weird Weapon to get. Weird as in the way to get it is very specific. 

To get it, you'll need to go to the &aEvoker Fort&r and the &aVindicator&r on the 2nd Floor will have it. Kill him to get it. 

The &aSword&r is a good Sword, doing 10 &4Hearts of Damage&r with normal Sword Speed. 

While Holding it you'll get a little &3Spell Resistance&r. Plus some might come with Enchants, mine did!

quests.title: &cCinderous Soulcaller
desc:
Well this arena seems pretty empty... oh wait what is this! 

The &cCinderous Soul Rune&r. Looks like a Keyhole almost, just the Decrepit Keys don't work on them. 

Trust me, they don't. 

Instead we'll need the &cCinderous Soulcaller&r! Which is made from &cCinder Essence&r, &5Netherite Scraps&r, and an &9Echo Shard&r. 

&5Netherite Scraps&r are from &5Ancient Debris&r, &9Echo Shards&r are from &9Ancient City&r, and &cCinder Essence&r is Drops from &5Ancient Knights&r!

quests.title: &6Pyrium
desc:
&6Pyrium&r is a confirmed Loot from &cCitadels&r Vaults... 

Except these Vaults don't take normal Trials Keys. Wow, it is almost like one Key can't open every Lock! 

We'll need the Decrepit Key, which is a Drop from &5Ancient Knights&r at the &cCitadel&r. They spawn in the Towers and lower level of the Library.

quests.title: Just Dire Things
desc: Just Dire Things is a jack of all trades mod. Just Dire Things adds a new crafting mechanic called Goo Spread, along with machines that assist in the automation of Goo Spread and other utilities.

quests.title: Gooblock Tier1
desc: Primogel Goo is the first tier of goo added by JDT and requires basic Overworld materials to craft.
Crafts Unlocked:
- Ferricore
- Primal Coal
Goo Spread Example:
{image:atm:textures/questpics/justdirethings/goo_spread_ferricore.png width:200 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: Gooblock Tier2
desc: Blazebloom Goo is the second tier of goo added by JDT and requires Nether materials to craft.
Crafts Unlocked:
- Blazegold
- Blaze Ember

quests.title: Gooblock Tier3
desc: Voidshimmer Goo is the third tier of goo added by JDT and requires End materials to craft.
Crafts Unlocked:
- Celestigem
- Void Flame

quests.title: Gooblock Tier4
desc: Shadowpulse Goo is the fourth and final tier of goo added by JDT and requires Ancient City and Warden materials to craft.
Crafts Unlocked:
- Eclipse Alloy
- Eclipse Ember
- Time Crystal

quests.title: Ferricore
desc: Ferricore is a new material added by JDT. Ferricore is aquired by performing Goo Spread on Iron Blocks using tier one goo or higher. Ferricore Ore is affected by fortune.

quests.title: Blazegold
desc: Blazegold is a new material added by JDT. Blazegold is aquired by performing Goo Spread on Gold Blocks using tier two goo or higher. Blazegold Ore is affected by fortune.

Blazegold grants the intrinsic ability of Lava Repair to tools and Armor. Lava Repair, repairs the tool/armor when dropped into a lava source block, converting the source block into obsidian in exchange for repairing the tool/armor.

quests.title: Celestigem
desc: Celestigem is a new material added by JDT. Celestigem is aquired by performing Goo Spread on Diamond Blocks using tier three goo or higher. Celestigem Ore is affected by fortune.

quests.title: Coal T1
desc: Primal Coal is a new material added by JDT. Primal Coal is aquired by performing Goo Spread on Coal Blocks using tier one goo or higher. Primal Coal Ore is affected by fortune.

quests.title: Coal T2
desc: Blaze Ember is a new material added by JDT. Blaze Ember is aquired by performing Goo Spread on Primal Coal Blocks using tier two goo or higher. Blaze Ember Ore is affected by fortune.

quests.title: Coal T3
desc: Voidflame Coal is a new material added by JDT. Voidflame is aquired by performing Goo Spread on Blaze Ember Blocks using tier three goo or higher. Voidflame Coal Ore is affected by fortune.

quests.title: Eclipse Alloy
desc: Eclipse Alloy is a new material added by JDT. Eclipse Alloy is aquired by performing Goo Spread on Netherite Blocks using tier four goo. Eclipse Alloy Ore is affected by fortune.

quests.title: Coal T4
desc: Eclipse Ember is a new material added by JDT. Eclipse Ember is aquired by performing Goo Spread on Voidflame Coal Blocks using tier four goo. Eclipse Ember Ore is affected by fortune.

quests.title: Quest 517F0135
desc: All simple machines come with redstone controll, and some come with filtering.

quests.title: Blockbreakert1
desc: A simple block breaker that requires a tool to break blocks.

quests.title: Blockplacert1
desc: Just a simple block placer.

quests.title: Clickert1
desc: Just a simple clicker that clicks with the item it is given.

quests.title: Sensort1
desc: Just a simple sensor that outputs a restone signal and has one filter slot.

quests.title: Droppert1
desc: A simple dropper and you can configure the amount dropped at once.

quests.title: Fluidplacert1
desc: Just a simple fluid placer.

quests.title: Fluidcollectort1
desc: Just a simple fluid collector.

quests.title: Generatorfluidt1
desc: A simple liquid fuel generator that runs off the liquid fuels added by JDT.

quests.title: Generatort1
desc: Just a simple coal generator.

quests.title: Itemcollector
desc: The item collecter collects items and deposits them into the inventory below it.

quests.title: Playeraccessor
desc: The player accessor acts as a chest that interfaces with the player's inventory. Using the GUI the player accessor can have it's sides configured to interface with the player's inventory, off-hand or armor slots.

quests.title: Blockswappert1
desc: The simple swapper can teleport items, blocks, mobs or players above it to another simple sawper it is linked to. To link swapers use the Ferricore wrench.

quests.title: Energytransmitter
desc: The energy transmitter provides power to blocks within it's working range, it can only accept power from the bottom.

quests.title: Quest 5F512045
desc: Advanced machines have the same capabilities as their simple varients with the addition of configurable working area, more filter slots and requiring power.

quests.title: Quest 7AEFF81E
desc: Using Shift Right Click when holding a JDT tool or wand will open the configuration menu where the player can configure and toggle abilities.

quests.title: Quest 3971FF7D
desc: Armor abilities can be configured and toggled in the configuration menu. Use a JDT tool or wand to open the menu and click on your armor to configure the abilities of that armor piece.

quests.title: Fuel Canister
desc: The Fuel Canister is an item that allows for more efficent use of fuel. It can store 50,000 fuel, each burnable item has a different fuel value depending on the amount of items smelted. One fuel is enough to smelt one item.

quests.title: Pocket Generator
desc: The Pocket Generator is a handheld generator that uses burnable items to charge items and tools in the player's inventory, the Pocket Generator is compatable with the Fuel Canister.

quests.title: Fluid Canister
desc:
Fuel Canister is a tank that can fill containers with the fluid it contains.

The Fuel Canister has three fill modes:

 - None
 - Any
 - Just Dire Things

quests.title: Blazejet Wand
desc: Abilites:

- Air Burst: Launches player in the direction they are facing consuming durability in the progress, higher tier wands launch the player a greater distance. Note the player won't take fall damage as long as they are holding the wand.

quests.title: Voidshift Wand
desc: Abilities:
- Air Burst: Improved launching distance and conusmes FE.
- Void Shift: Teleports player in the direction they are looking consuming FE in the process.

quests.title: Eclipsegate Wand
desc: Abilities:
- Air Burst: Further improved launch distance.
- Void Shift: Improved teleportation distance.

- Eclipse Gate: Creates a portable hole in a 3x3 area, direction is dependant of the face of the block targeted. Distance of the hole created is configurable. Note Eclipse Gate doesn't work on tile entities.

quests.title: Portalgun
desc: The Portal Gun is an item that uses power to create two portals to teleport between two points. Left Click shoots a blue portal, Right Click an orange portal and Shift Right Click removes both portals.

quests.title: Portalgun V2
desc: The Advanced Portal Gun is the upgraded version of the Portal Gun that requres both power and portal fluid to operate. Unlike the Portal Gun the Adavanced Portal Gun allows the player to teleport between locations that have been encoded. Using "V" (default keybind) the menu used to encode and select desinations for teleportion.

quests.title: Creaturecatcher
desc: The Creature Catcher allows for the transport of mobs. Mobs can be blacklisted via an entitiy tag.

quests.title: Machinesettingscopier
desc: Machine Settings Copier allows players to copy settings between machines.

quests.title: Ferricore Wrench
desc: The Ferricore Wrench allows the player to rotate machines, but it is also used to link swappers together.

quests.title: Totem Of Death Recall
desc: Totem of Death Recall is a one time use time that allows a player to teleport back to thier location of death.

quests.title: Polymorphic Fluid Bucket
desc: Polymorphic Fluid is the base of all Fluids / Fuels in JDT. Polymorphic Fluid is crafted by dropping Polymorphic Catalyst into water.

quests.title: Refined T2 Fluid Bucket
desc: Dropping Blaze Ember into Polymorphic Fluid will create Unrefined Blaze Ember Fuel. Perfoming Goo Spread with Tier Two goo or higher will convert Unrefined Blaze Ember Fuel into Blaze Ember Fuel.

quests.title: Refined T3 Fluid Bucket
desc: Dropping Voidflame Coal into Blaze Ember Fuel will create Unrefined Voidflame Fuel. Perfoming Goo Spread with Tier Three goo or higher will convert Unrefined Voidflame Fuel into Voidflame Fuel.

quests.title: Refined T4 Fluid Bucket
desc: Dropping Eclipse Ember into Voidflame Fuel will create Unrefined Eclipse Ember Fuel. Perfoming Goo Spread with Tier Four goo will convert Unrefined Eclipse Ember Fuel into Eclipse Ember Fuel.

quests.title: Portal Fluid Bucket
desc:
Portal Fluid is a mysterious green fluid vital in the operation of the Advanced Portal Gun.

Dropping Portal Fluid Catalyst into Polymorphic Fluid will create Unstable Portal Fluid BUT Unstable Portal Fluid can only exist in the End. Performing Goo Spread with Tier Three goo or higher will convert Unstable Portal Fluid into Portal Fluid.

quests.title: Upgrade Blank
desc:
Blank Upgrades are the base of all abilities. Abilities are seperated into two types, passive and active.

Passive abilities require no active input by the player to work, however Active abilities only work when triggered by a keybind players set in the configuration menu, also active abilities consume durability/power when used. When installed on higher tier armor Active abilities have reduced cooldowns and Passived abilities have greater effects.

The smithing table is used to apply upgrades to JDT tools and armor. Holding shift when hovering over JDT tools or armor shows what upgrades are valid.

quests.title: Upgrade Mobscanner
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Active
&lAbility Function:&r
Highlights nearby mobs with particals when activated.

quests.title: Upgrade Oreminer
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Mines adjacent ore blocks all at once, but takes slightly longer to mine.

quests.title: Upgrade Lawnmower
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Active
&lAbility Function:
Breaks nearby grass and flowers when activated.

quests.title: Upgrade Skysweeper
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Automatically clears any blocks affected by gravity directly above the block mined.

quests.title: Upgrade Treefeller
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Mines adjacent logs all at once, note will increase time taken to break when mining multipul logs.

quests.title: Upgrade Leafbreaker
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Active
&lAbility Function:&r
Breaks nearby leaves when activated.

quests.title: Upgrade Smelter
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Automatically smelts items dropped from mined blocks.

quests.title: Upgrade Smoker
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Automatically smokes items dropped by kills.

quests.title: Upgrade Hammer
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:
Increases area mined at once. When installed on higher tier tools the maximum area mined is increased. Mined area can be configured in the menu.

quests.title: Upgrade Cauterizewounds
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Active
&lAbility Function:&r
Provides minor healing when activated, but can only be actived if the player has recently taken damage or is taking damage.

quests.title: Upgrade Dropteleport
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r

Automatically teleports item drops to the inventory bound to the tool. Shift Right Clicking the tool on an inventory binds it. Note when on a JDT hoe items dropped by the auto harvest ability of the voidshimmer / shadowpulse farmland are teleported to the bound inventory, also right clicking voidshimmer / shadowpulse farmland will re-bind them if the bound inventory of the tool has been changed.

quests.title: Upgrade Orexray
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Active
&lAbility Function:&r
An upgraded version of Ore Scanner that renders nearby ores when activated.

quests.title: Upgrade Glowing
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Active
&lAbility Function:&r
An upgraded version of Mob Scanner that applied Glowing to nearby mobs when activated.

quests.title: Upgrade Instabreak
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Allows the tool to instantly mine blocks.

quests.title: Upgrade Runspeed
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Increases running speed.

quests.title: Upgrade Walkspeed
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Increases walking speed.

quests.title: Upgrade Stepheight
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Provides step assist to the player.

quests.title: Upgrade Jumpboost
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Increases the jump height of the player.

quests.title: Upgrade Mindfog
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Reduces the dectection range of hostile mobs.

quests.title: Upgrade Invulnerability
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Active
&lAbility Function:&r
Temporarily makes the player immune to damage when activated, has a cooldown.

quests.title: Upgrade Swimspeed
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Increases swimming speed.

quests.title: Upgrade Groundstomp
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Active
&lAbility Function:&r
Repells nearby mobs when activated, has a cooldown.

quests.title: Upgrade Extinguish
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Exingishes the player if they are on fire, has a cooldown.

quests.title: Upgrade Stupefy
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Active
&lAbility Function:
Temporarily makes nearby hostile mobs loose agro to the player, has a cooldown.

quests.title: Upgrade Elytra
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Provides the player with an Elytra, note the Elytra provided by this upgrade is affected by the Walk and Run Speed upgrades.

quests.title: Upgrade Negatefalldamage
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:
Prevents the player from taking fall damage.

quests.title: Upgrade Nightvision
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Grants the player Night Vision.

quests.title: Upgrade Decoy
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Active
&lAbility Function:&r
Spawns a decoy of the player that pulls aggro away from the player, has a cooldown.

quests.title: Upgrade Earthquake
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Active
&lAbility Function:&r
An upgraded version of Ground Stomp that repells and slows nearby mobs, has a cooldown.

quests.title: Upgrade Noai
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Active
&lAbility Function:&r
Permantly removes the ai of nearby mobs, due to the power cost it can only affect five mobs at max per activation, has a very long cooldown.

quests.title: Upgrade Flight
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Grants the player creative flight.

quests.title: Upgrade Lavaimmunity
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Makes the player immune to lava.

quests.title: Upgrade Phase
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Allows the player to walk though blocks when applied to leggings. There is a block tag to blacklist blocks from being able to be phased through.
When applied to a bow, allows arrows to phase through walls.

quests.title: Upgrade Deathprotection
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Allows the player to cheat death, has a very long cooldown. So otherwise a Totem of Undying with a cooldown that isn't consumed.

quests.title: Upgrade Debuffremover
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Active
&lAbility Function:&r
Removes all negative debuffs from the player when actived, has a cooldown.

quests.title: Template Ferricore
desc: Has no uses, looks cool though.

quests.title: Template Blazegold
desc: Blazegold Templetes are used to upgrade Ferricore armor and tools to Blazegold while retaining enchantments and installed upgrades.

quests.title: Template Celestigem
desc: Celestigem Templetes are used to upgrade Blazegold armor and tools to Celestigem while retaining enchantments and installed upgrades.

quests.title: Template Eclipsealloy
desc: Eclipse Alloy Templetes are used to upgrade Celestigem armor and tools to Eclipse Alloy while retaining enchantments and installed upgrades.

quests.title: Upgrade Orescanner
desc:
&lAbility Type:&r Active

&lAbility Function:&r

Highlights nearby ores with green particals when activated.

&4&lNOTE THIS ABILITY HAS BEEN DISABLED.&r&f

quests.title: Quest 441F37A9
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks. 

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission. 

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: Time Crystal
quests.subtitle: Timey Wimey
desc:
Time Crystals are a new material added by JDT. These grow on Budding Time Crystal Blocks, which are created by performing goo spread on Budding Amethyst or a Time Crystal Block.

HOWEVER, the Budding Time Crystal Block must collect time from the Overworld, the Nether, and The End to be able to grow Time Crystal Clusters. You CANNOT break or use silk touch on the Budding Time Crystal Block. You must use a Swapper, Cardboard Box, or Cut Paste Gadget to move them.

After a while, the Budding Time Crystal Block will run out of energy, and must go for another trip to the Overworld, Nether, and End.
{@pagebreak}
To automate this process, look at the video linked in the image above this quest.

quests.title: Time Wand
quests.subtitle: Cousin of the Time in a Bottle
desc:
The Time Wand can be used to accelerate blocks, similarly to the Time in a Bottle, up to x128 speed. Unlike TIAB, it uses FE and Time Fluid rather than stored time as fuel, making it considerably easier to refill.

It is blacklisted for fake players, though. We don't want you automating THIS.

quests.title: Paradoxmachine
desc:
The &7Paradox Machine&r can, for a price of a lot of Power and &aTime Fluid&r, take a Snapshot of blocks and entities in the designated area; then it can duplicate it. 

Lots of Blocks and Entities are blacklisted by configs so no duplicating Bees!

quests.title: Time Fluid Bucket
desc:
Time Fluid is used by the Paradox Machine and Time Wand. It is obtained by dropping a Time Crystal into Polymorphic Fluid.

For a crystal so tough to get, I'm glad they gave us an easy fluid for once.

quests.title: Upgrade Time Protection
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Prevents slowness and speed effects from being given while you have Time Crystals in your inventory.

quests.title: Bow Ferricore
desc: Valid Upgrades:
- Potion Arrow

quests.title: Bow Blazegold
desc: Valid Upgrades:
- Potion Arrow
- Splash
Intrinsic Ability:
- Lava Repair

quests.title: Bow Celestigem
desc: Valid Upgrades:

- Lingering
- Homing Arrow

quests.title: Bow Eclipsealloy
desc: Valid Upgrades:
- Potion Arrow
- Splash
- Lingering
- Homing Arrow
- Phase
- Yondu Arrow

quests.title: Upgrade Potionarrow
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Makes arrows fired by the Bow apply a potion effect based on your Potion Canister.

quests.title: Upgrade Splash
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Makes Potion Arrows fired by the Bow have a Splash effect, hitting multiple targets in an area.

quests.title: Upgrade Lingering
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Makes Potion Arrows fired by the bow have a Lingering effect, applying effects to an area over time.

quests.title: Upgrade Homing
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Passive
&lAbility Function:&r
Makes Arrows actively seek their targets.

quests.title: Upgrade Epicarrow
desc: &lAbility Type:&r Active
&lAbility Function:&r
Makes Arrows chain to nearby enemies.

quests.title: Quest 73552A4B
desc: These upgrades can go into either tools or armor.

quests.title: Productive Bees!
desc:
Welcome to &6Productive Bees&r!

To get started with the mod, you'll first need to find some Honeycombs and Honey Bottles! Find yourself a Beehive, and let the bees do their work for a little. Shearing it when it is full will give you honeycombs, and glass bottles will give you Honey Bottles!

&9Important Note&r: With the bee quests requiring combs, the recipes will not be shown. Make sure to look them up in JEI if you need them!

quests.title: Your First Beehive
desc:
Using the vanilla method, go ahead and make yourself a &9Beehive&r to have your own little setup!

These can hold 3 Bees each, but we won't be using it for long...

Bees will only create Honey and Honeycombs if they have the right flowers. Vanilla bees can use any flower, but most bees in the mod will require a specific block! Make sure to check JEI for more info.

quests.title: Capturing Bees!
desc: To get our own bee farm going, we'll have to find us some bees... and capture them.
Right-clicking a bee with this will capture it!
Adventuring can also net you some &6Sturdy Bee Cages&r, so keep an eye out!

quests.title: Advanced Beehive
quests.subtitle: No more shearing.
desc:
With the vanilla Beehive, we'll use this to craft an &eAdvanced Beehive&r. It can be Oak or any kind of wood.

Bees will fly in and out of these, and drop off Honeycombs in the inventory. You can also insert glass bottles to get Honey Bottles.

We'll need a lot of Honeycomb for treats!

quests.title: Wood Nests
quests.subtitle: Can be used in any Overworld biome
desc:
Wood Nests are used to lure Carpenter Bees and the Blue Banded Bee.

Dark Oak Nests lures 3 different bees.

These can be placed in any Overworld Biome.

quests.title: Stone Nest
quests.subtitle: Lures Bees in any Overworld Biome
desc: The Stone Nest can be placed in any overworld biome to lure in a Mason Bee or Digger Bee.

quests.title: Coarse Dirt Nest
quests.subtitle: Any Overworld Biome
desc: The &eDirt Nest&r can be placed in any overworld biome to lure in bees.
It can lure the Ashy Mining Bee, Chocolate Mining Bee, and the Leafcutter Bee.

quests.title: Sand Nest
quests.subtitle: Lures bees in Desert Biomes
desc: When placed in a Desert biome, the Sand Nest will attract either the Chocolate or Ashy Mining Bee.

quests.title: Snow Nest
quests.subtitle: Lures the Sweat Bee in Cold Biomes
desc: Placing a Snow Nest in a snowy biome will lure in a Sweat Bee.

quests.title: Gravel Nest
quests.subtitle: Lures in bees in River and Beach Biomes
desc: The Gravel Nest will lure bees in either a River biome or Beach biome.
It lures in the Ashy Mining Bee, Chocolate Mining Bee, and the Digger Bee.

quests.title: Sugar Cane Nest
quests.subtitle: Lures bees in any Overworld Biome
desc: A Reed Nest will work in any overworld biome, and will lure in a Mason Bee or a Reed Bee.

quests.title: Slimy Nest
quests.subtitle: Lures in a Slimy Bee in a Swamp Biome
desc: When placed in a swamp biome, the Slimy Nest will lure in Slimy Bees.

quests.title: Glowstone Nest
quests.subtitle: Lures a Glowing Bee in the Nether
desc: When placed in the Nether and given Glowstone, the Glowstone Nest will lure in a Glowing Bee.

quests.title: Soul Sand Nest
quests.subtitle: Lures in Ghostly Bees when placed in the Nether and given Ghast Tears

quests.title: Nether Quartz Nest
quests.subtitle: Lures in Crystalline Bees in the Nether
desc: This nest attracts &eCrystalline Bees&r. You'll need Nether Quartz instead of using Honey Treats to attract the Bee.
The easiest way to get a quartz block is by mining it with a Silk Touch pick.
Tip: Brass has the Silk Touch trait when making a Silent Gear tool.

quests.title: Nether Brick Nest
quests.subtitle: Lures in a Magmatic Bee when placed in the Nether
desc: Placing the Nether Brick Nest in the Nether will lure in a Magmatic Bee when given Magma Cream.

quests.title: End Stone Nest
quests.subtitle: Lures in Ender Bees when placed in the End
desc: To attract Bees to this nest, you'll need Popped Chorus Fruit instead of Honey Treats.

quests.title: Obsidian Nest
quests.subtitle: Lures a Draconic Bee in the End
desc: The Obsidian Nest will lure in Draconic Bees when placed in the End.
These do not accept Honey Treats, but instead use Dragon's Breath.

quests.title: Quest 37367101
quests.subtitle: Spawns from a Dirt Nest
desc: The Ashy Mining Bee is spawned from a Dirt, Gravel, or Sand Nest.

quests.title: Crystalline Bee
quests.subtitle: Spawns from a Quartz Nest in the Nether

quests.title: Tin Bee
quests.subtitle: Ashy Mining + Crystalline
desc: Tin Bees are made by breeding a Crystalline Bee with an Ashy Mining Bee.

quests.title: Aluminium Bee
quests.subtitle: Crystalline + Ashy Mining
desc: Yes, it's called an Aluminium Bee.

quests.title: Honey Treat
desc: In Productive Bees, you don't spend most of your time flying around trying to find certain bees.
Instead, you spawn them using Nests with &6Honey Treats&r.
With these, you'll create yourself some Nests and right click them with the treats to lure Bees in. Some Nests require special items instead of Honey Treats, so make sure to check JEI for more info!
Make sure to check out which biome you need to be in to lure in the right Bees!

quests.title: Searching for Nests
desc: Right-clicking on a Nest of the type you are looking for will point you in the direction of another!

quests.title: Upgrade Base
desc: The Upgrade Base is used to craft the various Upgrades in Productive Bees.

quests.title: Upgrade Time
quests.subtitle: Sonic Bees
desc:
Can be placed in a hive or centrifuge.

When in a hive, it decreases the amount of time bees spend in the hive by 20%.

When placed in a Centrifuge, it increases the processing speed.

These do stack.

quests.title: Upgrade Child
quests.subtitle: Making Babies
desc:
When installed in a Hive, it gives a 5% chance for a new baby Bee to be spawned every time honey is delivered.

When placed in a Catcher, it only allows the catcher to catch baby Bees.

You can stack these for a greater chance.

quests.title: Upgrade Block
quests.subtitle: 4x Comb
desc: All Bees will give Comb Blocks instead of Combs, effectively quadrupling outputs!

quests.title: Upgrade Anti Teleport
quests.subtitle: Prevents Bees from Teleporting in a Hive
desc: You'll need these for Ender Bees.

quests.title: Upgrade Range
quests.subtitle: Increases the Range of a Machine
desc: Mostly for the Catcher.

quests.title: Upgrade Entity Filter
quests.subtitle: Used to add Bees to a Filter

quests.title: Upgrade Gene Sampler
quests.subtitle: Extracts Genes from Bees in Hives

quests.title: Smart Filter
quests.subtitle: Processing Honeycombs
desc:
The &9Centrifuge&r is used to process Combs from Bees into useful items and honey! While you can definitely just use a regular &9Centrifuge&r in the beginning, getting a &6Powered Centrifuge&r soon after is a must. This is a faster Centrifuge that runs off of power!

If you're looking for the best way to process your Combs, the &cHeated Centrifuge&r is even faster and processes &aComb Blocks&r instead of Combs!

These can all be made faster by using Speed Upgrades.

quests.title: Diamond Bee
quests.subtitle: Ender + Lapis
desc: Breed the Ender Bee with a Lapis Bee to create a Diamond Bee!

quests.title: Lapis Bee
quests.subtitle: Redstone + Blue Banded
desc: Breed a Redstone Bee with a Blue Banded Bee to get a Lapis Bee!

quests.title: Redstone Bee
quests.subtitle: Glowing + Chocolate Mining
desc: With the Glowing Bee, breed it with the Chocolate Mining Bee to get a Redstone Bee!

quests.title: Ender Bee
quests.subtitle: &9Requires End Stone Nest
desc: Create yourself an &5End Stone Nest&r and head to the End to capture one of these bees!

quests.title: Glowing Bee
desc: You'll need to grab yourself a &6Glowstone Nest&r and head to the Nether to capture this bee!

quests.title: Emerald Bee
quests.subtitle: Diamond Bee + Slimy Bee
desc: Once you have a Diamond Bee, breed it with the Slimy Bee to create an Emerald Bee!

quests.title: Slimy Bee
quests.subtitle: &9Requires Slimy Nest
desc: You can lure these bees in using a Slimy Nest in a swamp biome.

quests.title: Ancient Bee
quests.subtitle: Feed Diamond Bee a Block of Netherite

quests.title: Withered Bee
quests.subtitle: Feed a Skeletal Bee a Withered Rose

quests.title: Allthemodium Bee
desc: Using a smeltery, pour &#F2EB2EMolten Allthemodium&r over an &#944A12Ancient Bee Spawn Egg&r.

quests.title: Skeletal Bee
quests.subtitle: Spawned with empty Beehives in the Dark
desc: Place some empty &eAdvanced Beehives&r in an unlit area. The bees will move in over time.

quests.title: Draconic Bee
quests.subtitle: &9Requires Obsidian Nest
desc: Place an Obsidian Nest in the End to lure this bee.

quests.title: Vibranium Bee
desc: Using a smeltery, pour &#4CE688Molten Vibranium&r over an &#F2EB2EAllthemodium Bee Spawn Egg&r.

quests.title: Unobtainium Bee
desc: Using a smeltery, pour &#9332D9Molten Unobtainium&r over an &#F2EB2EVibranium Bee Spawn Egg&r.

quests.subtitle: Molten Electrum over Gold/Silver Bee Spawn Egg

quests.subtitle: Spawns in a nest that has an Ashy Mining Bee
desc: If you want one of these, you'll need an Ashy Mining Bee first.
Once the Ashy Mining Bee is cozy in its nest, there is a chance for a Nomad Bee to take it over.

quests.title: Sugarbag Bee
quests.subtitle: Chance to Spawn when breaking Cocoa Pods in a Jungle

quests.title: ZomBee
quests.subtitle: Spawns in empty Advanced Beehives in Dark Places

quests.title: Bronze Bee
quests.subtitle: Molten Bronze over Copper/Tin Bee Spawn Egg

quests.title: Constantan Bee
quests.subtitle: Molten Constantan over Nickel/Copper Bee Spawn Egg

quests.title: Quest 2E51F09F
quests.subtitle: Farmer + Rancher
desc: This is the Breeder Bee.

quests.subtitle: Molten enderium over lead/diamond/platinum bee egg

quests.title: Invar Bee
quests.subtitle: Molten Invar over Tin/Iron Bee Spawn Egg

quests.title: Lumium Bee
quests.subtitle: Molten Lumium over Silver/Tin Bee Spawn Egg

quests.title: Signalum Bee

quests.title: Steel Bee
quests.subtitle: Molten Steel over Iron/Coal Bee Spawn Egg

quests.title: Ghostly Bee
quests.subtitle: Spawned using a Soul Sand Nest in the Nether.

quests.title: Magmatic Bee
quests.subtitle: Spawned using a Nether Brick Nest in the Nether

quests.title: Bumble Bee
quests.subtitle: Spawns in the Overworld from Bumble Bee Nests
desc:
Have you ever wanted to fly on a bee?

Bumble Bees naturally spawn in the world, and they can be used as mounts!

Make yourself a &6Treat on a Stick&r, slap a saddle on a Bumble Bee, and take to the skies!

quests.title: Quest 1C474B46
quests.subtitle: Spawned using a Gravel or Stone Nest

quests.title: Brown Shroombee
quests.subtitle: Feed a Shroombee a Brown Mushroom

quests.subtitle: Feed a Vanilla Bee a Hopper

Not as good as a Hoarder Bee.

quests.title: Fluix Bee
quests.subtitle: Feed a Spatial Bee a Fluix Pearl

quests.title: Hoarder Bee
quests.subtitle: Feed a Collector Bee a Shulker Shell
desc: Collects items on the ground and brings it back to it's nest.

quests.title: ProsperiBee
quests.subtitle: Feed a Crystalline Bee a Prosperity Block

quests.title: Red Shroombee
quests.subtitle: Feed a Shroombee a Red Mushroom

quests.subtitle: Feed a Diamond Bee a Ruby

quests.title: Sapphire Bee
quests.subtitle: Feed a Diamond Bee a Sapphire

quests.title: Soulium Bee
quests.subtitle: Feed a Ghostly Bee a Soulium Dagger

quests.title: Quest 17419401
quests.subtitle: The Bees and the Bees
desc: Aside from luring bees in with nests, most bees require either &eBreeding&r or &9Conversion&r to bee created. (No, that isn't a typo.)
&eBee Breeding&r requires 2 bees and specific items fed to them to cause them to mate.
&9Bee Conversion&r requires you to feed a bee a specific item to convert it into a new Bee.

quests.title: Quest 120BDCB7
quests.subtitle: Honey Treats Required
desc: If you want to turn your Bee Farm into a factory for resources, you'll need to start by spawning in Bees with &6Nests&r.
The nests must be placed in specific biomes, which you can find in the JEI for it (look for the I icon at the top).
To lure in a Bee to the Nest, right click on it with a &9Honey Treat&r. Nests will not work without the treats!!
&9Important Note&r: Certain Bees will only live in Nests and will not go into Advanced Hives. If they don't produce Honeycomb, they need to live in a Nest instead.

quests.title: Expansion Box
quests.subtitle: Increasing our bee storage
desc: Expansion boxes are placed on top of your Advanced Beehives to increase the amount of bees that can be in the hive to a total of 5 slots. These are also necessary for your Advanced Beehives to support upgrades.

quests.title: Quest 4C0302FF
desc: If you want the ATM bees, it takes a lot of capturing and breeding and feeding.
The following part of the questline outlines which bees you'll need to move forward.
Make sure to check JEI and the &9Big Book of Bees&r for more info!

quests.title: Gene Indexer
quests.subtitle: The Gene Combiner and Chest
desc: When collecting genes, you'll get a percentage of a trait. You can combine them in a crafting table to add them together, or place them in a Gene Indexer to auto-combine.

quests.title: Bottler
quests.subtitle: Honey I Squished The Bees
desc:
The Bottler has two uses: Bottling honey and squshing bees for genes.

To get genes from bees, place a piston above the Bottler with a block of space between them.

Place the bee on top of the Bottler, and activate the piston to squish the bee into genes. The resulting squished bottle can be then placed in a Centrifuge.

Note: Make sure to have bottles in the Bottler.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/bees/bottler.png width:100 height:150 align:1}

quests.title: Catcher
quests.subtitle: Catches Bees
desc:
Used to catch bees that are flying around it.

You can use a Filter Upgrade to filter out which bees you want to catch, as well as a BaBee Upgrade to only catch baby bees.

quests.title: Incubator
quests.subtitle: Baby Bee Daycare
desc:
This can be used to speed up the growth rate of baby Bees, or to create new Spawn Eggs.

Place a caged baby Bee with 20 Honey Treats to turn it into an adult.

To create Spawn Eggs, you'll need to combine the gene of the bee you want with a honey treat, then use that honey treat in this machine with an egg to create the new spawn egg.

Genes can be combined for a maximum of 100% purity, which will give you a 100% chance to convert an Egg to a Bee Spawn Egg.
{@pagebreak}

You can even apply genes to a bee without taking it out of its cage with this. Put a Honey Treat with the gene samples of your choice into the incubator along with a bee cage holding the bee you want to apply genes to.

quests.title: Jar Oak
quests.subtitle: Showing Off Bees
desc:
Proud of the Bees you have?

Wanna put them into a jar to show it off?

Place a Bee Jar down and use a Pipe or Hopper to insert the caged Bee into the jar.

quests.title: Nether Gold Nest
quests.subtitle: Lures a Gold Bee when placed in the Nether
desc: Instead of using Honey Treats, this hive requires Gold Ingots to attract Bees.

quests.title: Quest 0A11725B
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks. 

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission. 

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: Upgrade Simulator
quests.subtitle: Are the Bees still real?
desc:
When installed into an Advanced Beehive, bees no longer physically exit the hive. A trip to their flower block will be simulated.

Make sure to put its required flower block or a Feeding Slab in front of the hive containing the required flower blocks or items for the bee in the hive. To see how to set it up correctly, check the Feeding Slab quest.

I highly recommend getting this so your bees don't disappear and to be able to more easily put in/take out bees from the hive.

quests.title: Upgrade Time 2
quests.subtitle: Sonic everything but Bees
desc:
Think of the previous Upgrade: Speed, now think of it making things even faster! 

These Upgrades can be used in the Machines to make them work 40% faster! 
Yes, their effects stack. 

No, they can not be used in Hives, that's what Productivity is for!

quests.title: Stopping Dripping
quests.subtitle: You got no Drip
desc:
Do Hives annoy you when they drip? If so, you're in luck because there's an easy solution.

You can place a &eSponge&r in the Bottle slot of an Advanced Hive to stop it from dripping.

quests.title: Feeder
quests.subtitle: Slapping down a Slab
desc: You can place Bee Flowers on Feeding Slabs that are placed in front of Hives, as shown in the image below.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/bees/feeder.png width:175 height:100 align:center fit:true}

quests.title: Sky Steel Bee
desc: If you throw a &9Spatial Bee Spawn Egg&r and a &8Sky Steel Block&r into Lava, you will create a Sky Steel Bee Spawn Egg.

quests.subtitle: 2 tall flowers can be crafted with MA Essence

quests.title: Bee Of Infinity
desc: A &8BlazBee&r pollinating an &4Obsidian Bee Spawn Egg&r will convert it into a &2Infinity Bee Spawn Egg&r.

quests.subtitle: Industrially squeeze some Coal Bee Spawn Eggs

quests.subtitle: It seems Gold Bees like Music Discs

quests.title: Adamant Bee
quests.subtitle: Alloy a Diamond Bee Spawn Egg with a Nickel Bee Spawn Egg

quests.title: Draconium Bee
quests.subtitle: Wyvern Fusion Crafting
desc: Not to be confused with a Draconic Bee.

quests.title: Awakened Bee
quests.subtitle: Draconic Fusion Crafting
desc: Not to be confused with the Awakened Supremium Bee.

quests.title: Gene Samples
quests.subtitle: To make the ultimate bee
desc:
Bees have varying traits that can affect how they work, when they work, their aggression, and their likelihood to lose their stinger when they attack you. In these quests I will be going over the way to get the best traits possible, as well as how to use them.

To get these Gene Samples, check out the Bottler quest, which is a dependency of this one. To actually apply these Gene Samples to your bees, you will need to combine them with a Honey Treat in a crafting grid. All traits, except for Type, you can apply to your bees by feeding them the Honey Treat. Type works differently, and must instead be used with the Incubator to make a Spawn Egg of the respective bee.

quests.title: &a&lProductivity
quests.subtitle: The big one
desc:
Affects the amount of combs you receive whenever a bee produces honeycombs. There are 4 levels of this: &aNormal&r, &9Medium&r, &dHigh&r, &cVery High&r. &cVery High&r is what we are after.

It is found on KamikazBee and BeeBee. BeeBee can naturally be found in The Other, and is an EXTREMELY lethal bee. If you'd rather not risk dealing with an exceptionally lethal bee, you can also rely on KamikazBees.

To get a KamikazBee, you need a Bee Nest Helmet. Get attacked by mobs (or shoot yourself with an arrow) while wearing the helmet for a 30% chance of having a KamikazBee emerge. It is quite fast, and will sting the aggressor (unless it's you), so better catch it quickly or use the Catcher.

quests.title: &9&lWeather Tolerance
quests.subtitle: The least big one of the big ones
desc:
Affects the ability of a bee to work under harsh weather conditions. There are 3 levels of this: &aNone&r, &dRain&r, &cAny&r. &cAny&r is what we are after. You could leash the bee to a fence during a thunderstorm if you wanted to, but come on, that's just cruel.

I offer you an easier solution. Fishing. That's right, you can fish for bees. Water or Prismarine Bees naturally come with the ability to tolerate any weather conditions. We can make use of this!

quests.title: &e&lBehavior
quests.subtitle: Sleep is for the weak
desc:
Affects the time of day a bee can work. There are 3 levels of this: &aDiurnal&r, &dNocturnal&r, &cMetaturnal&r. &aDiurnal&r bees can only work during daytime, &dNocturnal&r bees can only work during nighttime, &cMetaturnal&r bees can work at any time of the day. &cMetaturnal&r is what we're after. BeeBee naturally has the &cMetaturnal&r trait. As mentioned in the &a&lProductivity&r quest, this bee is found in The Other, and is a particularly lethal one.

If you'd rather not deal with that lethal bee, there's another option. We will need to leash some bees to a fence during nighttime to make them &dNocturnal&r, then leaving those bees out on a fence during daytime to make them &cMetaturnal&r. We can skip one of these steps with a Ghostly Bee, which is naturally &dNocturnal&r.

quests.title: &b&lEndurance
quests.subtitle: One of the less important ones
desc: Affects the bee's likelihood of losing its stinger whenever it attacks something. This trait is less important compared to the first 3 I mentioned, but I will talk about it anyway. There are 4 levels of this: &aWeak&r, &9Normal&r, &dMedium&r, &cStrong&r. &cStrong&r is the one I will focus on. Certain Bees, like Draconic, Obsidian, and some other bees I may not have mentioned naturally have strong Endurance, allowing them to keep their stinger.

quests.title: &4&lTemper
quests.subtitle: Stop stinging me already!
desc: Affects the bee's aggression and likeliness to sting you. This is one of the less important traits, though it is worth not having an Aggressive bee when you want to work with one in world. There are 4 levels of this: &aPassive&r, &9Normal&r, &cHostile&r, &dAggressive&r. I'll be honest I don't really know what each level of Temper does. All I know is that &dAggressive&r bees WILL sting you, even if otherwise unprovoked. Bees will become less aggressive if you feed them Honey Treats.

quests.title: Breeding Chamber
quests.subtitle: Making Babies 2: Electric Beegaloo
desc:
The Breeding Chamber can be used to breed two bees with each other, automatically. It is capable of self breeding, as well as breeding 2 types of bees to make a third type (Example: Ashy Mining + Crystalline -> Iron). If this would result in a conflict (Continuing off of the earlier example, Ashy Mining + Crystalline -> Aluminium), take out one of the bees, then put it back in.

Provide breeding items in each slot (usually flowers, hold SHIFT on a bee cage holding a certain bee type to see what breeding item it uses (Draconic Bees use 2 Draconic Dust for example)) and some bee cages.

Just...don't do...whatever it takes to get the F.Bee.I. to go after you. I will ensure you get added to the Hall of Shame if they DO come after you.

quests.title: &l&6Relics
desc:
Welcome to &6&lRelics&r! 
 
&6Relics&r mod is similar to Artifacts, you get many unique and powerful items all throughout the Worlds. 
 
They have many different Abilities which are obtained and upgraded through the &6Research Window&r (Hold shift on the relic). There you can exchange &aVanilla XP&r to reroll the stats on its abilites, see your current &eRelic XP&r, gained from using the &6Relics&r, and level up their abilities! 
 
To use &6Relic&r Abilities default is Left Alt.

quests.title: &9Reflecting Necklace
quests.subtitle: Found in Ruined Portals, Nether Fortresses, and Bastions
desc: Pufferfish are pretty cool, same with Guardians, same with Thorns! Every damage dealt while wearing the &9Reflecting Necklace&r will accumulate points. Either after 5 seconds from last damage or when the points are full, the &9Necklace&r will shoot out &5Obsidian Spikes&r in all directions damaging all nearby.

quests.title: &6Magma Walkers
quests.subtitle: Found in Ruined Portals, Nether Fortresses, and Bastions
desc: The &6Magma Walkers&r allow you 2 things, walking on &cMagma Blocks&r without taking damage, and walking on &4Lava&r for a little bit. &cMagma Blocks&r don't have a cooldown but walking on &4Lava&r does. After the period is over the &6Boots&r will overheat and damage you.

quests.title: &3Aqua Walkers
quests.subtitle: Found in Shipwrecks and Ocean Ruins
desc: With &3Aqua Walkers&r you can use it's Ability to walk on &9Water&r! You can hold Shift to sink into &9Water&r and Swim. I think I've read about a story like that once?

quests.title: &9Midnight Robe
quests.subtitle: Found in Mineshafts or Strongholds
desc:
Ever want to be just like Batman? Living in the shadows bringing justice? Then the &9Midnight Robe&r is perfect for you! {It's also stylish!) When worn in Low Light Levels you will become Invisible and be given Speed. This can be upgraded for the Light Levels to be higher or to give more Speed. 
 
The Second Ability gives remneants of most Stealth Games. When you hit a Mob while Invisible you'll deal much more damage but lose your stealth and speed until you leave the Circle made around the Mob.

quests.title: &8Drowned Belt
quests.subtitle: Found in Shipwrecks and Ocean Ruins
desc:
First Ability with &8Drowned Belt&r is in the name, it's a Belt, it holds Talismans. 
 
The Second one works with swimming in the &9Water&r. Ever get jealous of how the Drowned move through the &9Water&r as if it were their home? Well with this Ability you can get similar! 
 
The Third one works like Impaling, you'll do increased Damage in the &9Water&r. 
 
And the Last Ability also works with Trident Enchanting, you can now use Channeling anywhere regardless of how wet!

quests.title: &9Jellyfish Necklace
quests.subtitle: Found in Shipwrecks and Ocean Ruins
desc:
Even though there might not be any &9Jellyfish&r in &2Minecraft&r we can get the power of them! With the &9Jellyfish Necklace&r! While wearing it, it's First and passive ability allows you to not sink in water, to walk over it. 
 
The Second Ability which is also a passive ability makes it so you sting mobs that come close to you. It can be upgraded to do more damage. 
 
The Last Ability grants an Effect to the Second Ability. Any mob hit with the Second Ability will be paralyzed! Kinda glad there isn't any &9Jellyfish&r in &2Minecraft&r now...

quests.title: &2Hunter's Belt
quests.subtitle: Found in Butcher's Huts of any Village
desc:
The &2Hunter's Belt&r works like the Leather Belt as in it holds Talismans. That's its first ability which can be upgraded to hold more! 
 
The Second Ability increases the damage your pets do. Pets are tamed Mobs that can do damage to other Mobs, like wolves!

quests.title: &cRage Glove
quests.subtitle: Found in Ruined Portals, Nether Fortresses, and Bastions
desc:
If you know the term '&4Berserk&r' in most gaming, that will help you understand what the &cRage Glove&r does. If you don't know, the basics of &4Berserk&r is when someone gets low health or takes lots of damage, usually they will deal higher damage and be faster. That's what happens with First Ability, when you take damage you accumulate points which can be exchanged for higher damage and speed! 
 
The Second Ability does that passively, and gives you Regeneration per the amount of health you lost.
