The Third Ability is an active one, when using it (Alt Tab) you will dash and attack any mob you are looking at. When hit it'll set them on &cFire&r, give them Bleeding, and any accumulated &4Berserk&r points deal extra damage with it!

quests.title: &bIce Skates
quests.subtitle: Found in Villages in Taigas or Snowy Taigas
desc:
Ever hate how slow &bIce&r is unless using a Boat? Which still doesn't make sense to me! &bIce Skates&r change that now you accelerate on &bIce&r while wearing &bIce Skates&r. You can upgrade them to accel faster! 
 
After upgrading them you can get a Second Ability which allows you to damage Mobs by running into them while wearing &bIce Skates&r.

quests.title: &eBastion Ring
quests.subtitle: Found in Ruined Portals, Nether Fortresses, and Bastions
desc:
The 'Babes' love the &eBling&r! The &eBastion Ring&r is perfect for the bartering man. While wearing it Piglins will be neutral with you like how they are when you wear &eGold&r. This does not mean you can freely loot their chests though. The &eRing&r will also give you a chance at getting more Loot from Bartering. 
 
(While wearing the &eRing&r Piglins might point you toward the nearest Bastion).

quests.title: &5Chorus Inhibitor
quests.subtitle: Found in End Cities and End Ships
desc: &5Chorus Inhibitor&r is another simple &6Relic&r. It can teleport you to a block you are looking at if it's in range. The range can be upgraded in the &6Research Window&r.

quests.title: &eSpace Dissector
quests.subtitle: Found in Ruined Portals, Nether Fortresses, and Bastions
desc: &eSpace Dissector&r should named &eWormhole Creator&r, it makes portals from one spot to another. To set the spots Hold Right Click to set the first portal, then move and stop Holding Right Click to set the second portal. You can upgrade them to increase the space between them and the time they are up. Hehe space and time, portals... if you were smarter you'd be laughing.

quests.title: &6Holy&r &7Locket&r
quests.subtitle: Found in all Villages
desc:
Okay this is a long one just stick with me. First Ability allows two modes,  &6Sancity&r and &7Unholiness&r. &6Sancity&r takes some of your Healing and uses it as Damage against enemies. &7Unholiness&r does the opposite, it takes the enemies Healing to help you deal more damage. Mobs like &dEnder Dragon&r and &5Wither&r both regenerate Health. 
 
The Second Ability is Repentance, while active it will Burn Undead Mobs (Zombie, Skeleton, and their cousins). 
 
The Third Ability grants a small time period of Invincibility.

quests.title: &2Ender Hand
quests.subtitle: Found in End Cities and End Ships
desc: &2Ender Hand&r does two things a Passive Ability and an Active Ability. Passive makes &5Endermen&r not angry when you look at them. Active allows you to trade places with a mob you're looking at with Left Alt.

quests.title: Elytra Booster
quests.subtitle: Found in End Cities and End Ships
desc: Are Rockets just too expensive? You can use an &7Elytra Booster&r instead of Rockets. Wear both Elytra and &7Elytra Booster&r, then Fuel the Booster. It accepts any Furnace Fuel: Coal, Lava, Logs, even Dried Kelp Blocks. Then when flying with an Elytra, Left Alt to press Accelerate! Now you're flying with much cheaper Eco-Friendly Fuel!

quests.title: &bMagic Mirror
quests.subtitle: Found in Mineshafts or Strongholds
desc:
'&bMirror Mirror&r on the wall how do I get back to my Respawn Point from my travels?' 
 
'After setting the &bMagic Mirror&r to a Bed by right clicking with it, you can hold right click for the &bMagic Mirror&r to teleport you back to your bed!' 
 
'Thank you &bMirror&r!'

quests.title: Ice Breakers
quests.subtitle: Found in Villages in Taigas or Snowy Taigas
desc:
&7Ice Breakers&r First Ability is to make your Balance as solid as a rock. Knockback is decreased and slipping on &bIce&r is decreased as well. 
 
The Second Ability is Earthquake! While falling select Earthquake with Left Alt and when you land it will cause a shockwave beneath you damaging all mobs nearby.

quests.title: &5Blazing Flask
quests.subtitle: Found in Ruined Portals, Nether Fortresses, and Bastions
desc: You like Flying? You like Arson? You like both? Then the Blazing Flask is perfect for you! Right Click the Blazing Flask near Fire sources and a circle will be made around it. In the circle you will be granted Creative Flight. The circle can be made bigger through upgrading it in the &6Research Window&r and by adding more Fire!

quests.title: &aSpore Sack
quests.subtitle: Found in Jungle Pyramids
desc:
The &aSpore Sack&r is all about.. you guessed it! &aSpores&r!!! The First Ability releases a &aSpore&r everytime you are hit. The &aSpore&r will fly around until it sticks to a Block and will explode when a mob comes near. 
 
The Second Ability allows you to accumulate &aSpores&r. Everytime you are hit 1 &aSpore&r is released and 1 is kept in your &aSpore Sack&r to be used for later. 
 
Third Ability allows floating &aSpores&r to reproduce like cells, divide and multiply! 
 
Last Ability is best of them all! Using Left Alt you can release all &aSpores&r accumulated! Their size is dependent on your health as well.

quests.title: &dShadow Glaive
quests.subtitle: Found in End Cities and End Ships
desc:
&dShadow Glaives&r are more Weapons than &6Relic&r. First Ability is just throwing 1 &dGlaive&r. After it hits a mob, it'll bounce back to other mobs, and maybe return back to you. You can upgrade it for more damage, bounces, and quicker recharge. 
 
The Second Ability uses all its charges to release a giant &dsaw&r! It's very cool I recommend trying it out!

quests.title: &cRoller Skates
quests.subtitle: Found in Mineshafts or Strongholds
desc: Allows you to move much faster on all blocks by letting you accelerate while running on them! Warning much more slippery! Upgrade them to go even faster.

quests.title: &cInfinity Ham
quests.subtitle: Found in Villages or Outposts
desc:
The Eternal Steak, oh wait wrong mod. The &cInfinity Ham&r works as an infinite food source. Eat all the Meat off the Bone and it'll Regenerate after some time. You can upgrade it to fill your belly more. 
 
The Second Ability of the &cInfinity Ham&r is marinating it in Potions. When you do that, everytime you eat from the &cHam&r you will get that Potion Effect. If you eat all the Meat it will lose the Effect though.

quests.title: &6Leather Belt
quests.subtitle: Found in Mineshafts or Strongholds
desc: Holds Talismans... not much else. Might also hold your Pants up but haven't tested it yet.

quests.title: &9Wool Mittens
quests.subtitle: Found in Villages in Taigas or Snowy Taigas
desc: This ones very simple. Put on your &9Mittens&r, pick up some &fSnow&r, mush it together, and Boom you just made a &fSnowball&r! These are better than &2Vanilla&r &fSnowballs&r, these were made with &9Mittens&r!

quests.title: &aAmphibian Boots
quests.subtitle: Found in Shipwrecks and Ocean Ruins
desc:
These &alittle fishy boots&r help you to swim faster with the First Ability. Upgrade them to swim slightly faster!

Second Ability works with &9Water&r as well, just the one from the sky. You will run faster when it is raining.

The Last Ability somehow affects your lungs, you get a chance at not using Oxygen Bubbles when underwater.

quests.title: &2Overworld
desc: These Relics can be found in the &2Overworld&r!

quests.title: &cThe Nether
desc: These Relics can be found in &cThe Nether&r!

quests.title: &dThe End
desc: These Relics can be found in &dThe End&r!

quests.title: Quest 3E99F4CD
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &9&lMetallurgic Infuser
quests.subtitle: The Starting Machine
desc:
The first and most important &5Machine&r is the &9&lMetallurgic Infuser&r! 

The &9&lMetallurgic Infuser&r will combine an &eItem&r and a &cChemicals&r to Craft new &eItems&r and Alloys. 

&cChemicals &for &aInfuse Types&r will go into the &eYellow Square&r and will show up in the &eBar&r to the Left of it. 

The &4Red Square&r will hold the Item that gets Infused. 

The &9Dark Blue Square&r will be where the product goes to! 

To the Right, the &aLight Green Slot&r and &aBar&r are for &aEnergy&r! 

If you need to make room in the &eChemical Bar&r, use the &lDUMP&r Button. This will eject all &aChemicals&r in it!

quests.title: &d&lEnrichment Chamber
quests.subtitle: Breaks Raw Ores into Dusts
desc:
The &d&lEnrichment Chamber&r will &dEnrich &eItems&r that go through it. Just place the &eItems&r in the &4Red Slots&r and the &dEnriched Items&r will come out of the &9Blue Slots&r. 

What is an &dEnriched Item&r? Or what happens when an &eItem&r gets &dEnriched&r? Either we get more of it the &eItems&r it can be made into or change the &eItem&r themselves! 

We can get 2 Dust from 1 Ore. We can get more Dyes from one Flower. We can even change &6Copper&r Stages or take &2Moss&r off &7Cobblestone&r! 

With later Tiers of &d&lEnrichment Chambers&r we get even more Slots to &dEnrich&f more &eItems&r at once. 

We also get the ability to Auto-Sort. With the press of this Button! We can set it so the Stacks of &eItems&r will be evenly distributed to each Slot so the &d&lMachine&r is more Efficient.

quests.title: &7&lOsmium Compressor
quests.subtitle: Really Only Good For 2 Things
desc:
The &7&lMachine&r creates two really strong ingots: &eRefined Glowstone&f and &5Refined Obsidian&r.

It &7Infuses&r an &eItem&r with &7Osmium&r to create a more powerful Ingot. 

We'll need to place &7Osmium Ingots&f, &7Osmium Blocks&f, or a &cChemical Tank&f with &7Osmium Chemical&r in it to feed the &l&7Compressor&r &7Osmium&r!

quests.title: &4&lCrusher
quests.subtitle: It Crushes Things.
desc:
The &4&lCrusher&r does as the name suggests! Just like every other Mod's &4Crushers&r... 

We can get Dust from Ingots, &7Cobble&r from &7Stone&r, and &2Bio Fuel&r from &2Plants&r! 

Dust will be needed for lots of Recipes so you'll definitely need this. Especially for making &8Upgrades&r!

quests.title: &cJetpack
quests.subtitle: Requires Hydrogen to Work!
desc:
The &5&lMekanism&r &cJetpack&r works similar to &l&7Iron Jetpacks&r just with different Modes and it requires Hydrogen as Fuel instead of &aEnergy&r! 

Just place some Hydrogen in the &cJetpack&r by putting it in a &5Machine&r that has Hydrogen. Funny enough the &9&lElectrolytic Separator&r also has Hydrogen when it has &bOxygen&r! 

Once you strap it on your Back you can press (G) to switch between the Modes. 

&4Regular&r: hold Jump to go up, you will move in any direction you hit with WASD and if you don't you will only go up. When you release Jump Button you will Fall. 

&bHover&r: same controls as Default but with slower movement and you won't Fall when you release Jump. You can lower by hitting (Shift). 

&6Vector&r: won't respond to WASD and instead will move to where the Player is looking when holding Jump to go up. 

&4Disabled&r: doesn't work! 

By the way, you can upgrade the &cJetpack&r with a few Blocks and Items to make it have Armor Protection!

quests.title: &5Quantum Entangloporters
quests.subtitle: Wireless Power, Gases, Fluids, Everything.
desc:
&o"Through using highly detailed Atomic Machinery we can take all Matter apart to the molecular level and move those molecules through specific wave lengths..."&r Oh come on this is just Magic! 
With 2 &5Quantum Entangloporters&r we can Wirelessly move &eItems&f, &bFluids&f, &cChemicals&f, &6Heat&f, and &aEnergy&r! 

First, we need to connect the &5Quantum Entangloporters&r. We do this by going into the Text Bar of one, and typing out a Network name. 

It can be Numbers, Letters, Symbols, whatever just Type it and hit the Checkmark Button! Then, go into the second &5Quantum Entangloporter&r and Click the name of the Set Network Name. Now they are connected. 

After that, Connect your &bPipes&f, &cTubes&f, &aCables&r whatever, to a &5Quantum Entangloporter&r and place more or even a &5Machine&r to the other one. 

Once that is all ready, change the Side Configs in order to actually move our things around. Don't forget to set Auto-Eject!

quests.title: &cInfused Alloy
quests.subtitle: The Basic Alloy for Crafting Items
desc:
One of the 3 most important Infused Items is the &cInfused Alloy&r. 

To make it we'll need to Infuse a &6Copper Ingot&r with 10mB of &4Redstone&r. 

How do we get 10mB of &4Redstone&r you ask? By placing a &4Redstone Item&r into the &eYellow Square&r of the &9&lMetallurgic Infuser&r! 

We'll lose the &4Redstone Item&r and different &4Items&r give different amounts. &4Redstone Dust&r gives 10mB, &4Enriched Redstone&r gives 80mB, and a &4Block of Redstone&r gives 90mB.

quests.title: Basic Control Circuit
quests.subtitle: The Basic Control Circuit
desc:
The last of the important Infused Items is the &aBasic Control Circuit&r. 

These ones are made by combining 20mB of &4Redstone&r with an &7Osmium Ingot&r. 

Check out the &cInfused Alloy Quest&r to learn how to add &4Redstone&r to the &9&lMetallurgic Infuser&r!

quests.title: &5Refined Obsidian
desc:
Throw the &5Refined Obsidian Dust&r into an &7&lOsmium Compressor&r and &7Compress &fsome &7Osmium&r into it! 

I think that's how the &7&lOsmium Compressor&r works... 

Now we'll have &5Refined Obsidian Ingots&r, these can be made into other &5Machines&r or even Tools and Armor!

quests.title: &6&lEnergized Smelter
quests.subtitle: Mekanism's Powered Furnace
desc:
No, no, no, no, no more using &0Coal&r to power our Furnaces, we need &0Coal &ffor &8Steel&r! 

Here use the &6&lEnergized Smelter&r instead! It uses &aEnergy&r to &6Smelt&e Items&r! 

It can also be Upgraded to contain more Slots for more &6Smelting&r, kinda like a Jumbo Furnace. 

Upgraded &lTiers&r will also have an Auto-Sort button. This allows the &6&lMachine&r to automatically distribute the &eItems&r evenly among the Slots to be more efficient!

quests.title: Custom Portals!
quests.subtitle: Teleportation at its Finest
desc:
&a&lTeleporters&r will allow us to Teleport anywhere in any Dimension as long as the &5Machine&r is made and &aPowered&r! 

Now how do we make it and Power it? 

First, to make the &a&lTeleporter&r we'll need 1 &aTeleporter Block&f and 9 &aTeleporter Frames&r. 

The &aTeleporter Block&r is the main &aController&r of the &a&lTeleporter&r. It is the Block that will need &aEnergy&r, and once &aPowered&r we can open it. Here we can set a Network similar to the &5Quantum Entangloporter&r, type in a name and click the Checkmark to make the Network! 

Now when other &a&lTeleporter Structures&r or &aTeleporter Blocks&r, are set to that Network (by clicking the named Network in their GUI) you can use the &a&lTeleporter&r to obviously Teleport to the other &a&lTeleporters&r at the same Network. 

Now about making the &a&lTeleporter Structure&r. Place a &aTeleporter Frame&r on each side of the &aTeleporter Block&r. Above those place 3 more to make it 4 Blocks high. With 2 Blocks space above the &aTeleporter Block&r, you can place our last &aTeleporter Frames&r. 

Now when Powered and set, the &a&lTeleporter&r will be ready and you can walk through whatever colored Portal spawned! 

(You can change the Color for each in the &a&lTeleporter&r GUI!)
{@pagebreak}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/meka_portal1.png width:200 height:75 align:center}
Place the &aTeleporter Block&r with 2 &aTeleporter Frames&r next to it.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/meka_portal2.png width:150 height:125 align:center}
Now place &aTeleporter Frames&r on the previous ones.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/meka_portal3.png width:100 height:125 align:center}
Repeat.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/meka_portal4.png width:100 height:140 align:center}
Now, we'll need a whole row of &aTeleporter Frames&r for the top.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/meka_portal5.png width:110 height:150 align:center}
Once everything is set, the Portal of your choosing should appear like so!

quests.title: &eSpeed &8Upgrade
desc:
We don't have all the time in the World, let's &eSpeed&r it up a bit! 

The &2&lReactors&r won't wait forever!

quests.title: &aEnergy &8Upgrade
desc:
Almost every &5Machine&r will use &aEnergy&r, and when we got dozens of them... it's definitely not easy on our Grids. 

If we add &aEnergy &8Upgrades&r, the &5Machines&r will do the same Task, just now requiring less &aEnergy&r to complete! 
If only we can put these on the &d&lS.P.S.&r!

quests.title: &9Filter &8Upgrade
desc:
&9Filter &8Upgrades&r are used only in &b&lElectric Pumps&r. 

The &b&lPumps&r will work the same, but instead of picking up &9Water&r, they will pick up &9Heavy Water&r. 

&9Heavy Water&r will be needed for Fuel for the &2&lFission Reactor&r!

quests.title: Muffling &8Upgrade
quests.subtitle: shhhhh... too loud....
desc:
&5&lMekanism&r &5Machines&r can be pretty loud! 

Let's stop that!

quests.title: &cChemical &8Upgrade
desc:
Some &5Machines&r will use &cChemicals&r especially to add to &eItems&r. Think, &9&lMetallurgic Infuser&r, &c&lChemical Injector&r, and &b&lPurifiers&r. 

These will basically use less &cChemicals&r for the same Tasks! 

I can't promise it'll work with every &eItem&r and &5Machine&r. And no, I am not testing with every Machine!

quests.title: &7Stone Generator &8Upgrade
desc:
&7Stone Generator&r is only for the &7&lDigital Miner&r. 

When used in it, they will automatically make &7Stone&r, instead of needing handouts. 

It will use these &7Stones&r to replace the Ores it picks up!

quests.title: &5&lMekanism&r Logistics
quests.subtitle: The Configurator
desc:
You should know Logistics by know! This Quest will now be reserved to explaining the &3Configurator&r! 

By Holding Shift and Scrolling you can change the Mode of the &3Configurator&r. 

&dWrench&r: will Drop &5&lMekanism&r &5Machines&r and Blocks when used on them. 
&eRotate&r: will simply Rotate the direction of the Block. 
&4Empty&r: will make it work like a Gauge Dropper. 
The rest of them will make the &3Configurator&r interact with&5 Machines&r to change their Configs! 

If you use it on Pipes it will change if they Push, Pull, or Both. You can use it on Ports to set Inputs and Outputs. And even on Bins to set them to Auto-Export below them.

quests.title: &e&lSolar Generator
quests.subtitle: Generates about 60FE/t
desc:
The &e&lSolar Generator&r will Generate &aEnergy&r based on being exposed to the &bSky&r during &eDaytime&r. 

It is a very simple to use automatic &e&lGenerator&r, just Crafting them is annoying! 

They won't generate &aEnergy&r as much as &b&lWind Generators&r do (only Daytime) but produce more in Bursts and take up less Space! 

They have been buffed and can now hold around 40kFE!

quests.title: &6&lHeat Generator
quests.subtitle: Basic Power Gen
desc:
The &6&lHeat Generator&r has 2 modes to generate &aEnergy&r. 

Passive: Surrounding the &6&lGenerator&r with &cLava Source&r or flowing blocks creates passive &aEnergy&r by creating &6Heat&r. 

Place one &cLava Source Block&r on top, and let it flow over the sides. 

Make sure to connect &bPipes&r first!

Active: Placing combustible materials such as &0Coal&r or &6Wood&r into the &6&lGenerator&r will burn the fuel to create &cEnergy&r. 

It now creates 320FE/t.

quests.title: &2&lBio-Generator
desc:
The &2&lBio-Generator&r works by taking &2Bio Fuel&r, making &2Bioethanol&r, and using that for &aEnergy&r! 

This &2&lGenerator&r has been heavily nerfed though, so it is recommened to not use it! 

That is because you buttheads keep making massive &aMelon Farms&r that eat Servers TPS!

quests.title: &l&e&oAdvanced Solar Generator
quests.subtitle: Generates about 480FE/t
desc:
If you're wondering if it is worth making this upgrade, the answer is yes.

&e&l&oAdvanced Solar Generators&r will take up more Space and are expensive to Craft but will Generate so much more &aEnergy&r. 

They work the same as normal &e&lSolar Generators&r, &eDaytime&f and need &bSky&r Exposure. 

These can hold 100kFE! 

You can also add them on top of &6&lThermal Evaporation Plants&r to produce more &6Heat&r.

quests.title: &b&lWind Generator
quests.subtitle: Generates Power from the Wind
desc: This is a great option for automatically generating &aEnergy&r.
The amount of &aEnergy&r the &b&lWind Generator&r creates is based on its Y Level.
This generates around 90FE/t at sea level and the most it can produce is 360FE/t!
The &b&lWind Generator&r will also need &bSky&r above it to work, like a Beacon!

quests.title: &5&lMekanism&r
quests.subtitle: The Start of Your Own Factory
desc:
&5&lMekanism&r is a tech mod that will change the way you play &2&lMinecraft&r. 

The mod focuses on breaking down materials to their chemical makeup, and getting the best out of every material you come across.

This mod features Hydrogen-Powered &cJetpacks&r, a mini-robotic friend, &2&lReactors&r, a &7&lDigital Miner&r to automate mining, and much, much more. 

Trust me, you'll see why it is used in almost every &6&lATM Modpack&r!

quests.title: &7Osmium
quests.subtitle: The Base Crafting Ingot
desc:
&7Osmium&r is an Ore that spawns below Y Level 56. It's Ore is in similar shape to &aEmerald&r with the Color being a &bBlue-ish&7 Grey&r! 

It will be useful for many of the &5Machines&r used in &5&lMekanism&r! So you'll need a lot of it! 

You can also Craft &7Armor &fand &7Tools&r from it! The &7Armor &fand &7Sword&r are same Points as &cNetherite&r! While the &7Pickaxe&r is the same as an &7Iron Pickaxe&r.

quests.title: &dEnriched Items
quests.subtitle: Enrich your items first!
desc: Using the &d&lEnrichment Chamber&r, you can &dEnrich &eItems&r to convert them into &dEnriched&r variants.
These &dEnriched Items&r give 8x the amount of mb in a &9&lMetallurgic Infuser&r.

&dEnriched &0Coal&r will help make more &8Steel&r. &dEnriched &4Redstone&r will help with &cInfused Alloys&r and &aBasic Control Circuits&r. And &dEnriched &5Refined Obisidian&r will help make &dUltimate&r Items!

quests.title: Quest 4A1C8125
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &8Steel
desc:
Now that we have our &9&lMetallurgic Infusion&r and hopefully some &cEnergy&r, we can start making &8Steel&r! 

We'll need &0Carbon&r in our &eChemical Bar&r. We can use &0Coal&f, &0Charcoal&r, or any varients of those in the &eChemical Slot&f to add &0Carbon&r. 

Then, if we add an &7Iron Ingot&f/&7Dust&r into the &4Item Slot&r, it will Infuse it with 10mB of Carbon to make Enriched Iron. 

We'll need to repeat that step just now with adding 10mB of &0Carbon&r to turn our &7Enriched Iron&r into &8Steel Dust&r! Smelt the &8Dust&r to get a &8Steel Ingot&r. 

&8Steel&r is used for pretty much everything! Machines, Tools, Upgrades, Reactors, Energy Cells! You'll need a lot of it.

quests.title: &l&5Machines
desc:
Come on we all know what you are here for... &5&lMACHINES&r! 

&5Machines&r are our little Factories, each will do something unique in gaining us more &eItems&r. Follow the individual Quests to find out what each does. 

Here I will talk more on the Configs and &8Upgrades&r!
{@pagebreak}

All &5Machines&r are different but the Colors of Slots and Bars will tell what they are for! &aLight Green&f: &aEnergy&r. &4Red&f: &4Initial Item/Fluid/Chemical&f. &9Blue&f: &9Product&f. &3Cyan&f: &3Second Product&f. &eYellow&f: &eInfuse Types&r. 

Each &5Machine&r has default Config Sides. These are where &eItems&r will be Input and Output. You can change these in the GUI of the &5Machine&r in Side Configs. 

It will change for &eItems&f, &bFluids&f, &cChemicals&f, and &aEnergy&r but each has similar Sides that can be changed. &4Red&f: &5Input&f. &6Orange&f: &6Second Input&f. &9Blue&f: &9Output&f. &3Cyan&f: &3Second Output&f. &5Purple&f: &5Both Input and Output&f. &aLight Green&f: &aEnergy&f. &eYellow&f: &eExtra&f like &cInfuse Types&r. 
You'll need to set the GUI to Auto-Eject if you want &eItems&r to be Input and Output!
{@pagebreak}

Some &5Machines&r can also use &8Upgrades&r! These are in the Top Right of the GUI. 

Here you can see which &8Upgrades&r the &5Machine&r can use. When you put them in it'll tell you how many it can hold. &eSpeed&8 Upgrades&r can hold more while Muffling doesn't need more!

quests.title: &e&lPrecision Sawmill
desc:
The &e&lPrecision Sawmill&r will work to "recycle" &6Wood Items&r. 

Just give it some &aEnergy&r and throw a &6Wood Item&r in and wait! 

It will turn Beds into 3 &6Wood Planks&r and 3 Wool. &6Doors&r into &6Wood Planks&r. And &2Logs&f into 6 &6Planks&r instead of 4! 

It will also turn &7Sticks&r into &6Sawdust&r which is needed for the &6Cardboard Box&r!

quests.title: &a&lPower!
desc:
90% of &5&lMekanism&r &5Machines&r will need &aEnergy&r to run. &5&lMekanism&r uses FE to run &5Machines&r! 

1kFE is 1000 FE, and 1mFE is 1,000,000 FE! 

The &aEnergy Tablet&r is &5&lMekanism's&r version of the Battery. It will also be needed to Craft most &aGenerators&r. 

Yes, &5&lMekanism&r has &aGenerators&r and yes, they are awesome!

quests.title: &a&lBasic Tier
desc:
&a&lBasic Tier&r is the simplest, cheapest, and worst &lTier&r of &5Machines&r and Blocks! 

Well unless you count Default &5Machines&r as a whole new &lTier&r but I don't. I just count it with &a&lBasic&r. 

&5Machines&r will start at default and can be Upgraded to &a&lBasic&r. While other Blocks like &bPipes&f or &aEnergy Cubes&r will start at &a&lBasic&r. 

All of these are made from &4Redstone&f, &aBasic Control Circuits&f, and sometimes &7Iron&r!

quests.title: &c&lAdvanced Tier
desc:
&c&lAdvanced&r is the Upgrade to &a&lBasic&r. 

&c&lAdvanced&r Machines will hold more &eItems&f, move more &eItems&r, and have more Slots than &a&lBasic Tier&r. 

&c&lAdvanced&r are made from &cInfused Alloys&f, &cAdvanced Control Circuit&f, and usually &7Osmium&r! 

&cAdvanced Control Circuits&r are made from 2 &cInfused Alloys&r and a &aBasic Control Circuit&r.

quests.title: &b&lElite Tier
desc:
&b&lElite Tier&r comes right after &c&lAdvanced&r. These have the same buffs as &c&lAdvanced&r... just more! 

&b&lElite&r are made with &bReinforced Alloys&f, &bElite Control Circuits&f, and most times &eGold Ingots&r. 

You can get &bReinforced Alloys&r from Infusing an &cInfused Alloy&r with 20mb of &bDiamond&r. That is 2 &bDiamond Dust&r or 1/4 &bEnriched Diamond&r! 

You can then use those &bReinforced Alloys&r (2 of them) with an &cAdvanced Control Circuit&r to make the &bElite Control Circuit&r.

quests.title: &d&lUltimate Tier
desc:
&d&lUltimate Tier&r is the best we can get from &5&lMekanism&r! Well atleast in Survival. 

These will give the most Slots, hold the most &eItems&r, and move the most &eItems&r! 

Each &d&lUltimate Tier&r will need &dAtomic Alloys&f, &dUltimate Control Circuits&f, and &bDiamonds&r. 

&dAtomic Alloys&r will need &5Refined Obsidian&r to create, follow the &7Osmium Compressor Quest&r to get those. But basically we'll need to Infuse a &bReinforced Alloy&r with 20mb of &5Refined Obsidian&r. 

Then, combine 2 &dAtomic Alloys&r with 1 &bElite Control Circuit&r to make the &dUltimate Control Circuit&r!

quests.title: Better &5Machines
desc:
Some &5Machines&r are a little more advanced, so that means we'll need more &cAdvanced Items&r to Craft them! 

Talking about &c&lAdvanced&r, they take the same Materials as &c&lAdvanced Tier&r &5Machines&r.

quests.title: &b&lPurification Chamber
desc:
The &b&lPurification Chamber&r is technically an Upgrade to the &d&lEnrichment Chamber&r. Well... it loses a lot of functions but it does Upgrade the &lOre Processing&r! 

That is pretty much all it does, it combines &7Ores&r with &bOxygen&r to get more Ingots out of them! 

Well... it doesn't make &7Ingots&r it makes &7Clumps&r... whatever just read the &lOre Processing&r Quest to find out more about that then!

quests.title: Even better &5Machines&r!
desc:
These &5Machines&r are even better than &c&lAdvanced&r! 

Use &eItems&r from the &b&lElite Tier&r to make these &5Machines&r!

quests.title: &c&lChemical Injection Chamber
desc:
The &c&lChemical Injection Chamber&r is another &5Machine&r that works with combining &eItems &fand &cChemicals&r, but this time it is just 1 &eItem&r plus 1 &cChemical&r to make 1 new &eItem&r! 

You can get &bWater Vapor&r from putting &9Water&r into a &c&lRotary &bCondensator&r, then Inject that &bWater Vapor&r into Dead Coral to revive it. 

You can get &bOxygen&r from an &9&lElectrolytic Separator&r and Inject that &bOxygen&f into &6Copper&r to Oxidize it. 

And most important, using &3Hydrogen Chloride&r into Ore Blocks to get Ore Shards for Processing!

quests.title: &e&lCombiner
desc:
The &e&lCombiner&r can automate simple 2 &eItem&r Recipes! 

Like 2 different Dyes, or Mud and Wheat to get Packed Mud. 

It can even do some new unique Recipes like &7Cobble&f and &0Flint&r to make &7Gravel&r, or 4 &5Obsidian Dust &fand &8Deepslate&f to make &5Obsidian&r!

quests.title: Some of the best &5Machines&r!
desc:
Only the best of the best &5Machines&r, will need the best Materials. 

Use &d&lUltimate&r &eItems&r to make these &5Machines&r and more! 

Yes, you'll want these &5Machines&r, they are worth the time and Materials!

quests.title: &a&lChemical Washer
desc:
The &a&lChemical Washer&r is only for &7Ore Processing&r. 

Like the &9&lElectrolytic Separator&r, this one only works with &cChemicals&f/&bFluids&r! 

&9Water&r (or &9Water&r replacement) will go in the Left Bar! And the Ore Slurry will go in the Bar next to it. 

When given &aEnergy&r, the &a&lChemical Washer&r will make the Dirty Slurry, Clean! 

Like a Washing Machine!

quests.title: &3&lChemical Dissolution Chamber
desc:
The &3&lC.D.C.&r (&3&lChemical Dissolution Chamber&r not Center for Disease Control and Prevention) is another &5Machine&r only used for &lOre Processing&r. 

The &3&lC.D.C.&r will need &aSulfuric Acid&r and &7Ore&r. 

The &7Ore&r will go in the &4Red Slot&r while the &aSulfuric Acid&r will go in the &4Red Bar&r. 

The finished &7Dirty Slurry&r will spawn in the &9Blue Bar&r!

quests.title: &5&lChemical Crystallizer
desc:
The &5&lChemical Crystallizer&r is actually a pretty simple Machine! We just need a &cChemical &fand &aEnergy&r! 

And yes this one isn't only used for &lOre Processing&r! Well some of it is... but not all. 

Just throw some &7Clean Ore Slurry&r into the &5&lCrystallizer&r and it will turn it into &7Ore Crystals&r. 

You can also feed it &dAntimatter&r to make &dAntimatter Pellets&r, or &6Lithium&r to make &6Lithium Dust&r!

quests.title: &9&lElectrolytic Separator
desc:
&9&lElectrolytic Separator&r will take 1 &bFluid&r and split it into 2 &cChemicals&r! 

The &bFluid&r will go in the &4Red Bar&r and the &cChemicals&r will appear in the &9Blue &fand &3Cyan Bars&r. 

We also get two Buttons on each of the bottom sides of the GUI. These will switch between functions of the two Output Bars. 

Idle will just reach the limit it can and won't take anymore. So if it is full on Hydrogen it will no longer use &9Water&r. 

Dumping Excess will reach the top but will dump enough to keep producing each &cChemical&r. This is helpful for those who need lots of &bOxygen&r but not Hydrogen. 

Dumping will delete all of that &cChemical&r that is made.

quests.title: &c&lChemical &eOxidizer
desc:
The &l&cRotary &bCondensator&r might make &cGas&f from &bLiquids&r, but the &c&lChemical &eOxidizer&r can turn (some) Items into Gas! 

This includes &cInfuse Types&f like &0Coal &fto &0Carbon&r. 

This will also be needed for taking Wasted Combs and Lithium Combs into their &cChemicals&r! 

&eItems&r will go in the &4Red Slot&r and their new &cGas&r forms will appear in the &9Blue Bar&r.

quests.title: &c&lChemical Infuser
desc:
&c&lChemical Infuser&r will take 2 different &cChemicals&r and... combine them. 

This isn't helpful early game, but later on it'll be very important! 

First &cChemical&r goes in the &4Red Bar&r on the Left and the Second &cChemical&r goes in the &6Orange Bar&r on the Right. 

Yes the pattern they are in matters. That I learned the hard way in &6&l9TTS&r!

quests.title: &2&lPressurized Reaction Chamber
desc:
The &2&lP.R.C.&r (&2&lPressurized Reaction Chamber&r) combines multiple &bFluids &fand &cChemicals&r with an &eItem&f to make new &eItems &fand &cChemicals&r! 

&bFluids&r, most likely &9Water&r, go in the farthest Left Bar. &cChemicals&r go in the Bar next to it, and initial &eItems&r in the &4Red Slot&r. 

The finished &eItem&r will spawn in the &9Blue Slot&r and the finished &cChemical&r will be in the &9Blue Bar&r. 

The &2&lP.R.C.&r can make a few Items like HDPE Items, &7Gunpowder&r and &aSulfur&r, and even &2Nuclear Items&r!

quests.title: &c&lRotary &bCondensentrator
desc:
&bCondensating&r is to make from &bLiquid &fto &cGas&r. &cDecondensating&r is turning &cGas &fto &bLiquid&r. 

The &c&lRotary &bCondenstrator&r does both! 

&cGas&r will go in the Bar on the Left. They can be added from &cTubes &for &cChemical Tanks&r that you place in the Left Slots. 

&bLiquids&r will go in the Right Bar. They can also be added with &bPipes &for &bFluid Tanks&r placed in the Right Slots. 

When powered, &cGas&r will become &bLiquid&r, and &bLiquid&r turned into &cGas&r. They will switch Bars and can then be taken out with &cTubes&f/&bPipes&r or &cChemical&f/&bFluid Tanks&r.

quests.title: &5&lMekanism: Reactors
desc:
You think this is all &5&lMekanism&r has? You don't even have a clue! 

Before we get there though, let's get some &5Machines &fand &aSulfur&r ready! 

We're going to have a long road ahead of us.

quests.title: &aUniversal Cables
desc:
&aUniversal Cables&r are used to move &aEnergy&r from &5Machine &fto &5Machine&r! 

Most &5Machines&r will have a default &aEnergy&r taking Side notified by the &aGreen Square&r on them. These can be changed within the GUI of the &5Machine&r in Side Configs. 

&5Machines&r will also share the &aEnergy&r they have in them with other &5Machines&r next to them, if their Configs are set to it!

&aUniversal Cables&r are made with 2 &8Steel Ingots&r and a &4Redstone Dust&r. They can be upgraded by combining 8 of the same Tier with a &aControl Circuit&r! 

&a&lBasic&r: will hold and move 3.2kFE per Tick. 

&c&lAdvanced&r: will hold and move 51.2kFE per Tick. 

&b&lElite&r: will hold and move 409.6kFE per Tick. 

&d&lUltimate&r: will hold and move 3.27mFE per Tick.

quests.title: &aEnergy Cubes
desc:
&aEnergy Tablets&r not holding enough &aEnergy&r? Then, you'll need some &aEnergy Cubes&r! 

&aEnergy Cubes&r can have &aEnergy&r Cabled in and out of it. Each has a set amount of storage for &aEnergy&r that is determined by their Tier. 

All sides of an &aEnergy Cube&r can take or place &aEnergy&r, that is determined by whether Cables are Pushing or Pulling. 

&a&lBasic&r: will hold 1.6mFE. 

&c&lAdvanced&r: will hold 6.4mFE. 

&b&lElite&r: will hold 25.6mFE. 

&d&lUltimate&r: will hold 102.4mFE.

quests.title: &bMechanical Pipes
quests.subtitle: Fluids
desc:
&bMechanical Pipes&r will move &bFluids&r. That is right! Not just &9Water&r! 

&bMechanical Pipes&r are made with 2 &8Steel Ingots&r and 1 &7Empty Bucket&r. They are also upgraded in the same way as the &eLogistical Transporters&r. 

&a&lBasic&r: will hold 2 Buckets of Fluids and move 250mB of Fluid each Tick. 

&c&lAdvanced&r: will hold 8 Buckets of Fluids and move a Bucket of Fluid each Tick. 

&b&lElite&r: will hold 32 Buckets of Fluid and will move 8 Buckets each Tick. 

&d&lUltimate&r: will hold 128 Buckets and will move 32 Buckets each Tick.

quests.title: &cPressurized Tubes
quests.subtitle: Chemicals, Pigments, Infuse Types
desc:
&cPressurized Tubes&r will pretty much anything the other Pipes can't move! &cChemicals&f, &cPigments&f, and &cInfuse Types&r are all moved with &cPressurized Tubes&r. 

In order to move &cChemicals&r in to &5Machines&r though, we'll need to change the Configs within the &5Machine&r. Those are in the Top Left of the Machine's GUI, Side Configs. They'll need to bet set to Auto-Eject to Output! 

You can Craft them with 2 &8Steel Ingots&r and a piece of Glass, any Glass! Then upgrade them with 8 &cTubes&r and a Control Circuit. 

&a&lBasic&r: will hold 4 Buckets of Chemicals and move 750mB of Chemicals each Tick. 
&c&lAdvanced&r: will hold 16 Buckets of Chemicals and move 2 Buckets of Chemicals each Tick. 

&b&lElite&r: will hold 256 Buckets of Chemicals and will move 64 Buckets each Tick. 

&d&lUltimate&r: will hold 1,024 Buckets and will move 256 Buckets each Tick.

quests.title: &eLogistical Transporters
quests.subtitle: Items
desc:
&eLogistical Transporters&r will move &eItems&f and &eBlocks&r from one Inventory to another! 

In order to move &eItems&r to &5Machines&r though, we'll need to change the Configs within the &5Machine&r. Those are in the Top Left of the &5Machine's&r GUI, Side Configs. They'll need to be set to Auto-Eject to Output &eItems&r. 

&eLogistical Transporters&r are Crafted with 2 &8Steel Ingots&r and 1 &aBasic Control Circuit&r. You can then combine 8 &eLogistical Transporters&r with the next Control Circuit to upgrade them. 

&a&lBasic&r: will move 2 Blocks/Items across 1 Block each Second. 

&c&lAdvanced&r: will move 32 Blocks/Items across 2 Blocks each Second. 

&b&lElite&r: will move a stack of Items or Blocks across 4 Blocks each Second. 

&d&lUltimate&r: will move 2 stacks of Items or Blocks across 10 Blocks each Second.

quests.title: &6Thermodynamic Conductors
quests.subtitle: Heat
desc:
&6Thermodynamic Conductors&r will move &6Heat&r. Yeah, some &5&lMekanism&r &5Machines&r use &6Heat&r! Like the &6&lThermal Evaporation Machine&r. 

Most of the &6Heaters&r will have set Sides for Outputting &6Heat&r! 

I'm not sure what these numbers mean but following the pattern: more expensive, more good!

quests.title: &lTier&r Installers
desc:
Don't like picking up your &5Machines&r to Upgrade them? Why not just use an &eItem&r! 

With &7Tier&r Installers you can just use the &eItem&r on the &5Machine &rto Upgrade them! 

Throw the &a&lBasic Tier &r&aInstaller&r onto a Default &5Machine&r to upgrade them to &a&lBasic Tier&r. 

No, you can't skip upgrades. Can't turn a &a&lBasic&r into &d&lUltimate&r with one &dInstaller&r.

quests.title: &cChemical Tanks
desc:
Like &bFluid Tanks&r but screw &bFluids&r we want everything else! 

Everything &cPressurized Tubes&r can move, the &cChemical Tank&r can hold. 

&a&lBasic&r: will hold 64 Buckets of Chemicals. 

&c&lAdvanced&r: will hold 256 Buckets of Chemicals. 

&b&lElite&r: will hold 1,024 Buckets of Chemicals. 

&d&lUltimate&r: will hold 8,192 Buckets.

quests.title: &bFluid Tanks
desc:
What a &7Bucket&r isn't enough? A Stack of &7Buckets&r isn't enough either? Then friend, you'll need some &bFluid Tanks&r! 

&bFluid Tanks&r can hold multiple &7Buckets&r of one &bFluid&r within them and can then be moved around like a &7Bucket&r. These unfortunately can not place Source Blocks though. 

To add or take out &bFluid&r, you'll need &bMechanical Pipes&r configured to do either or. 

&a&lBasic&r: will hold 32 Buckets of Fluids. 

&c&lAdvanced&r: will hold 64 Buckets of Fluids. 

&b&lElite&r: will hold 128 Buckets of Fluid. 

&d&lUltimate&r: will hold 256 Buckets.

quests.title: &eBins
quests.subtitle: Drawers
desc:
You like Drawers? &5&lMekanism&r gives us some! Just these are called &eBins&r. 

&eBins&r can hold only one type of Item but will hold tons of Stacks of that &eItem&r! 

You can use a &3Configurator&r on the &eBin&r to set it to automatically Output to the Inventory below it. 

If there is an &eItem &fin the &eBin&r, you can Shift Right Click it to Lock that &eItem&r. 

&a&lBasic&r: holds 64 Stacks. 

&c&lAdvanced&r: holds 128 Stacks. 

&b&lElite&r: holds 512 Stacks. 

&d&lUltimate&r: holds 4,096 Stacks.

quests.title: &6Fuelwood Heater
desc:
The &6Fuelwood Heater&r will generate &6Heat&r by using Furnace Fuels. 

Logs, &0Coals&f, &0Charcoals&r, even Wooden Swords! 

I can't tell you how &6Hot&r it can get, but you'll know it is &6Heated&r by the Color of the &6Heater&r changing!

quests.title: &6Resistive Heater
desc:
The &6Resistive Heater&r will also generate &6Heat&r, but instead of using Furnace Fuel, it will use &aEnergy&r! 

By feeding it &aEnergy&r, we can choose however much &6Heat&r it will make. 

The more &6Heat&r it makes, the more &aEnergy&r it takes! 

The max &6Heat&r is 9,999,999 something.

quests.title: Smart Filter
desc:
Drawers not your style? You like Backpacks better? Then you'll need a Personal Chest/Barrel! 

Both of these will act the exact same. After Crafting, Right Click with them to set yourself as their User. 

Then, only you can open this Chest/Barrel. Oh yeah by the way you can open it from your Inventory or by placing it down like a normal Chest/Barrel. 

It has 54 Slots but no upgrades...

quests.title: &a&lChargepad
desc:
&a&lChargepads&r will Charge any &eItems&r on the Player when the Player steps onto the &a&lPad&r! 

Obviously it will need &aEnergy&r within it to work. We can add that in on the Back or Bottom of the &a&lChargepad&r. 

Once it has &aEnergy&r within it, it will Charge each &eItem&r in your Inventory that can hold a Charge! 

Doesn't matter the Mod it is from either! 
It will prioritize the first &eItems&r in your Inventory and once it is full it will Charge the next. 

How quickly it fills the &eItems&r seems to be the same for every &eItem&r.

quests.title: &dEnrich &fthen &6Smelt
quests.subtitle: Tier 1 Ore Processing
desc:
The very first and simplest &lOre Processing&r is just 2 &5Machines&r! &d&lEnrichers&r and &6&lSmelters&r! 

We can use &7Ore Blocks&f to get twice the &7Dust &for &7Raw Ore&r to get 1/3 more. So 3 &7Raw Ore&f to get 4 &7Dust&r. 

Throw the &7Ore&r into the &d&lEnricher&r and you'll get &7Dust&r! Then, &6Smelt&r that &7Dust&r to get &7Ingots&r! 

Congrats, you just &lOre Processed&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_tier1_1.png width:150 height:50 align:center}

quests.title: Making &bOxygen &ffor &b&lPurifier
quests.subtitle: Tier 2 Ore Processing
desc:
For the next Tier of &lOre Processing&r we'll need &l&bPurifiers&r and they'll need &bOxygen&r. So, let's make some &bOxygen&r! 

Use an &9&lElectric Pump&r or any Automated &9Water&r to feed &9Water&r into an &9&lElectrolytic Separator&r. 

Once fed &aEnergy &fand &9Water&r, the &9&lElectrolytic Separator&r will turn that H2O into H (Hydrogen) and O (&bOxygen&r)! 

We can dump the &bHydrogen&r, and Pipe the Oxygen into the &b&lPurifier&r. 

Now that the &b&lPurifier&r has &bOxygen&r, we can place our &7Ores&r into it to get 3 &7Ore Clumps&f from &7Ore Blocks&f or 2 &7Ore Clumps &ffrom &7Raw Ore&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_tier2_1.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &4Crush &fand &dEnrich &four &7Clumps
quests.subtitle: Tier 2 Ore Processing
desc:
We got &7Ore Clumps&r? What do we do with a &7Clump&r, we wanted &7Ingots&r! 

To start, &4Crush &feach &7Clump&f to get 2 &7Dirty Ore Dust&r. 

We can't &6Smelt &7Dirty Dust&r, it'll ruin the Furnace! So we'll need to &dEnrich&r them to get our regular &7Dust&r. 

And like usual, &6Smelt &fthe &7Dust &fto get &7Ingots&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_tier2_2.png width:250 height:50 align:center}

quests.title: Making &eChlorine
quests.subtitle: Tier 3 Ore Processing
desc:
If we want even more &7Ores&r! We'll need a better way of &lProcessing&r our &7Ores&r. Hydrogen won't work, let's try &3Hydrogen Chloride&r. 

Obviously for that we'll need &eChlorine&r! 

Look at the &6&lThermal Evaporation Plant&r Quest to learn in better detail how to Craft the Mutliblock, but basically we'll need one. 

Feed &9Water&f into a &6&lThermal Evaporation Plant&r to (slowly) make &eBrine&r. 

Throw that &eBrine&r into an &9&lElectrolytic Separator&r to get &7Sodium&r and &eChlorine&r! &7Sodium&r is helpful for &2&lFission Reactor&r... but not &lOre Processing&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_tier3_1.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &b&lDynamic &cTank&r Multiblock
desc:
&b&lDynamic &cTanks&r are Multiblocks which can be made at any size that is atleast 3x3x3! 

&b&lDynamic &cTanks&r will hold a ton of one &bFluid &for &cChemical&r. How many Buckets of that &bFluid &for &cChemical&r can the &c&lTank&r hold? That matters on the size. 

&b&lDynamic &cTanks&r are made out of &bDynamic &cTank &fBlocks&r with the inside of the Structure being hollow. The Walls can be made with Structure or Reactor Glass but the frame will need to be made of &bDynamic &cTank&r Blocks. 

You'll also need &bDynamic &cTank&r Ports in the Walls to actually take and place Fluids and Chemicals. Whether it takes or places is determined by whether they Push or Pull.

quests.title: &6&lThermal Evaporation Plant
desc:
The &6&lThermal Evaporation Plant&r is a Multiblock that takes &9Water&r, and uses &6Heat&r to make it into &eBrine&r. It will also use &6Heat&r to make &eBrine&r into &6Liquid Lithium&r! 

To start you'll need a lotta &6Thermal Evaporation Blocks&r. The base is 4x4 and only ever 4x4 of &6Thermal Evaporation Blocks&r. 

The Walls need to be atleast 3 Blocks tall and a max of 18. The inside and top must be hollow like most Multiblocks. The &9Water &fand &eBrine&r needs to be held somewhere. 

Within the Walls (not the corners) we can put our &6Valves &fand &6Controller&r! The &6Controller&r is how we access the &6&lThermal Evaporation Plant's&r GUI. There we can see the &6Heat&r that is has. We'll only need 1 &6Controller&r. 

&6Valves&r are how we move &9Water &fand &eBrine&f in, &eBrine &fand &6Liquid Lithium&r out, and optionally &6Heat&r in! You won't need to configure the &6Valves&r, only the &bPipes &fand &6Conductors&r need to be configured. 

The top layer of the &6&lPlant&r can't have the corners filled in with &6Thermal Evaporation Blocks&r. You can add &e&l&oAdvanced Solar Generators&r on the corners of the top layer though if you want more &6Heat&r!
{@pagebreak}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_thermal1.png width:125 height:100 align:center}
Make a 4x4 of &6Thermal Blocks&r for the Base.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_thermal2.png width:125 height:100 align:center}
This part can be any size as long as the &6&lThermal Evaporation Plant&r is between 3 Blocks and 18 Blocks Tall. It is also where we place our &6Valves &fand &6Controllers&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_thermal3.png width:110 height:100 align:center}
The Corners must be Empty or filled with &l&e&oAdvanced Solar Generators&r on the Top Level.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_thermal4.png width:110 height:100 align:center}
You'll know it is set when the &6Controller&r lights up!

quests.title: &cInjecting &3Hydrogen Chloride
quests.subtitle: Tier 3 Ore Processing
desc:
Good good, now we got &eChlorine&r. What else do we need for &3Hydrogen Chloride&r? Oh yeah, Hydrogen! 

Feed some &9Water&r to an &9&lElectrolytic Separator&r, like in Tier 1, to get Hydrogen and &bOxygen&r. Just this time we need to keep the Hydrogen. 

With our &a&lChemical Infuser&r we can combine Hydrogen and &eChlorine&r to make &3Hydrogen Chloride&r. 

Pipe that &3Hydrogen Chloride&r into a &c&lChemical Injection Chamber&r to &cInject &7Ores&r to get &7Shards&r. 

&7Ore Blocks&r will get 4 &7Ore Shards&r while 3 &7Raw Ores&f will get 8 &7Ore Shards&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_tier3_2.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &7Shard&f, to &7Clump&f, to &7Dust&f, to &7Ingot
quests.title_plain: Shard, to Clump, to Dust, to Ingot
quests.subtitle: Tier 3 Ore Processing
desc:
Again? Dude, we want &7Ingots &fnot &7Clumps &fand not &7Shards&r! &7INGOTS&r! 

Throw those &7Ore Shards&r into a &b&lPurifier&r with &bOxygen&r (most likely from our previous &9&lElectrolytic Separator&r) to make &7Ore Clumps&r. 

Now we just repeat steps from previous Tier. &4Crush &fthe &7Clumps&f to get &7Dirty Dust&r. 

&dEnrich &fthe &7Dirty Dust&r to clean it. 

Then, &6Smelt &fthe &7Dust &fto get our &7Ingots&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_tier3_3.png width:250 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Creating &aSulfuric Acid
quests.subtitle: Tier 4 Ore Processing
desc:
How fun! A shopping List of &cChemicals&r! What are we Walter White? 

First, and most important, for &aSulfuric Acid&r, is &eSulfur&r! Mine some then &bOxidize&r it to get &eSulfur Dioxide&r. 

We'll need a little more &bOxygen&r though, so let's get some more with an &9&lElectrolytic Separator&r being fed &9Water&r. 
Then, combine that new-found &bOxygen&r with the &eSulfur Dioxide&r in a &c&lChemical Infuser&r to get &cSulfur Trioxide&r. 

Leave that &eSulfur&r whatever for a moment until we get Water Vapor! To get Water Vapor, put &9Water&r through a &c&lRotary &bCondensator&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_tier4_1.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Melting &7Ores&f with &aAcid &fand &5Crystallizing&r them
quests.title_plain: Melting Ores with Acid and Crystallizing them
quests.subtitle: Tier 4 Ore Processing
desc:
Now use another &a&lChemical Infuser&r to &a&lInfuse&r our Water Vapor and &cSulfur Trioxide&r. Now we have our &aSulfuric Acid&r! 

Pipe the &aSulfuric Acid&r into a &3&lC.D.C.&r to &3Melt&r down our &7Ores &fwith &aAcid&r. This will give us &7Dirty Ore Slurry&r, a &cChemical&r form of &7Ores&r. 

3 &7Raw Ore&r will give 2 Buckets of &7Ore Slurry&r and 1 &7Ore Block&r will give 1 Bucket of &7Ore Slurry&r. 

We can't go around with &7Dirty Ore Slurry&r, it's embarrassing! We'll need to clean it! Start up a &a&lChemical Washer&r and put some &9Water&r (and laundry detergent) into it. 

Every 5mb of &7Dirty Slurry&r will be turned into 3mb of &7Ore Slurry&r. 

Now that our &7Slurry&r is all clean, we can put it into a &5&lChemical Crystallizer&r. This will give us &7Ore Crystals&r! Yes, different from &7Shards &fand &7Clumps&r. Each 200mb of &7Ore Slurry&r is equal to 1 &7Crystal&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_tier4_2.png width:300 height:50 align:center}

quests.title: Making more &3Hydrogen Chloride
quests.subtitle: Tier 4 Ore Processing
desc:
Our &7Crystals&r will need even more &lProcessing&r! 

Repeat the previous steps of making a &6&lThermal Evaporation Plant&r to create &eBrine&r. 

Use an &9&lElectrolytic Separator&r to Separate the &eChlorine &ffrom the &eBrine&r. 

Then get &bOxygen&r from putting &9Water &finto an &9&lElectrolytic Separator&r. 

Combine the &eChlorine &fand &bHydrogen &fin a &a&lChemical Infuser&r to get &3Hydrogen Chloride&r! 

With our &c&lChemical Injector&r, we can &cInject &fthe &7Crystals&f with &3Hydrogen Chloride&r to get 2 &7Ore Shards&r from each &7Ore Crystal&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_tier4_3.png width:250 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &7Crystal&f, &7Shard&f, &7Clump&f, ETC
quests.subtitle: Tier 4 Ore Processing
desc:
This seems familiar? 

Now we have &7Shards&r again. Before we do anything with them though, we'll need &bOxygen&r. 

Throw &9Water &finto an &9&lElectrolytic Separator&r to get &bOxygen&r. Then, &cTube&r that &bOxygen &ffrom the &9&lSeparator&r to the &b&lPurifier&r. 

With that &bOxygen&f, the &b&lPurifier&r can turn your &7Shards &finto &7Ore Clumps&r. 

Now, &cCrush&r those &7Clumps&f to get &7Dirty Dust&r. Then, &dEnrich &fthose &7Dirty Dust&f to get &7Ore Dust&r. 

And finally &6Smelt&r that &7Dust&r, to get our beautifully &lProcessed Ore&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_tier3_3.png width:250 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &4Crushing &2Plants&f to get &2Bio Fuel
quests.title_plain: Crushing Plants to get Bio Fuel
desc:
&2Bio Fuel&r is made by &4Crushing&r up some &2Plants&r! All types of different &2Plants&r each giving a different amount! 

&6Pumpkin Pie&r gives the most &2Bio Fuel&r but &aMelon Slices&r are most efficient. 

&2Bio Fuel&r can be used in a ton of different ways! We can &aPower&r a &2&lBio-Generator&r, &9&lInfuse&r Items with &2Chemical Bio Fuel&r, or...

quests.title: &7Dictionary
desc:
The &7Dictionary&r isn't helpful to the average Player: it doesn't Mine, Place Blocks, Craft, Smelt, really interact with anything. 

Instead it is used for finding Tags! 

We can Right Click a Block with the &7Dictionary&r in Hand and the Blocks Tags will show up in Chat. We can do the same with Entities. 

Is that not enough? Well we can also Shift Right Click to open up our &7Dictionary&r! 

Here we can see the Items in our Inventory and check all the different Tags for them. From Item, to Potion, to Enchantment Tags, nothing can hide from the &7Dictionary&r!

quests.title: Gauge &8Dropper
desc:
The Gauge &8Dropper&r is a useful Tool for clearing out &cChemical Inventories&r. 

In a &5Machine's&r GUI, pick up the Gauge &8Dropper&r and drag it over the &cChemicals&r in the &5Machine&r. Then, just Right Click and it'll remove the &cChemicals&r and add them to the &8Dropper&r. 
I should have specified, we can get those &cChemicals&r back from the Gauge &8Dropper&r by clicking any &5Chemical Storage&r like a tank or clear the &8Dropper&r by shift-clicking it in the air.

quests.title: &6Cardboard Box
desc:
Only one of the most powerful Tools in all of Modded &2&lMinecraft&r! The &6Cardboard Box&r! 

These are made with very simple ingrediants, just 4 &6Sawdust&r. &6Sawdust&r is made from putting &7Sticks&r into a &e&lPrecision Sawmill&r. 

Now that we hopefully have one, just Right Click a Block with it and the Block will be placed into the &6Cardboard Box&r. Now we can break the &6Cardboard Box&r and move the Block by placing it again and Shift Right Clicking it to remove the Box. 

Some Blocks won't work like &8Bedrock&r or &dEnd Portal Frames&r... but there's so many more that will! Like &5Obsidian&f, &3Reinforced Deepslate&r, and Spawners!

quests.title: Using everything to turn &2Bio Fuel&r into HDPE
quests.title_plain: Using everything to turn Bio Fuel into HDPE
desc:
With 2 &2Bio Fuel&r we can make 1 &aSubstrate&r through the &2&lP.R.C.&r. 

Well... we'll also need &9Water&r and Hydrogen in the &2&lP.R.C.&r but then we'll get our &aSubstrate&r and also &dChemical Ethene&r. 

In order to make HDPE Pellets we'll need our &aSubstrate&r as well as turning our &dChemical Ethene&r into &dLiquid Ethene&r. We can use a &c&lRotary &bCondensator&r to turn it &bLiquid&r! 

Now throw both of our &dLiquid Ethene &fand &aSubstrates&r into the &2&lP.R.C.&r to make HDPE Pellets! 

We can then Craft 4 Pellets together to make a HDPE Rod or &dEnrich&r 3 of them to make a HDPE Sheet.

quests.title: &8Machine Upgrades
desc:
Most &5Machines&r, atleast the simple ones, can use &8Upgrades&r! 

&8Upgrades&r are in the Top Right of the GUI. This screen might be confusing but don't worry I'll explain it! 

First, the bottom shows the &8Supported Upgrades&r. The clear &8Upgrades&r are &aSupported&r while the more transperant ones are &4not&r! You can also hover over them with your Mouse to see their names and if they are &aSupported&r. 

&8Upgrades&r are added through the Top Slot, they'll then show up in the Right. Here you can Click them to see how many are in the Machine and see their Effect! 

If you'd like to take our &8Upgrades&r out, Click the one you want out, then hit the Uninstall Button. This will move the &8Upgrade&r into the Bottom Slot.

quests.title: &5Refined Obsidian Dust
desc:
&5Refined Obsidian&r will be important for many &eItems &fand &5Machines&r within &5&lMekanism&r especially at &d&lUltimate Tier&r. 
First, we'll need to &3Crush &5Obsidian&f to get &5Obsidian Dust&r. Obviously you need to use a &4&lCrusher&r for that. 

Then, we can use the &9&lMetallurgic Infuser&r to &9Infuse&f the &5Obsidian Dust&r with &bChemical Diamond&r. I'd recommend using &bEnriched Diamonds&r to get the most bang for your buck! 

Now we get a few choices of what to do with it, either &dEnrich&r it to get more &5Chemical Refined Obsidian&r or...

quests.title: &aPortable Teleporter
desc:
The &aPortable Teleporter&r will allow you to Teleport to any (Powered) &a&lTeleporter&r. 

Of course it does need &aEnergy&r as well, so you'll need to Charge it. And Right Click it to set it to you for Security reasons. 

After it is Charged and yours, you can Right Click to open its GUI. Here you can Click any Network and hit the Teleport Button to Teleport to that &a&lTeleporter&r. 

No, you can't Teleport to the &aPortable Teleporter&r, it's an Item...

quests.title: &cFree Runners
desc:
&cFree Runners&r are different from the other Armors, these will use &aEnergy&r instead of a &cChemical Fuel&r. 

When Powered and tied onto your Feet, you can press (B) they will start working and you can press it again to switch it's modes. 

&2Regular&r: the &cFree Runners&r will protect you from Fall Damage and Auto-Jump over Blocks for you. 

&6Safety&r: will prevent Fall Damage but won't Auto-Jump. (The preferred Method). 

&4Disabled&r: Free Runners won't protect or Auto-Jump, just look stylish! 

You can also Upgrade &cFree Runners&r to give them Armor Protection, just like the &cJetpack&r.

quests.title: &eScuba Set
desc:
The &eScube Set&r is both a Helmet and Chestplate that will give you &9Water Breathing&r when worn! 

In order to get &9Breathing&r though, we'll need to give our &eScube Tank&r some &bOxygen&r. Just place it within a &5Machine&r that has some, like an &9&lElectrolytic Separator&r and it will slowly fill up! 

Then, put on both the &eScube Mask &fand &eScube Tank&r and press (G) to turn it on. Once the &eScube Gear&r is on, it will use up the &bOxygen&r allowing you to &9Breath Underwater&r!

quests.title: &4Flamethrower
desc:
The &4Flamethrower&r is one of the Ranged Weapons &5&lMekanism&r offers. 

Like the &cJetpack&r it uses Hydrogen as Fuel and is loaded just the same way as the &cJetpack&r. 

We can press (N) to change its modes. 

&eCombat&r: will set Mobs on &6Fire&r and do Damage, but won't Burn Blocks or Items. 
&6Heat&r: from what I can tell can only do the same. 

&4Inferno&r: Burns everything!

quests.title: &3Electric Bow
desc: Just a normal Bow that takes &aEnergy&r instead of Durability.

quests.title: &4Crushed &fto Dust!
desc:
Some Recipes will require &7Ore Dusts&r! 

Thanks to &6&lAllTheOres&r, we can make &7Ore Dusts&r in a million different ways! 

The &5&lMekanism&r ways are with the &4&lCrusher&r and &d&lEnrichment Chamber&r. 

We can &4Crush&r &7Ingots&f into &7Dust&r. Or &dEnrich&r &7Ore Blocks&r to get 2 &7Dusts&r.

quests.title: &cD&ey&ae&bs&r and Pigments
desc:
&5&lMekanism&r has a couple of &5Machines&r just made for Coloring! 

There is 3 &5Machines&r we'll need to use and yes, in order! 

The &c&lPigment Extractor&r will take the Color out of &cD&ey&ae&bd&r Blocks and make a Pigment! Pigments are &cChemicals&r, and are used just like other &cChemicals&r: moved through &cTubes&f and held in &cChemical Tanks&r. 

&e&lPigment Mixer&r will take 2 Pigments and combine them into a new Color Pigment. This can even make some new Colors made for &5&lMekanism&r &eItems&r! 

&b&lPainting Machine&r will take those Pigments and apply them to Blocks and Items that can be &cD&ey&ae&bd&r, to &cD&ey&be&r them. This even works on Items that are already &cD&ey&ae&bd&r, you can't do that in &2&lVanilla&r!

quests.title: &eGold Leaves
quests.subtitle: Aura with Fireflies
desc: Breaking &eGolden Leaves&r has a high chance to drop a &eGold Leaf&r, which is needed for &eGold Powder&r.

quests.title: &aRitual of the Forest
desc:
The &aRitual of the Forest&r can be done by creating a multiblock structure using 8 Wooden Stands, 16 &eGold Powder&r and either an Oak or a Jungle Sapling, depending on the recipe.

To start a ritual place the items needed for the recipe on the Wooden Stands and Grow the Sapling needed in the middle. The &eGold Powder&r is consumed in the recipe, so you'll need a lot.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/natures_aura/forest_ritual.png width:295 height:150 align:center}

quests.title: Eye
quests.subtitle: An Eye on the environment
desc: The &bEnvironmental Eye&r can be made using the &aRitual of the Forest&r and can be worn in your Charm slot to monitor the aura levels in the top left corner of the screen.

quests.title: Ancient Trees
quests.subtitle: Not those Ancient Saplings
desc:
&dAncient Saplings&r are created using the &aRitual of the Forest&r. When they are grown, the trees attempt to maintain normal levels of aura (not too high or too low).

If the aura drops, the leaves will start to decay and reverse the process.

quests.title: &bToken of Joy
desc: The &bToken of Joy&r is the first Token you should craft, tokens are important crafting materials for items in &aNature's Aura&r.

quests.title: Bottles of Aura
quests.subtitle: Bottling up Aura
desc:
Aura can be bottled up by right-clicking in the air with a Bottle and Cork. Aura takes different forms depending on where it's collected.

In the Overworld it is bottled as &aSunlight&r, in the Nether it's &4Ghosts&r and in the End it's &0Darkness&r.

If the area you used the Bottle and Cork in has a severe lack of aura, you will get &0Bottled Vacuum&r.

quests.title: Aura Creation
quests.subtitle: More Aura!
desc: The &2Canopy Diminisher&r and the &2Herbivorous Absorber&r are both simple and easy ways of generating aura.

quests.title: &9Aura Cache
quests.subtitle: Caching in!
desc: The &9Aura Cache&r can be used to store &aAura&r!

quests.title: &bAura Trove
quests.subtitle: A Treasure Trove!
desc: The &bAura Trove&r is an upgraded version of the &9Aura Cache&r.

quests.title: &2Natural Alter
desc:
The &2Natural Altar&r is a multiblock structure made from 1 &2Natural Altar&r, 20 Planks, 16 Stone Bricks, 8 &eGolden Stone Bricks&r and 4 Chiseled Stone Bricks.

The Natural Altar will use up aura for each recipe and is needed to continue progressing in the mod.

The image to the right of this quest shows the multiblock setup.

quests.title: Structure Finders
quests.subtitle: I've got my Eyes on you
desc: The Eye of the Pillager, Eye of the Blaze and Eye of the Shulker are each used to locate specific structures.

quests.title: Infused Iron
desc:
To make an &2Infused Iron Ingot&r place an Iron Ingot on the &2Natural Altar&r.

This process will be quicker than with &6Tainted Gold.

quests.title: &6Tainted Gold
quests.subtitle: Taint that Gold!
desc:
To make a &6Tainted Gold Ingot&r place a &eGold Ingot&r on the &2Natural Altar&r.

This process will take longer than with &2Infused Iron&r.

quests.title: Offering Table
quests.subtitle: Offering the gods a Birdbath in a Forest of Flowers
desc: The Offering to the Gods is a multiblock structure made from 1 Offering Table and 36 Flowers. To make an offering you need Spirits of Calling.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/natures_aura/offering.png width:295 height:150 align:center}

quests.title: &bIngots of the Skies
desc: If you use &2Infused Iron Ingots&r or &6Tainted Gold Ingots&r on the Offering Table you will get &bIngots of the Skies&r.

quests.title: Upgraded Tokens
desc: Using your Tokens on the Offering Table will upgrade them. These upgraded Tokens will be needed for more advanced crafting recipes.

quests.title: Catalysts
desc:
These Catalysts can be added as pillar toppers to your &2Natural Altar&r. They allow you to turn more items into other items or to break them down.

The Crumbling Catalyst allows you to turn each Gold Leaf into 4 Gold Powder instead of 2!

quests.title: &2Altar of Birthing
quests.subtitle: Makin' Babies with Magic
desc: You can make a large number of vanilla mobs with the &2Altar of Birthing&r. &dSpirits of Birthing&r are made by breeding animals in areas with large amounts of aura.

quests.title: &eWelcome to &aNature's Aura
desc:
&aNature's Aura&r is a magic mod about using and replenishing &aAura&r. These quests will just go over some of the basics.

To get started, make some &eBrilliant Fiber&r which is made with &eGold Nuggets&r, &aLeaves&r and &aGrass&r. Right-clicking on any leaves with &eBrilliant Fiber&r will turn them into &eGolden Leaves&r.

Make sure to read the &aBook of Natural Aura&r, you can also use it to show how to make the multiblocks in &aNature's Aura&r.

quests.title: Other Tokens
desc: You will need to craft these Tokens too for other items.

quests.title: &dIngots of the Depths
desc: Combining 2 &bIngots of the Skies&r, 2 &6Tainted Gold Ingots&r and 1 &5Netherite Scrap&r together in a crafting grid will make &dIngots of the Depths&r.

quests.title: Netherite Finder
quests.subtitle: Netherite Finder
desc: The Staff of Ancient Knowledge uses Aura to highlight nearby &5Ancient Debris&r.

quests.title: &5Ender Crates and Oculars
quests.subtitle: Here and There!
desc:
&5Ender Crates&r are &5Ender Chests&r that can be used to transport items.

&5Ender Oculars&r are handheld versions of &5Ender Crates&r.

quests.title: &bStaff of Riches
desc:
The &bStaff of Riches&r uses aura to highlight all storage containers in a 64 block raidius for about 1 minute.

This can be very useful if you're looking for loot chests or if you put a chest in a mine somewhere.

quests.title: Quest 5A0EB2AD
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: Golden Delicious Apple Sapling
quests.subtitle: Red Delicious Apple + Granny Smith Apple

quests.title: Beliy Naliv Apple Sapling
quests.subtitle: Golden Declious Apple + Granny Smith Apple

quests.title: Blue Yonder Sapling
quests.subtitle: Shipwreck Chests
desc: These can be found in chests inside Shipwrecks.

quests.title: Firecracker Sapling
quests.subtitle: Ancient City Chests
desc: These can be found in chests inside Ancient Cities.

quests.title: Black Ember Sapling
quests.subtitle: Bastion Chests
desc: These can be found in chests inside Bastions.

quests.title: Flickering Sun Sapling
quests.subtitle: Desert Pyramid Chests
desc: These can be found in chests inside Desert Pyramids.

quests.title: Soul Tree Sapling
quests.subtitle: End City Chests
desc: These can be found in chests inside End Cities.

quests.title: Brown Amber Sapling
quests.subtitle: Cold Ocean Ruin Sus Blocks
desc: These can be found in Suspicious Sand and Gravel inside Cold Ocean Ruins.

quests.title: Quest 25D8BE02
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks. 

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission. 

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: Stripping
quests.subtitle: Please don't
desc: The (Log) Stripper strips Logs automatically using Axes put in the machine.

quests.title: Sawing
quests.subtitle: I Wood too
desc:
The Sawmill cuts Logs into Sawdust and more Planks than you would get from crafting. Sawdust can be used to make Paper.

 - Fustic Logs will also give you Fustic.
 - Brazilwood Logs and Logwood Logs will also give you Haematoxylin.

quests.title: Productive Trees
desc:
&lProductive Trees&r is a sister Mod to &lProductive Bees&r.

In order to get the different Trees you will need Pollinated Leaves. To get Pollinated Leaves you need Pollen. For Pollen you need Bees.

Bees flowering near the Trees will automatically Pollinate Leaves, or you can use a Pollen Sieve Upgrade in the Hive to get and use Pollen yourself! Have one on the house!

quests.title: Quest 0661E966
quests.subtitle: Self Breeding?
desc:
Some saplings can't be pollinated. These saplings have a random chance to grow into another tree.

For example if you want to get a &4Red Crepe Myrtle Sapling&r, first grow a Purple Crepe Myrtle Sapling. You will have a chance to get a &4Red Crepe Myrtle Tree&r from that.

quests.title: Sword Cast
quests.subtitle: Good ol' Reliable
desc: With this Cast, you can make the basic sword! Reliable damage and reliable speed.

quests.title: Katana Cast
quests.subtitle: Release Your Inner Samurai
desc: More damage than a Sword, but slower.

quests.title: Machete Cast
quests.subtitle: Thicc Sword
desc: Slightly faster than a Sword, but lower damage.

quests.title: Spear Cast
quests.subtitle: Release Your Inner Spartan
desc: Less damage than a Sword, but longer reach.

quests.title: Knife Cast
quests.subtitle: Stabby
desc: Higher Durability than a Dagger, but lower damage and speed.

quests.title: Dagger Cast
quests.subtitle: Stabby Stab
desc: Low damage, very high attack speed. Reduces the invincibility time of the target.

quests.title: Salvager
quests.subtitle: Breaking down (some) items!
desc:
The Salvager allows you to break down gear into the items they from.

For example: If you put in some Diamond Boots you will get 4 Diamonds back.

quests.title: Material Grader
quests.subtitle: The Material Tester
desc:
Placing an ingot in the Grader with a Grader Catalyst will give the material a grade.

The better the grade, the better the stats are on the material.

The best grade is "MAX".

quests.title: &dStarlight Charger
quests.subtitle: "Enchanting" Materials
desc:
The Starlight Charger can "enchant" materials with the "Star Charged" enchantment.

A structure must be built with the Starlight Charger in the middle in view of the night sky. It only gains Starlight Power during the night.

The Charger must be placed in the middle of a 7x7 structure, with a Pillar in each corner. Each pillar must have a "Starlight Charger Cap".

It also requires a charger catalyst per material.

quests.title: Tip Cast
quests.subtitle: For when you don't find 3 Diamonds
desc:
The Tip Upgrade is used to increase the mining level of a tool.

For example: If you have an Iron Pickaxe, with 1 Diamond, you can make a Diamond Tip Upgrade, and place it on your pickaxe. This will allow it to mine Obsidian, as well as give it a stat boost.

quests.title: Coating Blueprint
quests.subtitle: Totally not just for Netherite
desc:
Coats an items and tools.

Netherite makes a great coating material.

quests.title: Alloy Forge
quests.subtitle: Combines Materials
desc:
This is used to create custom alloys.

It is also the only way to get Tyrian Steel!

quests.title: Tier 1 Starlight Charger Pillar Cap
desc: This is a Tier 1 Pillar Cap for the Starlight Charger.

quests.title: Tier 2 Starlight Charger Pillar Cap
desc: This is a Tier 2 Pillar Cap for the Starlight Charger.

quests.title: Tier 3 Starlight Charger Pillar Cap
desc: This is a Tier 3 Pillar Cap for the Starlight Charger.

quests.title: Smart Filter
quests.subtitle: No Anvils required
desc:
Silent Gear gear can be repaired using a &9Repair Kit&r.

To repair an item, place the Repair Kit into a crafting grid, then place the materials needed to repair the tool in with it. This will "fill" the Repair Kit.

To repair the tool, combine the filled Repair Kit with the tool you'd like to repair in a crafting grid.

quests.title: Quest 769D5DE6
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: Recrystallizer
desc: The Recrystallizer allows you to combine together different crystals to make new crystals to use to make weapons, tools and armor.

quests.title: &9&lSilent Gear&r and &c&lProductive Metalworks
desc:
Some people like &9&lSilent Gear&r, while some like &7&lTinker's Construct&r. 

Instead of choosing between them, we've decided to take the best of both worlds by using &9&lSilent Gear&r and &c&lProductive Metalworks&r! 

&c&lProductive Metalworks&r will change how we obtain our &9&lSilent&r Items. Instead of using &9Blueprints&r, we'll now need &8Casts&r and a &c&lFoundry&r. 

To start making the &c&lFoundry&r, start with &cFire Clay&r.

quests.title: &c&lFoundry&r &aController
desc:
The &aController&r is the heart of the &c&lFoundry&r. 

Each &c&lFoundry&r will need atleast 1, to be made. 

We can use the &c&lFoundry&r to view the GUI of the &c&lFoundry&r. Here we can see the amounts of Liquids within the &c&lFoundry&r. 

We can also use it to put and take Items in and out of the &c&lFoundry&r.

quests.title: &c&lFoundry&r &bDrains
desc:
&bDrains&r are what we'll use to extract our the &7Liquid Metals&r. Yes, it is unfortunately too hot for our Hands or Buckets. 

Connect the &c&lFoundry&r &7Tap&r to the &bDrain&r, to drain out the &7Liquid Metals&r when Right Clicking the Tap. 

You can also view the amounts of Liquids in the &c&lFoundry&r when viewing the &bDrain&r!

quests.title: &l&cFoundry&r &4Tanks
desc:
&4Tanks&r are made for adding Liquids into our &c&lFoundry&r. 

Mostly Fuel. 

Mostly &cLava&r! 

That appears to be one of the only ways to actually Fuel the &c&lFoundry&r.

quests.title: Building the &c&lFoundry&r
desc:
Now that we have a &aController&r, &bDrains&r, and &4Tanks&r, we'll need a few more Blocks. 

First, is &6Liquid Heating Coils&r. These will make up the floor of the &c&lFoundry&r, and are needed to Heat up the &c&lFoundry&r. 

Last is either &c&lFoundry&r Windows or &cFire Bricks&r. These are what we'll use for the rest of the structure! The building blocks, quite literally. 

The &c&lFoundry&r will not need the frame built out, so every corner can remain empty; but it must have 4 Walls and a Floor to be completed. The &aController&r will tell you where a Block is missing, if there is one. 

The &c&lFoundry&r can be as small as 1x1 on the inside, as long as it has a &aController&r, &6Liquid Heating Coils&r, and the other Walls filled! 

I don't recommend making one so small though, as the bigger the &c&lFoundry&r, the more space it has in it! 

You'll know the &c&lFoundry&r is built, when the &aController&r lights up like a Furnace, and the &6Liquid Heating Coils&r turn &6Orange&r.

quests.title: Casting Items
desc:
&nFoundry&r: &aCheck&r 
&nLiquid Metal in Foundry&r: &aCheck&r 

Now how do we get it out? 

Remember our friend from earlier? The &c&lFoundry&r &bDrain&r? We'll need to acquaint him with our new friend, the &c&lFoundry&r &7Tap&r. 

Place the &c&lFoundry&r &7Tap&r on the &bDrain&r, now we can place Blocks beneath it to drain the &7Liquid Metal&r into... 

Blocks like the &8Casting Bin&r, which will turn about 900mB of &7Liquid Metal&r, into the full &7Metal Block&r. 

Or the &8Casting Table&r which is what we'll need in order to make...

quests.title: &8Casts
desc:
All &8Casts&r are made equal. In another sense I mean they are made the same way. 

By Pouring &8Steel&r onto an Item in a &8Casting Table&r! 

How do we make &8Steel&r you ask? Simply Melt down any &8Steel&r Items or Ingots. Or you can Alloy 9 &7Iron&r to 10 &0Coal&r. 

Alloying will happen when the &c&lFoundry&r is &6Heated&r and the right amounts of different &7Liquid Metals&r are in it. These two &7Liquid Metals&r will combine into one &7Liquid Metal&r!

quests.title: Welcome to the &9Twilight Forest&r!
quests.subtitle: Enter the Twilight Forest
desc:
The &9Twilight Forest&r is a mod that adds the Twilight Forest dimension to the game. This dimension is filled with brand new items, biomes, mobs and bosses!

To create the portal to get to the &9Twilight Forest&r, make a 2x2 hole in the ground and fill it with water. Surround the edges of the hole with flowers, and throw a Diamond into the water.

Assuming you did it correctly, Thor will give you a sign and the portal will activate.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/gettingstarted/twilight_portal.png width:100 height:100 align:center fit:true}

quests.title: The Silence of the Forest
desc:
In the &9Twilight Forest&r, there are a bunch of new creatures to discover.

One of the worst of these creatures is the Cicada. I suggest killing this for this, but killing any Twilight Forest mob will work.

quests.title: &cThe Final Boss
desc:
...is not implemented.

Instead, head to the giant castle in the Final Plateau and grab some door blocks!

There is a Kobold that spawns in as a "placeholder" but you will get nothing from killing it.

quests.title: Fancy Noms
desc:
There are a lot of different foods you can make from the &9Twilight Forest&r!

Try them all!

quests.title: &8Raven Feathers
desc:
It's easy to get lost in the &9Twilight Forest&r. In your travels, you'll run into &5Obsidian Pillars&r.

These pillars will have &8Ravens&r around them. Kill them and they'll drop their feathers, which you can use to create a map for the &9Twilight Forest&r!

quests.title: &aThe Real Final Boss
quests.subtitle: Growing Trees
desc:
Within the &9Twilight Forest&r, there are loot chests that can give you rare saplings.

Collect them all!

quests.title: &2Evening The Scales
desc:
The first boss you'll have to kill on your adventure in the &9Twilight Forest&r can be found within the Courtyard.

The &2Naga&r is a green serpent made up of multiple segments, as you deal damage to it, it's segments will disappear.

Killing the &2Naga&r will drop some nice items and grant you entry to the home of the next boss, the Lich.

quests.title: &eBring out your Dead
desc:
The &eLich Tower&r is home to the &eLich&r! The fight has 3 phases:

Phase 1: The &eLich&r surrounds himself in shields, and attacks you with &5Ender Pearls&r that shoot out like Ghast fireballs. Reflect them back to the &eLich&r to break his shields! As his shields break, he'll send out duplicates to distract you.

Phase 2: The &eLich&r switches scepters to summon Zombies to help him in the fight. With his defenses down, you will be able to melee him!

Phase 3: Once all of the charges are spent on his Scepter, he will switch to a &eGolden Sword&r and go berserk. Kill him fast!

quests.title: &cMighty Meef Stroganoff
desc:
In the depths of the Labyrinth Swamp is a giant &cMinoshroom&r.

Once defeated, it'll drop &eMeef Stroganoff&r. To unlock the next area, you must eat it.

quests.title: &9Hydra Slayer
quests.subtitle: The Firey Swamp
desc:
The &9Hydra&r is the infamous multi-headed beast from Greek Mythology.

Ranged attacks aren't as effective, meaning you'll need to get up close and personal.

Once defeated, you'll be able to find the next boss in the &2Dark Forest&r.

quests.title: &2The Dark Forest
quests.subtitle: The Darkest of Forests
desc:
Inside the &2Dark Forest&r, you'll find a structure that leads underground.

To enter, you'll need to place one of the boss trophies you've acquired on the nearby pedestal, don't worry about which one you place, you can pick it back up.

On the 3rd layer, you'll find the Knight Phantoms. Defeat these to unlock the next boss.

quests.title: &cTears of Fire
quests.subtitle: Dark Carmonite Tower
desc:
Within the &2Dark Forest&r, you'll find the &8Dark Tower&r.

To enter, look for the reappearing blocks at the base. Find your way through the maze all the way to the final floor to fight the &cUr-Ghast&r.
