The &cUr-Ghast&r is recommended to kill with a ranged weapon. There are 4 Ghast traps found on the boss floor, which can be used to damage the &cUr-Ghast&r.

These are charged with &cGhastling&r kills, then activating with Redstone. You don't have to use them, but they can prove useful.

quests.title: To the Snow Biomes!
quests.subtitle: You had Snow idea
desc:
After defeating the &cUr-Ghast&r, you'll unlock the Snowy Forest biomes.

There are many creatures to fight, but to continue your progression, you'll need to kill the Alpha Yeti.

You can find the Alpha Yeti in a massive Yeti cave. Defeat it to move on.

quests.title: &bClear Skies
desc:
Defeating the Alpha Yeti unlocks the &9Glacier&r biome. Here, you'll find cute little Penguins and the &3Snow Queen&r.

At the top of the &bAurora Palace&r, the &3Snow Queen&r will summon Ice crystals to protect herself.

She'll also slam &3Ice&r down that can destroy the floor and deal massive damage.

You'll only be able to hit her top half, as she's protected by &3Ice&r.

After defeating the &3Snow Queen&r, you'll unlock access to the &2Highlands&r.

quests.title: &6Lamp of Cinders
desc:
With a &8Giant's Pickaxe&r, you'll want to head back to Troll Caves to find &5Giant Obsidian&r.

Use the &8Giant's Pickaxe&r to break it, and you'll find some loot. Acquire the &6Lamp of Cinders&r to continue.

quests.title: Giant Pickaxe
quests.subtitle: The giants look like me, but are nothing LIKE me
desc:
With Magic Beans and Uberous Soil, you'll want to look for a large cloud in the highland biomes.

Plant the magic beans in the soil to grow a beanstalk all the way up. Here, you'll find the Giants.

You'll need to kill the Miner Giant and get their pickaxe to continue on.

quests.title: &2Naga Scale Armor
desc:
From the scales of the &2Naga&r, you can craft some armor.

The armor isn't very strong, but it looks nice.

quests.title: &9Scepter of Twilight
quests.subtitle: Shoots Ender Blasts
desc:
Do you want to be able to shoot Ender blasts like the &eLich&r? If so, the &9Scepter of Twilight&r is the scepter for you!.

To recharge, combine it with an &5Ender Pearl&r in a crafting grid.

quests.title: &cScepter of Life Draining
quests.subtitle: Drains Life
desc:
Using the &cScepter of Life Draining&r, you can drain the life of your enemies!

To recharge the scepter, combine it with &cFermented Spider Eyes&r in a crafting grid.

quests.title: &2Zombie Scepter
quests.subtitle: Summons Zombies
desc:
The &2Zombie Scepter&r exists because who doesn't want to summon their own &2Zombies&r?

To recharge, combine with &cRotten Flesh&r in a crafting grid.

quests.title: &6Scepter of Fortification
quests.subtitle: Summons Shields
desc:
The &6Scepter of Fortification&r summons shields around you for protection.

To recharge, combine with &6Golden Apples&r in a crafting grid.

quests.title: &2To the Swamps!
quests.subtitle: Where's Shrek?
desc:
It's time to go to the &2Swamps&r! In the &2Swamps&r, you'll find an odd-looking hill with an entrance on top. This is the &cMinoshroom Labyrinth&r!

Inside, you'll fight several new enemies that can drop &eMaze Map Focus&r. This is needed to make a &eMaze Map&r.

This is a special map that will map your way around the &cMinoshroom Labyrinth&r. Minimaps have no power here.

You can also find several loot rooms with special loot for the Maze!

quests.title: &eMagic Map
desc:
This map is a must have for the &9Twilight Forest&r.

Using a &eBlank Magic Map&r will give you a map that shows icons for nearby bosses and structures.

quests.title: &2Steeleaf Armor
desc:
This is slightly stronger than &2Naga&r armor, and comes fully enchanted.

You can make these by finding &2Steeleaf&r within the &9Twilight Forest&r.

quests.title: &6Ironwood Armor
desc: &6Ironwood Armor&r can be crafted using &6Ironwood&r and comes automatically enchanted.

quests.title: &cFiery Armor
desc:
The &2Hyrda&r drops &cFiery Blood&r that can be used to craft &cFiery Armor&r.

When wearing the full set, enemies that attack you will be set on fire for 10 seconds.

quests.title: &2Phantom Armor
desc: &2Phantom Armor&r has a chance of being found in &2Knight Phantom&r chests.

quests.title: Knightmetal Armor
desc: Knightmetal Armor&r can be crafted with Knightmetal Ingots and has a chance of being found in &2Knight Phantom&r chests.

quests.title: &cR&6a&em&2i&3f&9i&5c&ca&6t&ei&2o&3n
quests.subtitle: Quests?
desc:
Find the &cQ&6u&ee&2s&3t&9i&5n&cg &6R&ea&2m&r, for it bestows wealth to those who give it &cR&6a&ei&2n&3b&9o&5w &6W&eo&2o&3l&r (16 colors).

Hint: There's a Dispenser above your head in the ruins where the Ram is. It might prove useful.

quests.title: &cCharm of Life I
desc:
The &cCharm of Life I&r is a single-use item that will prevent death. Instead of dying, the charm will be consumed and you'll be given health regen for a short period of time.

These can be found in loot chests.

quests.title: &eCharm of Life II
desc:
Just like the &cCharm of Life I&r, the &eCharm of Life II&r is consumed to prevent your death. When consumed, you'll regen all of your health and be given Regen IV, Resistance, and Fire Resistance for 30 seconds.

These can be crafted with 4 &cCharms of Life I&r.

quests.title: &6Charm of Keeping I
desc: The &6Charm of Keeping I&r will prevent you from losing the items in your main hand and off-hand, as well as any armor you're wearing when you die.

quests.title: &fCharm of Keeping II
desc: The &fCharm of Keeping II&r works the same as the &6Charm of Keeping I&r but stops you from losing the stuff in your hotbar when you die too.

quests.title: &eCharm of Keeping III
desc: The &eCharm of Keeping III&r works the same as the other Charms of Keeping, but stops you from losing all of the stuff in your inventory.

quests.title: Yeti Armor
desc: Yeti Armor can be crafted with Alpha Yeti Fur.

quests.title: &6Arctic Armor
quests.subtitle: It's Dyable!
desc: Small Yetis and Winter Wolves drop Arctic Fur, which can be used to make &6Arctic Armor&r.

quests.title: Mazebreaker Pickaxe
quests.subtitle: Trapped Chamber, do not enter?
desc:
The Mazebreaker is a special pickaxe that is rarely found in Labyrinths.

This pickaxe will take 1 damage when breaking Maze Walls, instead of the 16 damage for all other pickaxes!

quests.title: &dTri-Bow
quests.subtitle: From a Lynel?
desc: The &dTri-Bow&r is dropped from the &3Snow Queen&r, it can shoot 3 Arrows at the same time, while only using 1.

quests.title: &aSeeker Bow
quests.subtitle: Bad Aim?
desc: The &aSeeker Bow&r is dropped from the &3Snow Queen&r, it can shoot Arrows that home in on your targets. No more missing!

quests.title: &bIce Bow
desc: The &bIce bow&r can be found randomly in loot chests, it will inflict Slowness III for 10 seconds on hit.

quests.title: &3Ender Bow
desc:
The &3Ender Bow&r is found rarely in the &bAurora Palace&r.

When an enemy is hit with an arrow from this bow, you will swap places with them. Be careful shooting things out of the sky!

quests.title: &cOre Magnet
desc:
The &cOre Magnet&r that can pull up anything with Ore in name, except Coal.

This can be found in &2Hollow Hill&r chests.

quests.title: &7Glass Sword
desc:
The &7Glass Sword&r deals 40 hearts of damage, but only has 1 durability.

You can make it indestructible if you want to use it.

These are rarely found in loot chests in the &bAurora Palace&r.

quests.title: &3Ice Sword
desc: Found in the &bAurora Palace&r, the &3Ice Sword&r will give enemies &bFrosted&r for 10 seconds when damaged.

quests.title: &6Moonworm Queen
desc:
The &6Moonworm Queen&r is like a torch launcher. It launches &eMoonworms&r at the targeted block, which light up the block similar to a torch.

These can be found in some &2Hollow Hill&r and &eLich Tower&r loot chests.

quests.title: Transformation Powder
desc:
Do you want to make the &aOverworld&r feel more like the &9Twilight Forest&r?

You can use this powder on animals in the Overworld to convert them into their &9Twilight Forest&r variants.

You can find this in dungeon chests in the &9Twilight Forest&r.

quests.title: &eMagic Map Focus
desc: Combining a &8Raven Feather&r with &eTorchberries&r and &6Glowstone&r will give you a &eMagic Map Focus&r.

quests.title: &cFiery Tools
desc:
Using the &cFiery Blood&r from the Hydra, you can make a couple of tools.

The Fiery Sword comes with Fire Aspect II.

The Fiery Pickaxe comes with auto-smelt.

quests.title: &bMinotaur Axe
desc: The &bDiamond Minotaur Axe&r is dropped by the &cMinoshroom&r. It deals more damage when the user is sprinting.

quests.title: &cReappearing \& Vanishing Blocks
desc:
&cReappearing Blocks&r are like really cool doors. Once right-clicked, they'll disappear for a short time.

&cVanishing Blocks&r will disappear when right-clicked, but they don't come back.

quests.title: &cCarmanite Builders \& Reactors
desc:
&cCarminite Builders&r, when powered with a Redstone signal, will generate temporary blocks in the direction the signal came from.

The &cCarminite Reactor&r will convert nearby Obsidian and Netherack into &eFalse Gold&r and &3False Diamond&r. After a short period of time, this will suck up nearby blocks and explode, creating &cCarminite Ghastlings&r around it.

quests.title: Visiting the Giants
quests.subtitle: Where's Jack?
desc:
Once you've unlocked the &2Highland&r biome, head over and find some Trolls to kill.

They can drop some &9Magic Beans&r. You'll also find chests that give you Uberus Soil, which is needed to grow the Magi Beans.

quests.title: Every Thorn has its Rose
desc:
Using the &6Lamp of Cinders&r, you are able to break the Thorns in the Thornland Biome.

Gather some &cThorn Roses&r to continue on to the &2Final Plateau&r.

quests.title: Advanced Fail Safe
desc:
In bigger &2&lReactors&r we'll need a more advanced fail safe. 
For this one, our &2&lReactor&r will need to be atleast 5 Blocks wide. That gives 3 Block width for our 2 &2FRLA&r. 

Place 1 of our &2FRLA&r in the &2&lReactor&r and set it to either High Temperature or Damage Critical. Then, place the second one atleast 1 Block away while on the same Y Level. The second will need to be set to Activation. 

Now, let's do some &4Redstone&r! 

Place a &4Redstone Repeater&r facing out from the first &2FRLA&r. Then, where the &4Repeater&r is facing, place a Block that can transmit &4Redstone&r. 

On that Block, place a &4Redstone Torch&r in the direction that the second &2FRLA&r is. 

After that, place &4Redstone Dust&r next to the &4Torch&r, while on the same X/Z Level of the second &2FRLA&r. And lastly, place a second &4Redstone Repeater&r going from the &4Redstone Dust&r and into the second &2FRLA&r.

quests.title: Quest 066F7893
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks. 

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission. 

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &2Fissile Fuel
desc:
Great, another &c&lChemical Infuser&r! 

Combine the &aUranium Oxide&r and &7Hydrofluorite Acid&r to create &aUranium Hexafluoride&r. 

Now we can process the &aUranium Hexafluoride&r through an &5&lIsotopic Centrifuge&r to finally get our beautiful &2Fissile Fuel&r.

quests.title: Preparing &aUranium
desc:
Let's take a break from &eSulfur&r and Acids and let's focus on the &2Radioactive&r part of &2Fissile Fuel&r! 

Now let's see... what is &2Radioactive&r, abundant, and used in &6&lATO&r so any version will work? 

Oh yeah &aUranium&r! 

Mine &aUranium Ore&r and use the &aUranium Ingots&r in an &d&lEnrichment Chamber&r to make &eYellow Cake Uranium&r. 

No, don't eat it. It isn't that type of Cake! 

Bake the &eYellow Cake Uranium&r in a &c&lChemical &eOxidizier&r to make &aUranium Oxide&r.

quests.title: &5&lMekanism: Reactors
desc:
Yes, &5&lMekanism&r is that big! 

If you want your &2&lReactors&r and Invincible Armor, then you are in the right spot! 

First, we'll need a &2&lFission Reactor&r and that needs &2Fissile Fuel&r. To make &2Fissile Fuel&r we'll need some &cSulfuric Trioxide&r. 

Start by putting &eSulfur&r into a &c&lChemical &eOxidizier&r to make &eSulfur Dioxide&r. 

Then, make some &bOxygen&r by processing &9Water&r through an &9&lElectrolytic Separator&r. 

Now we can &cTube&r that &bOxygen&r and &eSulfur Dioxide&r into a &c&lChemical Infuser&r to make our &cSulfur Trioxide&r.

quests.title: &cSulfur Trioxide&r into &7Hydrofluoric Acid
desc:
We aren't done with our &cSulfur Trioxide&r yet! We will need some Water Vapor to process it further though. 

To get Water Vapor we can use the &c&lRotary &bCondensator&r to turn &9Water&r into Water Vapor! 
More &cInfusing&r! Combine our Water Vapor with our &cSulfuric Trioxide&r to make &aSulfuric Acid&r. 

Well it's an Acid now... but not the right one... 

Oh yeah, we'll need &dFluorite&r which we can get from Mining Ores. Then, use the &3&lChemical Dissolution Chamber&r to dilute the &aSulfuric Acid&r with &dFluorite&r to finally get our &7Hydrofluoric Acid&r!

quests.title: &2Fissile Fuel&r storage and usage
desc:
&2Fission Fuel Assembly&r are what make up the storage for &2Fissile Fuel&r. They also help determine Efficiency. 

&2Fission Fuel Assemblies&r will need to be placed in the &2&lFission Reactor&r in order to work. 

They can be stacked on top and next to each other, but each stack will need a... 

&2Control Rod Assembly&r on top of them! &2Control Rod Assembly&r don't change anything like Efficiency but the &2Fission Fuel Assembly&r won't work if there isn't a &2Control Rod Assembly&r above them within the &2&lFission Reactor&r!

quests.title: &2Fission Reactor Logic Adapter
desc:
The &2Fission Reactor Logic Adapter&r ,which I will be calling &2FRLA&r, is used to monitor and configure the &2&lFission Reactor&r with &4Redstone&r. 

First, place the &2FRLA&r in one of the walls of the &2&lFission Reactor&r like you would with the &2Ports&r. 

Then, we can Right Click the &2FRLA&r to configure it. 

Disabled: won't interact with &4Redstone&r. 

Activation: will turn the &2&lReactor&r on when given a &4Redstone Signal&r, and when there is no longer a &4Signal&r it will turn off. 

High Temperature: will send out a &4Redstone Signal&r when the &6Temperatures&r reach a dangerous Level. 

Critical Waste Level: will give a &4Signal&r when there is too much &8Nuclear Waste&r. 

Damage Critical: will, like the others, will give out a &4Signal&r when the &2&lReactor&r is just about to blow up! 

Insufficient Fuel: will give a &4Signal&r when it is running out of &2Fissile Fuel&r.

quests.title: &2Fission Reactor Port
desc:
&2Fission Reactor Ports&r are pretty darn important. The &2&lFission Reactor&r will need Ports for &2Fuel&f, &bCoolant&f, and &8Waste&r... so it won't work without &2Ports&r. 

&2Ports&r can be placed within any parts of the &2&lFission Reactor's&r Walls, just not on the edge. 

We'll need to have 4 of them and we'll need to use the &3Configurator&r on the &2Ports&r to Configure them. 

They will start as &aInput Only&r but by Shift Right Clicking the &2Ports&r with the &3Configurator&r it will switch to &eOutput Waste&r and then to &bOutput Coolant&r. 

&aInput Only&r will take in both &2Fissile Fuel&r and &bCoolant&r as either &9Water&r or Sodium. 

&eOutput Waste&r will send &8Nuclear Waste&r out of the &2&lFission Reactor&r. 

&bOutput Coolant&r will either take out Steam if &9Water&r was used as the &bCoolant&r or if Sodium is used it will take out &6Superheated Sodium&r.

quests.title: &2&lFission Reactor
quests.subtitle: Splitting 1 Element into 2
desc:
The smallest (working) &2&lFission Reactor&r we can make is 3x4x3. 

The base and frame will need to be made of &2Fission Reactor Casing&r while the inside will need to be either Empty, or have &2Fuel Rod Assembly&r or &2Control Rod Assembly&r! 

The inside of the walls (not the edges) can have our &2Fission Reactor Ports&r or &2FRLA&r and the rest can be filled with &2Reactor Glass&r. 

Once our &2&lFission Reactor&r is built, we can Right Click anywhere (besides the &2FRLA&r) on the &2Reactor&r to open its GUI.
{@pagebreak}

This can look pretty scary to new Players so we'll go through it slowly to understand it better! 

At the top, we can see 4 different Bars. These are where we can see how much &2Fissile Fuel&f, &bCoolant&f, &6Heated Coolant&f, and &8Nuclear Waste&r. 

Between the Bars we'll find the main menu of the &2&lReactor&r. It will tell us whether it is on or off, how &2Fissile Fuel&r is being used up every Tick, how much Temperature it rises every Tick, and how much Damage the &2&lReactor&r has suffered! 

Below all of these we'll see 2 Buttons! One to turn on the &2&lReactor&r saying Activate and the other to turn it off saying SCRAM. Next to the SCRAM Button is a little image to help Players know if it is on or off. Green when on, Red when off. 

Below those Buttons we'll see how Hot our &2&lReactor&r is and below it will show a visual of the Temperature change.
{@pagebreak}

Outside of this menu, we can Click the Top Tab to pull up the Statistics. 

The top Chart shows off how much Heat can be held until Damage occurs, how much room &2Fuel&r has within the &2&lReactor&r, and how Efficient it is at using Heat to use up &2Fuel&r. 

The rest is all based on how much &2Fuel&r can be used each Tick. We can set a max in the Type Box. It is also set at mB per Tick! 

The other Tab we can find on the side of the main menu is for our Temperature! 

It will show its Dissipiation rate as well as the Temperature Unit shown. We can change the Temperature Unit by Clicking on the Tab. You'll most likely use F (Fahrenheit) or C (Celsius) but we can also use K (Kelvin), R (Rankine), or STP (Standard Temperature and Pressure)!
{@pagebreak}

MELTDOWNS! 

The &2&lFission Reactor&r will explode if it goes to 250% Damage. When it explodes it will break Blocks, start Fires, and worst of all... spread &aRadiation&r! 

Let's avoid that! 

The Damage will increase when the Temperature goes over 1,200K. We'll need to use &bCoolants&r to keep that Temperature down. 

Make sure it has a constant supply of &bCoolant&r and make sure the &bCoolant Output&r doesn't bottle-neck. If this happens, more &bCoolant&r can't be used and the Temperature will increase. 

LEAKS! 

&aRadiation&r leaks can also occur if the &8Nuclear Waste&r Bar is full. This will spread &aRadiation&r around the &2&lReactor&r. Avoid this with constantly removing &8Nuclear Waste&r and even using &2FRLA&r to know when &8Waste&r is full!
{@pagebreak}
This Multiblock can be made at any size available, not just what is shown through the Images. The Images merely show the smallest size we can make.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_fission1.png width:100 height:75 align:center}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_fission2.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_fission3.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_fission4.png width:100 height:110 align:center}

quests.title: Clock Switch
desc:
If you have a small &2&lFission Reactor&r primarily for &aPolonium&r then we should use this as a simple fail safe! 

&aPolonium&r is made with the &e&lSolar Neutron Activator&r. You can probably tell it needs &eDaylight&r to work! 

So, in order to stop bottle-necking (which can be deadly when we are talking about &2&lReactors&r) we can turn off our &2&lReactor&r when it is Nighttime! 

First, set your &2FRLA&r to Activation. This will turn on the &2&lReactor&r when it has a &4Redstone Signal&r and turned off when it doesn't. 

Now we can place our &eDaylight Sensor&r and connect it to the &2FRLA&r with &4Redstone&r. 

Then, boom, it is ready!

quests.title: &9Water &bCoolant
desc:
Listen, I have been telling you guys to use &9Electric Pumps&r for most of the &5&lMekanism&r Quests. 

But to be honest I have to let you guys graduate. The &2&lReactors&r will need more &9Water&r so I grant you, the &9Sink&r! 

The &9Sink&r has Infinite &9Water&r and can be &bPiped&r out from practically any Mod. I recommend using &9&lID&r if available because it can pull over 2 Billion mB of &9Water&r each Tick! 

The reason I have been using the &9Electric Pumps&r is not because I don't trust you with &9Sinks&r rather it is for these reasons. 1. it will stay for Modpacks that don't have &9Sinks&r and 2. it is from &5&lMekanism&r.

quests.title: Sodium &bCoolant
desc:
Sodium can be used as a &bCoolant&r instead of &9Water&r. Sodium is more Efficient, gets higher &6Temperatures&r, but is harder to get and reuse. 

Now how do we get it? 

We'll need a &6&lThermal Evaporation Plant&r. I've made like 3 Quests explaining how to Build and use them, this won't be the 4th. 

We'll use the &6&lThermal Evaporation Plant&r to take our &9Water&r and make &eBrine&r. 

Then, we can use an &9&lElectrolytic Separator&r to demolish that &eBrine&r to get our Sodium! 

And another &cChemical&r but we don't care about it!

quests.title: &aRadioactivity
desc:
Now we can finally worry about &aRadioactivity&r! 

&8Nuclear Waste&r (and it's products) are &aRadioactive&r. That means they must be held within &eRadioactive Waste Barrels&r. 

The &8Nuclear Waste&r (and it's products) must be Tubed into and out of the &eRadioactive Waste Barrels&r. 

You can not break the &eBarrel&r or &cTubes&r that hold &aRadioactive&r materials, or else the &aRadiation&r will spread in the World. 

&aRadioactivity&r can also come from &2&lReactors&r leaking or melting down. 

How do we deal with &aRadioactivity&r? &6Hazmat Suit&r and time. Check out its own Quest to learn more about them!

quests.title: Steam
desc:
If we are using &9Water&r as a &bCoolant&r, we will get Steam as a byproduct! 

Now what do we do with it?

quests.title: Toss it!
desc:
Honestly, if you don't need more &aEnergy&r and would rather be as safe as you can with your &2&lReactor&r then just delete it! 

Oh yeah, you heard me! Just delete the Steam! 

I know lots of things are important in &2&lMinecraft&r and it is usually greater to hold onto these, instead of tossing them... 

But Steam is pretty much only for Turbines to make &aEnergy&r. 

Don't need it? Then, Tube it into an Ultimate Trash Can!

quests.title: Spinning for &3Plutonium
desc:
Hey, I remember you! 

Turns out, the &5&lIsotopic Centrifuge&r is used for 2 Recipes. &2Fissile Fuel&r and &3Plutonium&r! 

For each 5mB of &8Nuclear Waste&r we can create 1mB of &3Plutonium&r. 

If each &3Plutonium Pellets&r are 1,000mB worth of &3Plutonium&r, then we'll need 5,000mB of &8Nuclear Waste&r and the same for &2Fissile Fuel&r.

quests.title: &3Plutonium Pellets
desc:
We got our &3Plutonium&r and the rest is what we should already have! 

A &2&lP.R.C.&r, &9Water&r, and &dFluorite Dust&r! 

Combine 1,000mB &9Water&r, with 1,000mB &3Plutonium&r, and 1 &dFluorite Dust&r to make 1 &3Plutonium Pellet&r and 1,000mB &8Spent Nuclear Waste&r. 

&dFluorite Dust&r can be made like any Metal Dust: &4&lCrusher&r, &d&lEnrichment Chamber&r, or even an Ore Hammer!

quests.title: &aPolonium Pellets
desc:
We got our &aPolonium&r and the rest is what we should already have! 

A &2&lP.R.C.&r, &9Water&r, and &dFluorite Dust&r! 

Combine 1,000mB &9Water&r, with 1,000mB &aPolonium&r, and 1 &dFluorite Dust&r to make 1 &aPolonium Pellet&r and 1,000mB &8Spent Nuclear Waste&r. 

&dFluorite Dust&r can be made like any Metal Dust: &4&lCrusher&r, &d&lEnrichment Chamber&r, or even an Ore Hammer!

quests.title: &cFusion Reactor Ports
desc:
&cFusion Reactor Ports&r will replace the Reactor Glass within the &c&lFusion Reactor&r in order to be used. 

We'll need a few &cPorts&r. 2 (or 1) for &cDeuterium&r and &aTritium&r (or just &5D-T Fuel&r) for Fuel. We'll also need 1 for Outputting &aEnergy&r. 

If you want to use &9Water&r to cool the &c&lFusion Reactor&r, you'll need 2 more &cPorts&r. 1 for Inputting &9Water&r and 1 for Outputting Steam. 

Like other Ports, we can use the &3Configurator&r to set whether the &cPort&r Inputs or Outputs!

quests.title: &e&lQuantum Item Orchestration
quests.subtitle: (QIO)
desc:
Move aside &b&lAE2&r and &3&lRS2&r! We got &5&lMekanism&r! 

The &e&lQuantum Item Orchestration&r (&e&lQIO&r) is a Virtual &eItem&r storage. We'll need a few &eItems&r to open and store &eItems&r in it before we get to use it! 

First, is the heart of the system, the &e&lQIO Drive Array&r. It is the &5Machine&r everything will go through and connect through. 

It doesn't require &aEnergy&r but like &a&lTeleporters&r and &5&lQuantum Entangloporters&r it will need to be set to a Network! The other &eItems&r that connect to the &e&lQIO Drive Array&r will need to be set to that Network as well. 

For the &eQIO Drives&r we just need to place them within the &e&lQIO Drive Array&r!

quests.title: &eQIO Drives
desc:
&eQIO Drives&r determine the Storage within &e&lQIO Drive Arrays&r. 

They are placed within the &5Machines&r Inventory in order to be used. You can place up to 12 of them. 

The &eQIO Drives&r hold the &eItems&r and they will automatically fill up the first &eQIO Drive&r in order. 

Each of them have an &eItem Storage&r limit and &eItem Type&r limit. The better the &eQIO Drive&r, the more &eItems&f and &eItem Types&r you'll get! 

&aQIO Drive&r: is the most basic, having 16k Items and 128 Types. This is the only one not needing a &2&lFission Reactor&r to Craft. 

&cHyper-Dense QIO Drive&r: and everything after will need the &2&lFission Reactor&r. This one holds 128k Items and 256 Item Types. 

&bTime-Dilating QIO Drive&r: can store 1,048k Items and 1,024 Item Types. 

&dSupermassive QIO Drive&r: will need &dAntimatter&r to Craft but will obviously give the most Storage. Allowing 16b Items and 8,192 Item Types.

quests.title: Import and Export
desc:
&eImporters &fand &eExporters&r can be used to automatically Import and Export &eItems&r from and to the &e&lQIO System&r. 

&eImporters &fand &eExporters&r are both Placed on Blocks with Inventories in order to take or give &eItems&r. They'll also need to be set to the same Network as the &e&lQIO Drive Array&r. 

If they are set to Import or Export without Filters, they will automatically take in (or out) every &eItem&r in the respected Inventories or System. 

If you want to Filter, you use Itemstack, Tag, and Mod. Each are set by putting an &eItem&r into the Slot. Itemstack will use only that &eItem&r. Tag will need the Item Tag typed into the Text Box. Mod will use the Mod an &eItem&r is from. Like &2&lMinecraft&r for all &2&lVanilla&r Blocks.

quests.title: &ePortable QIO Dashboard
desc:
The &ePortable QIO Dashboard&r allows us to view our &e&lQIO System&r from anywhere! 

Right Click with the &eItem&r to make it yours! 

Now you can Right Click it and set a Network Frequency to our &e&lQIO System&r. 

Boom everything the &eQIO Dashboard&r does, we can do with this little friend!

quests.title: &l&7Modification Station
desc:
The &7&lModification Station&r is how we will throw our &7Module Units&r into our Tools and Armor. 

It will need &aEnergy&r to operate, because of course it does. 

When you Right Click a (powered) &7&lModification Station&r it will open up its GUI. Here we can see our entire Inventory including Armor and Offhand. We also have a Screen and 2 extra Slots. 

The 2 extra Slots are where our &7Module Units&r (Left Slot) and our Armor or Tools we want to add the &7Module Units&r go (Right Slot). 

Once both are added into their Slots, they will automatically place the &7Module Units&r into the &eItem&r. If they stay in the Slot, we can view the &7Module Units&r installed in the &eItem&r in the Screen. 

If you want to take our a &7Module Unit&r, click it on the Screen, and then hit the Remove Button. 

When we have &7Module Units&r installed we can hit (\\) to pull up their Configs. Here we can Enable or Disable them, and more!

quests.title: &a&lMekaSuit Helmet
desc:
The &a&lMekaSuit Helmet&r, is obviously the part that goes on your head! You'll need an &dAntimatter Pellet&r, &aPolonium Pellets&r, an &dUltimate Induction Cell&r, and more! 

It serves as an Upgrade to &5Unobtainium Helmets&r. While it has a lot less Armor Points, it works different from &5Unobtainium Helmets&r. 

If the &a&lMekaSuit Helmet&r isn't Charged, it will work with similar stats to a &cNetherite Helmet&r, but here's the fun part! &a&lMekaSuits Helmets&r will block all Damage (but Magic Damage) and use up &aEnergy&r. 

Also when worn, it will display on our HUD: our Cordinates, &aEnergy&r within our &a&lMekaSuit&r, and will replace the Armor Points with an &aEnergy Bar&r. 

We can use the &7&lModification Station&r to give Upgrades to the &a&lMekaSuit Helmet&r, like more &aEnergy&r to take even less Damage! Water Breathing, safety from &aRadiation&r, and even &eSolar Charging&r!

quests.title: &a&lMekaSuit Bodyarmor
desc:
The &a&lMekaSuit &f&mChestplate&r &a&lBodyarmor&r, will be an upgrade to &5Unobtainium &f&mBodyarmor&r &5Chestplate&r. 

It will need a few other &eItems&r in order to upgrade it though, like an &dAntimatter Pellet&r, &aPolonium Pellets&r, and even an &dUltimate Induction Cell&r! 

The &a&lMekaSuit Bodyarmor&r without &aEnergy&r will act just like a &cNetherite Chestplate&r. What about with &aEnergy&r? It might just block all Damage besides Magic Damage and will use &aEnergy&r instead of Health! 

We can toss it into a &7&lModification Station&r in order to add &7Module Units&r which can upgrade it! The &a&lMekaSuit Bodyarmor&r has the most &7Module Units&r of all the Armor, so definitely check them out!

quests.title: &a&lMekaSuit Pants
desc:
You need even fancier Pants? How about we upgrade our &5Unobtainium leggings&r into &a&lMekaSuit Pants&r! 

This will also cost an &dAntimatter Pellet&r, an &dUltimate Induction Cells&r, and a few &aPolonium Pellets&r. 

Is the upgrade worth it? It only has the same Armor stats as &cNetherite Leggings&r?!? And these should be 4 upgrades after &cNetherite&r! 

Yes... it... is! We can Charge the &a&lMekaSuit Pants&r and instead of you taking Damage, the &a&lMekaSuit Pants&r will use up &aEnergy&r! Well all Damage except Magic Damage... 

Then, use it in a &7&lModification Station&r to add &7Module Units&r which mostly upgrade your Movement. Yeah, that can be pretty darn important!

quests.title: &a&lMekaSuit Boots
desc:
Hey, nice Kicks! The &a&lMekaSuit Boots&r are an upgrade to &5Unobtainium Boots&r. 

No, not just &5Unobtainium Boots&r, you'll also need an &dAntimatter Pellet&r, &aPolonium Pellets&r, and an &dUltimate Induction Cell&r! 

Do you really care about the stats of Boots? Who's hitting your Feet! Oh yeah Fall Damage forgot. 

Well if it isn't charged it will protect the same amount as &cNetherite Boots&r... but if it is Charged it will use &aEnergy&r to protect you. 

&7&lModification Station&r is a &5Machine&r we can use to add &7Module Units&r to upgrade our &a&lMekaSuit Parts&r, including &a&lBoots&r. These upgrades are similar to lots of Enchants!

quests.title: Pellet Antimatter
desc:
With 1,000mB of &dAntimatter&r processed through a &5&lChemical Crystallizer&r we can make 1 &dAntimatter Pellet&r. 

That means it takes 1,000,000mB &aPolonium&r or 1MmB &aPolonium&r. 

For all that &aPolonium&r you'll need 5,000,000mB &8Nuclear Waste&r and &2Fissile Fuel&r to make the &8Nuclear Waste&r. Only 5MmB &2Fissile Fuel&r... only! 

But finally, we have it! The most valued &eItem&r in all of &5&lMekanism&r! The &dAntimatter Pellet&r. 

We can now make our MekaSuit, more storage for the &e&lQIO&r, and even the &6&lATM Star&r!

quests.title: &d&lAntiprotonic &5Nucleosynethesizer
desc:
&d&lAntiprotonic &5Nucleosynthesizer&r is a &5Machine&r made from &dAntimatter Pellets&r. 

Of course it also uses &dAntimatter&r as Fuel as well, because it wasn't expensive enough! 

So what does it do? 

With our &dAntimatter&r, &aEnergy&r, and a certain &eItem&r to create a brand new (and usually rare) &eItem&r. Some we can't even Craft! 

Like &5Amethyst&f to &9Echo Shards&f, &eGolden Apple&f to &eEnchanted Golden Apple&r, and even Eggs to the &dDragon Egg&r!

quests.title: &l&7Digital Miner
desc:
The &l&7Digital Miner&r is a 3x2x3... Block? &5Machine&r? 

We all know of Void Miners but come on those are weird! This Mines actual Blocks! 

We can Right Click it to open it's GUI, here we can see a whole bunch! Buttons, Screens, and even Slots! 

Slots are where the Mined &eItems&r will go to. The Screen will tell if it is ready, doesn't have enough &aEnergy&r, or how many Blocks it can Mine. It also has Buttons within the Screen to Auto-Eject, suck up the Blocks it Mines, and even use Silk Touch! 

The Buttons will do everything else! We can use Visuals to see the area that will be Mined. Or even add Upgrades to make it better! 

Start: will tell the &l&7Digital Miner&r to start Mining! It won't work if the &5Machine&r isn't ready. Stop: will tell the &l&7Digital Miner&r to stop Mining. Config: sets Filters, this is important. Reset: is broken. 

Configs left side sets the Working Area for the Mining. How far, high, and low! The right side is for the actual &eItem&r Filter. The Filter is the same as with &e&lQIO&r &eImporters &fand &eExporters&r, check out their Quest to learn how to set those! 

You can also use Inverse Mode to Blacklist the Filters. Plus Replacements which will fill in the Mined Blocks.

quests.title: &bAtomic &cDissambler
desc:
The &bAtomic &cDissambler&r is &5&lMekanism's&r Paxel! 

It can Mine any Blocks an &6AllTheModium Paxel&r can! It can also be used as a Sword... well more like an Axe, there's no Sweeping Edge. 

It has different Modes, each doing different Efficiency and &aEnergy&r usage. We can change it by holding Shift and Scrolling. 

Normal: is default Mode. With an Efficiency of 20 which means just around Efficiency II. 

Slow: is like a Paxel without Efficiency, but will use less &aEnergy&r on use! 

Fast: uses a ton more &aEnergy&r but much faster! Like Efficiency V. 

Off: will not break Blocks, instead it's sole purpose is to KILL!

quests.title: &dMeka-Tool
desc:
The &dMeka-Tool&r is the best Tool &5&lMekanism&r offers, hence the name! 

It can do everything the &bAtomic &cDissambler&r just better! Breaking Blocks wise, with more Damage and Attack Speed. 

Instead of having Modes though, it can use Modification Units! Check out their own Quests. 

Even though it uses the &3Configurator&r to Craft, it doesn't replicate it any way.

quests.title: &a&lRobit
desc:
Meet &a&lRobit&r! He is your new Robotic Companion! 

Place him down onto a &aChargepad&r to set it as his Home! This is important as &a&lRobit&r needs &aEnergy&r to move and work. He can hold 40kFE. 

We can Right Click him to open his GUI (with his permission of course!). In the middle we'll see a Screen that teaches us facts about him: his Name, his &aEnergy&r, his Job, and his Owner! 

On the left we got some Buttons. In order from Top to Bottom: Teleport Home will bring him to his &aChargepad&r, Rename changes his Mob Name, and Appearance is cosmetic &a&lRobit&r stuff! 

Below the &aEnergy Slot&r is Buttons to set his Job. Pickup: will allow &a&lRobit&r to pick up &eItems&r on the ground and put them in his Inventory. Follow: will make &a&lRobit&r either Follow you or stop where he is at. 

To the far right, is even more Buttons! The first, will bring up the main &a&lRobit&r menu. Crafting will open up a Crafting Table within &a&lRobit&r! Inventory will open up &a&lRobit's&r Inventory. Here you can store &eItems&r or where picked up &eItems&r will go. Smelting will use &aEnergy&r to Smelt &eItems&r like a Furnace. Repairing will allow you to combine two &eItems&r to Repair their Durability.

quests.title: &aInduction Ports
desc:
&aInduction Ports&r are how we'll get our &aEnergy&r in and out of our &a&lEnergized Induction Matrix&r. 

Like in what seems to be every single Multiblock, you'll need to place the &aPorts&r within the Walls of the &a&lInduction Matrix&r. 

I don't believe the &aPorts&r have limits besides what the &a&lInduction Matrix&r has, so you won't need more than 2 unless you're taking from different sources!

quests.title: &aInduction Cells
quests.subtitle: Storage
desc:
&aInduction Cells&r are placed within the &a&lEnergized Induction Matrix&r and will increase the amount of storage it has. 

And yes, their totals will stack on each other! 

&aBasic Induction Cell&r: will hold 3.2GFE each. 

&cAdvanced Induction Cells&r: will hold 25.6GFE each. 

&bElite Induction Cell&r: will hold 204.8GFE each. 

&5Ultimate Induction Cell&r: will hold 1.6TFE each.

quests.title: &aInduction Providers
quests.subtitle: Transport
desc:
&aInduction Providers&r are placed within the &a&lEnergized Induction Matrix&r and will increase the amount of &aEnergy&r it can Input and Output. 

And yes, their totals will stack on each other! 

&aBasic Induction Providers&r: will Input and Output 102.4kFE each Tick. 

&cAdvanced Induction Providers&r: will Input and Output 819.2kFE each Tick. 

&bElite Induction Providers&r: will Input and Output 6.55MFE each Tick. 

&5Ultimate Induction Providers&r: will Input and Output 52.41MFE each Tick.

quests.title: &a&lEnergized Induction Matrix
desc:
Technically the smallest (working) &a&lEnergized Induction Matrix&r we can make only has 1 &aInduction Cell &fand &aInduction Provider&r but all are made the same way. 

We'll need to make a frame of &aInduction Casings&r atleast 3x4x3 to 18x18x18. 

The Walls, Ceiling, and Floor can be filled with &aInduction Casing&r, Structural/Reactor Glass, or &aInduction Ports&r. 

The inside of the &a&lInduction Matrix&r will be made of our &aInduction Cells &fand &aProviders&r. 

If we use the 18x18x18 size, we'll have 4,096 Space to place &aCells &fand &aProviders&r. So if we split it in half between the two we can get... a Storage of 3.28QFE and an Input/Output of 107GFE per Tick.
{@pagebreak}
This Multiblock can be made at any size available, not just what is shown through the Images. The Images merely show the smallest size we can make.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_matrix1.png width:100 height:75 align:center}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_matrix2.png width:100 height:90 align:center}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_matrix3.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_matrix4.png width:100 height:110 align:center}

quests.title: &dSPS Ports
desc:
The &d&lSuper-Critical Phase Shifter&r (&d&lS.P.S.&r) will turn our &aPolonium&r into &dAntimatter&r. 

In order to do that, we'll need &aPolonium&r, &aEnergy&r, a place to mix both, and a place to take &dAntimatter&r out! 

So we'll need a &dPort&r for each of those! 
2 &dPorts&r for &aEnergy&r at the sides, 1 &dPort&r for giving the &d&lSPS&r &aPolonium&r, and the last for taking our &dAntimatter&r out.

quests.title: &dSupercharged Coils
desc:
The &d&lSuper-Critical Phase Shifter&r will need a lot of &aEnergy&r. I mean a lot a lot! Hundreds of Millions of FE. 

How do we deliver this much &aEnergy&r though? 

We'll need atleast 1 (recommended 2) &dSupercharged Coils&r! 

The &dSupercharged Coil&r is placed inside the &d&lS.P.S.&r, on an &dSPS Port&r. The &dPort&r will need to feed the &dSupercharged Coil &aEnergy&r. 

Each &dSupercharged Coil&r can send in 400MFE per Tick. And we'll need a whole lotta those for &dAntimatter&r!

quests.title: &d&lSuper-Critical Phase Shifter
quests.subtitle: &d&lSPS
desc:
While being one of the most expensive &5Machines&r in &5&lMekanism&r, it isn't actually that difficult to use! 

First, after Building it, we'll need to Fuel it with &aPolonium&r. &cTube&r some into one of the &dSPS Ports&r because we'll need to charge our &aPolonium&r into &dAntimatter&r! 

To charge it we'll need to Power our &dSupercharged Coils&r! &aCable&r &msome&r massive amounts of &aEnergy&r into the &dSPS Ports&r so they can move it to the &dSupercharged Coils&r. 
Each &dSupercharged Coil&r can only take so much &aEnergy&r so for optimal efficiency use 2! Yes, you can use 1 but come on we need &dAntimatter&r this year not next year! 

Once we've blasted the &aPolonium&r with &menough&r millions of FE we'll get our &dAntimatter&r. Wait this is &cChemical&r &dAntimatter&r?!?! We need...
{@pagebreak}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_sps1.png width:100 height:75 align:center}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_sps2.png width:100 height:90 align:center}

quests.title: Using the &eSun&r to make &aPolonium
quests.title_plain: Using the Sun to make Polonium
desc:
Like the &5&lIsotopic Centrifuge&r, the &e&lSolar Neutron Activator&r is only used for 2 Recipes and 1 of them is with &8Nuclear Waste&r! 

This &5Machine&r will take in the &eSun's&r Rays through the &eSolar Cells&r on top. It will then focus those Rays into one Beam and use it on the &8Nuclear Waste&r. 

This also makes it so it doesn't work at &9Nighttime&r... 

Every 5mB of &8Nuclear Waste&r will become 1mB of &aPolonium&r. 

So you'll need 5,000mB of &2Fissile Fuel&r to make 5,000mB of &8Nuclear Waste&r.

quests.title: &6Hazmat Suit
desc:
The &6Hazmat Suit&r is the only way of preventing &aRadiation&r from killing you. 

You need to wear the entire set to prevent &aRadiation Poisoning&r! 

&aRadiation&r will kill other Mobs and Players near it, the Players can be saved with &6Hazmat Suits&r... but Mobs aren't so lucky!

quests.title: &eQIO Dashboard
desc:
The &e&lQIO Drive Array&r doesn't do much on its own, instead we'll need to add a &eQIO Dashboard&r! 

The &e&lQIO Dashboard&r, like all &eItems &lQIO&r related, needs to be set to the same Network. 

When it is finally ready we can deposit and access &eItems&r into our &e&lQIO System&r. 

We'll start with the most important parts! The Slots in the middle are where &eItems&r can be put, stored, and taken from. We can increase how many Slots are shown with the Buttons on the Left to Increase or Decrease Height. From 2 Rows, to 7. 

Above the Slots is the Search Bar to look up &eItem&r names, Tags, and Mods. Below the Slots is a Sorting option. Whether Items are A to Z or from least to most &eItems&r in a stack. 

The Right Button will make it so either when we open the &eQIO Dashboard&r, our Typing will start at &lEMI&r or the &e&lQIO&r Type Bar. 

Now for another helpful part of the &e&lQIO System&r, Crafting! On the Left we have a Crafting Button! This will bring up, up to 3 Crafting Windows. These each have a 3x3 Crafting Grid we can use. 

The Button below the Crafting Button effects Shift Clicking &eItems&r from our Inventory. Either it will send them to the open Crafting Window, or into the &e&lQIO System&r. 

The last Button is used with &lEMI&r and automatically setting up Recipes. Either the replaced Blocks will be put in your Inventory, or back into the &e&lQIO System&r.

quests.title: &cLaser Focus Matrix
desc:
Another part we'll need to actually start the &c&lFusion Reactor&r is &6Heat&r! We can use either &4Lasers&r or &cPorting &6Heat&r into it. 

We're just going to use &4Lasers&r here. More specifically &4Laser Amplifier&r shooting a certain amount into the &cLaser Focus Matrix&r. 

We'll need a &4Laser Amplifier&r with 1GFE worth of &aEnergy&r to be shot into the &cLaser Focus Matrix&r. It sounds like a lot of &aEnergy&r but don't worry we'll get it back! 

Following the &4Laser Amplifier&r Quest, we'll need to shoot &4Lasers&r into the &4Laser Amplifier&r. But each only gives about 1MFE every few seconds... 

Instead of waiting a year, we can use multiple &4Lasers&r shooting into multiple &4Laser Amplifiers&r that shoot into the one targeting the &cLaser Focus Matrix&r. 

Place the &4Laser Amplifiers&r so that they have another behind each other, while all of them have 4 &4Lasers&r shooting from the other directions!

quests.title: &4Laser Amplifying
desc:
&4Laser Amplifiers&r have their own Internal &aEnergy&r Storage, but they don't charge like most &5Machines&r. 

The way &4Laser Amplifiers&r work is by taking Charge from other &4Lasers&r shooting into them! 

Whether it be other &4Laser Amplifiers&f or &4Lasers&r, that is how they gain &aEnergy&r. 

They will then use that &aEnergy&r into a more focused beam by the Configs you set within its GUI. Delay, Minimum, and Maximum. 

Delay is how many Ticks it will wait after reaching the Minimum &aEergy&r to shoot it. The least amount of Ticks is 0 and the most is 9,999! 

Minimum is the amount of &aEnergy&r it will hold before shooting an even more powerful &4Laser&r! The least FE it will wait for is 800mFE while the most is 2GFE. 

Maximum works similar with how much it will hold before shooting the &4Laser&r.

quests.title: &4Lasers
desc:
You ever see those Tutorials that use Beacons as a &4Laser Security Gate&r. Then, when you try it you get disappointed it doesn't kill people? 

Well &4Lasers&r do just that! 

Trust me, they look like Beacons and they definitely kill! 

Unlike Beacons though, you can't change its Color with Glass. Most likely because they break almost every Block that gets in their way and Voids the drops... 

They also use &aEnergy&r instead of Materials to get powered. 

I don't know the exact amount of Damage they do but they do enough to Fry a Chicken the instant it touches the &4Laser&r!

quests.title: &cDeuterium
quests.subtitle: D
desc:
&cDeuterium&r is actually relatively simple to get! 

First, we need &9Heavy Water&r. &9Heavy Water&r is just like good ol' H2O, just the H is a little different! 

We can use the &9Filter &8Upgrade&r in an &9&lElectric Pump&r (obviously above &9Water&r) to extract &9Heavy Water&r instead of &9Water&r. 

Processing the &9Heavy Water&r through an &9&lElectrolytic Separator&r will give us &bOxygen&r and &cDeuterium&r instead of &7Hydrogen&r. 

Told ya it's simple!

quests.title: &aTritium
quests.subtitle: T
desc:
&aTritium&r is unfortunately not as easy to get as &cDeuterium&r is... 

We'll need a &6&lThermal Evaporation Plant&r. Well... actually 2 of them. 1 to turn &9Water&r into &eBrine&r, the other to turn the &eBrine&r into &6Lithium&r. 

Well... actually &6Liquid Lithium&r, we need &cChemical &6Lithium&r. Use the &c&lRotary &bCondensator&r to turn it from &bLiquid&r to &cChemical&r! 

Then, we can use the &e&lSolar Neutron Activator&r to turn the &6Lithium&r into &aTritium&r.

Harder than &cDeuterium&r, but easier than &2Fissile Fuel&r.

quests.title: &5D-T Fuel&r
desc:
We can combine &cDeuterium&r and &aTritium&r in a &c&lChemical Infuser&r to make our &5D-T Fuel&r. We can also just &cPort&r both the &cChemicals&r into the &c&lFusion Reactor&r and combine them within the &c&lReactor&r. 

If we just &cPort &5D-T Fuel&r it will Inject at the rate it is &cPorted&r into. But if we &cPort&r both &cDeuterium&r and &aTritium&r and combine it within the &c&lReactor&r we can pick any Inject Rate we want! 

We'll also need a little dab of &5D-T Fuel&r within a &eHohlraum&r and put that within the &c&lFusion Reactor&r for the inital start up. 

How do we make a &eHohlraum&r you ask? Just &9Infuse &f4 &eGold Dust&r with 10mb of &0Carbon&r within a &9&lMetallurgic Infuser&r to Craft the &eHohlraum&r. 

Oh wait it comes out empty, throw it into a &5Machine&r that has &5D-T Fuel&r to fill it up. Then, put it within the Slot in the &c&lFusion Reactor's&r GUI, and it is ready!

quests.title: &c&lFusion Reactor
quests.subtitle: Combining 2 Elements into 1
desc:
First, we build. Second, we start up. Third, we use. 

All sides of the &c&lFusion Reactor&r use a 5 Block long Diamond shape. The frame will be made of &cFusion Reactor Casing&r and the inside can be made of Reactor Glass&r. 

The &cFusion Reactor Ports&r can replace any Reactor Glass Block in the Structure (besides where other Blocks are needed) 

The &cLaser Focus Matrix&r will also be placed where Reactor Glass is. Hopefully not to close to other Blocks though! 

The &cFusion Reactor Controller&r, the most important Block, will be placed in the square center of the top layer. 

Don't worry the inside will be hollow... I don't recommend checking if it is when it's on, that'll kill you.
{@pagebreak}

BOOM! It is built! Now how do we get this puppy working? 

First, grab your &eHohlraum&r, which should be filled! And place it within the GUI of the &c&lFusion Reactor&r. 

We can open its GUI by Right Clicking the &cController&r of a fully built one. 

Now along with the filled &eHohlraum&r we'll need to throw some Fuel in! 

Then, we can blast the &4Laser Amplifier&r with atleast 1GFE, into the &cLaser Focus Matrix&r. 

Now it is ready for use!
{@pagebreak}

Most of the use is through the &cController&r. First, we get the main menu. This is just for the &eHohlraum&r slot, and telling you if it is built correctly! 

Next, is the Heat menu. This is for how Hot the &6Temperature&r of the &c&lFusion Reactor&r is. This determines the amount of &aEnergy&r or Steam is created! And is determined by the &4Laser Amplifier&r being shot into it, and if it is cooled. 

We can change the Units of &6Temperature&r or even &aEnergy&r with the bottom Buttons! 

Next menu, is for Fuel! It will show how much &cDeuterium&r, &aTritium&r, and &5D-T Fuel&r is within the &c&lFusion Reactor&r. We can also change the Inject Rate, how much Fuel is used up each Tick. 

Stats menu shows us a lot of fancy numbers! They're only important to nerds so we won't focus on them!
{@pagebreak}
(new page placeholder text)
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_fusion1.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_fusion2.png width:110 height:90 align:center}

quests.title: &9&lTurbine&r Inputs and Outputs
desc:
Our &9&lTurbine&r will need Steam in, &9Water&r out, and &aEnergy&r out. 

But how? 

We can use &9Turbine Ports&r to bring in Steam and take out &aEnergy&r. We'll need to use the &9Turbine Vents&r to take out &9Water&r though! 

Both of these are placed within the Walls of our &9&lTurbines&r.

quests.title: Moving parts
desc:
The way the &9&lTurbine&r works is it takes in Steam via the &9Ports&r and that Steam will move the &9Blades&r on the &9Rotors&r. 

Oh wait I should probably tell you how to create the &9&lTurbine&r insides! 

The &9Rotors&r will be placed from the floor up within the exact center of our &9&lTurbines&r. Each &9Rotor&r can hold 2 &9Blades&r. 

The more &9Blades &fand &9Rotors&r the wider it will get. We won't be able to use 5x5 Base with bigger insides. 

On top of our highest &9Rotor&r we'll place the &9Rotational Complex&r. Trust me it is important!

quests.title: Making &aEnergy&r with a &9&lTurbine&r
desc:
Before we start making &aEnergy&r let's get our Steam all over the place. We can do that by surrounding the &9Rotational Complex&r with &9Pressure Dispersers&r! 

Above that layer we'll need a new layer, this one full of &aElectromagnetic Coils&r. These will be moved because of the &9Rotational Complex&r, them moving with each other is what develops &aEnergy&r through their Magnetic Forces. Same thing happens with Hydroelectric Plants! 

Above the &aElectromagnetic Coils&r we can use &9Saturating Condensers&r which will recycle our Steam back into some &9Water&r! The &9Water&r will be extracted through the &9Vents&r.

quests.title: &9&lTurbine
desc:
The &9&lTurbine&r is atleast a 5x7x5 &5Machine&r but can be expanded to hold more Steam and make more &aEnergy&r! 

The frame of the &9&lTurbine&r is made of &9Turbine Casings&r. The Floor and Ceiling can be filled in with &9Turbine Casings&r or Structural Glass. 

Before we worry about the Walls let's focus on the inside! That's the real Money-maker! 

In the dead center from the Floor is where our &9Rotors&r will be placed. For the smallest one we'll need 2! Then, attach the &9Blades&r on them, 4 in total. 

Above the highest &9Rotor&r place our &9Rotational Complex&r and surround it with &9Pressure Dispersers&r. 

The Layer above the &9Rotational Complex&r will be &aElectromagnetic Coils&r and above them will be our &9Saturating Condensers&r. 

Now we can put our &9Ports&r and &9Vents&r in our Walls and fill the rest with &9Turbine Casings&r or Structural Glass!
{@pagebreak}

Thankfully the &9&lTurbine&r is much easier to use than Build! 

&cTube&r in some Steam through the &9Port&r and it should start spinning. The amount of Steam it can hold is determined by the size of the entire &9&lTurbine&r Build. 

Then the &9Rotors &fand &9Blades&r will start spinning because of the Steam rising through the &9&lTurbine&r. This will move the &9Rotational Complex&r which moves the &aElectromagnetic Coils&r making &aEnergy&r! 

The &aEnergy&r can be &aCabled&r out of our 2nd &9Port&r. The amount of &aEnergy&r is determined on how fast the &9Rotors &fand &9Blades&r are moving. Which itself is determined on how much Steam is Input into the &9&lTurbine&r. 

If we use &9Saturating Condensers&r we'll get a little &9Water&r back from our Steam. We can take this &9Water&r out from the &9Vents&r and back into our &2&lFission Reactor&r! 

We do have a setting within our &9&lTurbine&r GUI which is similar to those within the &9&lElectrolytic Separator&r. We can choose to Dump Excess Steam, to constantly have it working at fastest &aEnergy&r production. We can Dump Steam, incase you want to get rid of it I guess... or Idle which is default! If you use one that isn't Idle, it won't recycle &9Water&r from Steam.
{@pagebreak}
This Multiblock can be made at any size available, not just what is shown through the Images. The Images merely show the smallest size we can make.

quests.title: &6&lThermoelectric Boiler
desc:
The &6&lThermoelectric Boiler&r is built similar to the &2&lFission Reactor&r with the outside shell being just Casings, Glass, and Ports, while the inside is all the important stuff! 

The edges of the &6&lBoiler&r will need to be &6Boiler Casings&r. The Roof and Floor can be made entirely of &6Casings&r or the middle can be made with Glass! 

The Walls are similar, just now including &6Boiler Ports&r. 

The inside is where our &9Pressure Dispersers&r and &6Superheating Elements&r. 
The Roof can be given space between the Ceiling and the &9Pressure Dispersers&r to give more room for Steam. 

We can also give more space below the &9Pressure Dispersers&r and above the &6Superheating Elements&r to give more room for &9Water&r.
{@pagebreak}

The &6&lThermoelectric Boiler&r won't do much on its own, it'll need some &6Ports&r moving our &cChemicals&f and &bFluids&r in to start it up! 

Right now we'll focus on cooling &6Superheated Sodium&r! For that we'll need &6Superheated Sodium&r and &9Water&r within the &6&lBoiler&r. 

Once the &6Superheated Sodium&r is in, the &6&lBoiler's&r &6Temperature&r will start rising. With the &9Water&r the &6&lSuperheated Sodium&r will cool down while the &9Water&r will boil into Steam. 

The higher the &6Temperature&r the quicker &9Water&r will boil and &6Superheated Sodium&r will cool down. If we want/need extra &6Heat&r we can &6Conduct&r some via the &6Thermodynamic Conductors&r. 

We can &6Conduct Heat&r from &6Resistive Heaters&r or even &2&lFission Reactors&r!
{@pagebreak}
This Multiblock can be made at any size available, not just what is shown through the Images. The Images merely show the smallest size we can make.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_boiler1.png width:100 height:75 align:center}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_boiler2.png width:100 height:100 align:center}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_boiler3.png width:110 height:100 align:center}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_boiler4.png width:100 height:110 align:center}

quests.title: &6Boiler Ports
desc:
Our &6&lThermoelectric Boiler&r can be used to get &6Superheated Sodium&r and &9Water&r and recycle it into Sodium and Steam! 

But how do we get our &6Superheated Sodium&r and &9Water&r into the &6&lBoiler&r? 

With &6Boiler Ports&r! We'll need to use a &3Configurator&r on them to change the &6Ports&r configs though. 

Our &6Superheated Sodium&r and &9Water&r will be added in through Input &6Ports&r (separate Input &6Ports&r). 

The cooled down Sodium, will be taken out through an Output &6Port&r. And Steam gets its very own Steam Output &6Port&r!

quests.title: The Thermo part of the &6&lThermoelectric Boiler
quests.title_plain: The Thermo part of the Thermoelectric Boiler
desc:
The inside, and important part, of the &6&lThermoelectric Boiler&r is made of fancy Blocks! 

&6Superheating Elements&r which work in transfering &6Heat&r to &9Water&r and &9Pressure Dispersers&r which will help create the Steam! 

If we use bigger Builds, we can leave room between the different Blocks inside the &6&lBoiler&r to give more storage to Steam and &9Water&r. 

Air between the Top and the &9Pressure Dispersers&r will add to the Steam Storage. Air between the &9Pressure Dispersers&r and the &6Superheating Elements&r will give more room for &9Water&r.

quests.title: &aEnergy &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Everything
desc:
&aEnergy &7Units&r can be used in all the &a&lMekaSuit Parts&r and even the &dMeka-Tool&r. 

We can add 8 of them to each &eItem&r. Each adds more &aEnergy Storage&r to the &eItem&r. 

No, it doesn't increase the &aEnergy&r that is already in it. There's no such thing as Free &aEnergy&r!

quests.title: &cC&6o&el&ao&br &cM&6o&ed&au&bl&ca&6t&ei&ao&bn &7Unit
quests.subtitle: All Armor
desc:
The &cC&6o&el&ao&br &cM&6o&ed&au&bl&ca&6t&ei&ao&bn &7Unit&r will allow you to change the &cC&6o&el&ao&br&r of the &a&lMekaSuit Part&r it is in. 

Just hold the &eItem&r and press (\\) in order to access its Configs. 

How many &cC&6o&el&ao&br&ds&r do we have available? I don't know, how many &cC&6o&el&ao&br&ds&r do we have with the Hex Codes! 

This will only effect that &a&lMekaSuit Part&r though, each &a&lMekaSuit Part&r will need their own &7Units&r.

quests.title: &4Laser Dissipation &7Unit
quests.subtitle: All Armor
desc:
The &4Laser Dissipation &7Units&r will upgrade the &a&lMekaSuit&r. Well each piece of it. 

Instead of quickly killing you when you walk into &4Lasers&r, they won't cause any Damage at all! 

A little bit of the &4Laser&r will actually pass right through you! Not all of it.

quests.title: &aRadiation Shielding &7Unit
quests.subtitle: All Armor
desc:
You know that &aRadiation&r stuff can get pretty deadly! And everyone makes mistakes. 

But the question remains, would you rather wear the stylish but very weak &6Hazmat Suit&r or... the all powerful &a&lMekaSuit&r with &aRadiation Shielding &7Unit&r! 

If all &a&lMekaSuit Parts&r have the &aRadiation Shielding &7Unit&r installed, you'll be able to safely walk around in &aRadiation&r!

quests.title: &eExcavation Escalation &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Meka-Tool
desc:
With this &7Unit&r the &dMeka-Tool&r will Mine Blocks much quicker! 

The more you have, the quicker it goes! 
Just like the Efficiency Enchantment.

quests.title: &4Attack Amplification &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Meka-Tool
desc:
The &dMeka-Tool&r already does more Damage than an &6AllTheModium Sword&r, but why not a little more! 

I can't tell how much more each &7Unit&r gives, but it definitely increases the more you have added. 

Just like Sharpness!

quests.title: &2Farming &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Meka-Tool
desc:
Wait if Paxels can make Paths, make Farmland, and Strip Logs why can't the &dMeka-Tool&r! 

Oh wait, it can if you just use the &2Farming &7Unit&r. 

You'll need to enable which is set in the Configs though. You can't make Soil and Farmland from the same Grass! 

We can't use this one with the &7Shearing Unit&r or &5Teleportation &7Unit&r.

quests.title: &7Shearing Unit
quests.subtitle: Meka-Tool
desc:
This one adds &7Shears&r to our &dMeka-Tool&r! 

We can't use it with the &2Farming &7Unit&r or &5Teleportation &7Unit&r.

quests.title: &bSilk Touch &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Meka-Tool
desc:
The &bSilk Touch &7Unit&r will act as a Silk Touch Enchantment for the &dMeka-Tool&r. 

But not just the Pickaxe part, also the Shovel and other Tools within the &dMeka-Tool&r! 

So you can pick up Stone and Ores plus Grass and Mycelium. 

We can't use this &7Unit&r with the &dOre Refinement &7Unit&r on a &dMeka-Tool&r.

quests.title: &dOre Refinement &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Meka-Tool
desc:
We need lots of Ores for &5&lMekanism&r so why not upgrade our &dMeka-Tool&r to get more! 

&dOre Refinement&r will act like Fortune. When Ores are Mined, there is a chance to get more Drops from them. 

We can't use the &bSilk Touch &7Unit&r with this one though. Either Ore Blocks or Ore Drops, choose 1!

quests.title: &6Blasting &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Meka-Tool
desc:
&6Blasting&r isn't close to &2&lVanilla&r Enchantments, but closer to Modded! 

Once Installed, we can mess with its Configs to change how big of a square of Blocks we can Mine. 

Default is 1x1 aka 1 Block. We can change it to 3x3, 5x5, 7x7, and 9x9. 

Yes, Mining a 9x9 square will take more &aEnergy&r than Mining a single Block.

quests.title: &aVein Mining &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Meka-Tool
desc:
&aVein Mining&r is a limited FTB Ultimine. 

When we Mine Ores or Logs, the same Blocks connected to it will be broken with it. 

Saving lots of time... but we also have FTB Ultimine... so.

quests.title: &5Teleportation &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Meka-Tool
desc:
&5Teleportation &7Unit&r is a pretty unique &7Unit&r. 

With our &dMeka-Tool&r with &5Teleportation&r added we can look at a Block and Right Click to Teleport on to it. 

It uses &aEnergy&r and has a limited range, but don't worry the range is still pretty far! 

This &7Unit&r can't work with the &2Farming &7Unit&r or &7Shearing Unit&r.

quests.title: &9Electrolytic Breathing &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Helmet
desc:
Talking about replacing things (&6Hazmat Suit&r with &aRadiation Shielding &7Unit&r) lets replace the &eScube Gear&r! 

With this &7Module Unit&r added to our &a&lMekaSuit Helmet&r, we will be able to swim &9Underwater&r and breathe! 

If we have a &cJetpack &7Unit&r in our &a&lMekaSuit Bodyarmor&r it will feed it &7Hydrogen&r when in &9Water&r.

quests.title: &bInhalation Purification &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Helmet
desc:
The &bInhalation Purification &7Unit&r actually does a few things. 

1. It will use &aEnergy&r to block out Magic Damage. Like Potions of Instant Harming! 

2. It can be Configured to block Potion Effects based on their level of help or harm. Beneficial, Neutral, and Harmful. 

Beneficial will help the Player in any way. Like Regeneration, Healing, Speed, and Strength. Neutral doesn't do much, like Glowing. Harmful will make the Game harder for the Player. Like Wither, Weakness, or Blindness.

quests.title: &aVision Enhancement &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Helmet
desc:
To all Players who don't cheat by using &aNight Vision&r Resource Packs, this might be helpful! 

This &7Module Unit&r will give you some &aNight Vision&r when you wear the &a&lMekaSuit Helmet&r. 

While yes, lots of &eItems&r make this useless, I'm still going to tell you about it!

quests.title: &dNutritional Injection &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Helmet
desc:
&dNutritional Paste&r is made from processing any &eItem&r that gives Food Bars when eaten through a &d&lNutritional Liquifier&r. 

Think of it like a giant Blender! I can't promise the &dNutritional Paste&r will taste good though... 

The &a&lMekaSuit Helmet&r can hold &dNutrional Paste&r and with this &7Unit&r it will automatically feed you when you lose Hunger Points.

quests.title: &aDosimeter &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Bodyarmor
desc:
The &aDosimeter&r will show how many SVP Units of &aRadiation&r are currently in you. 
Yes, in you. 

Remember you can enable and disable it to clear up room in your HUD!

quests.title: &2Geiger &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Bodyarmor
desc:
The &2Geiger &7Unit&r will work like the &aDosimeter &7Unit&r but instead of &aRadiation&r in you, it's &aRadiation&r around you! 

Just so you can find where it might be hiding. 

You can also enable and disable it!

quests.title: &cJetpack &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Bodyarmor
desc:
The &cJetpack &7Unit&r will act as if you are wearing the &5&lMekanism&r &cJetpack&r and your &a&lMekaSuit Bodyarmor&r. 

The &cJetpack&r uses the same Controls, and will need &7Hydrogen&r as fuel. 

You can fuel it with &7Hydrogen&r in 2 ways. You can place it in a &5Machine&r that has &7Hydrogen&r in it. Or be under &9Water&r while your &a&lMekaSuit Helmet&r has &9&lElectrolytic Breathing&r. 

You won't be able to use this &7Unit&r while you have the &dGravitational Modulating &7Unit&r on.

quests.title: &aCharge Distribution &7Units
quests.subtitle: Bodyarmor
desc:
Instead of each &a&lMekaSuit Part&r having their own individual Charge, they will now share one Charge. 

This is important in keeping every &a&lPart&r Charged. 

And that is important to keeping you alive!

quests.title: &dGravitational Modulating &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Bodyarmor
desc:
Literally just Creative Flight. 

You can't use this with the &cJetpack &7Unit&r and yes it will use &aEnergy&r to Fly! 

Within its Configs you can increase how fast you Fly as well.

quests.title: &7Elytra Unit
quests.subtitle: Bodyarmor
desc:
&7Elytra&r or &a&lMekaSuit Bodyarmor&r... 

&7Elytra&r or &a&lMekaSuit Bodyarmor&r... 

Why not both?

quests.title: &eLocomotive Boosting &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Pants
desc:
Potions are nice but don't you hate that they have time limits? 

No, shut up about the Infusion Pylon! 

With this &7Unit&r you will run faster and jump higher! (But you're still no good at Basketball). 

The more you have, the faster and higher you'll go!

quests.title: Gyroscopic Stabilization &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Pants
desc:
Lots of these &a&lMekaSuit Pants&r &7Units&r work just like Enchantments. 

This one is a 2 for 1! Both Air Affinity and Aqua Affinity. 

You will no longer have a Mining penalty when Swimming or Flying or Falling.

quests.title: &9Hydrostatic Repulsor &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Pants
desc:
Thank you &2&lMinecraft&r for the Update Aquatic, but Swimming can still be very slow. 

So why not speed it up! Just like Depth Strider! 

With the &9Hydrostatic Repulsor &7Unit&r you can Walk and Swim faster in &9Water&r.

quests.title: &8Motorized Servo &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Pants
desc: This one is just Swift Sneaking Enchantment... just a &7Unit&r now!

quests.title: &eHydraulic Propulsion &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Boots
desc:
These &7Units&r will make your Feet and pretty much entire Legs, longer and stronger! 

You can Sprint Jump higher and walk up higher steps. 

You can Jump and step higher with more &7Units&r Installed and you can change the Configs of the &7Unit&r to go even higher!

quests.title: &4Magnetic &9Attraction &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Boots
desc:
The &4Magnetic &9Attraction &7Unit&r works just like a Simple Magnet. When used/worn, it will attract &eItems&r toward you that are out of range. 

The more &4Magnetic &9Attraction &7Units&r the farther &eItems&r can be that will be pulled toward you.

quests.title: &bFrost Walker &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Boots
desc:
It is in the name, but it being a Treasure Enchantment not everyone will know about it. 

When walking over &9Water&r with Boots enchanted with Frost Walker or &a&lMekaSuit Boots&r with the &bFrost Walker &7Units&r the &9Water&r will turn into &bIce&r! 

The &bIce&r won't last forever though, it will thaw out shortly! 

The more Frost Walker, the more &bIce&r!

quests.title: &8Soul Surfer &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Boots
desc:
Usually &8Soul Sand&r will slow you down. Usually... 

With &8Soul Surfer &7Unit&r you will walk normally on &8Soul Sand &fand &8Soil&r. 

With a few more you'll walk even faster on &8Soul Sand &fand &8Soil&r than on other Blocks! 

Hey, maybe &8Soul Sand&r paths aren't a bad idea anymore...

quests.title: &5Gravitational Modulating Additional &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Bodyarmor
desc:
&5Gravitational Modulating Additional &7Unit&r, as you can tell by the name is an upgrade to the &dGravitational Modulating &7Unit&r. 

Both will need to be Installed to use them! 

So what are these Upgrades? Well you will instantly stop when you stop holding your Movement Keys in Flight. You can ascend faster! And even Fly always!

quests.title: &6Geothermal Generator &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Pants
desc:
Wait, so we take less &mDamage&r &aEnergy&r from &6Heat Sources&r and make &aEnergy&r from them? Sign me up! 

When you walk on &6Magma&f, through &6Fire&f, or in &6Lava&r you'll gain &aEnergy&r in your &a&lMekaSuit Pants&r. 

If you have &aCharge Distribution &7Unit&r in your &a&lMekaSuit Bodyarmor&r, it will also Charge the other &a&lMekaSuit Parts&r.

quests.title: &eSolar Recharging &7Unit
quests.subtitle: Helmet
desc:
&eSolar Recharging &7Units&r go into &a&lMekaSuit Helmets&r and will charge the &a&lMekaSuit&r! 

The more you have added, the more FE will be generated. 

Yes, it works just like a normal &eSolar Generator&r... &eDaytime&r and exposed to the &bSky&r!

quests.title: Upgraded, Un-Upgradable &5Machines
desc:
Some &5Machines&r from &5&lMekanism&r can be Upgraded like the &9&lMetallurgic Infuser&r and &d&lEnrichment Chamber&r. Some can't though, these can only take &8Upgrade&r Cards. 
The &6&lATM Devs&r saw this and wanted Players to instead of making 50 &9&lElectrolytic Separators&r they can make 1 Multiblock! 

In order to Craft these Multiblocks though, we'll need a previous Multiblock. The &c&lAutomatic Hepheastus Forge&r. 

It has its own Quest in &aChapter 4&r: &dCreative&r. Check it out there! 

All of the Multiblocks use the same Structure just with different Controllers. Check out the Next Page in order to see Instructions on Building it!
{@pagebreak}

The first layer is the most complicated with it hosting all of the &cMachine Casings&r. The various &cMachine Casings&r will be within the middle while the &9Darkstone Stairs &fand &9Blocks&r and &6Gilded Chiseled Polished Darkstone&r surrounds them.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_multi_runic1.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
The second layer tops off the first with more &9Darkstone Bricks&r and &9Stairs&r. Now it includes &9Darkstone Slabs&r and &7Rune Blocks&r as well!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_multi_runic2.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
Doesn't get more simple than this! Just place &9Darkstone Pillars&r above the 4 outer &7Rune Blocks&r and that's all you have to do!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_multi_runic3.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
I was right, it doesn't get more simple. It just stays the same exact amount of simple! Repeat the previous step.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_multi_runic4.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
To finish, place &bArcane Crystal Blocks&r above the &9Darkstone Pillars&r and a &8Quantum Injector&r above the uncovered &7Rune Block&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/mek/mek_multi_runic5.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
Our &5&lMultiblock Machines&r will need Hatches to work though! To add them, replace the &9Darkstone Bricks&r on the first layer with the Hatches.

quests.title: &dDreaming of &cDemons
desc:
Welcome to &dOccultism&r!

This mod aimes to help the player in many different ways by enlisting the help of &c&mDemons&r &bSpirits&r! Don't worry, most of them are friendly. &oMost&r.

To get started, you'll need to get some &aDemon's Fruit Seeds&r.

quests.title: Little Book o' &cDemons
desc: The &aDictionary Of Spirits&r serves as the Guide Book for &dOccultism&r. You'll absolutely need to make this if you want to continue with the mod!
The Dictionary has a quest-style guide inside of it if you'd rather read it instead of doing these quests!
You'll also need the book to craft several things in the pack, so you kind of have to make it. :)

quests.title: &cDemon Fruit
quests.subtitle: Get Ready for a Trip
desc: &cDemon's Dream Fruit&r is perfectly healthy for you. There might be some side effects you should know about.

When you consume one, you have a chance to get the effect of the &3Third Eye&r, allowing you to see into the &9The Otherworld&r. Certain items in the world might not be what they seem, and you'll need this "vision" to find certain items for progression.
Or you can set it on fire and skip finding most of them. That's up to you.

quests.title: The Flames of &9The Otherworld
desc: What if I told you that the Demon's Fruit is flammable?
Throwing our &cDemon's Dream Fruit&r down and setting it on fire will create &dSpiritfire&r. This is how we'll convert some overworld items into &9Otherworld&r materials.
It's also pretty.

quests.title: &dSpiritfire&r Conversions
desc: Using &dSpiritfire&r, we can convert several Overworld mats into their Otherworld variants. You can also find several Otherworld mats by going under the effects of the &bThird Eye&r and adventuring into the world. You might be surprised what you find. To make it easier, there are crafting recipes for the basic materials by throwing them into &dSpiritfire&r.
&bAndesite&r converts to &3Otherstone&r, which can be used to light a permanent &dSpiritfire&r.

&aOak Saplings&r convert to &9Oak Saplings&r but they are not the same. When grown, these will look exactly like a regular Oak tree. However, under the effects of the &bThird Eye&r, you will be able to harvest the Otherworld variant.
If you have trouble collecting the logs (if they turn into regular Oak Logs even with &bThird Eye&r), try collecting them from the top.
&eDiamonds&r will turn into &dSpirit Attuned Gems&r which are used in several recipes we'll need later on.

quests.title: Preparing for a Ritual: &aCandles
desc:
Demons like Candles. I think.

For almost every Ritual to summon our friends, you'll need some Candles. You can create the &aButcher Knife&r and kill some pigs, cows, sheep, horses, or even the Trader Llamas to get some &aTallow&r to make them. Matter of fact, you should definitely find the Trader Llamas. I hear they make good candles. &mI totally didn't just make that up&r.

Otherwise, Vanilla Candles can also work!

&9Spirit Attuned Crystals&r are also used in several Rituals, so might as well make some now!

quests.title: Preparing for a Ritual: &eChalk
desc:
Before we start enlisting the help of our Demon friends, we will need to create the most important item needed for Rituals: &aChalk&r.

There are several colors of chalk needed, with higher level Rituals requiring several to activate. To start with, &bWhite Chalk&r is the easiest to get.

Start by tossing Otherstone in a furnace, and tossing Otherworld Logs into &dSpiritfire&r. With the items you create, you'll be able to make the Impure White Chalk.

To purify any piece of Chalk, simply throw it into &dSpiritfire&r to cleanse it. Using the Purified Chalk on the ground will draw &mdemonic&r pretty symbols on the ground. These are a pain to remove, unless of course, you make yourself the &aChalk Brush&r. Do it, it's worth it.

quests.title: Preparing for a Ritual: &6Bowls
desc:
What is a Demonic Ritual without a &cSacrifice&r! :D

Most of the time, Demons just like items so don't be too afraid yet. However, if you have a favorite Cow, you might need to be worried. Sorry Betsy.

&aSacrifical Bowls&r are used to place items needed for Rituals. These can be placed anywhere within the Ritual, as long as it isn't convering up any of the required Chalk.

For now, you'll only need four, but later on you'll need upwards of ten bowls for each ritual!

The &6Golden Ritual Bowl&r is used in the middle of the Ritual to activate it, and also usually needs a Book of Binding for the Ritual in it.

quests.title: &bBooks of &dBinding
desc:
For us to specify which &c&mDemon&r &9Friend&r we want to summon, we'll need to make a specific &bBook of Binding&r.

To make this, you'll need to purify some Black Dye in &dSpiritfire&r to get Purified Ink. With this, we're going to make our first Book of Binding which will summon a &aFoliot&r Demon.
Alternatively, you can make an Empty Book of Binding, which can be dyed later to fit whatever tier of ritual you need.

quests.title: &bOur First &dRitual
quests.subtitle: Aviar's Circle
desc: The first type of ritual we'll be performing is the &9Summoning Ritual&r. These rituals are used to summon different types of useful Demons to assist you in crushing, smelting, and more as you get to higher tiers of rituals.
For our first ritual, we want to summon a &aFoliot Crusher&r Demon. This Demon will crush items for us, which is something we'll need to make some of the higher level Chalks!
To start with, combine your Unbound Book with your &aDictionary of Spirits&r in a crafting grid. This will bind a Demon to the Book, which is what we'll need for the ritual.

Speaking about your Dictionary of Spirits, it's time to open it up! On the left, click on the &dPentacles&r tab and click on &bAviar's Circle&r. You might have to advance through it by reading a little bit. There is also a way to click \"Mark All As Read\" so it unlocks everything in the Book.

This is what we're going to use to summon our new friend. On the right side, you can click the eye in the bottom-left corner of the image to build an outline of the ritual for you in the world. This is super helpful!

Once you've completed the multi-block ritual, place down 4 (or more for future rituals) Sacrificial Bowls anywhere within 8 block horizontal radius from the center Sacrificial Bowl and use the required items on them. Once you place your Bound Book in the Golden Sacrificial Bowl, the ritual will start!
This is what the ritual will look like.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/occultism/aviarcirclenew.png width:200 height:200 align:1}

quests.title: &aChalking It Up
desc: Now that we have a Foliot Crusher, we can &muse&r politely ask it to crush down some &eEnd Stone&r, &9Obsidian&r and &7Calcite&r for us. We'll use these to make some new Chalk!

quests.title: &cRed Chalk
quests.subtitle: R.I.P. Betsy
desc: If we want to collect all of the Chalks, we'll need to summon and kill aa not-so friendly &cAfrit&r.
Even though this isn't a &5Possession Ritual&r, you'll need a live sacrifice for this ritual. In this instance, we'll be sacrificing a Cow. Sorry Betsy!

quests.title: &dEmpty Soul Gem
desc: This item is used to capture mobs for transport or storage. It's also needed for the &6ATM Star&r.

quests.title: Tools of the Trade: Spectral Goggles
quests.title_plain: Tools of the Trade: Spectral Goggles
quests.subtitle: Quit eating that fruit!
desc: There are more Otherworld items you will need to gather, and eating &cDemon's Dream Fruit&r every time you need the &7Third Eye&r effect gets annoying.
This is what the &dOtherworld Goggles&r are for! When equipped (even in your Curios slot), it gives the Third Eye effect!

quests.title: &cIesnium: Ore of the Otherworld
desc: The next step in your journey will be to find &eIesnium Ore&r in the Nether.
Without the effects of the &3Third Eye&r, this will look just like Netherrack. Make sure to have your &dOtherworld Goggles&r equipped!

To locate the ore, try using a &aDivination Rod&r. You'll need to attune it to Netherrack first, then hold down right click to use it. After a few seconds, you will see a particle shoot out in the direction of the nearest Iesnium Ore. You can only mine the ore using the &dInfused Pickaxe&r!
Since you can't break this ore down into double the dusts using the standard methods, try using your Foliot Crusher to double your ingots per raw ore!
Note: If you don't see the particle, make sure your particle settings are turned on!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/occultism/iesniumexample.png width:200 height:175 align:1}

quests.title: &aThe Otherworld Pickaxe&r
desc: Once you've gathered a few &aRaw Iesnium Ores&r, you'll probably want to use the first few ingots to make an &dIesnium Pickaxe&r. This not only mines Iesnium like the Infused Pickaxe, but lasts a lot longer too.
