Do yourself a favor and make one of these!

quests.title: &cDemon Mining
desc:
With our ability to harvest &cIesnium&r, we can call upon the Demons to do our bidding in the mines... I mean.... help us gather ores. Definitely not exploiting Demons or anything.

For this, we'll need to create a &dDimensional Mineshaft&r to access the Demon Mining World. You'll also need a Mining Demon confined to a lamp, which you'll place inside of the Mineshaft for it to work. While any tier will complete this quest, higher tiers work faster and have a higher chance at mining Iesnium for you.

The Mineshafts do not auto-export on their own. You will need to extract the items out using either Hoppers, Transporting Demons, or some other method like Item Pipes. It will void any items over its storage limit.

quests.title: &c&mDemonir&r &dMagical Storage&r!
desc: You're bound to have too many items playing this modpack. It's just it works, and if you haven't figured out your storage situation yet, &dDimensional Storage&r might just be right for you!

To get started with this magical storage solution, you'll need to craft the &dDimensional Storage Actuator&r and place it down into the world. This acts just like a Shulker Box, meaning if you break it, it won't lose any of the items stored inside.

By default, this has 128 storage slots with each slot holding up to 16 stacks of an item, except for items with &5NBT&r data. These will not stack and will take up an entire slot, so make sure to leave those items out!
If you aren't sure what items have NBT data on them, you can always check out the quest "NBT and You" in the Storage questline for more info on NBT!

quests.title: &aUpgrading Our Magical Storage
desc: To upgrade the amount of stacks your magical storage can hold, you'll need to make &dStorage Stabilizers&r.
Once made, these must point directly at the Dimensional Matrix part of your Storage Actuator, not the base. These can be up to 5 blocks away, but must have a clear line of sight to the Matrix.

Whenever you want to upgrade to a higher tier Stabilizer, breaking it won't destroy the items inside. However, you will not be able to add any more items to your storage until it is either replaced or upgraded.
Below is an example of a simple setup!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/occultism/storageupgradeexample.png width:200 height:150 align:1}

quests.title: Tools of the Trade: Divination Rod
quests.title_plain: Tools of the Trade: Divination Rod
quests.subtitle: Hunting for &dOtherworld&r Materials
desc: While you can get most of the &dOtherworld&r materials using Spiritfire, you can also use &9Divination Rods&r to locate these materials.

First, you'll need to attune the Rod to the material you are looking for. For example, if you are on the hunt for &8Otherstone&r, you can use the Rod on &aAndesite&r to help locate the Otherstone in the world.
Once attuned to a material, you can hold right click with the Rod in hand, and a particle will shoot off in the direction of the nearest material it is attuned to.
You will still need to be under the effects of the &3Third Eye&r to be able to harvest the Otherworld block.

quests.title: &aRemote Access
desc: Want to access your storage remotely? This can be done with either the &eStable Wormhole&r or the &aStorage Accessor&r.
To use the &eStable Wormhole&r, shift-click a &dStorage Actuator&r to link it. You can then place the Wormhole to act as another storage location.
The &aStorage Accessor&r is linked in the same way, but acts as a wireless remote that can even work across dimensions!

quests.title: &dFamiliars
desc: Occultism provides more than just Demons to crush your ores!
There are Demons that can move stuff for you, chop down wood, and more!!
There are also ways to summon cool friends known as &dFamiliars&r that give special buffs and even fight for you! Make sure to check out the &dFamiliar Rituals&r in your guide book!

quests.title: Quest 6CCDEEDA
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks. 

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission. 

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &eEziveus' Spectral Compulsion
quests.subtitle: Put some Demon Dust on it!
desc: Our next step is a foray into &6Infusion Rituals&r. These rituals are used to imbue items with the magic of demons.
The first tier of &6Infusion Rituals&r is &eEziveus' Spectral Compulsion&r. We'll be using this ritual to create several items that you'll need throughout this mod.
It is recommended to create this ritual in a separate area from your first one, because the three main types of rituals build off each previous tier.

quests.title: Tools of the Trade: Butcher's Knife
quests.title_plain: Tools of the Trade: Butcher's Knife
quests.subtitle: Hack and slash!

quests.title: &aLime Chalk
desc: The first and most important item to make using Eziveus' Spectral Compulsion is the Research Fragment Dust. This is used in combination with some crushed Emeralds to create Lime Chalk!

quests.title: &aIhagan's Enthrallment
quests.subtitle: Who you gonna call?
desc: With Lime Chalk, it's time to delve into &5Possesion Rituals&r. These rituals are slightly different from the others because they all require a live sacrifice, usually small mobs such as Chickens, Bees, Bats, etc. However, as rituals get more complicated, they will require larger and larger sacrifices.
Even if you've placed all of the items needed and the Book of Binding into the Golden Sacrificial Bowl, the Ritual will not begin until you kill the sacrifice on top of the runes.
It is recommended that you make some sort of mob capture item such as an Empty Soul Gem, Jar, Mob Imprisonment Tool, or Quantum Catcher!

The first tier of &5Possession rituals&r is &eHeidryn's Lure&r, which is only used to get mundane items like Skeleton Skulls and End Stone. Because of this, you can skip straight to the second tier of ritual, &aIhagan's Enthrallment&r.

quests.title: &6Orange Chalk
desc: Using &aIhagan's Enthrallment&r, you can sacrifice an Allay, Bat, Bee, or Parrot to summon a &6Possessed Bee&r. Upon defeating one, it will drop Cursed Honey, the main ingredient for making Orange Chalk!

quests.title: &6Abras' Open Conjure
quests.subtitle: Hot Demons!
desc: No, not that kind.
&cAfrit Demons&r are Demons of &cFire&r. They are more advanced Demons, which some are friends and some are... not. It all depends on how strongly the ritual can control the &cAfrit&r.
Because we don't have access to Red Chalk yet, all we can summon is an &9Unbound&r Demon, meaning it cannot be controlled and will be violent.

quests.title: &aStrigeor's Higher Binding
quests.subtitle: The "Everything" Ritual
desc: Strigeor's Higher Binding is the second tier of &6Infusion Rituals&r. It's used for many different things, but the main things we'll need are the Infused Pickaxe and Gray Paste.

quests.title: &8Gray Chalk
desc: Using &aStrigeor's Higher Binding&r, you can create Gray Paste. Smear this on a piece of Impure White Chalk to create Gray Chalk.

quests.title: &2Green Chalk
desc: Using &eEziveus' Spectral Compulsion&r, we can imbue a myriad of different nature blocks to form some &2Nature Paste&r. Combine this Paste with some Impure White Chalk to create Green Chalk.

quests.title: Tools of the Trade: Infused Pickaxe
quests.title_plain: Tools of the Trade: Infused Pickaxe
desc: Most of the items we've needed from the &3Otherworld&r so far just needed some Spiritfire. However, we will need to use the help of the &3Third Eye&r to find the Ore of the &3Otherworld&r.
We'll also need a special pickaxe to be able to mine it. For this, we'll need to Infuse a Demon into a &dSpirit Attuned Pickaxe Head&r to create a pickaxe that can break this new kind of ore.

quests.title: Tools of the Trade: Ritual Satchel
quests.title_plain: Tools of the Trade: Ritual Satchel
quests.subtitle: Pocket Ritual!
desc: Tired of lugging around Chalks, Candles, Skulls, and Crystals? Just make a Ritual Satchel!
By sneak + right-clicking with the Ritual Satchel in your hand, you can fill it with all the materials you need to draw a ritual circle.
Once you've loaded up the Satchel, simply right-click any preview block to begin (slowly) automatically placing all the runes for the selected ritual.
If a piece of chalk inside the bag falls under 40% durability, the enchantment glint on this item will dissapear to signal that it may be time to repair or replace some of your Chalks.

quests.title: Chalk Repair
quests.subtitle: You break it, &mwe&r Demons fix it!
desc: If you haven't noticed already, making and re-making rituals over and over again is very taxing on the durability of your Chalks.
If you're worried about your Chalk breaking, but don't feel like doing the entire ritual to create a new chalk over again, then this ritual is for you!
Using the power of a &aDijinni&r, you can repair any color of Chalk to it's maximum!
Alternatively, you could use something like the &aEternal Stella&r from the Forbidden Arcanus mod to permenantly preserve your Chalks!

quests.title: &cSevira's Permanent Confinement
quests.subtitle: The "Even More Everything" Ritual
desc: &cSevira's Permanent Confinement&r is the third tier of &6Infusion Rituals&r. It's mainly used to create the next level of foundation Chalk, Black Chalk.
It's also used to create a couple of items that can speed up ritual making and performing by a significant amount.

quests.title: Black Chalk
desc: Using &cSevira's Permanent Confinement&r, we can combine several different Wither materials and some Netherite to create three Witherite Dust. With these, we can create ourselfs the highest form of Foundation Chalk, Black Chalk.

quests.title: Tools of the Trade: Artisanal Ritual Satchel
quests.title_plain: Tools of the Trade: Artisanal Ritual Satchel
desc: The Ritual Satchel is nice, but it takes a long time to place all the blocks. Now that you can perform the &cSevira's Permenant Confinement&r ritual, you can create the Artisanal Ritual Satchel!

The Artisanal Ritual Satchel functions nearly identically to the regular Ritual Satchel, except it instantly places all the nessecary items for the ritual, and has the added ability to right-click on Golden Bowl to erase all the Chalk Runes and collect all the other items (Skulls, Candles, and Crystals) and return them to the Satchel.
No, it doesn't restore the durability of the Chalk.

quests.title: Repairing Items
quests.subtitle: Free(ish) durability!
desc: Similar to the Chalk Repairing function of &aStrigeor's Higher Binding&r, &cSevira's Permanent Confinement&r can be used to repair items using the power of an Afrit Demon.
This ritual can repair just about anything, so &eDemon Miners&r, tools, and armor can all be restored to their original durability!
All items that are repaired using this ritual retain their original properties (affixes, enchantments, etc), so don't worry about your precious enchantments!

quests.title: &6Odus' Open Convocation
quests.subtitle: How... Fleshy...
desc: &6Odus' Open Convocation&r is used to bring an &cAfrit&r demon into a Pig. Because this ritual is performed without the use of Red Chalk, it's only powerful enough to summon an &9unbound&r demon.
In particular, this ritual will create an &cAfrit&r-possessed Zombified Piglin, which will drop some Demonic Meat, which is used to craft Pink Chalk
&4WARNING: YOU MAY HAVE TO DO THIS ONE MULTIPLE TIMES TO GET ENOUGH DEMONIC MEAT.

quests.title: &dPink Chalk
desc: After fighting through a few Demon Possessed Zombified Piglins summoned by &6Odus' Open Convocation&r, you can use the Demonic Meat dropped by them to craft some Pink Chalk.

quests.title: &dOsorin's Unbound Calling
quests.subtitle: For the less trial-chamber-inclined of us
desc: &dOsorin's Unbound Calling&r is the second tier of &dDemon-less rituals&r. The first tier isn't useful for progression at all, it's only used for reviving Familiars and turning Vexes into Allays.
This ritual is used to create a ton of rare-ish blocks, items, and materials that you might not be able to (or it's hard to) get otherwise.

quests.title: &4Abras' Fortified Conjure
quests.subtitle: Is it a Bird? Is it a Plane? No, it's an unbound &9Marid&r!
desc: Don't worry, this is the last of the Abras series of rituals. It is used to summon a &9Marid&r demon, but even though it uses Red Chalk, it's not powerful enough to &9bind&r the Demon. This means that, unfortunately, you're going to have to fight it.

This ritual uses a Trident as a sacrifice, which is confusing because most sacrifices are living creatures. So instead of killing a mob on top of the completed ritual circle, you simply throw the Trident at the center bowl to start the ritual.

quests.title: &9Blue Chalk
desc: After you've successfully slain the &9Unbound Marid&r Demon that you summoned with &4Abras' Fortified Conjure&r, you can use the &9Marid Essence&r that it drops to craft the "highest" colored Chalk, Blue Chalk.

quests.title: &9Fatma's Incentivized Attraction
quests.subtitle: Maximum Summon
desc: That first &eFoliot Crusher&r was cool, but what if I told you that you could summon a demon that gives you 6 dusts per raw ore it crushes?
The &9Marid Crusher&r does exactly that. To summon one, you'll need to use &9Fatma's Incentivized Attraction&r.

quests.title: &9Xeovrenth Adjure
quests.subtitle: Maximum Possession
desc: &9Xeovrenth Adjure&r is the maximum tier of &5Possession Rituals&r. It only has two uses: creating Cruelty Essence, the main ingredient in Brown Chalk, and creating an Iesnium Golem, which is basically just an Iron Golem that's immortal and does more damage.

quests.title: &9Uphyxes' Inverted Tower
quests.subtitle: Maximum Infusion
desc: &9Uphyxes' Inverted Tower&r is the maximum tier of &6Infusion Rituals&r. It doesn't have as many uses as the other three tiers, but it's still nessecary for the "endgame" of Occultism.
Mainly, it's used to create Dragonyst Dust, which is the main ingredient for Magenta Chalk.

quests.title: &bLight Blue Chalk
desc: After using &9Fatma's Incentivized Attraction&r to summon a &9Marid Crusher&r, you can turn Ice, Packed Ice, and Blue Ice into their crushed forms, and use these to create Light Blue Chalk.

quests.title: &#AD00C8Magenta Chalk
desc: To create Dragonyst Dust, you'll need to perform &9Uphyxes' Inverted Tower&r. However, to create Magenta Chalk, you'll also need some materials that you can only get through the &9Marid Crusher&r.

quests.title: &3Cyan Chalk
desc: With your freshly summoned &9Marid Crusher&r, you can break down an Echo Shard and an Iesnium Ingot, which when combined with a Glow Ink Sac creates Cyan Chalk.

quests.title: &#4E2C00Brown Chalk
desc: After slaying the Goat of Mercy summoned from &9Xeovrenth Adjure&r, you'll find yourself one Cruelty Essence richer. Combine this with some Cocao Beans to create Brown Chalk.

quests.title: &dRonaza's Contact
quests.subtitle: With this sacred treasure I summon...
desc: Once you've gathered every single colored Chalk and Foundation Chalk, you can perform the second &dDemon-less&r type ritual, &dRonaza's Contact&r. This is the ultimate ritual, using everything you've learned so far!
It has limited uses, but everything created with this ritual is super powerful!

quests.title: &zRainbow&r Chalk
desc: Grab your chalks, draw your &dRonaza's Contact&r ritual, and get ready to create the ULTIMATE CHALK*!
Instead of having to lug around a full set of 16 chalks, you can use the Rainbow Chalk to paint a color-changing Rune that counts as any of them!
&8*Does not include Foundation Chalk. Make the Void Chalk to include those&r

quests.title: Chalk Void
desc: An "upgrade" to the Rainbow Chalk, for those who don't like the rapid color-switching runes ruining their tediously crafted aesthetic.
Has the same function as the Rainbow Chalk, except all the runes will show up as white. Additionally, it works for foundation chalk as well.

quests.title: Iesnium Anvil
desc: Arguably the most useful item that you can create in Occultism, the &bIesnium Anvil&r is a super-powerful version of the Vanilla Anvil.
Created using &9Uphyxes' Inverted Tower&r, it:
- Is unbreakable.
- Increases the maximum level of all enchants for anything combined on it by one level.
- Costs half as much xp as the estimate says (rounded down, so if it says 25, it'll cost 12).
- Has a smaller experience requirement increase for repeated edits on the same item.
- Increases the maximum xp level at which you can edit items (the point at which it says "Too Expensive!").

quests.title: Iesnium Ritual Bowl
quests.subtitle: Super-speed Rituals!
desc: As you've probably noticed, rituals tend to be... a little slow. But not anymore! Using &cSevira's Permanent Confinement&r, you can create the &bIesnium Ritual Bowl&r.
When using this in place of a Golden Ritual Bowl, it greatly reduces how long it takes to perform a ritual, taking it down to one fourth of its original time!

quests.title: Trinity Gem
desc: Using &dRonaza's Contact&r, you can upgrade your Soul Gem to create a Trinity Gem. It's basically just a beefed up version of the Soul Gem that can capture larger enemies, although it still can't contain most bosses.

quests.title: Eldritch Chalice
desc: With &dRonaza's Contact&r, you can upgrade your &bIesnium Ritual Bowl&r to the Eldritch Chalice. When used in a ritual, reduces the time it takes to complete... entirely.
Yes, the Eldritch Chalice makes it so that all rituals complete instantly!

quests.title: What's Next?
desc: Now that you've come this far, you may be asking yourself, what's next? Well, there are so many more things to explore in Occultism!

You can see a comprehensive list of every single ritual and item in your &6Dictionary of Spirits&r, you could try going through all the rituals' outcomes to see if you can find something that piques your interest!
If you haven't already, you could lay out and decorate three separate ritual areas, one for Summons, one for Possessions, and one for Infusions.
There's always new ways to use each and every seemingly mundane feature to maximize your experience with the modpack. Happy ritual crafting!

quests.title: The Basics of Rituals
desc: This is the main source of information on &dRituals&r. Here's the basics:
&lTiers of Rituals&r:

Rituals have (basically) four tiers based on how powerful the Demon that you're invoking is. The first tier is &eFoliot&r, then &aDijini&r, &cAfrit&r, and &9Marid&r. Some rituals fall into in-between tiers, such as the &6Unbound Afrit&r tier.
T&lypes of Rituals&r:

There are five main types of rituals, but we'll only need four for progression. The main three are &9Summoning Rituals&r, &5Possession Rituals&r, and &6Infusion Rituals&r. Each one will be explained the first time that they appear in these quests. The fourth type of ritual is a sort of &dDemon-less&r &dRitual&r, meaning that it uses bits and pieces from all three types to preform a special action without the direct usage of a Demon.
The fifth type, &eFamiliar Rituals&r, are not needed for progression. But they can still be summon some useful friends to help you out!
&lChalks&r:
There are two types of Chalks: Foundation Chalks, and Colored Chalks.
Foundation chalks are used in every single ritual, and each tier higher gets a shade darker, starting with White Chalk and ending with Black Chalk.
Colored Chalks are the most commonly used, but the color of the Chalk doesn't directly corelate to its power the same as Foundation Chalks.

quests.title: &aOphyx' Calling
quests.subtitle: An alternate path for light blue
desc: Don't want to get a &9Marid Crusher&r for &bLight Blue Chalk&r? Then you can settle for a &aDjinni Crusher&r instead. &aOphyx' Calling&r is used for summoning &aDjinnis&r. This includes a Demonic Wife/Husband. &aDjinnis&r are able to crush ores more efficiently than Foliots, but not as efficiently as &cAfrits&r or &9Marids&r. They're also capable of crushing ice without melting it.

quests.title: Welcome to the &2&lUndergarden&r!
desc:
The &2&lUndergarden&r Dimension is full of diverse and disgusting Biomes full of plenty of Vegetation, Mobs: friendly and unfriendly, and of course Ores and Items. 

Hope you're ready for a fight!

quests.title: Catacombs
desc:
Catacombs are massive underground structures made of Depthrock Bricks. They might have a part sticking out of the ground you can find. 

Within the huge maze lies &7Forgottens&r, hidden Chests, and the boss: &aForgotten Guardian&r. 

Hope you're prepared for it!

quests.title: Gronglegrowth
desc:
My favorite Biome by far! 

A giant Green Jungle with huge Gronglegrowth Trees. 

On those Trees you can find &eGronglets&r!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_grongle.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &eGronglets&r
desc:
&eGronglets&r are technically Blocks not Mobs. But I love them too much to not include them! 

They spawn on Grongle Trees and emit Noise and Light! Definitely perfect for decoration.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_gronglet.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Ancient Sea
desc:
Ancient Seas are wide open Seas in the &2&lUndergarden&r. 

Somehow even with the amount of pollutants the Water is safe to drink. 

The Water also holds &bGwibs&r and &bGwiblings&r. And can't forget Glitterkelp!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_ancient.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Glitterkelp
desc:
Glitterkelp grows in Ancient and Icy Seas. 

They don't do much but Glow and can be crafted into Pie!

quests.title: Wigglewood Forest
desc:
Wigglewood Forests are forests like all others. 

Just these Trees like to go as they please.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_wiggle.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Forgotten Fields
desc:
Forgotten Fields are the Plains of the &2&lUndergarden&r. 

They don't have Trees but they have plenty of Rocks, Flowers, and Mobs! 

They do not spawn &7Forgottens&r though, yeah sorry to ruin your enthusiasm.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_field.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Veil Mushroom Bog
desc:
I promise this is the last Mushroom Bog! 
These Mushrooms look pretty normal, their gimmick though is what comes from them! 

The Veils! Definitely a useful decoration Block.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_veil.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &cRotling&r
desc:
The smallest and weakest of the &cRot Mobs&r. 

These have 5 Hearts. 

Like all &cRot Mobs&r they will target &2Stoneborns&r and &7Forgottens&r and will drop &cUtheric Shards&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_rotling.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &cRotwalker&r
desc:
The medium sized &cRot Mob&r, the &cRotwalker&r. 

They have 20 Hearts. 

Like all &cRot Mobs&r they will target &2Stoneborns&r and &7Forgottens&r and will drop &cUtheric Shards&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_rotwalker.png width:100 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: &cRotbeast&r
desc:
The largest and most dangerous &cRot Mob&r. 

They have 80 Hearts, which I think qualifies as a Miniboss. 

Like all &cRot Mobs&r they will target &2Stoneborns&r and &7Forgottens&r and will drop &cUtheric Shards&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_rotbeast.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &4Muncher&r
desc:
&4Munchers&r are similar to any other Hostile Mobs in the &2&lUndergarden&r, but this ones drops makes it much more useful! 

The Muncher can drop &7Cloggrum&r and &bFroststeel Nuggets&r on death.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_muncher.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &2Stoneborn&r
desc:
&2Stoneborns&r are the perfect mix of Villagers and Iron Golems. 

You can trade with them by Right Clicking them. 

And they will fight off Hostile Mobs (or Players who hit them).
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_stoneborn.png width:100 height:150 align:center}

quests.title: &5Gloomper&r
desc:
&5Gloompers&r are technically Passive but they have a defense mechanism against you so I consider them Neutral! 

When hit they will drop an Effect similar to a Lingering Potion. 

On death they will drop their Legs (which are very tasty) and possibly Leather. 

They can also be bred with Gloomgourds!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_gloomper.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &dNargoyle&r
desc:
&dNargoyles&r are nasty and hostile Mobs that spawn underground. 

They have 7 and a half Hearts and will relentlessly try to kill you. 

They drop nothing and just serve as an obstacle for those trying to peacefully mine.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_nargoyle.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &7Scintling&r
desc:
&7Scintlings&r are little innocent Slugs found everywhere in the &2&lUndergarden&r. 

They act like Snow Golems as in they leave a trail wherever they walk. Just this one is more Gooey... 

On death they drop Scintling Goo, but you can just farm it from their trails, so why kill them!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_scintling.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &9Sploogie&r
desc:
&9Sploogies&r can rarely spawn but when they do they are destined to annoy you. 

They will shoot spit at you (and make disgusting sucking noises) but if you hit them they will run away; similar to a baby Piglin. 

They only drop Depthrock Pebbles on death.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_sploogie.png width:125 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &bGwibling&r
desc:
&bGwiblings&r are friendly fish in the Seas. 

They are smaller than &bGwibs&r and act like Vanilla Fish!

quests.title: &bGwib&r
desc:
&bGwibs&r are larger and angrier versions of &bGwiblings&r. 

They don't have any Drops nor can they be placed in Buckets. All they offer is pain!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_gwib.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &2Mog&r
desc:
Is that rock moving? Oh wait that isn't a rock, it's a &2Mog&r! 

&2Mogs&r can be bred together with Depthrock Pebbles and on death might drop more Pebbles or Mogmoss! 

Mogmoss can be used in many different recipes!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_mog.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &3S'Mog&r
desc:
Is that Smogvent moving? No wait it's just a &3S'Mog&r! The close cousin of the &2Mog&r! 

They act exactly like &2Mogs&r just these might drop Blue Mogmoss.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_smog.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &7Forgotten&r
desc:
&7Forgottens&r are warriors that spawn within the Catacomb Structure. 

They wear Ancient Armor and hold Cloggrum Tools, all which can be dropped upon death. 

They will also target and kill &cRot Mobs&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_forgotten.png width:100 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: &aForgotten Guardian&r
desc:
The &aForgotten Guardian&r is a massive Golem made of &aForgotten Ingots&r. 

It'll target the Player and will do whatever needed to kill them. 

They have 80 Hearts and if you can kill them they will drop &aForgotten Nuggets&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_guardian.png width:100 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: &cUtheric&r
desc: &cUtherium&r can either be Mined or dropped from &cRot Mobs&r.

quests.title: &eRegalium&r
desc:
&eRegalium&r is the Emerald equivalent in &2&lUndergarden&r. 

It can't be made into Armor or Tools but it can be used to trade with &2Stoneborns&r for other Items.

quests.title: &aForgotten&r
desc:
&aForgotten Ingots&r need to be obtained through the Catacombs; whether it be looting the Chests or killing the &aForgotten Guardian&r. 

You'll also need a Smithing Template which is found in Catacomb Chests.

quests.title: &bFroststeel&r
desc:
Froststeel spawns in the Frozen Biomes: Frostfields, Frosty Smogstem Forests, and probably Icey Seas. 

It spawns in Shiverstone which replaces Depthrock in these Biomes. The Shiverstone will act similar to Ice as in it is slippery and slows you down a little. 

You might also find some Nuggets in Munchers bellies!

quests.title: &7Cloggrum&r
desc:
&7Cloggrum&r is the Iron of the &2&lUndergarden&r. 

It is found everywhere and is used in a dozen different recipes. 

Heck even some Mobs drop it!

quests.title: &7Cloggrum&r Armor
desc:
&7Cloggrum&r has stats a little worse than Iron Armor, but it pratically grows on Trees so I think that's fair. 

The Boots also help with going through Scintling Goo!

quests.title: &7Cloggrum&r Tools
desc:
&7Cloggrum&r Tools act just like Iron Tools, these just look more like Mud than Iron does! 

The Sword does more damage than an Iron Sword though.

quests.title: &7Cloggrum&r Weapons
desc:
Normal Tools just won't suffice especially when handling the dangerous Mobs in the &2&lUndergarden&r. 

We can craft the &7Cloggrum Shield&r which acts like a normal Shield. 

But we will need to get the &7Battleaxe&r as a rare drop from &7Forgottens&r.

quests.title: &bFroststeel&r Armor
desc:
&bFroststeel&r Armor is slightly worse than Diamond Armor but it also gives big Knockback Resistance. 

It also gives Speed debuff though, looks like we ain't moving much!

quests.title: &bFroststeel&r Tools
desc:
Similar to Iron Tools just all of these slow down whoever is hit by them. 

Well besides the Hoe, but do you really care about a simple hoe?

quests.title: &cUtherium&r Armor
desc:
&cUtherium Armor&r has same stats as Netherite Armor! 

Without needing a Smithing Template!

quests.title: &cUtheric&r Tools
desc:
&cUtherium&r Tools are similar to Diamond Tools but the weapons are more effective to &cRot Mobs&r! 

You use what they make to do more damage to them! There's probably a dozen of pop culture references I can make with that but I can't think of any...

quests.title: &aForgotten&r Tools
desc:
Upgrade &7Cloggrum&r Tools with &aForgotten Ingots&r and a Smithing Template. 

These are the best Tools you can get, they come with Efficiency on them already just for &2&lUndergarden&r Blocks. 

And the Sword and Axe will deal more damage to all &2&lUndergarden&r Mobs but the &cRot Beast&r and &aForgotten Guardian&r!

quests.title: Ultimate Weapon!
desc: Upgrade your &7Cloggrum Battleaxe&r to make the greatest weapon &2&lUndergarden&r can give!

quests.title: &aForgotten Minions&r
desc:
&aForgotten Minions&r aren't spawned like normal Mobs, they need to be created. They are created by placing a Carved Gloomgourd over a &aBlock of Forgotten Ingots&r. 

They act similar to Snow Golems, they won't ever attack you and instead shoot at Hostile Mobs. 

They have 10 Hearts and don't drop anything on death... but like why would you kill them?
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_minion.png width:125 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Barren Abyss
desc:
The Barren Abyss is as the name suggests, barren... It holds nothing but Hostile Mobs and Pebbles. 

Personally I'd rather find Pebbles anywhere else...
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_barren.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Blood Mushroom Bog
desc:
The Blood Mushroom Bog is home to the giant Blood Mushrooms. 

Blood makes me uneasy so I think I'll keep this description short.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_blood.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Dead Sea
desc:
Picture the Ancient Sea. Okay now remove all Kelp from it and remove all &bGwibs&r and &bGwiblings&r. 

That is the Dead Sea for you!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_dead.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Dense Forest
desc:
Some people hate exploring many different Biomes to get all the different Tree Saplings. 

Clearly the &2&lUndergarden&r Dev did, so he put most of them in the Dense Forest!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_dense.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Frostfields
desc:
Frostfields are one of the cold Biomes in the &2&lUndergarden&r. You can tell it is cold by the massive icesicles, Powdered Snow, and Frozen Deepturf! 

Also here instead of the usual Depthrock underground you will find Shiverstone. 

Shiverstone acts more like Ice than real Stone. Well atleast when standing on it!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_frosty.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Frosty Smogstem Forest
desc:
Near Frostfields you may find Frosty Smogstem Forests. 

These are just like Frostfields just with Smogstem Trees!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_frostytrees.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Icy Sea
desc: Another Sea, just this one is much colder.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_icey.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Indigo Mushroom Bog
desc:
Indigo Mushroom Bog is much more filled Bog than the Blood Mushroom Bog. 

Of course it has Indigo Mushrooms but also Mini Smogstem Trees and ponds of Virulent Mix. I wonder what it does...
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_indigo.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Ink Mushroom Bog
desc:
A purple Bog! 

These have Ink Mushrooms and Virulent Mix all over!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_ink.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Smog Spires
desc:
The Smog Spires are... yep you guessed it! Where all the Smog comes from! Well not all, we can't discredit the &2Mogs&r and &3S'mogs&r. 

Here you will find Blisterberries, Coarse Deepsoil, and Smog Vents. I wouldn't recommend going near them though...
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_smogspires.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Smogstem Forest
desc:
Smogstem Forest is a neighboring Biome to Indigo Mushroom Bogs. 

Of course it is also Blue and has Indigo Mushrooms in it! Just has bigger Smogstem Trees!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_smogstem.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Wigglewood Sapling
desc:
I'm pretty sure the only definition of what a Wigglewood Tree is that it has Wigglewood Logs and Leaves. They seem to grow in any direction, size, and shape. 

You can find them in Wigglewood Forests and Dense Forests. 

They have pretty pink Leaves and brown Logs similar to Spruce!

quests.title: Veil Mushroom
desc:
Veiled Mushrooms can only be found in their Bog. 

They have Brown Caps which if there is Air below it, it will spawn Mushroom Veils. Hence the name!

quests.title: Smogstem Sapling
desc:
Smogstem Trees are much thicker on their bottom halves, similar to Baobab Trees in real life! 

They have Blue Leaves with Grey Logs. 
You can find them in multiple Biomes: Smogstem Forests, Dense Forests, and even in Indigo Mushroom Bogs!

quests.title: Blisterberry
desc:
Blisterberries spawn in Smog Spires. 

Because they grow in such a disgusting area some will come Rotten. 

I don't recommend eating those, maybe they can be useful for something else!

quests.title: Ink Mushroom
desc: Yes they can make Black Dye!

quests.title: Indigo Mushroom
desc: Indigo Mushrooms are apparently bestfriends with Smogstem and will spawn mainly with them!

quests.title: Grongle Sapling
desc:
Grongle Trees are tall Jungle like Trees that only spawn in Gronglegrowth Biomes! 

These Trees are also where &eGronglets&r spawn on.

quests.title: Gloomgourd
desc:
Gloomgourds spawn and farm like Pumpkins. 

Also like Pumpkins they can be made into Pie or even Jack-O-Lanterns! 

Unlike Pumpkins they can be made into explosives...

quests.title: Underbeans
desc:
Eat em raw, roast them, put them on a Stick. 

What can't you do with Underbeans!

quests.title: Droopvine Item
desc:
Droopfruit can spawn pretty much in any Biome just look up! 

They spawn on the roof of most Biomes and will grow similar to Glowberries.

quests.title: Ancient Armor
desc:
Ancient Armor is what's worn by &7Forgottens&r, and is where you can get it from. 

There isn't any Ancient Boots though, apparently &7Forgottens&r don't have feet.

quests.title: The Undergarden
quests.subtitle: Making the Portal
desc:
Getting to the &2&lUndergarden&r is similar to getting to &c&lThe Nether&r. You'll need to craft a Portal. 

It is the same shape and size as Nether Portals but instead of Obsidian you'll need a varient of Stone Bricks. Stone Bricks, Mossy Stone Bricks, or Deepslate Bricks. 

Once formed, you can activate it by using the Catalyst on it.

quests.title: &2Dweller&r
desc:
&2Dwellers&r are the Cows of &2&lUndergarden&r. 
They are Passive and will drop Leather and Dweller Meat on death. 

Thank God they can't be milked, I don't want any milk these &2Dwellers&r make.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_dweller.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &eBrutes&r
desc:
&eBrutes&r spawn in a few Biomes and are Neutral. 

If hit, all in the area will attack you. Similar to Wolves or Zombified Piglins. 

On death they might drop their Tusks, which can act as a replacement for Bones!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/undergarden/undergarden_brute.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Slingshot
desc:
Slingshot is a very fun weapon added by &2&lUndergarden&r. It has 4 Ammo that can be shot: 

Scintling Goo can be fired and when it hits a Mob it'll give them the Gooey Effect. 

Depthrocks are just normal projectiles. 

Rotten Blisterberries will blow up on impact. 

And &eGronglets&r don't do any damage they just make noise and get shot!

quests.title: Explosives!!!
desc:
Rotten Blisterberries can't be thrown but when made into Blisterbombs they can be! 

You can even go farther and make Boomgourds which will act like TNT that throws Blisterberries everywhere.

quests.title: Blood Mushroom
desc:
Blood Mushrooms can be found within their Bogs. 

They are shaped like Dark Oak Trees and are mostly White with only some blocks having Blood spots on them!

quests.title: Quest 4C7E0065
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: Spinning into gems
quests.subtitle: Centrifuging a clump gives me gems....?
desc: Now you have the &eclumps&r, using a fluid addon on a centrifuge will allow you to input &aSulphuric Acid&r into it. When &eclumps&r are processed with this acid, you will get gems.
Alternatively, you can use &9Water&r for a lower yield.
&l&o&nNote&r
Currently, some recipes are broken which output dusts or nuggets.

quests.title: Desalination Plant
desc:
&bSalt&r is important for Incubating &eAlchemical Sulfurs&r! 

To get &bSalt&r we'll need to cook some Items. Different Items make different &bSalts&r though. The &bSalts&r have different Tiers with them going higher the rarer they are. 

To cook the &bSalt&r out we need to put the Items into the Oven and use a Heat source to Heat it. Then take the &bSalt&r out of the Oven!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/theurgy/theurgy_oven.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &bStrata Salt
desc:
&bStrata&r is the first and most basic crafted from regular blocks like Stone or Sand or Obsidian. 

You can use 5 &bStrata Salt&r to craft &bMineral Salt&r.

quests.title: &bMineral Salt
desc:
&bMineral Salts&r are made from... well Minerals. 

Everything Mined in some form of Ore can be made into &bSalt&r. Raw Ores, Ingots, Gems, all become &bMineral Salt&r! 

Even Unobtainium can be made into &bSalt&r! Just please don't, there's so many better alternatives.

quests.title: &bPlant Salt
desc:
All gifts from Mother Nature... can be mercilessly burned down in an Oven to nothing but &bSalt&r! 

Logs, Leaves, and Crops can get Toasted into &bPlant Salts&r.

quests.title: &bCreature Salt
desc:
Currently this can only be crafted from cooking 2 &bPlant Salts&r into 1 &bCreature Salt&r. 

Hopefully in newer updates we can kill more living creatures for &bSalt&r!

quests.title: Making &dSal Ammoniac
desc:
We'll need these two Blocks to make &dSal Ammoniac&r (felt like calling it a Multi-block but I don't consider 2 Blocks a Multi-Block). A &dSal Ammoniac&r Tank on the bottom with a &dSal Ammoniac Accumulator&r on top of it. 

The &dSal Ammoniac Accumulator&r is where &9Water&r and &dCrystals&r will go; it can hold 10,000mb of &9Water&r or 10 Buckets, and a stack of &dSal Ammoniac Crystals&r. The Tank will hold the created &dSal Ammoniac&r and can hold 2,000mb or 2 Buckets.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/theurgy/theurgy_sal_front.png width:100 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: Why Machines?
quests.subtitle: Why do we need Machines if we can just Mine it?
desc:
You can Mine &dSal Ammoniac Crystals&r in the &2Overworld&r but it isn't that easy. We'll still need &9Water&r and the Machines to make &dSal Ammoniac&r to make &eAlchemical Sulfur&r. 

The &dCrystals&r are optional but help a ton; with just Water 1000mb will be turned into 100mb of &dSal Ammoniac&r. With 1000mb of &9Water&r and a &dSal Ammoniac Crystal&r we'll instead get 1000mb of &dSal Ammoniac&r. 

10 times the production with only a single Item more!

quests.title: &dSal Ammoniac
desc:
&dSal Ammoniac&r is a critical part of &eAlchemical Sulfur&r which is what we will use to make and reproduce Items. 

To get &dSal Ammoniac&r we'll need some &9Water&r.

quests.title: Making &eAlchemical Sulfur
desc:
Now we finally get to the Meat of the Mod, &eAlchemical Sulfurs&r! 

To make them we'll need a Liquefaction Cauldron, an Item, &dSal Ammoniac&r, and a Heater. 

Heat is explained in another Quest but you'll need either the Pyromantic Brazier or the Caloric Flux Emitter beneath the Cauldron to Heat it. 

Then the Liquid &dSal Ammoniac&r in it. 

And finally the Item you want to be turned into an &eAlchemical Sulfur&r. 

You'll know it's working when it's bubbling.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/theurgy/theurgy_lique.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Man you're Hot!
quests.subtitle: Man you're Hot!
desc:
Some Machines in &l&6Theurgy&r need Heat to get started! Except &l&6Theurgy&r is very jealous with how their Machines get Heat, you can only use these two Machines as Heat sources. 

(The Machines that use Heat are: Liquefaction Cauldron, Calcination Oven, &cMercury&r Distiller, and Incubator.)

quests.title: Furnace like Heat
desc: Very simple Heat Source. Place under the Machine and feed it Furnace Fuel: Coal, Logs, Dried Kelp Blocks.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/theurgy/theurgy_brazier.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Wireless Heat
quests.subtitle: How?
desc:
Don't you hate when you have all this power but no Heating? 

Now you can change that with the Caloric Flux Emitter! Shift Right Click with it to bind it to a Machine. Then place it down and power it to send Heat. 

Can't be set to multiple Machines!

quests.title: Making &cMercury
desc:
&cMercury&r is one of the most important materials for &l&6Theurgy&r! 

To get it we'll need to distill some in the &cMercury&r Distiller. Put Items into the Distiller, and give it some Heat! 

Some Items give more &cMercury&r like Diamonds which will give 10 &cMercury&r for 1 Diamond, compared to Stone which needs 10 Stone for 1 &cMercury&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/theurgy/theurgy_distiller.png width:100 height:150 align:center}

quests.title: Mercury
quests.subtitle: Venus... no &cMercury&r!
desc:
Don't eat it! 

&cMercury&r can be used for 3 different things: Incubation, Power Creation, and Logistics!

quests.title: Divination Rods
desc:
Divination Rods are our Tools we use to contact the spirits to find certain Items. 

First, you'll need to select the Block or Item by either Shift Right Clicking it with the Rod, or crafting the Rod with its &eAlchemical Sulfur&r!

By holding them and holding Right Click the Rod will look for a selected Item. It will make a noise and the Rod will light up for how close the Block or Item is. 

If close enough an orb might appear showing you the way to the Item.

quests.title: &l&6Theurgy
desc:
&l&6Theurgy&r is the art of using Magic for Alchemy! Or in our sense using Machines and Items to make more or different Items! 

Lot's of the Machines that we need for &l&6Theurgy&r needs Copper so start there!

quests.title: Incubator
desc:
Now this is a Multiblock Machine! 

To get Items back from &eAlchemical Sulfur&r we'll need to Incubate them. This requires The Incubator with all 3 Vessels adjacent to it. The order doesn't matter just as long as they are touching the bottom half. 

Once it has all the Items in the Vessels and Heat it will start Incubating your Items! You'll know it's working when Smoke particles come out from it.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/theurgy/theurgy_incubator.png width:200 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: &cMercury&r Vessel
desc:
Like a Thermometer these hold &cMercury&r! 

Either &cMercury Crystals&r or &cShards&r it holds &cMercury&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/theurgy/theurgy_vessel_1.png width:100 height:125 align:center}

quests.title: &bSalt&r Vessel
desc:
This is where the &bSalt&r will be held. 

The type of &bSalt&r does matter for what you will try and Incubate. If you want to make Unobtainium you'll need &bMineral Salt&r, if you want Wheat you'll need &bPlant Salt&r, and so on.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/theurgy/theurgy_vessel_2.png width:100 height:125 align:center}

quests.title: &eSulfur&r Vessel
desc:
This is where you will put the &eAlchemical Sulfur&r into it. 

Whatever Item is in the &eAlchemical Sulfur&r will be turned back into that Item from Incubation!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/theurgy/theurgy_vessel_3.png width:100 height:125 align:center}

quests.title: Step 1: Source Pedestal
desc:
Reformation is changing one &eAlchemical Sulfur&r into another or using &3Alchemical Niter&r to turn into more! 

First step is the Source Pedestal, this is where you put the &eSulfur&r that you want to be changed into another.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/theurgy/theurgy_reform_1.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Step 2: Target Pedestal
desc:
The second step is the Target Pedestal. This is where you put the &eSulfur&r that you want the first one to be made into. 

Or where you put the &3Alchemical Niter&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/theurgy/theurgy_reform_2.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Step 3: Result Pedestal
desc: The third step is where the newly changed &eSulfur&r will go, Result Pedestal. Once it's reformed it will go here.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/theurgy/theurgy_reform_3.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Step 4: Powering it
desc:
Reformation takes Mercury Flux to work! You'll need to Shift Right Click all 3 Pedestals with the Sulfuric Flux Emitter to set them. Then place down the Emitter and feed it power.

After that it should be ready to Reform!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/theurgy/theurgy_reform_setup.png width:200 height:50 align:center}

quests.title: Divination Rod T1
desc:
The cheapest Divination Rod, the Glass Divination Rod. 

It can find all Ores that a Stone Pickaxe can mine. So Copper, Coal, and Iron. Nothing higher.

quests.title: Divination Rod T2
desc: The Iron Divination Rod is a slight bit higher, being able to find Ores that an Iron Pickaxe can mine! So Diamonds, Redstone, and Gold.

quests.title: Divination Rod T3
desc: All &2Vanilla&r Ores can be found with the Diamond Divination Rod. Being able to find all plus Netherite!

quests.title: Divination Rod T4
desc: Of course &2Vanilla&r isn't our max, there's much more and much rarer in Modded!

quests.title: Making Power with &cMercury
desc:
Put &cMercury&r in, 
Take Power out. 

MF stands for &cMercury&r Flux not Metal Face or a vulgar phrase to call someone!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/theurgy/theurgy_mercuryflux.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Fermentation Vat
desc:
&nFermentation&r: 
The chemical process by which molecules such as glucose are broken down anaerobically. 

AKA &9Water&r and time change thing! 

To use the Fermentation Vat put the Items and Fluid into the Vat then Shift Right Click to close it. 

After awhile it should ferment! This is how we turn &eAlchemical Sulfur&r into &3Alchemical Niter&r which can be turned into more Items!

quests.title: Digestion Vat
desc:
Digestion (very crude form of processing) is how we change &3Alchemical Niters&r to different forms. 

First we'll need Purified Gold which can be made from putting Gold, &bAlchemical Salt&r, and &9Water&r into the Digestion Vat and Shift Right Click to close it like the Fermentation Vat. 

Then we can either combine 4 of one &3Alchemical Niter&r with Purified Gold and &dSal Ammoniac&r to get a higher Tier or do the reverse for a lower Tier.

quests.title: Logistics with &cMercury&r
desc:
&l&6Theurgy&r has Machines so of course it needs Logistics!

(Check out the Basic Logistics Page to learn more about logistics).

With &cMercury&r you can move Items and Fluids from place to place using &cMercury Wires&r and other Items! Wires are what will actually move the Items.

quests.title: Item Movement
desc:
You can transfer Items using &cMercury&r. 
Attach an Item Extrator to where you want Items to be taken from. Then attach the Item Inserter to where you want Items to go. Connect both with &cMercury Wires&r and the Items should start moving! 

This can be used with &l&6Theurgy&r Machines for automation!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/theurgy/theurgy_item.png width:200 height:75 align:center}

quests.title: Fluid Movement
desc:
You can also move Fluids from one Tank to another with &cMercury&r. 

Attach Fluid Extrator from where you want the Fluid to be taken from, like a Sink. Then put the Fluid Inserter on where you want the Fluid to go, like a &dSal Ammoniac&r Accumulator. Attach both with Wires and it should be moving!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/theurgy/theurgy_fluid.png width:200 height:75 align:center}

quests.title: Wires go here, Wires go there
quests.title_plain: Wires go here, Wires go there
desc:
If you need Wires to go either farther or connect to more places, you might need a Connector Node. 

Simple as that!

quests.title: List Filter
desc:
With Logistics we need Filtering. There's two different Filters: List and Attribute. 
List Filter you add Items into it and change whether it's whitelist or blacklist, and whether it respects NBT Data or not. 

Attribute Filter takes a reference Item then Filters off a selected Attribute. This includes tags and other things like whether it can be used as Furnace Fuel or can be pathwayed!

quests.title: Of course there's a Wrench
quests.subtitle: I thought this was a magic mod...
desc:
&l&6Theurgy's&r Wrench is the &cMercurial&r Wand. You can Shift and Scroll to change its Modes. 

You can Enable/Disable to basically stop Wires from transferring. 

You can change the side of where Items will Extract or Insert to. 

And you can change the Frequency Channel!

quests.title: Easier Fermenting
desc:
If you want to be cheap with Fermenting Recipes then Fermentation Starter is perfect for you. 

Very cheap replacement for other Items in Fermenting.

quests.title: Sulfur Attuned Divination Rod Abundant
desc:
The first special crafted Divination Rod is the Abundant Material Rod! 

When you craft the Rod with an &eAlchemical Sulfur&r of an Item, the Rod will be attuned to that Item. 

You can see the list for Abundant Materials in the Tags, it's too big for me to read off in Quests.

quests.title: Sulfur Attuned Divination Rod Common
desc:
Common Materials are a step higher and rarer than Abundant. These are mostly Ingots and rarer Mob Drops like Ender Pearls or Rabbit Hide. 

Again you can see the whole list in Tags.

quests.title: Sulfur Attuned Divination Rod Rare
desc: Now we're getting to the fun stuff! The Rare items even go up the Elytra! Yeah I would think it's better than Rare but I didn't make this sorting.

quests.title: Sulfur Attuned Divination Rod Precious
desc: The best of the best. From Diamonds, to the Nether Star, to Allthemodium. This Rod finds only the best Items!

quests.title: Amethyst Divination Rod
desc:
This one's unique!

Instead of finding Ores it will find Budding Amethyst blocks!

No more struggling to find Geodes for you good sir!

quests.title: &eAlchemical Sulfurs
desc:
&eAlchemical Sulfurs&r can be made from practically anything and can be made into practically anything! 

There's a few different groups of Items in &eAlchemical Sulfurs&r which might be explained more in another Quest. 

There's 3 different paths you can take with processing &eAlchemical Sulfurs&r. 1. Fermentation and Digestion for making Niter. 2. Incubation for making those Items again and 3. Changing the Item with Reformation.

quests.title: Quest 41ABC09C
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks. 

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission. 

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &lXyCraft
desc:
&lWelcome to XyCraft!&r

This series of mods is mostly dedicated to XyCraft: World and Machines!
World gives us the Gems which can be found while mining.

quests.title: &bBlue Xychorium Gems
quests.subtitle: The B in Roy G. Biv

quests.title: &cRed Xychorium Gems
quests.subtitle: The R in Roy G. Biv

quests.title: &l&7Kivi
desc:
Kivi can be used for a couple of things, mainly for decorations and machines.

You'll need Kivi for Machine Frames and other machines in XyCraft. It can be used with Xychorium Gems in a Stonecutter for decorative blocks.

quests.title: Machine Base
desc: Reinforce the Kivi with Aluminum and you'll get Machine Frames which are needed to craft machines.

quests.title: &cIgnition Plate
desc:
The &cIgnition Plate&r spawns fire infront of it when given a Redstone Signal.

It will put out the fire when the Signal is stopped.

quests.title: &2Accelerated Planter
desc:
The &2Accelerated Planter&r works similar to normal Farmland but with some changes.

It's automatIically watered and it's faster than normal Farmland.

quests.title: &9Water Block
quests.subtitle: Water but Solid, Ice?
desc:
The &9Water Block&r acts as Water without the whole moving part.

Cobble Gens can be made with them, Farmland can be watered with it, you just can't MLG clutch with it. (Fish will also try to get into it but will still die).

quests.title: &fLight Field
desc:
The Light Field doesn't show much light, but it does work like a Mega Torch.

Mobs won't spawn in a set area around it. That area is about a 32 block radius.

quests.title: &8Fluid Void
desc:
The &8Fluid Void&r is a block that stops all water connected to it.

Source blocks or flowing water, anything within a 1 block radius is gone.

quests.title: Extractor
quests.subtitle: Farming for Rocks! (and More)
desc:
The Extrator will "grow" the block or item beneath it and move it to an inventory above it.

This can be used for a Cobblestone generator that works with many types of stone, an Amethyst generator, or even a Dragon Egg generator, along with others!

quests.title: Stake
quests.subtitle: Up!
desc:
The Balloon on a Stick is an early and restrictive source of Creative Flight.

Place down the stick and you'll be attached to a balloon! Double touch space to start Flying just not too far. Go too far and you'll get detached and fall.

quests.title: &6Item Storage and Manipulation
desc: XyCraft has some item storage and manipulation. Not as much as fluid storage and manipulation though!

quests.title: &bFluid Storage and Manipulation
desc: XyCraft has a great Fluid Tank mulitblock!

quests.title: Void Container
desc: The Void Container makes any inventory a Trash Can. Put it on top of the inventory and no more items!

quests.title: Soaryn Box
desc:
The Soaryn Box (Soaryn being the author of XyCraft) is the chest of XyCraft.

It will not hold items off breaking the block! I wonder what those squares on it do?

quests.title: Fabricator
quests.subtitle: Auto-Crafter
desc:
Fabricator is the Auto-Crafter. It will take items from the inventory below and make a set recipe.

You can lock recipes with CTRL Click. It will need to pipe out the created items though.

quests.title: Item IOs
quests.subtitle: Where Items come and go
desc: Item IOs give us the ability to transport items in and out of the Tank. They can be toggled for Output and Input.

quests.title: Valves
quests.subtitle: Where Fluid comes and goes
desc: The Valve is the Heart of your Tank. This is where you'll pump, or pipe fluids into it.

quests.title: &lThe Tank
desc:
Now it's time to make the Tank! First off you need Building Blocks and at least 1 Valve. Glass and Item IOs are optional.

The Tank must be made of a frame of building blocks. Building blocks are anything that isn't transparent, gravity influenced, or natural Dirt or Grass.

Items like stone, wood, or metal must make the frame and the edges. Glass, Valves, and Item IOs must be placed in the walls and the inside must be hollow.

It can only be 13x13x13 big. Once you done all that, right click the Valve and it will either say 'Formed' or will tell you the problem.

quests.title: Collector
desc:
The Collector works as a very cheap Absorption Hopper.

It will pick up all items within a 3 block radius and put it in the inventory below or it's own. It can be turned off with Redstone!

quests.title: Pipes
desc:
To get liquids into the Tank you'll need some sort of Pipes.

The Hydro Pump can automatically put Water into them at a slow rate, but also for free!

quests.title: Kivi Automation
desc: Kivi Seeds can be used to grow Kivi Essence which can be crafted in Kivi!

quests.title: Quest 16B4A009
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks.

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission.

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: PneumaticCraft: Repressurized
quests.subtitle: The Power of Air
desc:
PneumaticCraft is all about Pressure! These quests won't go over everything the mod has, but will still go over a lot! Please remember to check JEI, read the tooltips and read the PCB:R, they are all very useful.

To get started, you'll need to craft some &3Compressed Iron Ingots&r! The easiest way to do this is to make a hole in the ground, throw in some iron ingots (or blocks) and then blow it up with some TNT!

Some might get lost in the explosion, but that's a risk we'll have to take!

quests.title: Reinforced Stone
quests.subtitle: You'll need a lot of this
desc: One of the most important materials you'll be needing is &3Reinforced Stone&r, start by making 32 using Compressed Iron and some regular stone.

quests.title: Compressed Iron Armor
quests.subtitle: Great Knockback Resistance
desc:
Compressed Iron can be used to craft &3Compressed Iron Armor&r, it's the same as Iron Armor but with better Armor Toughness and Knockback Resistance.

The armor can be crafted or can be found commonly in loot chests.

quests.title: Smart Filter
quests.subtitle: Tired of blowing stuff up?
desc:
Is that even possible?

If you wish to automate this process you can use &eProductive Bees&r or &aMystical Agriculture&r. Or I guess you could automate it, with...explosions.

quests.title: Moving Pressure
quests.subtitle: What Pressure?
desc: To move pressure you will need to obtain &3Pressure Tubes&r. What pressure you may be asking? Continue the questline to see what these are used for.

quests.title: Quest 7B200897
quests.subtitle: What happened to RF or FE?
desc: When making pressure in an Air Compressor, if you don't have anywhere for the pressure to go. it will just disappear. Make sure you have somewhere for the pressure to go before making some.

quests.title: The Pressure Chamber
quests.subtitle: Pressurizing!
desc:
The &3Pressure Chamber&r is an important multiblock structure made up of &3Pressure Chamber Walls&r (The faces can be replaced with &3Pressure Chamber Glass&r). The Pressure Chamber can be as small as a 3x3x3 multiblock, or as big as a 5x5x5 multiblock. The blocks required for the 5x5x5 is what's needed to complete this quest.

To use the Pressure Chamber you will need to pipe pressure into a &3Pressure Chamber Valve&r using the &3Pressure Tubes&r you made earlier, remember to put a Security Upgrade into the Pressure Valve. &lDifferent recipes require different amounts of pressure&r.

You'll need to be able to input and output items to and from the Pressure Chamber, this is where &3Pressure Chamber Interfaces&r come into it. Blue on the outside means it's for importing items, while if gold is on the outside it's for outputing items, place one of each on any face.

quests.title: Preventing Explosions?
quests.subtitle: If only there was an easy Solution...
desc:
Did I forget to mention everything can blow up? ...

Luckily there's an easy solution! The &3Security Upgrade&r when placed in a machine makes sure they don't explode, put these into any machines they can go into.

quests.title: Generating Pressure
quests.subtitle: Feeling the Pressure
desc: The &3Air Compressor&r is an easy way of making pressure, simply put some burnable items into it, and watch the magic happen! (I recommend making at least 3 of these to start off with).

quests.title: Pneumatic Wrench
quests.subtitle: Torque-ing about Tools!
desc: The &3Pneumatic Wrench&r is used to move around or break your machines and tubes.

quests.title: Small Tank
quests.subtitle: 32,000mb
desc:
These can be used in recipes using the bucketed version of PneumaticCraft liquids.

When a &3Fluid Tank&r is put on top of another &3Fluid Tank&r and wrenched together they become one big tank.
{image:pneumaticcraft:textures/patchouli/small_tanks.png width:250 height:250 align:center fit:true}

quests.title: Charging Station
quests.subtitle: Where's the cord?
desc: The &3Charging Station&r is used to charge various tools and gadgets in &aPneumaticCraft&r using pressure.

quests.title: Omnidirectional Hopper
quests.subtitle: A configurable hopper
desc: Thie &3Omnidirectional Hopper&r can input items from any side, plus it can be upgraded to be way faster than a regular Hopper! Nice for when Pipes aren't needed.

quests.title: Liquid Hopper
quests.subtitle: Who needs pipes?
desc: The &3Liquid Hopper&r is a Hopper, but for liquids. Not a replacement for pipes.

quests.title: Transfer Gadget
quests.subtitle: Smaller Hopper
desc: The &3Transfer Gadget&r acts like a Hopper that can be placed inbetween blocks.

quests.title: Manometer
quests.subtitle: I need more Info!
desc: The &3Manometer&r is used to show extra information about a machine.

quests.title: Camo Applicator
quests.subtitle: Want to make your setup look cool?
desc: The &3Camouflage Applicator&r can be used to hide PneumaticCraft machinery inside of other blocks.

quests.title: Crude Oil
quests.subtitle: The Path to Plastic
desc: The next stage of the mod requires the collection of &3Crude Oil&r. This Oil can be found naturally on the surface of the overworld.

quests.title: Gas Lift
quests.subtitle: Drilling for Oil
desc: Although you can find Crude Oil on the surface, drilling is a great way to obtain a bunch of oil. First use a &3Seismic Sensor&r until you find oil underneath you, then use your &3Gas Lift&r filled with drill pipes to drill for oil. (This requires pressure to work).
{image:pneumaticcraft:textures/patchouli/oil_pumping.png width:200 height:200 align:right fit:true}

quests.title: Oil Refinery
quests.subtitle: Now we're getting somewhere
desc: The &3Oil Refinery&r we'll be making is a 1x1x5 multiblock made up of 1 &3Refinery Controller&r (at the bottom) and four &3Refinery Outputs&r (on top). You will need to input Oil and heat for this to work. This will produce Diesel, Kerosene, Gasoline and LPG. Putting &3Thermal Laggings&r on the sides helps keep it warm.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/pneumaticcraft/oil_refinery.png width:300 height:150 align:center}

quests.title: Speed Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Speedy!
desc: Makes things faster.

quests.title: Heat Production
quests.subtitle: Still not RF...
desc: The &3Vortex Tube&r seperates pressure into hot and cold air. The cold air goes to the blue side and the hot air goes to the red side.

quests.title: Better Heat Production
quests.subtitle: More Heat
desc: To increase your heat production, place a &3Heat Sink&r on the cold side of your Vortex Tube.

quests.title: Moving Heat
quests.subtitle: We have the heat to move :)
desc: To move the heat being made by the Vortex Tube, make some &3Heat Pipes&r.

quests.title: Security Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Secure!
desc: Prevents things from exploding.

quests.title: Diesel
quests.subtitle: Poor Sel
desc: &3Diesel&r can be used to make more Kerosene or to make Lubricant.

quests.title: Kerosene
quests.subtitle: Have you Kero-seen this?
desc: &3Kerosene&r can be used to make Gasoline or it can be used as fuel in a Kerosene Lamp.

quests.title: Gasoline
quests.subtitle: Gas, gas, gas
desc: &3Gasoline&r can be used to make LPG.

quests.title: LPG
quests.subtitle: The one we need
desc: &3LPG&r can be used to make Molten Plastic.

quests.title: Kerosene Lamp
quests.subtitle: Mega Torches are nothing!
desc: The &3Kerosene Lamp&r is a great light source that uses fuel (Kerosene being the best) to produce light.

quests.title: Thermopneumatic Processing
quests.subtitle: The longer the name, the better
desc: The &3Thermopneumatic Processing Plant&r will be used to make Molten Plastic, simply pump in some LPG, Coal and some heat.

quests.title: &fPlastic
quests.subtitle: Finally!
desc: Place your Liquid Plastic onto the ground or store some in a Chest with a Heat Frame attached and there's your &3Plastic Sheet&r!

quests.title: Empty Pcb
quests.subtitle: The path to PCBs
desc: Now that we have plastic, the next step is getting some finished PCBs, first make some &3Empty PCBs&r in the Pressure Chamber.

quests.title: Upgrade Matrix
quests.subtitle: Saving Lapis
desc: Only use 1 Lapis for an Upgrade instead of 4.

quests.title: Amadron
quests.subtitle: I wonder if they have 1 day delivery?
desc: We will need to order some stuff off of &3Amadron&r using the &3Amadron Tablet&r in order to continue progression. To use it, shift-right click a Chest and a Fluid tank, put your currency in a linked container (Emeralds, etc) and order something. You'll see an Amadrone come down to take your money and another Amadrone come to drop off what you ordered.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/pneumaticcraft/amadron_drone.png width:300 height:150 align:center}

quests.title: &9PCB Blueprint
quests.subtitle: Thanks Amadron!
desc: &3PCB Blueprints&r ON SALE NOW for 8 Emeralds. (Only for a limited time).
{@pagebreak}
(new page placeholder text)

quests.title: Charging with UVs
quests.subtitle: I hope you have some Sunglasses!
desc: Place your Empty PCBs in a &3UV Light Box&r to charge them. Needs pressure and access to sunlight.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/pneumaticcraft/uv_charging.png width:300 height:150 align:center}

quests.title: Dispenser Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Gone!
desc: Makes things able to dispense items.

quests.title: Range Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Come Closer!
desc: Increases range, does different things when used in different things.

quests.title: Volume Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Turn it up!
desc: Increases how much pressure things can hold.

quests.title: Simple Upgrades
quests.subtitle: Very useful stuff
desc: Below are some &3Upgrades&r you can use early on in this mod. Shift while hovering over an &3Upgrade&r to see what it can be used in, or shift while hovering over something to see what upgrades it can use.
Note: The subtitle will tell you the max amount of that &3Upgrade&r that can be put in something.

quests.title: Etching Tank
quests.subtitle: It's Etching Time!
desc: The next step of making PCBs involves using the &3Etching Tank&r with Etching Acid. Requires heat to run.

quests.title: Etching Acid Bucket
quests.subtitle: Don't Ask...
desc: &3Etching Acid&r is made in the Pressure Chamber with Molten Plastic...and some other stuff. Used in the Etching Tank.

quests.title: Unassembled Pcb
quests.subtitle: Almost there!
desc: Put a Charged Empty PCB into the Etching Tank with some Etching Acid and some heat and you'll get an &3Unassembled PCBs&r.

quests.title: Printed Circuit Board
quests.subtitle: You did it!
desc: Craft together your Unassmbled PCB with 2 Capacitors and 2 Transistors to get yourself a &3Finished PCB&r.

quests.title: Micromissiles
quests.subtitle: Firing Explosions from afar!
desc:
With Micromissiles you can shoot explosions from far away! Now nobody can escape!

Theses are needed to craft the &6ATM Star&r.

quests.title: Reinforced Chest
quests.subtitle: Better than your Everyday Chest
desc: The &3Reinforced Chest&r is a blast-proof Chest with 36 slots. Not Double Chest-able. Also works like a Shulker Box.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/pneumaticcraft/reinforced_chest_ui.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Smart Chest
quests.subtitle: The Nerds of Chests
desc: The &3Smart Chest&r is a blast-proof Chest with 72 slots, includes a built in, fully configuarble Omnidirectional Hopper and has upgrade slots. Not Double Chest-able. Also works like a Shulker Box.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/pneumaticcraft/smart_chest_ui.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Lubricant
quests.subtitle: Producing Lube!
desc: &3Lubricant&r can be used to make Drill Bits.

quests.title: Vegetable Oil
quests.subtitle: Better Oil
desc: &3Vegetable Oil&r can be made by putting either crops or seeds into a &3Thermopneumatic Processing Plant&r.

quests.title: Fish \& Chips!
quests.subtitle: Fancy some Fish \& Chips?
desc: Could I get that with some Mashed Peas with a side of Beans on Toast please Governor?

quests.title: Yeast
quests.subtitle: The Yeast of your Problems
desc: Why doesn't regular Bread need Yeast?

quests.title: Ethanol
desc: &3Ethanol&r can be used to make Biodiesel.

quests.title: Biodeisel
quests.subtitle: Bio/Diesel
desc: &3Biodeisel&r can be used to make &3Lubricant&r and &3Molten Plastic&r.

quests.title: Sourdough
quests.subtitle: You knead this
desc: Made with &3Wheat Flour&r. Can be used to make Salmon Tempura and Sourdough Bread.

quests.title: Crop Support
quests.subtitle: Faster Crops
desc: &3Crop Supports&r can be placed over your crops to make them grow faster.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/pneumaticcraft/crop_support.png width:200 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Smart Filter
quests.subtitle: There's no pain worse than stepping on these
desc: &3Construction Bricks&r are cool building blocks, be careful they hurt. Craft them again to make them smooth.

quests.title: Assembly Controller
quests.subtitle: Always Required
desc:
The next stage of this mod requires you to set up &3Assembly Lines&r. The main component of an &3Assembly Line&r is the &3Assembly Controller&r.

This is where the pressure will go.

quests.title: Reinforced Pressure Tube
quests.subtitle: Upgraded Pressure Tubes
desc: Just like regular &3Pressure Tubes&r only these can hold 10 bars of pressure.

quests.title: Assembly Platform
quests.subtitle: Always Required
desc: The item will need to be placed here before getting picked back up.

quests.title: Assembly Io Unit Export
quests.subtitle: Always Required
desc: This will drop the finished product into your output chest.

quests.title: Assembly Io Unit Import
quests.subtitle: Always Required
desc: This will take the items out of your input chest.

quests.title: Using Assembly Lines
quests.subtitle: Some Assembly Required
desc:
Although not every recipe requires the same components, you can set up your &3Assembly Lines&r with everything installed. A simple &3Assembly Line&r setup that can be used for everything is shown in the image below. Read the quests for each component for some important information about them.

Speed Upgrades make this so much quicker!

quests.title: Tube Junction
quests.subtitle: No, go this way!
desc: The &3Tube Junction&r gives you more control over the transportation of your pressure by allowing you to move your Pressure Tubes in more directions.

quests.title: Advanced Pressure Tube
quests.subtitle: A Whole new Level!
desc:
&3Advanced Pressure Tubes&r are the best Pressure Tubes available, being able to hold 20 bars of pressure!

Although these are really cool on their own, they can also be used in some even cooler recipes.

quests.title: Automating PCBs
desc: Using a Laser Assembly Program you can speed up the production of &3Unassembled PCBs&r. Just put an Empty PCB in the input chest, pump in some pressure and wait.

quests.title: Generating Power
quests.subtitle: Pressure = Power
desc:
Whoever told you PneumaticCraft wasn't about generating power?

The &3Pneumatic Dynamo&r allows you to turn your pressure in FE. Read the tooltip or read about it in the PNC:R to learn how it works.

quests.title: Pneumatic Armor
quests.subtitle: Compressed Iron Man
desc: The &3Pneumatic Armor&r by itself is pretty great, however if you want to make this armor amazing, you'll need to install upgrades. Press 'U' by default to open the Upgrade GUI, some upgrades use pressure, some don't.
Just like upgrading other tools in PneumaticCraft, to upgrade &3Pneumatic Armor&r you will need a Charging Station with pressure.
Note: The subtitle will tell you the max amount of that upgrade that can be put in something.

quests.title: Pressure from Power
quests.subtitle: Power = Pressure
desc: The &3Flux Compressor&r can create a ton of pressure using power. Simply pump some FE in and it will start generating some. If you have enough FE to spare, this is probably the easiest way to generate pressure.

quests.title: Advanced Air Compressor
quests.subtitle: No need for boring old Air Compressors now!
desc: The &3Advanced Air Compressor&r works the same way as the Air Compressor, only way better!

quests.title: Pressure from the Sun
quests.subtitle: In the palm of my hand...
desc:
The &3Solar Compressor&r generates Pressure by using sunlight, the warmer it gets, the more Pressure it will produce.

However, be careful, if it gets too hot it will malfunction and you will need to repair it.

quests.title: Pressure from Liquids
desc: The &3Liquid Compressor&r creates pressure using certain liquids. You can put the fuel in by right-clicking the bucket onto the machine, pumping in the fluid, or by putting a bucket in the top slot in the GUI.
{image:pneumaticcraft:textures/gui/gui_liquid_compressor.png width:200 height:200 align:center fit:true}

quests.title: Pressure from Lightning
desc:
The &3Electrostatic Compressor&r generates a lot of pressure from Lightning Strikes.

For more info check out the "Information" tab in JEI.
{image:pneumaticcraft:textures/patchouli/electrostatic_compressor.png width:100 height:100 align:left fit:true}

quests.title: Pressure from Heat
desc: The &3Thermal Compressor&r creates pressure using heat! Place somthing hot on one side and something cold on the other to create pressure.
{image:pneumaticcraft:textures/patchouli/thermal_compressor.png width:100 height:100 align:left fit:true}

quests.title: Jackhammer
quests.subtitle: Sorry Jack!
desc: The &3Pneumatic Jackhammer&r uses pressure to mine, it can be upgraded to be amazing!

quests.title: Programming Drones
desc: Although these quests won't go over Drones, they are amazing! Look into using them if you want to.

quests.title: Heat Frame
desc: When the &3Heat Frame&r is placed on a container containing certain fluids and made cold enough, it will turn said fluids into items.
Turns Molten Plastic into Plastic.
Turns Water into Ice.
Turns Lava into Obsidian.

quests.title: Drill Bit Diamond
desc: &3Drill Bits&r can be used in a Pneumatic Jackhammer.

quests.title: Solar Cells
quests.subtitle: The Sun's Cells
desc: &3Solar Cells&r are used to make Solar Compressors.

quests.title: Aphorism Tile
quests.subtitle: Signs? Never heard of them!
desc:
A smart Sign which can store and display arbitrary amounts of text, scaled so the text always fits.

Right-click with any Dye to recolor the tile, you can color the border and the background independentrly.

quests.title: Elevators
desc: With these 3 components you can create some amazing &3Elevators&r.
{image:pneumaticcraft:textures/patchouli/elevator.png width:1 height:1 align:left fit:true}

quests.title: Drill Bit Netherite
quests.subtitle: This is the Best Bit
desc: The &3Netherite Drill Bit&r is the best Drill Bit, it's even better than the Diamond Drill Bit.

quests.title: Armor Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Max: 4
desc: Each upgrade adds +0.5 Armor Defence and +1 Armor Toughness.

quests.title: Block Tracker Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Allows you to see details about certain blocks/fluid, even through walls.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/pneumaticcraft/block_tracker.png width:150 height:150 align:center}

quests.title: Charging Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Max: 6
desc: Charges other pressurizable items in your inventory from the chestplate's storage.

quests.title: Coordinate Tracker Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Right-click somewhere and you will be able to pathfind your way back. If you're close enough and have a direct route, a path will appear.

quests.title: Elytra Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Allows you to use an Elytra while still having your Pneumatic Chestplate on.

quests.title: Ender Visor Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Makes Endermen not get angry at you like Carved Pumpkins.

quests.title: Entity Tracker Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Living creatures nearby will be automatically tracked, even through walls. If it's an aggressive mob you'll get a warning when it targets you.

quests.title: Flippers Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Makes you swim faster.

quests.title: Gilded Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Makes Piglins Passive (same as wearing Gold Armor), you only need to put the Upgrade on one piece.

quests.title: Jet Boots Upgrade 1
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc:
Allows you to fly like Iron Man.

You can only have one level of these Upgrades in the Boots at a time. Each level will use more pressure than the previous.

Use these upgrades, don't just craft them.

quests.title: Jet Boots Upgrade 2
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Goes faster than Tier I.

quests.title: Jet Boots Upgrade 3
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Goes even faster than Tier II.

quests.title: Jet Boots Upgrade 4
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Maybe a little too fast even.

quests.title: Jet Boots Upgrade 5
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: 100% way too fast! Try not to die!

quests.title: Jumping Upgrade 1
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc:
Allows you to jump higher than usual and makes you springy, making for faster travel.
