You can only have one level of these Upgrades in the Leggings at a time.

quests.title: Jumping Upgrade 2
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Allows you to jump higher than with Tier I.

quests.title: Jumping Upgrade 3
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Allows you to jump higher than with Tier II.

quests.title: Jumping Upgrade 4
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Allows you to jump VERY high.

quests.title: Night Vision Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Grants the player Night Vision when worn.

quests.title: Radiation Shielding Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Protects you from Mekanism radiation.

quests.title: Scuba Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Keep your breathing underwater, once your bubbles go down to 5 they will be refilled! It also allows you to see much more easily underwater!

quests.title: Search Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Select an item an this upgrade will search fo it nearby in chests or on the floor. To find it in chests it will need the Block Tracker Upgrade and to find it on the floor it will need the Entity Tracker Upgrade.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/pneumaticcraft/item_search_upgrade.png width:200 height:200 align:center}

quests.title: Stomp Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Max: 1
desc: Any damage you take when falling (ignoring armor) will also be dealt to nearby mobs.

quests.title: Pneumatic Door
desc: The &3Pneumatic Door&r acts as automatic door that can be made to only open for you!
{image:pneumaticcraft:textures/patchouli/pneumatic_door.png width:200 height:200 align:right fit:true}

quests.title: Aerial Interface
quests.subtitle: Wireless Pressure!
desc:
The &3Aerial Interface&r can be used to refill your pressurizable things with pressure. Now you can use your Pneumatic Armor without needing to recharge!

You will need one of these in order to craft the &6ATM Star&r.

quests.title: Advanced Liquid Compressor
desc: The &3Advanced Liquid Compressor&r works the same as the Liquid Compressor, only way better!

quests.title: Jet Boots
quests.subtitle: You thought using an Elytra was hard?
desc:
You will only see this quest if you have used Jet Boots.

There's no way of using Jet Boots without taking damage, don't even try...

quests.title: Charging Module
desc: The &3Charging Module&r depressurizes any pressurizable things in containers it points at.

quests.title: Module Expansion Card
desc: The &3Module Expansion Card&r makes the Charging Module even better.

quests.title: Logistics
quests.subtitle: Transporting Items/Fluids
desc: To start with Logistics craft a &3Logistics Core&r, I recommend reading the PNC:R Manual for a full tutorial on how to use these items.

quests.title: Smart Filter
desc: Each &3Logistic Frame&r can be used for different types of automation.

quests.title: Logistics Configurator
desc: The &3Logistics Configurator&r can be used to configure Logistic Frames and Transfer Gadgets.

quests.title: Logistics Module
desc: The Logistic Frames need to connect to a &3Logistics Module&r to work.
{image:pneumaticcraft:textures/patchouli/logistics_module.png width:100 height:100 align:left fit:true}

quests.title: Minigun
quests.subtitle: Pew Pew!
desc: The &3Minigun&r is a gun that needs pressure and ammo to work. Read the tooltip for more info.

quests.title: Gun Ammo
desc: Load up your Minigun with this &3Minigun Ammo&r to use it.

quests.title: Magnet Upgrade
quests.subtitle: Max: 6
desc: Allows you to pickup items and experience from furthur away.

quests.title: Sentry Turret
quests.subtitle: Pew Pew (Without you)
desc: The &3Sentry Turret&r can be placed somewhere and set to attack mobs or players when they are in range. It just needs some Minigun Ammo.
{image:pneumaticcraft:textures/patchouli/sentry_turret.png width:100 height:100 align:left fit:true}

quests.title: Quest 325483DE
desc:
This Quest has been authored by &6AllTheMods Staff&r, or a &2Community contributor&r for use in AllTheMods Modpacks. 

As all &6AllTheMods&r packs are licensed under &eAll Rights Reserved&r, this Quest is not allowed to be used in any public packs not released by &6AllTheMods Team&r without explicit permission. 

This quest is intentionally hidden, if you're seeing this, you're in editing mode.

quests.title: &7&lRailCraft
desc:
&lRailCraft&r is an entire mod based off &5Trains&r! 

From &7Minecarts&r to &eElectric Locomotives&r to &9Tunnel Bores&r! It has everything &5Train&r accessory wise as well! Traffic Lights, Steam Boilers to power &5Trains&r, and automation for it all. 

The model Mod for Model &5Train&r Lovers!

quests.title: Smart Filter
quests.subtitle: "What, ya gonna rob me?"
desc:
The &4Crowbar&r is the main tool of RailCraft. 

When used on a &5Locomotive&r it will change the direction it's facing. 

When shift clicked you can connect &5Locomotives&r and &7Carts&r. 

When just used on &7Carts&r they give them a slight push. 

And when used on special tracks they change their mode. 

The different &4Crowbars&r just give different looks and damage.

quests.title: 'Switch em up'
desc: The Spike Mauls are used on normal &6Tracks&r to switch their modes. Very helpful for trying to make intersections!

quests.title: &6&lRails&r!
desc:
Hence the name of the mod, &lRailCraft&r, and what it revolves around, &5Trains&r, &6Rails&r are pretty important. 

The &2Vanilla&r ones work for lots of these but come on we all know they suck. Upgraded ones will need some more special items for their recipes! Craft them! (They might require using machines to make the items so check out that part of the quest!)

quests.title: &c&lTracks&r!
desc:
&cTrack Kits&r are used to craft with &6rails&r to make special &6rails&r. 

These &6rails&r will be helpful for everything &5Train&r wise like: stopping the &5Train&r, moving the &5Train&r, and emitting redstone.

quests.title: &3Steam Locomotive
desc:
The &3Steam Locomotive&r is the most basic &5Locomotive&r. It can be powered by giving it water, furnance fuel, and waiting. It'll need constant water to keep working. 

Don't worry that just means the smoke coming out of the top of it is Water Vapor, which is safe for the Environment. Well the Coal part isn't the best for the Environment... eh its &2Minecraft&r what do we care!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_steam_locomotive.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &7&lCarts&r 'N' &5&lTrains&r!
desc:
The reason we're all here, &5Trains&r. The mod is called &l&7RailCraft&r don't act surprised. 

There's 2 different main &5Trains&r and 1 special mining &5Train&r. 

These &5Trains&r all by themselves can get a little boring, so why not attach &7Carts&r to them! Connecting &7Carts&r with &7Carts&r and with &5Trains&r is called Coupling, and to unconnect them is to Decouple. To Couple &5Trains&r and &7Carts&r use a &4Crowbar&r or a &6Track&r with the Coupling &cTrack Kit&r.

quests.title: Seasons Crowbar
desc: This &4Crowbar&r has a few different modes, each with change the design of a &5Locomotive&r. From default which is described while hovering over the item in your inventory, none which goes to &7grey&r, &6H&r&5a&r&6l&r&5l&r&6o&r&5w&r&6e&r&5e&r&6n&r which makes it spooky, and &cC&r&2h&r&cr&r&2i&r&cs&r&2t&r&cm&r&2a&r&cs&r which makes it festive!

quests.title: &6Reinforced Tracks
desc: &6Reinforced Tracks&r are the upgraded version of normal &6rails&r! They're slighter faster and don't blow up.
{@pagebreak}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_reinforced1.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
{@pagebreak}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_reinforced2.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
{@pagebreak}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_reinforced3.png width:150 height:100 align:center}
{@pagebreak}
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_reinforced4.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &6High Speed Tracks
desc: &6High Speed Tracks&r are like &6Reinforced Tracks&r but obviously faster. They'll need &cTrack Kits&r to help build up speed though! And careful around corners.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_speed.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &6Electric Tracks
desc: The &6Electric Tracks&r are used for the &eElectric Locomotives&r. They'll need to be powered by &eFrames&r and yes it will hurt you if you touch it.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_electric_rail.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &6High Speed Electric Tracks
desc: The &6High Speed Electric Tracks&r are like the &6Electric Tracks&r but faster! They also require what the normal &6High Speed Tracks&r require and what the &6Electric Tracks&r require. &cSpeed Boosts&r and &eFrames&r to power them. Now you have to be careful around corners and with touching them!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_electric_speed.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &6Strap Iron Tracks
desc: The &6Strap Iron Tracks&r, like the &6Abandoned Tracks&r, are perfect for the cheapskates. They go much slower than the other &6tracks&r but no risk of derailment!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_strap.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &6Abandoned Tracks
desc: &6Abandoned Tracks&r are good for the cheapskates and aesthetic. They can be used to bridge accross a few blocks without support. They can only be 2 blocks away from blocks going the same direction, or one block from the opposite direction. They come at the risk of derailment though, basically your &7Cart&r will be thrown off the &6rails&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_abandoned.png width:150 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &6Wye Tracks
desc: The &6Wye Track&r is the second track made by using a Spike Maul. It directs two &6Tracks&r into one. If you have one &6Track&r intersected by another the &6Wye&r will move &7Carts&r on the first &6Track&r into the intersecting one.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_wye.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &6Turnout Tracks
desc: The &6Turnout track&r is the first from hitting a &6track&r with a Spike Maul. It can help go two directions, forward and to a side. It can be switched with a Switch next to the &6track&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_turnout.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &6Junction Tracks
desc: The &6Junction&r is the last &6Track&r made by the Spike Maul. It acts as a normal intersection for &6Tracks. &7Carts&r keep going the same way as before but now &6Tracks&r can intersect. What happens if 2 &7Carts&r hit each other on it? THEY EXPLODE!!! I'm kidding but &eElectric Locomotives&r will though.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_junction.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &eFrames
desc: In order to power your &6Electric Rails&r and your &eElectric Locomotive&r you'll need &eFrames. Frames&r need to be powered and will move power to each connected to &eFrame&r.

quests.title: &eElectric Locomotive
desc:
Unlike the &3Steam Locomotive&r you won't need to put anything into the &eElectric Locomotive&r. 

It runs off the power from the &eFrames&r beneath the &6Electric Tracks&r. 

Yes, it can only be ran off &6Electric Tracks&r.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_electric.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &9Tunnel Bore, Bore Head
desc:
To actually use a &9Tunnel Bore&r you'll need a &9Tunnel Bore Head&r. 

They come in 4 different styles and it mines dependent on the &9Bore Head&r. 

It can be enchanted and has durability so you'll want to enchant it!

quests.title: &9Tunnel Bore
desc:
The &9Tunnel Bore&r is perfect for automatically placing &6Rails&r especially under mountains or hills. 

It'll need 3 things to start working: &9Bore Head&r, fuel like Coal, and &6Rails&r. Once it has all 3 just let it go! 

Remember to keep track of the items going in it!
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_tunnel.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: New Carts
desc: These new &7Carts&r are similar to the special &2Vanilla&r &7Carts&r. The &7Minecart with a Tank&r will hold and move any Liquid held in it. The &7Minecart with an Energy cell&r will instead hold and move Energy!

quests.title: &7Carts&r and &6Tracks
desc:
These new &7Carts&r are mostly for laying down &6Tracks&r.

The &7Track Layer&r places down &6Tracks&r while the &7Track Remover&r removes &6Tracks&r.

The &7Track Relayer&r replaces the &6Tracks&r with different ones and the &7Track UnderCutter&r replaces the blocks beneath the &6Tracks&r.

quests.title: Item Loader
desc: The Item Loader is the most basic dispenser from RailCraft. It has to be above the &6Track&r and can be configured to what you'll want loaded onto your &7Carts&r below.

quests.title: Item Unloader
desc: The Item Unloader is the opposite of the Item Loader. It will take items from the &7Carts&r. This one must also be above the &6Track&r.

quests.title: Fluid Loader
desc: The Fluid Loader will be helpful to keeping your &3Steam Locomotives&r up and running. It has to be placed a few blocks above the &6Tracks&r and it will deploy fluids into either the &5Locomotive&r or &7Carts&r.

quests.title: &7Cart&r Dispenser
desc: The &7Cart&r Dispenser will do as the name suggests. It can dispense any &7Carts&r onto the &6Tracks&r in front of it. Needs a Redstone signal to dispense.

quests.title: Train Dispenser
desc: The &5Train&r Dispenser is a better version of the &7Cart&r Dispenser. It can Dispense the whole &5Locomotive&r and more! Set a pattern for what you want to be deployed then give it a redstone signal.

quests.title: Fluid Unloader
desc: The Fluid Unloader is the exact opposite of the Fluid Loader. Instead of being over the &6Track&r its under. Instead of giving &3Steam Locomotives&r water it takes their water. I don't know why you'd want to do that but you can!

quests.title: Advanced Item Unloader
desc: The Advanced Item Unloader is just like the normal part but can be used from any direction. Nothing different besides direction.

quests.title: Advanced Item Loader
desc: The Advanced Item Loader is everything the regular one is but can be used from anywhere near the &6Track&r. Next to, above, next to on the other side. Use the &4Crowbar&r to change its direction.

quests.title: Switch Track Lever
desc: The Switch Track will be needed for moving lanes between the different Special &6Tracks&r. The Arrows on it show which goes where.

quests.title: &cTrack Kits&r for stopping &7Carts&r
desc:
These &cTracks&r are made for stopping the &5Locomotives&r and &7Carts&r. 

The &cLocking Kit&r stops &7Carts&r and only starts them when given a redstone pulse. 
The &cBuffer Kit&r is for the end of your &6tracks&r, will stop them and not start. 
The &cGated Kit&r just deploys a Fence Gate connected with the &6track&r.

quests.title: &cTrack Kit&r Coupler
desc:
&cThe Coupler&r is for connecting or disconnecting &7Carts&r. Coupling is the phrase for connecting &7Carts&r. 

It can be configured with a &4Crowbar&r to couple, decouple, or auto couple. Needs Redstone to work.

quests.title: &cTrack Kits&r for moving &7Carts&r
desc:
These &cTracks Kits&r are for changing momentum with your &7Carts&r. 

The &cTransition Kits&r change the speed of the passing &5Locomotive&r, needs redstone power. 
The &cBooster Kits&r will speed up the &7Cart&r if powered and slow down the &7Cart&r if not powered. 
The &cControl Kit&r gives the &7Carts&r a little push, when powered it'll change the direction it pushes it in. 
The &cThrottle Kit&r will change the speed of a passing &5Locomotive&r to whatever speed is configured, needs to be powered with redstone. 
The &cLauncher Kit&r will quite literally throw your &7Cart&r!

quests.title: &cTrack Kit&r One Way
desc: The &cOne Way Track Kit&r is quite simple. &7Carts&r can only go where the arrow is facing.

quests.title: &cTrack Kit&r Whistle
desc: The &cWhistle Kit&r when active with Redstone will cause the &5Locomotives&r to set off their whistles.

quests.title: &cTrack Kit&r Routing
desc: The &cRouting Kit&r is used with the passing tickets.

quests.title: &cTrack Kits&r for using Redstone
desc:
These 2 &cTrack Kits&r are for using &7Carts&r and Redstone.

The &cActivator Kit&r will activate whatever &7Cart&r goes over it. 
The &cDetector Kit&r will activate a redstone signal whenever a &7Cart&r passes over it. 

Both are similar to their &2Vanilla&r counters for regular &6tracks&r.

quests.title: &cTrack Kits&r for moving entities
desc:
These &cTrack Kits&r are for using entities with your &7Carts&r (Entities aka Mobs). 

The &cEmbarking Kit&r will pick up any Mobs nearby and put them in a &7Cart&r. 
The &cDisembarking Kit&r unloads Mobs from the &7Carts&r. 
The &cDumping Kit&r will drop the mobs in the &7Carts&r below the &6tracks&r its on.

quests.title: Coke Oven
desc:
Wait we have Steel again does that also mean we get our (Coal) Coke back? Yes! 
To get (Coal) Coke you'll need a Coke Oven. To make one you'll need 26 Coke Oven Bricks and place them 3x3x3 with 1 block hollow in the center. You'll know it's done when you can access the GUI and it's all one texture. 

Place Coal or Coal Blocks to get (Coal) Coke and Liquid Creosote! You can always put any log in to get Charcoal and Creasote.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_coke.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Blast (Steel) Furnace
desc:
&l&7RailCraft&r adds a Blast Furnace multiblock for us to transform Iron into Steel! 

To build it you'll need 34 Blast Furnace Bricks. It'll be 3 blocks wide, 3 blocks long, and 4 blocks tall. The two blocks in the exact center need to be hollow. You'll know it's done when it forms all together and allows you to access its GUI. 

There you can put Iron ,in any form, to get Steel and Granulated Sand.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_furnace.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: &l&7Machines
desc: &l&7RailCraft&r uses many machines for different things but mostly resource creation.
All of them start with Iron Ingots!

quests.title: Water Tank
desc:
The Water Tank is like having a barrel outside. Just this barrel is much bigger. It collects water and can hold water for Steam Locomotives. 

The amount of water is makes is dependent on the biome and visible to the sky. 

It's made by a 3x3x3 Water Tank blocks with the center being hollow.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_tank.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Crusher
desc:
The Crusher is just as the name suggests. It can crush blocks to get the crafting materials, like bricks from a brick staircase, or dusts from ingots. 

It needs power to work though! 

To build one it's 3x2x2 of Crusher blocks.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_crusher.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Manual Rolling Machine
desc:
The Manual Rolling Machine will be your little crafting machine for many things material for railcraft! 

When you put the recipe in and it can make more than 1 it will autocraft while you're still looking at it. When you leave the Rolling Machine while crafting it will abort the crafting and put it in your inventory. 

You must manually build the last recipe!

quests.title: Powered Rolling Machine
desc:
The Powered Rolling Machine is much better version of the Manual Rolling Machine. 

You don't have to keep looking in the machine to craft things and it will automatically craft all of them. 

The only problem is it needs power!

quests.title: Boilers
desc: The Water Boilers are some of the most helpful machines from &l&7RailCraft&r. They need a Fuel Firebox and some sort of boiler on top. The Fueled Firebox can be 1x1 2x2 or 3x3. The size of the Firebox changes how big the Boiler on top can be. For 1x1 Firebox it can only have 1x1 Boiler. For 2x2 Firebox it can be a 2x2x3 Boiler. For 3x3 Firebox it can be 3x3x4. The Liquid Fuel will take Creosote to heat up. For Solid Firebox it'll use anything a furnace can use.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_big_boiler.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Steam Oven
desc:
The Steam Oven is another machine that uses Steam for something useful. 

By putting Steam into the Steam Oven it will act as a furnace to any items in it. Making Ingots from Ores and cooking food items. 

It's a 2x2x2 machine of Steam Oven blocks.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_oven.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Steam Turbine
desc:
The Steam Turbine uses Steam to make FE and EU energy. 

It's 3x2x2 building of only Steam Turbine Housing, and it'll need a Turbine Motor in it, and Steam piped in.
{image:atm:textures/questpics/railcraft/rail_turbine.png width:100 height:100 align:center}

quests.title: Color Legend
desc:
With this Quest page I took a lot of time coloring the texts to try and help you the Player understand what I am referencing. Only for me to realize it might be even more confusing, so here's a Legend! 

&5Purple&r is any Train or Locomotive, so both Electric and Steam Locomotives and Carts attached. 
&6Gold&r is any Tracks and Rails, includes special Rails but not Track Kits. 
&cLight Red&r stands for any Track Kits. 
&4Dark Red&r is for Crowbars. 
&3Cyan&r is for the Steam Locomotive only. 
&eYellow&r is for only the Electric Locomotive. 
&9Blue&r is for the Tunnel Bore. 
&7Grey&r is for Minecarts and special Carts.
